Project.Title: SIGMA - Study of Industrial Gravity Measurement Applications

Title_Other.Title: SIGMA-工业重力测量应用研究
SIGMA - Study of Industrial Gravity Measurement Applications

Project.Abstract: This project is a collaboration between RSK and the University of Birmingham (UoB) to carry out a feasibility study identifying the potential of Quantum Technology (QT) gravity sensors in geophysical surveys for environmental and engineering applications such as locating buried objects and finding voids. These QT sensors currently do not exist, but are the focus of many research activities in UK universities such as the GG-TOP project at the UoB developing a gravity gradient sensors with many more sensor developments planned as part of the UoB led QT Hub, if funded. For the QT sensors to achieve an accelerated commercialization, it is vital to ensure that they meet user needs. Therefore, this project will assess the current geophysical sensing technologies, establish their limitations and also operational parameters. This will provide a quantitative assessment matrix against which the QT sensors can be judged. It will further provide those developing the QT sensors with a specification of capability to strive for.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: This project is a collaboration between RSK and the University of Birmingham (UoB) to carry out a feasibility study identifying the potential of Quantum Technology (QT) gravity sensors in geophysical surveys for environmental and engineering applications such as locating buried objects and finding voids. These QT sensors currently do not exist, but are the focus of many research activities in UK universities such as the GG-TOP project at the UoB developing a gravity gradient sensors with many more sensor developments planned as part of the UoB led QT Hub, if funded. For the QT sensors to achieve an accelerated commercialization, it is vital to ensure that they meet user needs. Therefore, this project will assess the current geophysical sensing technologies, establish their limitations and also operational parameters. This will provide a quantitative assessment matrix against which the QT sensors can be judged. It will further provide those developing the QT sensors with a specification of capability to strive for.

该项目是RSK与伯明翰大学（UoB）的合作项目，旨在开展一项可行性研究，确定量子技术（QT）重力传感器在地球物理勘探中的潜力，以用于环境和工程应用，如定位埋藏物和寻找空隙。这些QT传感器目前不存在，但是英国大学的许多研究活动的焦点，例如UOB的GG-Topy项目开发了重力梯度传感器，其中有更多的传感器开发计划作为UOB LED QT集线器的一部分，如果资助的话。为了使QT传感器加速商业化，确保它们满足用户需求至关重要。因此，本项目将评估当前的地球物理传感技术，确定其局限性和操作参数。这将提供定量评估矩阵，根据该矩阵可以判断QT传感器。它将进一步为那些开发QT传感器的人提供一个可以争取的能力规格。

Project.Title: District of Columbia Newspaper Project: Planning

Title_Other.Title: District of Columbia Newspaper Project: Planning
哥伦比亚特区报业项目：规划

Project.Title: A Center for Women in Mathematics at Smith College

Title_Other.Title: A Center for Women in Mathematics at Smith College
史密斯学院女子数学中心

Project.Abstract: With this grant, the mathematics department of Smith will inaugurate two programs both with the goal of increasing the number of women going to graduate school in the mathematical sciences. One will be a junior year program in mathematics, in which undergraduate women mathematics majors from schools across the country will spend a year at Smith taking mathematics almost exclusively. The second will be a post-baccalaureate program in mathematics, in which students who have earned a bachelor's degree but lack sufficient coursework in mathematics will spend a year at Smith studying undergraduate and graduate mathematics. Participants in both programs will receive extensive mentoring, will join research groups under the direction of faculty, and will travel to conferences. We aim to increase participants' confidence, background and desire to go to graduate school in the mathematical sciences. While women advance in many traditionally male areas, progress in mathematics has been slow. Women are a majority entering and graduating from medical school, but comprise only 32% of those studying for Ph.D.s in mathematics and only 16% of tenured mathematics faculty. At every stage in the pipeline, women withdraw from mathematics. The record at women's colleges, however, and at Smith in particular, is different. At Smith, more women major in mathematics, more advance to graduate school and more Smith graduates successfully earn doctorates. Progress here is critical to the advancement of women overall, due to the centrality of mathematics in intellectual life. A woman with a degree in mathematics is immediately a candidate for programs in biology, computer science, economics, engineering, management, and finance, in addition to the mathematical sciences. This program seeks to address the gender imbalance in mathematics by spreading the benefits of a women's education in mathematics. Our twin targets are tentative but talented undergraduate women at coeducational institutions and women graduates who recognized late their love for mathematics. By nurturing, energizing, and educating these women, we hope to make a significant change in their success rate in mathematics graduate schools and beyond.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 有了这笔拨款，史密斯的数学系将启动两个项目，目的都是增加进入数学科学研究生院的妇女人数。其中一个是数学专业的大三课程，全国各所学校的女数学专业本科生将在史密斯大学学习一年，几乎只学数学。第二个项目是数学学士后课程，在该项目中，获得学士学位但缺乏足够数学课程的学生将在史密斯大学学习一年本科和研究生数学。这两个项目的参与者将接受广泛的指导，在教师的指导下加入研究小组，并参加会议。我们的目标是增加参与者的信心，背景和愿望，进入研究生院的数学科学。虽然女性在许多传统上属于男性的领域取得了进步，但在数学方面的进展却很缓慢。进入医学院和从医学院毕业的学生中，女性占大多数，但在攻读数学博士学位的学生中，女性仅占32%，在终身数学教师中，女性仅占16%。在这个过程的每一个阶段，女性都会退出数学。然而，女子学院，特别是史密斯大学的记录却不同。在史密斯，更多的女性主修数学，更多的升入研究生院，更多的史密斯毕业生成功地获得博士学位。由于数学在智力生活中的中心地位，这方面的进展对提高妇女的整体地位至关重要。一个拥有数学学位的女性是生物、计算机科学、经济学、工程学、管理学和金融学以及数学科学课程的候选人。该项目旨在通过推广女性数学教育的好处来解决数学中的性别失衡问题。我们的两个目标都是男女同校院校的有才华的本科女生和认识到自己对数学热爱较晚的女毕业生。通过培养、激励和教育这些女性，我们希望她们在数学研究生院内外的成功率有一个重大的变化。

Project.Title: NetSE: Small: Structure and Dynamics of Complex Networks

Title_Other.Title: NetSE: Small: Structure and Dynamics of Complex Networks
NetSE:Small:复杂网络的结构与动力学

Project.Abstract: The Social Web, or Web 2.0, has changed the way people connect with each other and use information. Sites such as Twitter, Flickr, and Digg allow people to create content, annotate it with descriptive labels, and befriend others to create communities. The collective knowledge and expertise of the community is expressed through the links between people and information. The key to extracting this knowledge is understanding the structure and dynamics of networks. This project will study dynamics of information spread on networks and how it relates to network structure and quality of information. In previous work, investigator has developed a mathematical framework to study the properties of static networks. She showed that a centrality metric based on the number of paths connecting nodes can be used to identify groups and important nodes within them. However, looking at static structure ignores valuable temporal information that can be used to improve the ability to identify influential nodes and hidden groups, as well as quickly and reliably predict important trends and evaluate the quality of information. The investigator will extend these metrics to dynamic networks and model information spread on networks. The investigator will apply these methods to complex networks that link different types of entities, namely, people, content, and groups. Considering network structure in the dynamics of information spread will lead to more effective tools to leverage community's knowledge to address a number of problems, including identifying important trends, assessing information quality, and separating true information from rumors.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: The Social Web, or Web 2.0, has changed the way people connect with each other and use information. Sites such as Twitter, Flickr, and Digg allow people to create content, annotate it with descriptive labels, and befriend others to create communities. The collective knowledge and expertise of the community is expressed through the links between people and information. The key to extracting this knowledge is understanding the structure and dynamics of networks. This project will study dynamics of information spread on networks and how it relates to network structure and quality of information. In previous work, investigator has developed a mathematical framework to study the properties of static networks. She showed that a centrality metric based on the number of paths connecting nodes can be used to identify groups and important nodes within them. However, looking at static structure ignores valuable temporal information that can be used to improve the ability to identify influential nodes and hidden groups, as well as quickly and reliably predict important trends and evaluate the quality of information. The investigator will extend these metrics to dynamic networks and model information spread on networks. The investigator will apply these methods to complex networks that link different types of entities, namely, people, content, and groups. Considering network structure in the dynamics of information spread will lead to more effective tools to leverage community's knowledge to address a number of problems, including identifying important trends, assessing information quality, and separating true information from rumors.

社交网络（Web 2.0）改变了人们相互联系和使用信息的方式。Twitter、Flickr和Digg等网站允许人们创建内容，使用描述性标签对其进行注释，并与其他人友好地创建社区。社区的集体知识和专门知识是通过人与信息之间的联系来表达的。提取这些知识的关键是理解网络的结构和动力学。本计画将研究资讯在网路上的传播动态，以及它如何与网路结构和资讯品质相关。在之前的工作中，研究者已经开发了一个数学框架来研究静态网络的特性。她表明，基于连接节点的路径数的中心度度量可以用来识别组和其中的重要节点。然而，静态结构忽略了有价值的时间信息，这些信息可以用来提高识别有影响节点和隐藏组的能力，以及快速可靠地预测重要趋势和评估信息质量。研究者将把这些度量扩展到动态网络，并对网络上传播的信息进行建模。研究者将把这些方法应用于连接不同类型实体（即人、内容和组）的复杂网络。在信息传播的动态中考虑网络结构将导致更有效的工具来利用社区的知识来解决一些问题，包括识别重要趋势、评估信息质量、将真实信息与谣言分离。

Source.Name: Directorate for Computer & Information Science & Engineering

Project.Title: UKERC Whole Systems Networking Fund

Title_Other.Title: UKERC全系统网络基金
UKERC Whole Systems Networking Fund

Project.Abstract:
Despite the increasing attention paid to interdisciplinarity and whole systems research within the RCUK energy research portfolio, the Scientific Advisory Committee has identified the need for further action to ensure that a whole systems approach is more clearly reflected in the portfolio as a whole. There is a need for those conducting detailed, specific research on a particular technology or within a particular discipline to take into account more fully how their research relates to the whole energy system. Equally, whole systems energy research could make better use of insights from more detailed research. Within this, there is a desire to provide greater opportunities for early career researchers to get involved, and to ensure that any activities to address this problem encourage diversity.
This proposal for a Whole Systems Networking Fund has been developed to meet this need following a request to UKERC from the Research Councils. It has benefitted from consultation with senior energy academics funded by the RCUK energy programme.
The Fund's activities will be delivered in three main phases over two years: 1. An engagement phase. This will involve promoting the objectives of the networking fund to the research community, consulting them about potential themes, and laying the foundations for calls for proposals. This phase will also involve some activities led by the UKERC HQ team including a review of best practice on integration of specific and energy systems research; mentoring and training on research communication; and activities to improve the articulation between communities working on decision making tools and those working in more specific and specialist energy fields. 2. A delivery phase that will involve a series of calls for small and large networking grant proposals. A steering group composed of leading researchers from across the energy research community will advise on the calls and on the selection of projects for funding. Clear criteria for funding will be developed and applied, with an emphasis on promoting inclusion, interdisciplinarity, innovation and impact. Once commissioned, these projects will be actively managed by UKERC's expended HQ team to ensure that they meet their objectives and maximise their impacts. 3. An analysis phase which will involve work to learn lessons from projects, to maximise the impact of the Fund as a whole, including through a final event for academic, policy, industry and other stakeholders.
To deliver the Fund, the UKERC HQ team will be expanded with an additional two people to engage and advise the energy research community, and to ensure effective administration, management and communication of project activities. The governance of the Fund will be via a new Fund Committee comprising leading energy academics. A number of candidates have already agreed to serve on this committee.

尽管在区域协调单位能源研究组合中越来越重视跨学科和整个系统的研究，但科学咨询委员会已确定需要采取进一步行动，以确保整个组合中更清楚地反映出整个系统的方法。有必要对特定技术或特定学科进行详细、具体的研究，以更充分地考虑其研究如何与整个能源系统相联系。同样，整个系统能源研究可以更好地利用更详细研究的见解。在这方面，人们希望为早期职业研究人员提供更多的参与机会，并确保解决这一问题的任何活动都鼓励多样性。 在研究委员会向UKERC提出请求后，为满足这一需要，制定了一项关于整个系统网络基金的提案。它得益于与RCUK能源方案资助的高级能源学者的磋商。 基金的活动将在两年内分三个主要阶段进行： 一。交战阶段。这将包括将网络基金的目标提升到研究社区，咨询他们潜在的主题，并为建议的提出打下基础。这一阶段还将包括由UKERC总部团队领导的一些活动，包括审查特定和能源系统研究整合的最佳实践；研究交流的指导和培训；以及改善决策工具社区与更具体和专业能源领域工作社区之间联系的活动。 2。一个交付阶段，将涉及一系列要求小型和大型网络赠款提案。一个由来自能源研究界的主要研究人员组成的指导小组将就这些呼吁和供资项目的选择提出建议。将制定和应用明确的供资标准，重点是促进包容、跨学科、创新和影响。一旦委托，这些项目将由UKERC的总部扩展团队积极管理，以确保它们达到目标并最大限度地发挥其影响。 三。一个分析阶段，包括努力从项目中吸取经验教训，最大限度地发挥基金作为一个整体的影响，包括为学术、政策、行业和其他利益相关者举办最后一次活动。 为了提供资金，UKERC总部团队将扩大，增加两人，以参与和建议能源研究社区，并确保项目活动的有效管理、管理和沟通。该基金的管理将通过一个由主要能源学者组成的新基金委员会。一些候选人已经同意在这个委员会任职。

Source.Name: Engineering and Physical Sciences Research Council

Project.Title: Collaborative Research: The Effects of Terrorist Threats on Democratic Support in Liberal and Illiberal Democracies

Title_Other.Title: 合作研究：恐怖主义威胁对自由和非自由民主国家民主支持的影响
Collaborative Research: The Effects of Terrorist Threats on Democratic Support in Liberal and Illiberal Democracies

Project.Abstract: The threat of international terrorism is a salient and growing fixture of modern times. As a result, citizens are increasingly making political evaluations and decisions under the specter of terrorist threat. This project examines the extent to which terrorist threats affect support for democracy and how these effects vary across type of democracy (liberal versus illiberal) and information environment (with or without reminders of democratic values). Illiberal democracies are those in which formal democratic procedures operate, but in which civil liberties and other democratic provisions are not extensively protected. Few studies have looked specifically at general threat contexts, most have not considered terrorist threats specifically, and none explore effects across different types of democratic and information environments. The investigators expect support for democracy to decrease in illiberal and liberal democracies in the presence of a terror threat absent contextual reminders of democratic values. However, these shifts are expected to be more comprehensive in illiberal settings. When reminders of democratic values are presented, those in liberal societies are expected to maintain relatively high support for democracy both in the abstract (i.e., support for free speech) and with respect to specific situations (i.e., support for protests in the war on terror). In illiberal societies, in which diffuse support for democratic values is not well-engrained and does not resonate, such reminders will have no effect. To assess these expectations, the investigators perform a series of ten survey experiments in eight countries representing both liberal democracies (the U.S., the U.K., France, and Spain) and illiberal ones (Albania, Turkey, Bolivia, and Ecuador). The experimental design varies the salience of the terrorist threat brought to mind by having participants read a randomly assigned newspaper article that either invokes or decreases the terrorist threat level. Also varied is whether or not the article is accompanied by a reminder of democratic values. The survey respondents are then queried about their level of support for democratic values, procedures, and institutions. This type of experiment provides the cleanest test of a cause-effect relationship. Some surveys are taken over the internet, others are taken on a computer in a lab; the use of these parallel approaches improves the reliability of findings by drawing on different subject pools. The project has several broader impacts. Given that international terrorist plots and attacks have grown in number, size, and geographic scope, it is critical to understand how the shadow of a terrorist threat affects the ways that citizens around the world understand and engage in politics. With respect to liberal democracies, evidence that reminders of core democratic values reduce the otherwise negative effects of terrorist threat on support for democracy carries the public policy implication that such reminders in the face of a real threat may provide important balance, helping to keep citizens from losing confidence in democratic practices. With respect to illiberal democracies, evidence for an unconditional negative effect of terrorist threat on support for democracy carries with it the warning that citizens may withdraw their support for democracy, which may lead to political instability. However, if reminders of democratic values do prove effective even in illiberal societies, this would be an important lesson.

With respect to illiberal democracies, evidence for an unconditional negative effect of terrorist threat on support for democracy carries with it the warning that citizens may withdraw their support for democracy, which may lead to political instability. However, if reminders of democratic values do prove effective even in illiberal societies, this would be an important lesson.

国际恐怖主义的威胁是现代社会一个突出和日益增长的特点。因此，在恐怖主义威胁的威胁下，公民越来越多地作出政治评价和决定。这一项目审查恐怖主义威胁对支持民主的影响程度，以及这些影响在不同类型的民主（自由与非自由）和信息环境（无论是否提醒民主价值观）之间如何变化。非自由民主国家是指那些实行正式民主程序，但公民自由和其他民主规定得不到广泛保护的国家。很少有研究专门研究一般的威胁背景，大多数研究没有具体考虑恐怖主义威胁，也没有研究不同类型的民主和信息环境的影响。调查人员预计，在缺乏民主价值观背景提示的恐怖威胁面前，非自由民主国家和自由民主国家对民主的支持将减少。然而，在非自由环境下，这些转变预计会更加全面。在提出民主价值观的提醒时，自由社会的人在抽象上（即支持言论自由）和在具体情况（即支持反恐战争中的抗议活动）上都应保持对民主的相对高度支持。在非自由社会中，对民主价值观的广泛支持并没有得到很好的体现，也没有产生共鸣，这种提醒不会产生任何效果。为了评估这些期望，调查人员在八个代表自由民主国家（美国、英国、法国和西班牙）和非自由主义国家（阿尔巴尼亚、土耳其、玻利维亚和厄瓜多尔）的十个国家进行了一系列的调查实验。实验设计通过让参与者阅读随机分配的报纸文章来改变恐怖威胁的显著性，这篇文章可以援引或降低恐怖威胁水平。文章是否附有民主价值观的提醒也各不相同。然后，调查对象被问及他们对民主价值观、程序和制度的支持程度。这种类型的实验提供了因果关系的最干净的测试。一些调查是通过互联网进行的，另一些则是在实验室的计算机上进行的；使用这些并行方法通过绘制不同的主题库来提高调查结果的可靠性。这个项目有几个更广泛的影响。鉴于国际恐怖主义阴谋和袭击在数量、规模和地理范围上有所增加，了解恐怖主义威胁的阴影如何影响世界各地公民了解和参与政治的方式至关重要。关于自由民主国家，提醒人们注意核心民主价值观的证据减少了恐怖主义威胁对支持民主的负面影响，这一证据在公共政策上意味着，面对真正的威胁，这种提醒可能会提供重要的平衡，有助于防止公民对民主失去信心实践。关于非自由民主国家，恐怖主义威胁对支持民主产生无条件负面影响的证据附带着一个警告，即公民可能撤回对民主的支持，这可能导致政治不稳定。然而，如果民主价值观的提醒即使在不自由的社会也被证明是有效的，这将是一个重要的教训。

Source.Name: Directorate for Social, Behavioral & Economic Sciences

Project.Title: Optical Studies of High-field Electron and Hole Transport in Nitride-based Wide Bandgap Semiconductor Nanostructures

Title_Other.Title: 氮化物基宽禁带半导体纳米结构中高场电子和空穴输运的光学研究
Optical Studies of High-field Electron and Hole Transport in Nitride-based Wide Bandgap Semiconductor Nanostructures

Project.Abstract: This project addresses high-field carrier transient transport in nitride-based wide bandgap semiconductor nanostructures. The approach is to conduct systematic studies of transient electron and hole transport properties such as velocity overshoot and phonon dynamics in nitride-based wide bandgap semiconductor nanostructures by using time-resolved, sub-picosecond Raman spectroscopy. Goals are to achieve greater understanding of fundamental phenomena to define optimal device operation conditions, and to provide the basis for the design of a new class of high performance electronic devices. %%% An important impact of the project is in education and human resource development through the integration of research and education. The proposed research program will enhance the PI's student mentorship activities and increase chances of attracting minority students pursuing advanced degrees at ASU. The proposed research program will further enhance the existing infrastructure of both nanostructured materials as well as wide bandgap semiconductors having advantages in computing and signal processing technologies. ***

The approach is to conduct systematic studies of transient electron and hole transport properties such as velocity overshoot and phonon dynamics in nitride-based wide bandgap semiconductor nanostructures by using time-resolved, sub-picosecond Raman spectroscopy. The proposed research program will further enhance the existing infrastructure of both nanostructured materials as well as wide bandgap semiconductors having advantages in computing and signal processing technologies. ***

本计画探讨氮化物基宽禁带半导体奈米结构中的高场载流子瞬态传输。该方法是利用时间分辨的亚皮秒拉曼光谱对氮化物基宽禁带半导体纳米结构中的瞬态电子和空穴输运特性，如速度超调和声子动力学进行系统研究。目的是为了更好地理解基本现象，确定最佳的器件工作条件，为设计一类新型高性能电子器件提供依据。%%%该项目的一个重要影响是通过研究与教育的结合在教育和人力资源开发方面。拟议的研究计划将加强PI的学生指导活动，增加吸引少数民族学生攻读华硕高级学位的机会。所提出的研究计划将进一步增强现有纳米结构材料的基础结构以及宽带隙半导体在计算和信号处理技术方面的优势。***

Project.Title: A Book on the Philosophy of William Ockham and the Edition and Translation of a Treatise of Paul of Venice

Title_Other.Title: 威廉·奥卡姆哲学著作与《威尼斯保罗论》的编译
A Book on the Philosophy of William Ockham and the Edition and Translation of a Treatise of Paul of Venice

Class.ClassName: 2202 History and Philosophy of Specific Fields

Project.Abstract: To complete a book on the medieval philosophy of William Ockham: his ontology, logic, theory and knowledge and psychology, philosophy of science, theology and ethics, in order to make his philosophy available to a broader philosophical community for whom his views have been relatively inaccessible. Also to finish the critical edition and translation of the treatise On Insolubles from Paul of Venice's early 15th century Logica Magna.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: To complete a book on the medieval philosophy of William Ockham: his ontology, logic, theory and knowledge and psychology, philosophy of science, theology and ethics, in order to make his philosophy available to a broader philosophical community for whom his views have been relatively inaccessible. Also to finish the critical edition and translation of the treatise On Insolubles from Paul of Venice's early 15th century Logica Magna.
完成一本关于威廉·奥卡姆中世纪哲学的书：他的本体论、逻辑、理论和知识以及心理学、科学哲学、神学和伦理学，以便使他的哲学能够被一个更广泛的哲学界所接受，而他的观点对这个哲学界来说是相对不可接近的。完成威尼斯15世纪早期逻辑学大师保罗的《不可辩驳论》的批判性编辑和翻译。

Project.Title: Beyond the Glomerulus: Novel Clinical Markers of Kidney Health and Prognosis

Title_Other.Title: 肾小球外：肾脏健康和预后的新临床指标
Beyond the Glomerulus: Novel Clinical Markers of Kidney Health and Prognosis

Project.Abstract: DESCRIPTION (provided by applicant): Currently, clinical assessment of chronic kidney disease (CKD) depends upon estimates of glomerular filtration (eGFR) and glomerular injury (albuminuria). This two-dimensional assessment of glomerular health forms the backbone of recent Kidney Disease Improving Global Outcomes (KDIGO) guidelines because each represents a different component of CKD and each provides prognostic information on adverse kidney and non-kidney outcomes independent of the other. As defined, CKD is an enormous public health problem, due to its high prevalence, its economic costs, and its adverse impact on morbidity and mortality. Beyond glomerular filtration and glomerular injury, the kidney has many other critical biological functions that are primarily mediated by the tubulointerstitium; these include proximal tubule reabsorption, electrolyte transport, acid/base homeostasis, and endocrine actions. Neither eGFR nor albuminuria captures tubulo- interstitial abnormalities. Our preliminary data strongly suggest that a comprehensive assessment of kidney health in adults will require the addition of measures of tubulo-interstitial injury and tubular function. The broa objective of this proposal will be to develop a Kidney Tubule Health Panel (KTHP) that will be comprised of established and novel measures of kidney tubule injury and dysfunction. For kidney tubule injury, we will evaluate and compare the prognostic value of urinary measures of proximal tubule injury, distal tubule injury, and interstitial fibrosis. For kidney tubule dysfuncton, we will evaluate the prognostic utility of endocrine resistance, metabolic acidosis, decreased proximal tubule reabsorption, and host defense. Outcomes of interest will include development of end-stage renal disease (ESRD), progressive loss of kidney function and development of hospitalized acute kidney injury (AKI) (Aims 1 and 2). In Aim 3 we will develop the KTHP utilizing novel statistical approaches to select a parsimonious set of biomarkers that will maximize the prediction of ESRD, progressive loss of kidney function, and AKI. We will address our hypotheses in the Reasons for Geographic and Racial Differences in Stroke Study (REGARDS) and the Multi-Ethnic Study of Atherosclerosis (MESA), as they offer a broad age range of participants, a large representation of whites, blacks, Asians, and Hispanics, detailed measures of kidney risk factors, available urine and serum specimens and the outcomes of ESRD, loss of kidney function and AKI over 10 years. By broadening the assessment of kidney health and disease beyond the glomerulus, we believe that our KTHP can ultimately lead to improved understanding, classification, prevention, and treatment of CKD. Our proposal includes a collaborative team of PIs, each with expertise in different components of the application, a long-standing history of collaboration, and extensive expertise in both cohorts.

是吗？描述（由申请人提供）：目前，慢性肾脏疾病（CKD）的临床评估依赖于肾小球滤过（EGFR）和肾小球损伤（蛋白尿）的评估。这种对肾小球健康的二维评估构成了最近肾脏疾病改善全球预后（kdigo）指南的基础，因为每一种评估都代表ckd的不同组成部分，并且每一种评估都提供了关于不良肾脏和非肾脏预后的独立信息。正如所定义的，CKD是一个巨大的公共卫生问题，因为它的高流行率，其经济成本，及其对发病率和死亡率的不利影响。除了肾小球滤过和肾小球损伤外，肾脏还有许多其他重要的生物学功能，主要由肾小管间质介导；这些功能包括近端肾小管再吸收、电解质转运、酸碱平衡和内分泌作用。egfr和蛋白尿均未捕捉到肾小管间质异常。我们的初步数据强烈表明，对成人肾脏健康的综合评估需要增加肾小管间质损伤和肾小管功能的测量。本提案的BROA目标是建立一个肾小管健康小组（KTHP），该小组将包括肾小管损伤和功能障碍的新措施。对于肾小管损伤，我们将评估和比较尿中测量近端小管损伤、远端小管损伤和间质纤维化的预后价值。对于肾小管功能障碍，我们将评估内分泌抵抗、代谢性酸中毒、近端小管再吸收减少和宿主防御的预后效用。感兴趣的结果将包括终末期肾病（esrd）的发展、肾功能的逐渐丧失和住院急性肾损伤（aki）的发展（目的1和2）。在目标3中，我们将利用新的统计方法来开发kthp，以选择一组简洁的生物标记物，最大限度地预测esrd、肾功能进行性丧失和aki。我们将讨论中风研究（ADVICES）和动脉粥样硬化多民族研究（Mesa）中的地理和种族差异的原因，因为它们提供了广泛的参与者年龄范围，白人、黑人、亚洲人和西班牙人的大量代表，肾危险因素的详细测量，可获得的尿液和血清样本以及10年来的血沉、肾功能丧失和AKI结果。通过扩大对肾小球以外肾脏健康和疾病的评估，我们相信我们的KTHP最终可以提高对CKD的理解、分类、预防和治疗。我们的提议包括一个由pis组成的协作团队，每个团队都拥有应用程序不同组件的专业知识、长期的协作历史以及两个团队的广泛专业知识。

Source.Name: National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases

Project.Title: Autonomous Offshore Wind Farm Inspection

Title_Other.Title: Autonomous Offshore Wind Farm Inspection
海上风电场自主检查

Project.Abstract:
"Offshore wind is a key energy source for the UK. It will play an increasingly significant role in future years, as part of an energy mix that is moving towards cleaner and more renewable sources. Offshore Wind Turbines (OWTs) have significant environmental challenges in terms of both the marine environment and the weather. This project, led by Perceptual Robotics and in partnership with ASV, the University of Bristol and VulcanUAV - will be developing and testing key technologies to address the autonomous inspection of offshore turbines.
Building on an existing capability for the inspection of onshore wind turbines, the team will be working on integrating this with an autonomous surface boat provided by ASV, creating a system which will automatically deploy and recover the inspection drone without the need for human interaction. The long term vision of this project is to enable fully autonomous inspection for OWT - working from an autonomous boat whilst being monitored remotely from land. Key challenges associated with this project include mechanical deployment, robust operations, multi vehicle cooperation, communications and the handling and processing of large datasets.
The team consists of specialists in drone design, construction and operation with Perceptual Robotics and VulcanUAV; specialists in autonomous marine vehicles through ASV; experts in computer vision with Bristol University and the ideal facilities in which to develop and test the system at the ORE Catapult facilities. Working together to solve the problems associated with operating an autonomous system in the extreme environment found offshore, the team will need to use modern control theory, sensors, materials, computer technology and AI algorithms to create a platform which can carry out rapid, robust inspections in the marine environment.
A fully autonomous system for offshore turbine inspection will not only significantly reduce the costs associated with ongoing inspection, but will also improve the quality and quantity of the inspection data. Modern sensing, including the vision processing offered by the University of Bristol will allow Perceptual Robotics to fly closer and more accurately with respect to the blades, thereby improving the images and maximising the flight envelope. This in turn will offer the potential for accurate condition monitoring and possible lifetime extensions. The UK is currently a world leader in offshore wind energy and this project will provide a further step change in the efficiency and quality of inspections."

Abstract_Other.Abstract: “海上风电是英国的关键能源。它将在未来几年发挥越来越重要的作用，作为朝着更清洁和更可再生能源方向发展的能源组合的一部分。海上风力涡轮机（OWTs）在海洋环境和天气方面都面临着重大的环境挑战。该项目由感知机器人技术牵头，并与ASV、布里斯托尔大学和VulcanUAV合作，将开发和测试关键技术，以解决海上涡轮机的自动检查问题。 在现有的陆上风力涡轮机检查能力的基础上，该小组将致力于将这与AASV提供的自主水面船集成，创建一个系统，该系统将自动部署和恢复检查无人机，而不需要人类交互。该项目的长期目标是实现对OWT的完全自主检查——在从陆地远程监控的同时，从自主船上进行工作。与该项目相关的主要挑战包括机械部署、稳健的操作、多车辆协作、通信以及大型数据集的处理和处理。 该团队由以下方面的专家组成：无人机设计、建造和使用感知机器人和VulcanUAV的操作专家；通过ASV的自主海上车辆专家；布里斯托尔大学的计算机视觉专家以及在矿石弹射器设施中开发和测试系统的理想设施。为了共同解决在海上极端环境下操作自主系统的相关问题，该团队将需要使用现代控制理论、传感器、材料、计算机技术和人工智能算法，以创建一个平台，能够在海洋环境中进行快速、稳健的检查。 一个完全自主的海上涡轮机检查系统不仅将大大降低与正在进行的检查相关的成本，而且还将提高检查数据的质量和数量。现代感测，包括布里斯托大学提供的视觉处理，将允许感知机器人相对于叶片更近、更精确地飞行，从而改善图像并最大化飞行包络线。这反过来将提供准确的状态监测和可能的寿命延长的潜力。英国目前在海上风能领域处于世界领先地位，该项目将在检查的效率和质量上进一步改变。”

Project.Title: Nutrition of Plant-Feeding Mites

Title_Other.Title: 植物性食螨的营养
Nutrition of Plant-Feeding Mites

Project.Title: Mineral-Fluid Equilibria in Iron-Formation in the Aureole of the Duluth Gabbro

Title_Other.Title: Mineral-Fluid Equilibria in Iron-Formation in the Aureole of the Duluth Gabbro
德卢斯辉长岩光环中铁形成的矿物流体平衡

Class.ClassName: 氧化物矿物、氢氧化物矿物

Project.Abstract: 9627829 Frost This pilot study will concentrate on the relations of the LTV mine in the Biwabik iron formation. With increasing grade, individual siderite layers in the aureole become oxidized to magnetite. The PIs will attempt to determine the process by which this oxidation occurred. Carbon and oxygen isotopes will be used to determine whether the formation of the magnetite was preceded by simple oxidation or by formation of metastable methane. Each process should produce a distinctive isotopic signature. Ion microprobe analyses of the silicates and carbonates will be performed o determined the temperature and fluid compositions that were present at the time of oxidation. The magnetite-hematite relations in low grade rocks will also be investigated.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 9627829 Frost本次试验研究将集中于比瓦比克铁矿地层中LTV矿山的关系。随着品位的增加，光晕中的个别菱铁矿层变为磁铁矿。PIS将试图确定氧化发生的过程。碳和氧同位素将被用来确定磁铁矿的形成是否是简单氧化或形成亚稳甲烷之前。每个过程都应该产生一个独特的同位素特征。将进行硅酸盐和碳酸盐的离子微探针分析，以确定在氧化时存在的温度和流体成分。此外，还将研究低品位岩石中的磁铁矿-赤铁矿关系。

9627829 Frost This pilot study will concentrate on the relations of the LTV mine in the Biwabik iron formation. With increasing grade, individual siderite layers in the aureole become oxidized to magnetite. The PIs will attempt to determine the process by which this oxidation occurred. Carbon and oxygen isotopes will be used to determine whether the formation of the magnetite was preceded by simple oxidation or by formation of metastable methane. Each process should produce a distinctive isotopic signature. Ion microprobe analyses of the silicates and carbonates will be performed o determined the temperature and fluid compositions that were present at the time of oxidation. The magnetite-hematite relations in low grade rocks will also be investigated.

Project.Title: 2011 Molecular and Cellular Biology of Lipids Gordon Research Conference

Title_Other.Title: 2011年脂质分子与细胞生物学戈登研究会
2011 Molecular and Cellular Biology of Lipids Gordon Research Conference

Project.Abstract: DESCRIPTION (provided by applicant): This application is for partial support of the 2011 Gordon Research Conference (GRC) on Molecular and Cellular Biology of Lipids, a meeting that will bring together leading scientists in the field to present and discuss their research and to facilitate advances in lipid research. This conference has been held every other year for almost 50 years and is nationally and internationally recognized as a prestigious forum for the presentation of ground breaking research in lipid biochemistry and molecular biology. In 2011, the conference will focus heavily on the continuing emergence of lipids in understanding the mechanisms of health maintenance and chronic disease development. The meeting will be held July 17 - 22 at the Waterville Valley Resort in Waterville Valley, New Hampshire, and will include nine lecture sessions and four afternoon poster sessions. Lecture sessions will cover a broad range of topics, including the genetic regulation of lipid metabolism, cellular lipid trafficking, regulation of sterol metabolism, function and regulation of phospholipid metabolism, intracellular storage of neutral lipids, lipids and cell signaling, novel methodologies and lipid frontiers, and the molecular mechanisms of metabolic diseases. The >32 speakers in these sessions will describe research done in an array of biological systems, from humans to yeast to model membranes, and using multiple experimental approaches. The talks at the Molecular and Cellular Biology of Lipids GRC, as well as the large and lively poster sessions, are well known to stimulate dynamic discussions among attendees who in this case will include biochemists, cell biologists, geneticists, molecular biologists, structural biologists, and physiologists. Scientists who attend this conference derive synergistic benefit from close interactions with the high quality speakers and the diverse experimental backgrounds of both the speakers and the participants, all fostered by the intimate atmosphere of the meeting, which is limited to about 150 participants. These benefits in turn drive future advances and multidisciplinary collaborations in the field. Participants and speakers have been and will be chosen to reflect international excellence in this medically-relevant area of science, with an ideal balance between youth and experience. The program includes outstanding women and men, and scientists of many different ethnicities. Superb facilities are available to accommodate handicapped individuals. PUBLIC HEALTH RELEVANCE: Lipids such as fats and cholesterol are required for life, but cause heart attacks and strokes when present in excess. It is also now known that lipids play an important role in the development of other metabolic syndrome disorders including diabetes, obesity, and some types of cancer. The 2011 Gordon Research Conference on the Molecular and Cellular Biology of Lipids will address current issues in lipid metabolism, and how the fundamental processes of lipid synthesis, breakdown, and storage go awry in cardiovascular and other diseases.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: DESCRIPTION (provided by applicant): This application is for partial support of the 2011 Gordon Research Conference (GRC) on Molecular and Cellular Biology of Lipids, a meeting that will bring together leading scientists in the field to present and discuss their research and to facilitate advances in lipid research. 说明（由申请人提供）：本申请是为了部分支持2011年关于脂质分子和细胞生物学的戈登研究会议（GRC），该会议将汇集该领域的主要科学家，介绍和讨论他们的研究，并促进脂质研究的进展。本次会议每隔一年举行一次，为期近50年，是国内外公认的脂质生物化学和分子生物学领域开创性研究的著名论坛。2011年，会议将重点关注脂质在理解健康维持和慢性病发展机制中的持续出现。会议将于7月17日至22日在新罕布什尔州沃特维尔山谷的沃特维尔山谷度假村举行，包括九次讲座和四次下午海报会议。讲座内容广泛，包括脂质代谢的遗传调控、细胞脂质转运、固醇代谢的调控、磷脂代谢的功能和调控、中性脂质的细胞内储存、脂质和细胞信号、新方法和脂质前沿等，以及代谢性疾病的分子机制。在这些课程中，32位以上的演讲者将描述在一系列生物系统中所做的研究，从人类到酵母到模型膜，并使用多种实验方法。众所周知，在脂质GRC的分子和细胞生物学的讲座，以及大型和生动的海报会议，将激发与会者之间的动态讨论，在这种情况下，与会者将包括生物化学家、细胞生物学家、遗传学家、分子生物学家、结构生物学家和生理学家。出席本次会议的科学家们从与高质量发言者的密切互动以及发言者和与会者的不同实验背景中获得协同效益，所有这些都是由会议的亲密气氛所促成的，而会议的参与者仅限于约150人。这些好处反过来推动了未来的进展和该领域的多学科合作。与会者和发言者已经并将被选为反映这一医学相关科学领域的国际卓越水平，在青年和经验之间实现理想的平衡。这个项目包括杰出的男女，以及许多不同种族的科学家。为残疾人士提供一流的设施。公共健康相关性：脂肪和胆固醇等脂类是生命所必需的，但过量时会引发心脏病和中风。现在也知道，脂质在其他代谢综合征疾病的发展中起着重要作用，包括糖尿病、肥胖症和某些类型的癌症。2011戈登脂质分子和细胞生物学研究会议将讨论脂质代谢的当前问题，以及在心血管和其他疾病中脂质合成、分解和储存的基本过程如何出错。

Title_Other.Title: 粘土岩地层松动带发育和愈合研究实验室项目（简称：LUVEAT）
Laborprogramm zur Untersuchung der Entwicklung und Verheilung von Auflockerungszonen in Tonsteinformationen (Kurztitel: LUVEAT)

Project.Title: Clinical and immunological aspects of toxoplasmosis in hypokodemia of experimentally infected animals

Title_Other.Title: 实验感染动物低血钾症弓形虫病的临床和免疫学研究
Klinické a imunologické aspekty toxoplasmózy při hypojodémii experimentálně infikovaných zvířat

Class.ClassName: 控制论（数学）、信息论（数学）

Project.Abstract: The primary infection of a susceptible animal with the T. gondii parasite is mostly asymptomatic, the clinical disease develops when an infection occurs during pregnancy or an infection of immunosuppressed animals. At present, toxoplasmosis is considered to be one of the major causes of abortions in small ruminants. The severity of this zoonosis is documented by my work PGS, in which T. gondii infection was confirmed by serological examination in 69% of goats kept in the Czech Republic and in which the clinically manifesting toxoplasmosis of goats was documented for the first time in the Czech Republic. The finding of clinical signs of toxoplasmosis in goats with a concomitant deficiency of iodine suggests the existence of a close relationship between hypokodemia of the organism and the clinical manifestation of toxoplasmosis. Within this grant project, the ability of a body with attenuated iodine deficiency to respond to the protozoan parasite of T. gondii will be verified. The study of this problem will be carried out in the form of experiments (laboratory mouse, small ruminant) in which, after induction of iodine killing,

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 感染弓形虫的易感动物的原发感染大多是无症状的，当感染发生在怀孕期间或免疫抑制动物的感染时，临床疾病就会发展。目前，弓形虫病被认为是小反刍动物流产的主要原因之一。我的工作PGS记录了这种人畜共患病的严重性，其中捷克共和国饲养的69%山羊的血清学检查证实了弓形虫感染，捷克共和国首次记录了山羊的临床表现弓形虫病。发现伴有碘缺乏的山羊弓形虫病的临床体征提示机体的低体温与弓形虫病的临床表现密切相关。在这个资助项目中，将验证碘缺乏减毒体对弓形虫原生动物寄生虫的反应能力。对这一问题的研究将以实验的形式进行（实验室老鼠、小反刍动物），在诱导碘杀灭后，

Primární infekce vnímavého zvířete parazitem T. gondii má většinou průběh asymptomatický, k rozvoji klinického onemocnění dochází, dojde-li k infekci v průběhu březosti nebo k infekci imunosuprimovaných zvířat. V současnosti je toxoplazmóza považována zajednu z hlavních příčin abortů u malých přežvýkavců. Závažnost této zoonózy dokládá moje práce PGS, ve které byla infekce T. gondii potvrzena sérologickým vyšetřením až u 69 % koz chovaných v ČR a ve které byla poprvé v ČR dokumentována klinicky se manifestující toxoplazmóza koz. Nález klinických příznaků toxoplazmózy z koz se současně prokázaným deficitem jódu naznačuje existenci úzkého vztahu mezi hypojodemií organizmu a klinickou manifestací toxoplazmózy. V rámci tohoto grantového projektu bude ověřována schopnost organizmu oslabeného karencí jódu reagovat na protozoárního parazita T. gondii. Studium uvedeného problému bude realizováno formou pokusů (laboratorní myš, malý přežvýkavec), v rámci nichž bude po vyvolání karence jódu provedeno u pok

Organization.Name: University of Veterinary and Pharmaceutical Sciences
University of Veterinary and Pharmaceutical Sciences

Project.Title: 2007 Molecular Membrane Biology GRC

Title_Other.Title: 2007 Molecular Membrane Biology GRC
2007分子膜生物学GRC

Project.Abstract: DESCRIPTION (provided by applicant): This grant will partially support travel costs and conference fees for speakers and session Chairs who have been invited to participate in the Molecular Membrane Biology (MMB) Gordon Conference to be held July 8-13, 2007 at Proctor Academy in Andover, NH. This meeting brings together scientists working on all aspects of membrane structure and function, including vesicle trafficking, organelle biogenesis and structure, lipid biology, membrane protein structure and function, and protein translocation. Hence, MMB has great value in that it facilitates detailed discussion and scientific exchange between investigators focused on understanding the complexity of membrane function. Proposed session topics include: Entering the ER; Traversing the Golgi; Lipid Transport and Localization; Vesicle Formation; Pathogens and Membrane Traffic; Organelle Structure and Dynamics; Membrane Domains; Membrane Fusion; and Reaching the Plasma Membrane. We have invited a diverse group of speakers, many of whom are early in their careers and 22% of whom are female. We have left open at least 19 slots for additional short presentations chosen from submitted abstracts, increasing our opportunities for hearing the most recent and exciting results and diversifying our speakers. We have invited several established investigators (33% female) to serve as session Chairs, and have set aside 20 minutes at the end of each session for the Chairs to present an overview and to lead a general discussion of current controversies, unresolved issues, and future directions, in a manner that will engage a large percentage of the audience. This meeting is generally oversubscribed and is considered a 'must-attend' for many in the field. Research conducted by attendees is funded by several NIH institutes, including NIGMS, NCI, NEI, NIDDK, NICHD, NIMH and NIAID. Thus, the work discussed is of general significance to human health and disease.

说明（由申请人提供）：此项补助金将部分资助应邀参加将于2007年7月8日至13日在新罕布什尔州安多弗市普罗克特学院举行的分子膜生物学（MMB）戈登会议的演讲者和会议主席的差旅费和会议费。这次会议汇集了研究膜结构和功能的各个方面的科学家，包括囊泡运输、细胞器的生物发生和结构、脂质生物学、膜蛋白结构和功能以及蛋白质转运。因此，MMB有很大的价值，因为它有助于研究者之间的详细讨论和科学交流，重点是了解膜功能的复杂性。建议的会议主题包括：进入内质网；穿过高尔基体；脂质运输和定位；囊泡形成；病原体和膜运输；细胞器结构和动力学；膜域；膜融合；到达质膜。我们邀请了一批不同的演讲者，其中许多人都是刚开始工作的，22%是女性。我们已经为从提交的摘要中选择的额外简短演讲留出了至少19个名额，增加了我们听到最新和令人兴奋的结果的机会，并使我们的发言人多样化。我们邀请了几位资深调查人员（33%为女性）担任会议主席，并在每届会议结束时留出20分钟让主席概述当前的争议、未解决的问题和未来的发展方向，以吸引大部分观众的方式。这次会议通常超额认购，被认为是该领域许多人的“必须出席”会议。与会者进行的研究是由几个国家卫生研究院资助的，包括NIGMS，NCI，NEI，NIDDK，NICHD，NIMH和NIAID。因此，本文所讨论的工作对人类健康和疾病具有普遍意义。

Source.Name: National Institute of General Medical Sciences

Project.Title: Doctoral Dissertation Research: Nation-Making and the Politics of Difference

Title_Other.Title: Doctoral Dissertation Research: Nation-Making and the Politics of Difference
博士论文研究：国家创造与差异政治

Project.Abstract: This project analyses the formation of the British nation state within the context of racial politics. While current scholarship views this history as a struggle for rights, British colonial subjects were being excluded from holding these rights. The formation of civil, political and social rights within Britain took place at a time when British settlers built a slave-empire in the Caribbean, implemented forced labor regimes across four continents, and controlled immigration. The purpose is to understand the politics of racial exclusion. The study seeks to find the historical roots of the nation state's hostility towards immigrants and refugees. Analyzing the legacies of empire involved in the construction of the British nation state aims to shine a light on the deep-seated racial politics linking Europe and its former colonial others. Even though historical sociology has long studied the formation of the modern nation state, existing explanatory mechanisms are largely endogenous to Europe and a spatial break between "the nation" and "the empire" has seeped into sociological analytical frameworks. The project addresses this analytical shortcoming and examines the making of modern Britain in interaction with the colonial British West Indies. It asks: How did the British nation state form amidst a context of colonial empire? Specifically, research focuses on three historical moments in metropolitan and colonial British politics: The formation of civil rights amidst settler rights claims and slavery abolition; the formation of working class political rights amidst indentured labor regimes in the empire; and the formation of social rights during a time of colonial immigration. The study draws on government archival documents, colonial office communications and newspapers, and it has two objectives: First, it seeks to explain how and why the British metropolitan body politic came to be defined against colonial populations and created a citizenry that was imagined as white, normalizing the color line. Second, following the consolidation of the nation state, it aims to show how immigrating colonial subjects challenged the nation-building project and how a struggle over difference came to threaten the isomorphism between people, race and nation.

这个项目分析了在种族政治背景下英国民族国家的形成。虽然目前的学术界将这段历史视为争取权利的斗争，但英国殖民地的臣民却被排除在享有这些权利的范围之外。英国国内公民、政治和社会权利的形成是在英国殖民者在加勒比海建立奴隶帝国、在四大洲实行强迫劳动制度以及控制移民的时候发生的。目的是了解种族排斥的政治。这项研究试图找出民族国家对移民和难民的敌意的历史根源。分析帝国在英国民族国家建设中的遗产，旨在揭示将欧洲与其前殖民地国家联系起来的根深蒂固的种族政治。尽管历史社会学长期以来一直在研究现代民族国家的形成，但现有的解释机制在很大程度上是欧洲内生性的，“民族”与“帝国”之间的空间断裂已经渗透到社会学的分析框架中。该项目解决了这一分析上的缺陷，并考察了现代英国与殖民地英属西印度群岛的互动。它问：在殖民帝国的背景下，英国民族国家是如何形成的？具体来说，研究集中在英国大都市和殖民地政治的三个历史时刻：定居者权利主张和废除奴隶制中的民权形成；帝国契约劳动制度中工人阶级政治权利的形成；以及殖民移民时期社会权利的形成。这项研究借鉴了政府档案文件、殖民地办公室通讯和报纸，有两个目标：第一，它试图解释英国大都会政治体是如何和为什么被定义为反对殖民地人口，并创造了一个被想象为白人的公民，使肤色线正常化。第二，在民族国家巩固之后，它旨在说明移民殖民主体是如何挑战国家建设工程的，如何通过争夺差异来威胁人、种族和民族的同构。

Source.Name: Directorate for Social, Behavioral & Economic Sciences

Project.Title: Photonic liquid crystal polymer fiber.

Title_Other.Title: 光子液晶聚合物光纤。
Polimerowe ciekłokrystaliczne światłowody fotoniczne.

Class.ClassName: 高分子物理、高分子物理化学

Project.Abstract: In this research project (NCN 2011/01 / B / ST7 / 05015) fotoników team of prof. T. Wolin from the Department of Physics in collaboration with teams of chemists with UMTS and WAT (respectively experts in the field of fiber optics technology and photonic liquid crystals) carried out experimental and theoretical research of polymer photonic crystal fiber. The first task was the selection of suitable polymer materials to produce photonic fiber. The choice fell on these polymers PMMA, PC and Zeonex. Next, numerical modeling was carried out fotonicznychi designed fiber optic, which have been prepared in UMTS and ordered the company Kiriama (Australia). In order to retune the dynamic optical properties of the fiber filled polymer dedicated polar mixtures of highly reactive liquid crystal, inter alia, temperature, electric field, magnetic and optical. Thus prepared fiber was tested for the effect of temperature on the phenomenon of light propagation. As a result of research gave selective propagation of light based on the phenomenon of the photonic band gap and the effect of retuning breaks under the influence of temperature. The effects have been observed so far only in optical fibers made of silica glass with air core and fiber-optic photonic crystal. Later in the project developed four integrated microelectrodes to the electrical control propagacyjnymi properties of photonic crystal fiber. Also conducted research on the impact of electric field on the propagation of light in liquid crystal polymer fiber PC. Effect was observed reorientation of liquid crystal molecules in the presence of increasing the electric field, which resulted in a loss of power propagated light and narrowing of the spectrum. The project also developed a technique called. "Cold welding" or polymeric fiber splicing with optical fibers silica using UV light curable adhesive. The study showed the possibility of using polymer photonic crystal fiber to build the tunable optical filters, silencers or polarization controllers. Fiber polymer to a large extent can be used for sensing applications as strain sensors longitudinal or transverse. However, it should be borne in mind that is not yet stable and repeatable systems. Measurements show that it is still necessary to carry out many studies on the strength of systems and repeatability phenomena. The research on polymeric materials and polymer fiber photonic significantly broadened knowledge, and enriched with new experiences collaborating research teams from the Faculty of Physics and UMTS and WAT. This project opens up new possibilities in the field of sensors and optical systems based on fiber-optic polymer structures and contribute to the further development of new photonic technologies using liquid crystal polymer fiber photonic, and for the development of related disciplines such as, for example. Optofluidyka fiber.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 在这个研究项目（NCN 2011/01/B/ST7/05015）中，物理系T.Wolin教授的fotoników团队与UMTS和WAT的化学家团队（分别是光纤技术和光子液晶领域的专家）合作，对聚合物光子晶体进行了实验和理论研究纤维。第一个任务是选择合适的聚合物材料来制作光子纤维。选择的对象是这些聚合物PMMA、PC和Zeonex。接下来，对fotonicznychi设计的光纤进行了数值模拟，该光纤已在UMTS中制备并订购了Kiriama（澳大利亚）公司。为了恢复高反应性液晶的光纤填充聚合物专用极性混合物的动态光学特性，特别是温度、电场、磁场和光学特性。测试了温度对光纤传输现象的影响。研究结果给出了基于光子带隙现象和温度影响下的退调谐断裂效应的光选择性传输。到目前为止，这种效应只在空心石英玻璃光纤和光纤光子晶体光纤中观察到。随后在项目中开发了四种集成微电极，用于光子晶体光纤的电控制性能研究。还研究了电场对液晶聚合物光纤PC中光传播的影响，发现电场增大时液晶分子的取向发生了改变，导致传播光功率损失和光谱变窄。该项目还开发了一种技术，称为。”“冷焊接”或使用紫外线固化粘合剂与光纤二氧化硅进行聚合纤维拼接。研究表明，利用聚合物光子晶体光纤制作可调谐滤光片、消声器或偏振控制器是可行的。纤维聚合物在很大程度上可用作纵向或横向应变传感器。然而，应该记住的是，还不是稳定和可重复的系统。测量结果表明，对系统的强度和重复性现象仍有必要进行大量的研究。聚合物材料和聚合物光纤光子的研究极大地拓宽了知识面，丰富了来自物理系、UMTS和WAT的合作研究团队的新经验。该项目在基于光纤聚合物结构的传感器和光学系统领域开辟了新的可能性，并有助于进一步开发利用液晶聚合物光纤光子的新光子技术，以及发展相关学科，例如。视光纤维。

W niniejszym projekcie badawczym (NCN 2011/01/B/ST7/05015) zespół fotoników prof. T. Wolińskiego z Wydziału Fizyki PW przy współpracy z zespołami chemików z UMCS i z WAT (odpowiednio specjalistami w dziedzinie technologii światłowodów fotonicznych oraz ciekłych kryształów) przeprowadził badania eksperymentalne i teoretyczne polimerowych ciekłokrystalicznych światłowodów fotonicznych. Pierwszym zadaniem było dobranie odpowiednich materiałów polimerowych do wytworzenia światłowodów fotonicznych. Wybór padł na wspomniane polimery PMMA, PC i Zeonex. W następnej kolejności przeprowadzono modelowanie numeryczne światłowodów fotonicznychi zaprojektowano światłowody, które zostały wytworzone w UMCS oraz zamówione w firmie Kiriama (Australia). W celu uzyskania dynamicznego przestrajania właściwości optycznych światłowody polimerowe wypełniano dedykowanymi niepolarnymi mieszaninami ciekłokrystalicznymi silnie reagującymi między innymi na temperaturę, pole elektryczne, magnetyczne oraz optyczne. Tak przygotowane światłowody przebadano pod kątem wpływu temperatury na zjawisko propagacji światła. W wyniku badań uzyskano selektywną propagację światła opartą na zjawisku fotonicznej przerwy wzbronionej, a także efekt przestrajania przerw pod wpływem temperatury. Uzyskane efekty dotychczas obserwowane były jedynie w światłowodach wykonanych ze szkła krzemionkowego z powietrznym rdzeniem i ciekłokrystalicznych światłowodach fotonicznych. W dalszej części projektu opracowano cztery układy mikroelektrod do elektrycznego sterowania właściwościami propagacyjnymi ciekłokrystalicznych światłowodów fotonicznych. Przeprowadzono także badania dotyczące wpływu pola elektrycznego na propagację światła w polimerowym ciekłokrystalicznym światłowodzie fotonicznym. Zaobserwowano efekt reorientacji molekuł ciekłego kryształu w obecności rosnącego pola elektrycznego, które powodowało spadek mocy propagowanego światła i zawężenie jego widma. W ramach projektu opracowano również technikę tzw. „zimnego spawania”, czyli łączenia światłowodów polimerowych ze światłowodami krzemionkowymi za pomocą klejów utwardzalnych światłem UV. Przeprowadzone badania wykazały możliwość zastosowania polimerowych ciekłokrystalicznych światłowodów fotonicznych do budowy przestrajalnych filtrów optycznych, tłumików czy też kontrolerów polaryzacji. Światłowody polimerowe w dużej mierze mogą posłużyć do zastosowań czujnikowych, jako sensory naprężeń podłużnych czy też poprzecznych. Jednak trzeba mieć na uwadze fakt, iż nie są na razie układy stabilne i powtarzalne. Z pomiarów wynika, że konieczne jest jeszcze przeprowadzenie wielu badań dotyczących wytrzymałości układów i powtarzalności zjawisk. Przeprowadzone badania dotyczące materiałów polimerowych i polimerowych światłowodów fotonicznych w znacznym stopniu poszerzyły stan wiedzy, a także wzbogaciły o nowe doświadczenia współpracujące zespoły badawcze z Wydziału Fizyki PW oraz z UMCS i WAT. Niniejszy projekt otwiera nowe możliwości w dziedzinie czujników i układów optycznych opartych na światłowodowych strukturach polimerowych i przyczyni się do dalszego rozwoju nowych technologii fotonicznych z wykorzystaniem ciekłokrystalicznych polimerowych światłowodów fotonicznych, a także do rozwoju pokrewnych dyscyplin naukowych takich jak np. optofluidyka światłowodowa.

Project.Title: IQSY Program in Meteorology

Title_Other.Title: 气象学中的IQSY程序
IQSY Program in Meteorology

Project.Title: Roles for YAP in multiciliogenesis

Title_Other.Title: YAP在多向成骨中的作用
Roles for YAP in multiciliogenesis

Class.ClassName: 理论、技术、方法、研究、评价、策略

Project.Abstract: DESCRIPTION (provided by applicant): Cilia are thin hair-like projections that form on the surface of cells and help cells sense and respond to their environment. These structures are found ubiquitously throughout the body and defects cause a variety of diseases, collectively referred to as ciliopathies. In the lung, cilia are critical for defense of the epithelium against damage, and dysfunction of cilia ultimately leads to chronic respiratory disease. The aim of this proposed work is to determine the mechanism of cilia formation in the lung following cell fate specification, focusing on two proteins, Yes-associated protein (Yap) and Trim32. Classically described as a transcriptional effector of the Hippo pathway, Yap is recruited to the apical domain of ciliated cells at the base of cilia, and this proposal will explore a non-canonical role or Yap in regulating the cytoskeleton at that location. The requirement for Yap at different stages of cilia formation and maintenance will be determined through in vivo and in vitro assays using an inducible loss of function approach. We have identified Trim32, an E3 ubiquitin ligase that has been shown to target actin and has also been implicated in Bardet Beidl ciliopathies, as a Yap interacting protein. The activity of this protein and its requirement for Yap-directed ciliogenesis will be examined through gain and loss of function experiments in vitro. Collectively these studies will advance our understanding of cilia formation in the lung epithelium and improve our ability to combat ciliopathies and their detrimental impact on human health.

? 描述（由申请人提供）：纤毛是在细胞表面形成的细毛状突起，有助于细胞感知和响应环境。这些结构广泛存在于全身，缺陷导致多种疾病，统称为睫状体病。在肺中，纤毛是保护上皮免受损伤的关键，纤毛功能障碍最终导致慢性呼吸系统疾病。这项工作的目的是确定细胞命运规范后肺纤毛形成的机制，重点是两种蛋白质，是相关蛋白（Yap）和Trim32。经典地描述为Hippo途径的转录效应器，Yap被招募到纤毛基部纤毛细胞的顶端区域，本研究将探讨Yap在该位置调节细胞骨架中的非典型作用。在纤毛形成和维持的不同阶段对Yap的需求将通过体内和体外实验，采用诱导性功能丧失的方法来确定。我们已经鉴定了Trim32，一种E3泛素连接酶，已被证明以肌动蛋白为靶点，并且作为Yap相互作用蛋白参与了Bardet-bedl纤毛病。该蛋白的活性及其对Yap定向纤毛形成的需要将通过体外获得和丧失功能实验来检测。总之，这些研究将促进我们对肺上皮纤毛形成的理解，提高我们对抗纤毛病及其对人类健康有害影响的能力。

Project.Title: NOVEL COMPACT HIGH ACCURACY NON-MAGNETIC AZIMUTH SENSOR THAT IS INSENSITIVE TO LOCAL ENVIRONMENT, INTERFERENCE, AND JAMMING

Title_Other.Title: NOVEL COMPACT HIGH ACCURACY NON-MAGNETIC AZIMUTH SENSOR THAT IS INSENSITIVE TO LOCAL ENVIRONMENT, INTERFERENCE, AND JAMMING
一种新型紧凑型高精度非磁方位传感器，对局部环境、干扰和干扰不敏感

Project.Abstract: The goal of this Phase-II SBIR effort is to build and demonstrate the performance and advantages of advanced azimuth sensors that are non-magnetic, compact, low power, light weight, rugged, insensitive to magnetic interference and electronic jamming, are not dependent on GPS signals, are readily integrated in laser rangefinders and laser designators, and are useful in Battlefield environments. The Phase-II effort includes an accelerated optimization, design, fabrication and demonstration of the novel azimuth sensor. Extensive interaction is planned with USMC, Naval, and System Prime personnel to optimize integration of the azimuth sensor into military system applications. Additionally two concurrent R & D options are proposed to add additional capabilities to the core OAS sensor.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: The goal of this Phase-II SBIR effort is to build and demonstrate the performance and advantages of advanced azimuth sensors that are non-magnetic, compact, low power, light weight, rugged, insensitive to magnetic interference and electronic jamming, are not dependent on GPS signals, are readily integrated in laser rangefinders and laser designators, and are useful in Battlefield environments. The Phase-II effort includes an accelerated optimization, design, fabrication and demonstration of the novel azimuth sensor. Extensive interaction is planned with USMC, Naval, and System Prime personnel to optimize integration of the azimuth sensor into military system applications. Additionally two concurrent R & D options are proposed to add additional capabilities to the core OAS sensor.

第二阶段SBIR的目标是建立和展示先进的方位传感器的性能和优势，这些传感器无磁、紧凑、低功耗、重量轻、坚固耐用、对磁干扰和电子干扰不敏感，不依赖于GPS信号，很容易集成在激光测距仪和激光指示器中，在战场环境中很有用。第二阶段的工作包括加速优化、设计、制造和演示新型方位传感器。计划与USMC、海军和系统主要人员进行广泛的交互，以优化方位传感器在军事系统应用中的集成。此外，还提出了两种并行研发方案，以增加核心OAS传感器的额外能力。

Source.Name: United States Department of the Navy

Project.Title: Material Transformation and Community Creation at the Etowah Site, Georgia

Title_Other.Title: Material Transformation and Community Creation at the Etowah Site, Georgia
格鲁吉亚埃托瓦遗址的物质改造和社区创建

Project.Abstract: With support from the National Science Foundation, Dr. Adam King and colleagues seek to explore changes in the built environment of the Etowah site and how those changes reflect community organization and the community formation process itself. While this study is firmly grounded in material culture, architecture, and the use of space the intent is to use data generated through remote sensing as a primary source for interpretation. Traditionally, the data generated through techniques such as gradiometry, ground-penetrating radar, and electrical resistance have only been used as guides for where to excavate to evaluate ideas and learn about the past. In part the emphasis on remote sensing is a conscious effort to reduce the impacts (of excavation) on the archaeological record of Etowah -- a precious resource to some and sacred to others. Additionally, the emphasis on remote sensing data is intended to push the interpretive limits of those data. This project to explore the creation of the social groups living at Etowah through the built environment will contribute to continuing efforts to understand the formation of complex, often multi-ethnic communities of the Mississippian period. Because the establishment and creation of the physical space of a community is a human universal, what is learned from these efforts will contribute to broader attempts, spanning time and geography, to explore the creation of society using space and architecture. Methodologically, this project attempts to push the limits of non-invasive investigations by asking questions of geophysical data that traditionally have been asked only of excavated data. The results may make it possible to study the development of prehistoric communities like Etowah using only geophysical data and information from very limited and targeted excavations. Today the Etowah site is a state park and a prehistoric archaeological site famous for having some of the largest earthen platform mounds built in the Deep South, and producing some of the most impressive art objects ever found in the Southeast. In the past it was a thriving Native American community and capital of a larger polity: a role it played for some 550 years during the Mississippian period of the Native American past. Etowah's archaeological record not only captures the structure of those communities, but it also contains traces of the process through which those Etowah communities were formed. Communities are collections of people who, through various means, forge themselves into a social unit with a shared sense of identity, history, and community practice. Community creation is a complex and ongoing process that is part of the universal human experience, and it is encoded into the use of space, architecture, and material culture. This project uses remote sensing data and limited archaeological excavation to explore how Etowah's built environment and associated material culture were transformed with each new incarnation of the Etowah community and in turn examine the process of community creation. This project to explore the creation of the social groups living at Etowah through the built environment will contribute to continuing efforts to understand the formation of complex, often multi-ethnic communities of the Mississippian period. Because the establishment and creation of the physical space of a community is a human universal, what is learned from these efforts will contribute to broader attempts, spanning time and geography, to explore the creation of society using space and architecture. Methodologically, this project attempts to push the limits of non-invasive investigations by asking questions of geophysical data that traditionally have been asked only of excavated data. The results may make it possible to study the development of prehistoric communities like Etowah using only geophysical data and information from very limited and targeted excavations. This project will also serve an important teaching function. The archaeological data will be collected by field school students as they learn the process of archaeology, and the geophysical and archaeological data produced will form the basis for a graduate student theses. It is also designed to involve descendant communities in the exploration and interpretation of their history. Members of culturally affiliated Creek and Cherokee communities will be invited to participate in the data collection, the interpretation of the results and in learning from those interpretations.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 在国家科学基金会的支持下，亚当·金博士和同事们试图探索埃托瓦遗址建成环境的变化，以及这些变化如何反映社区组织和社区形成过程本身。虽然这项研究的基础是物质文化、建筑和空间利用，但目的是利用遥感数据作为主要解释来源。传统上，通过梯度测量、探地雷达和电阻等技术生成的数据，只被用作在何处挖掘、评估想法和了解过去的指南。在某种程度上，对遥感的重视是有意识地努力减少（挖掘）对埃托瓦考古记录的影响——埃托瓦对某些人来说是宝贵的资源，对其他人来说是神圣的。此外，对遥感数据的重视意在推动这些数据的解释极限。本项目旨在探索通过建成的环境创建生活在埃托瓦的社会群体，将有助于继续努力了解密西西比时期复杂、多民族社区的形成。由于建立和创造一个社区的自然空间是人类的普遍现象，从这些努力中学到的东西将有助于跨越时间和地理，探索利用空间和建筑创造社会的更广泛尝试。在方法上，该项目试图通过询问传统上只询问挖掘数据的地球物理数据来突破非侵入性调查的局限性。这些结果可能使我们有可能仅利用地球物理数据和来自非常有限和有针对性的挖掘的信息来研究像埃托瓦这样的史前社区的发展。今天，埃托瓦遗址是一个国家公园，也是一个史前考古遗址，以在南部深处建造一些最大的土平台土丘和在东南部发现的一些最令人印象深刻的艺术品而闻名。在过去，它是一个欣欣向荣的美洲原住民社区和一个更大的政体的首都：在美洲原住民过去的密西西比时期，它扮演了大约550年的角色。埃托瓦的考古记录不仅记录了这些社区的结构，而且还包含了这些埃托瓦社区形成过程的痕迹。社区是人们的集合，他们通过各种方式，将自己打造成一个具有共同身份感、历史感和社区实践的社会单元。社区创造是一个复杂而持续的过程，是人类普遍经验的一部分，它被编码到空间、建筑和物质文化的使用中。该项目利用遥感数据和有限的考古发掘，探索埃托瓦的建筑环境和相关的物质文化是如何随着埃托瓦社区的每一个新的化身而改变的，并反过来检查社区创建的过程。本项目旨在探索通过建成的环境创建生活在埃托瓦的社会群体，将有助于继续努力了解密西西比时期复杂、多民族社区的形成。由于建立和创造一个社区的自然空间是人类的普遍现象，从这些努力中学到的东西将有助于跨越时间和地理，探索利用空间和建筑创造社会的更广泛尝试。在方法上，该项目试图通过询问传统上只询问挖掘数据的地球物理数据来突破非侵入性调查的局限性。这些结果可能使我们有可能仅利用地球物理数据和来自非常有限和有针对性的挖掘的信息来研究像埃托瓦这样的史前社区的发展。这个项目也将发挥重要的教学作用。考古资料将由野外学校的学生在学习考古过程中收集，所产生的地球物理和考古资料将构成研究生论文的基础。它还旨在让后代社区参与对其历史的探索和解释。文化相关的克里克和切罗基社区的成员将被邀请参与数据收集、结果解释和学习

This project will also serve an important teaching function. The archaeological data will be collected by field school students as they learn the process of archaeology, and the geophysical and archaeological data produced will form the basis for a graduate student theses. It is also designed to involve descendant communities in the exploration and interpretation of their history. Members of culturally affiliated Creek and Cherokee communities will be invited to participate in the data collection, the interpretation of the results and in learning from those interpretations.

Source.Name: Directorate for Social, Behavioral & Economic Sciences

Project.Title: Textures and Tectonics of Metamorphic Crystallization

Title_Other.Title: Textures and Tectonics of Metamorphic Crystallization
变质结晶的结构与构造

Project.Abstract: A general aim of this project is understanding the dynamics of metamorphic textures by integrating mineral chemical and microstructural data: reconciling geometric and chemical aspects of metamorphic textures for petrologic and structural applications. These data are obtained and integrated using a variety of approaches: electron back-scattered diffraction to determine crystallographic orietnation, electron microprobe analysis to document mineral composition and zoning, X-ray computed tomography and serial sectioning/image analysis to obtain 3-dimensional views of textures, and modeling methods to explore crystal growth in the context of deformation (e.g., Elle microstructural modeling). This investigation focuses on the growth of garnet, an important metamorphic mineral for recording pressure, temperature, time, fluid, and deformation information during metamorphism, and the basis for many studies of metamorphic crystallization processes. Specific questions being studied are: What does the presence of high-angle misorientation boundaries in morphologically coherent crystals of garnet indicate about garnet nucleation and growth? And, because these boundaries are rare in other porphyroblasts: Do garnets grow by different mechanisms than other porphyroblasts? A hypothesis to be tested is that the boundaried form during early coalescence of garnets that grow prior to development of growth zoning, and that the boundaries represent special low energy orientations. This project represents part of the Ph.D. thesis of a University of Minnesota graduate student, Eric Goergen, and involve international collaboration with Dr. Mark Jessell (Toulouse). The research also involves undergraduate research assistants at Minnesota and summer interns from other institutions as part of an NSF-REU site. Results are being incorporated into a new teaching module that focuses on the Dutchess County, NY, Barrovian sequence; the module is distributed through the Teaching Petrology website.

本项目的总体目标是通过整合矿物化学和微观结构数据来理解变质结构的动力学：为岩石学和结构应用协调变质结构的几何和化学方面。这些数据是通过多种方法获得和整合的：电子背散射衍射确定晶体取向，电子探针分析记录矿物成分和分带，X射线计算机断层扫描和序列切片/图像分析获得纹理的三维视图，以及建模方法探索变形背景下的晶体生长（例如Elle微观结构建模）。石榴石是记录变质过程中压力、温度、时间、流体和变形等信息的重要变质矿物，是研究变质结晶过程的基础。研究的具体问题是：石榴石晶体中存在的大角度错取向边界对石榴石的形核和生长有何指示？而且，由于这些边界在其他的卟啉母细胞中很少见：石榴石的生长机制是否与其他卟啉母细胞不同？一个有待验证的假设是，在生长分区发展之前生长的石榴石在早期聚并期间形成的边界，并且边界代表特殊的低能方向。该项目是明尼苏达大学研究生埃里克·戈尔根博士论文的一部分，涉及与马克·杰塞尔博士（图卢兹）的国际合作。这项研究还包括明尼苏达大学的本科生研究助理和其他机构的暑期实习生，作为NSF-REU网站的一部分。研究结果被整合到一个新的教学模块中，该模块主要关注纽约州杜特奇斯县的巴罗维亚序列；该模块通过教学岩石学网站发布。

Project.Title: Filming teh Accession Records and Manuscript Indexes of the Houghton Library

Title_Other.Title: Filming teh Accession Records and Manuscript Indexes of the Houghton Library
霍顿图书馆收录记录及手稿索引的拍摄

Project.Abstract: Because the accessions records and manuscripts indexes of Harvard's Houghton Library are deteriorating, this project will develop a microfilm of these documents. This microfilm will allow the library to contribute substantially to the two main Federally-sponsored projects designed to describe American's manuscript holdings.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 由于哈佛大学霍顿图书馆的访问记录和手稿索引正在恶化，本项目将开发这些文件的缩微胶卷。这部缩微胶卷将使图书馆能够为两个主要的联邦资助项目做出实质性贡献，这两个项目旨在描述美国人的手稿藏品。

Because the accessions records and manuscripts indexes of Harvard's Houghton Library are deteriorating, this project will develop a microfilm of these documents. This microfilm will allow the library to contribute substantially to the two main Federally-sponsored projects designed to describe American's manuscript holdings.

Organization.Name: British Institute of the United States
British Institute of the United States

Project.Title: Crowdsourcing Assessments and Evaluations

Title_Other.Title: Crowdsourcing Assessments and Evaluations
众包评估和评估

Project.Abstract: Statement of Work:In many operation settings, the performance (or ability, experience, knowledge, productivity, etc.) of an agent(professionals, researchers, authors etc.) cannot be easily assessed by an objective ~test~ but rather must be inferred from the reports or evaluations of other agents. In such settings, it is necessary or convenient that the evaluation process be ~crowdsourced~. However, crowdsourcing systems for evaluations/assessments often do not operate well because ~peer~ evaluations may be unreliable for any of a number of reasons: the evaluator may be malicious or incompetent or may simply not exert sufficient effort to provide an accurate assessment because effort is not rewarded.To ensure that crowdsourcing systems for evaluations/assessments work well it is necessary to identify high quality (accurate) feedback and to provide incentives for evaluators to provide such feedback, and in particular, to encourage effort and cooperative behavior and discourage low quality feedback due to limited effort spent, incompetence ormalicious behavior. The goal of this project is to construct a system for crowdsourcing assessments that can operate in many different communities/types of agents in an efficient, fair and robust manner. The theory and the associated constructions willneed to enable us to deal with the incentive problems posed by assessments in a large variety of communities of professionals, including communities consisting of a large number of anonymous, heterogeneous (have different needs, preferences, capabilities, information etc.) agents, and in which the peers have heterogeneous ability and evaluations are (known to be) imperfect.Objective:The object of this research is to develop formalisms, methods and an associated ~crowdsourcing~ platform foreffectively performing evaluations/assessments using other peers. The methods developed will be very widelyapplicable in many scenarios, including those mentioned above ~ indeed to almost all settings in which the quality of the work of an individual is subjective, or cannot be directly tested or easily observed/evaluated by the authority ~ but can be observed/evaluated by peers.Approach:In this project the PI aims to develop a systematic framework for modeling the problem of crowdsourcing assessments, a theory for analyzing it, methods for solving it, algorithms for designing and implementing it and a prototype for validating it. Typically, evaluations require costly effort and do not convey direct benefit. This will mean that, in the absence of incentives, evaluators will not want to put in the effort needed to evaluate others. However, as mentioned previously, evaluators are in turn evaluated by others (not necessarily those that they evaluated), so social reciprocity can be used in the design of the crowdsourcing platform for assessments in such a way that if the evaluator does exert effort and provides an accurate evaluation, then he/she can be rewarded for this effort in the form of being assigned better evaluators in the future; this is desirable (at least for agents who produce good work) because better evaluatorsproduce more accurate assessments of quality and also because it is believed that the quality of an agent as a worker will improve if he/she receives high quality evaluations. A succinct way to keep track of the evaluator~s history of past assessments and their qualities is through a rating/reputation system. The rating will be used to reward/punish agentsthrough the assignment of better/worse sets of evaluators.Overall Merit and ONR Mission/Relevance:Providing high quality, competent and truthful assessments of the work performed by various agents - the ~agents~ may be individuals or teams of individuals ~ is of paramount importance for the well-functioning of any organization and/or operation, including the Navy and/or Naval operations. The systems developed in this project for crowdsourcing evaluations will be relevant to numerous Navy opera

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 工作说明：在许多操作环境中，一个代理（专业人员、研究人员、作者等）的表现（或能力、经验、知识、生产力等）不容易通过客观的测试来评估，而必须从其他代理的报告或评估中推断出来。在这种情况下，评估过程必须或方便地采用~crowdsourced~。然而，用于评估/评估的众包系统通常不能很好地运行，因为~peer~评估可能不可靠，原因有很多：评估者可能是恶意的或不称职的，或者仅仅因为努力得不到回报而没有足够的努力来提供准确的评估评价/评估工作良好，有必要确定高质量（准确）的反馈，并鼓励评价者提供此类反馈，特别是鼓励努力和合作行为，并阻止由于投入有限、不称职或行为不当而导致的低质量反馈。该项目的目标是构建一个众包评估系统，该系统能够以高效、公平和稳健的方式在许多不同的社区/类型的代理中运行。理论和相关的结构将需要使我们能够处理各种各样的专业人员社区中评估所带来的激励问题，包括由大量匿名、异构（具有不同需求、偏好、能力、信息等）代理组成的社区，目的：本研究的目的是发展形式、方法和相关的众包平台，使之能够有效地利用其他同行进行评估。所开发的方法将在许多情况下非常广泛地适用，包括上述情况~事实上，几乎所有个人工作质量是主观的情况下，或者不能被权威机构直接测试或容易观察/评估，但可以被同行观察/评估。方法：在本项目中，PI旨在开发一个系统框架，用于建模众包评估问题、分析该问题的理论、解决该问题的方法，设计和实现它的算法以及验证它的原型。通常情况下，评价工作需要付出昂贵的努力，而不会带来直接的好处。这将意味着，在没有激励措施的情况下，评估人员将不愿意投入评估他人所需的努力。然而，如前所述，评价者依次由其他人（不一定是他们所评价的人）进行评价，因此在设计众包平台进行评价时，可以采用社会互惠的方式，如果评价者确实付出了努力并提供了准确的评价，然后，他/她可以通过在未来被指派更好的评价者的形式得到奖励；这是可取的（至少对于那些做出好工作的代理人而言），因为更好的评价者能够对质量做出更准确的评价，而且还因为人们相信，如果他/她得到高的评价，作为一名工人的代理人的质量将会提高质量评估。一种简洁的方法是通过评级/声誉系统来跟踪评估者过去的评估历史及其质量。评级将用于通过指派更好/更差的评估人员来奖励/惩罚代理人。总体绩效和ONR任务/相关性：提供高质量，对于任何组织和/或行动（包括海军和/或海军行动）的良好运作而言，对各种代理人（代理人可能是个人或个人团队）所做工作的称职和真实评估至关重要。本项目中开发的众包评估系统将与众多海军歌剧院相关

Source.Name: United States Department of the Navy

Project.Title: Assessing fuel behavior in the sodium-cooled fast reactor ASTRID

Title_Other.Title: Assessing fuel behavior in the sodium-cooled fast reactor ASTRID
钠冷快堆ASTRID燃料特性评估

Class.ClassName: 同位素地质学、地质年代学

Project.Abstract: Large international research efforts are made on Gen IV nuclear energy systems for providing long-term sustainable energy production with low carbon emission. In France, world?s first prototype GenIV sodium-cooled reactor, ASTRID, is to be deployed by 2020, and the proposed research program contributes to ensuring its safe and secure operation by assessing fuel behavior in-core and at outage from the core. Two projects are included:Failed Fuel Detection (FFD): During reactor operation, fuel cladding may occasionally fail, releasing radioactive isotopes into the coolant. Early detection of such failures is crucial to mitigate releases. The ASTRID sodium coolant requires new FFD techniques as compared to currently deployed reactors. This research comprises a unique comparative study of three promising technologies; Gamma Spectroscopy of short-lived gas isotopes, Atmospheric Pressure Ionization Mass Spectroscopy and laser-driven Cavity Ring-Down Spectroscopy.Decay Heat Assessment of MA-bearing Fuels (DHA): A fuel parameter of paramount safety importance is decay heat, governing the short- and long-term cooling needs after power shutdown. In the ASTRID reactor, high-decay-heat MA-bearing fuels will be used, for which scarce data is available. Here, their properties will be researched in irradiation experiments in the OSIRIS reactor, and a dedicated calorimeter will be constructed in combination with a high sensitivity gamma spectrometer to assess the decay heat.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 国际上对第四代核能系统进行了大量研究，以提供低碳排放的长期可持续能源生产。在法国，世界？首个GenIV钠冷反应堆原型ASTRID将于2020年部署，拟议的研究计划通过评估堆芯内和堆芯停堆时的燃料特性，有助于确保其安全可靠运行。包括两个项目：失效燃料检测（FFD）：在反应堆运行期间，燃料包壳可能偶尔失效，将放射性同位素释放到冷却剂中。及早发现此类故障对于缓解释放至关重要。与目前部署的反应堆相比，阿斯特里德钠冷却剂需要新的FFD技术。这项研究包括三项有前途的技术的独特比较研究：短命气体同位素伽马能谱、大气压电离质谱和激光驱动腔衰荡光谱。含MA燃料（DHA）的衰变热评估：具有最高安全重要性的燃料参数是衰变热，控制电源关闭后的短期和长期冷却需求。在ASTRID反应堆中，将使用高衰变热含MA的燃料，对此，可获得的数据很少。在这里，它们的特性将在OSIRIS反应堆的辐照实验中进行研究，并将与高灵敏度伽马能谱仪相结合构建一个专用量热计来评估衰变热。

In France, world?s first prototype GenIV sodium-cooled reactor, ASTRID, is to be deployed by 2020, and the proposed research program contributes to ensuring its safe and secure operation by assessing fuel behavior in-core and at outage from the core. Two projects are included:Failed Fuel Detection (FFD): During reactor operation, fuel cladding may occasionally fail, releasing radioactive isotopes into the coolant. Early detection of such failures is crucial to mitigate releases. The ASTRID sodium coolant requires new FFD techniques as compared to currently deployed reactors. This research comprises a unique comparative study of three promising technologies; Gamma Spectroscopy of short-lived gas isotopes, Atmospheric Pressure Ionization Mass Spectroscopy and laser-driven Cavity Ring-Down Spectroscopy.Decay Heat Assessment of MA-bearing Fuels (DHA): A fuel parameter of paramount safety importance is decay heat, governing the short- and long-term cooling needs after power shutdown. In the ASTRID reactor, high-decay-heat MA-bearing fuels will be used, for which scarce data is available. Here, their properties will be researched in irradiation experiments in the OSIRIS reactor, and a dedicated calorimeter will be constructed in combination with a high sensitivity gamma spectrometer to assess the decay heat.

Title_Other.Title: 大气气溶胶形成系统的蒸气压研究
A Study of the Vapor Pressures of Systems Forming Atmospheric Aerosols

Source.Name: Directorate for Computer & Information Science & Engineering

Project.Title: Interdealer Trades in Over-the-Counter (OTC) Markets - Who Buys and Who Sells?

Title_Other.Title: Interdealer Trades in Over-the-Counter (OTC) Markets - Who Buys and Who Sells?
交易商间在场外交易市场交易-谁买谁卖？

Project.Abstract: Abstract as per original application: Over-the-counter (OTC) markets, as opposed to central trading, are where many assets including government and corporate bonds, asset-backed securities and derivatives are traded. In OTC markets, almost all trades go through dealers, and empirical findings have suggested that interdealer trades count for a large proportion of overall transactions. Recent papers have documented several empirical findings regarding interdealer trades. (1) The directions of interdealer trades are persistent. (2) The trading relationships have a core-periphery structure. Central dealers are more interconnected and peripheral dealers connect mainly with central dealers. (3) Central dealers hold more inventories and the duration is longer. Existing studies have provided theoretical explanations for one or more of these findings but cannot simultaneously address all of them. We propose a tractable investor-dealer dynamic random search model. The nuance is the assumption of heterogeneous inventory capacities: a dealer either has large or small inventory capacity. This may result from heterogeneous financial costs or risk management considerations. In each period, dealers first randomly meet investors, which are governed by a certain matching technology. In the meeting, dealers can buy from a low-value asset owner only if they have storage space and can sell to a high-value non-owner only if they have inventory. Dealers then trade in a competitive interdealer market to re-balance inventories. We expect the equilibrium outcomes to match the above stylized facts. Each type of dealer has his/her optimal inventory level. Due to search frictions, the inventories after trading with investors may be higher or lower than the optimal level. Interdealer trades then emerge out of the re-balancing needs. Such needs and hence the direction of interdealer trades are persistent in steady state. Moreover, the structure of the trading relationships should have large dealers in the center and small ones in the periphery, as there are gains from trade between small and large dealers and among large dealers, but not among small dealers. Finally, it is more costly for a small dealer to hold inventory, as it means missing more potential buying opportunities. Therefore, central dealers hold more inventories. In addition, we can characterize how the direction of trade between small and large dealers depends on the underlying environments. We can also generate testable implications regarding prices and volume based on comparative statics analysis, which can provide reference for future empirical work. The results also have policy implications regarding regulations and market design.
