这些研究旨在阐明物理特征如何影响生态系统过程的机制。研究人员将开发嵌套模型，涵盖整个北太平洋海盆的现象——例如ENSO和与政权转移/PDO相关的特征——并纳入年际到年代际时间尺度的变化。他们将特别关注浮游动物，无论是在个体种群层面（如幼发拉底群岛），还是在聚集群落层面，并采用先进的数据同化（如中尺度调查），以产生最佳的合并数据/模型产品，供全球环境政策综合工作使用。耦合的物理生态系统模型产品将包括CCS野外试验区域和时间的动态一致的数据同化后发数据，以及年代际、流域尺度、嵌套计算（1970年至今）。通过这项研究，研究人员试图（i）量化加州当前系统的物理特征和与气候变化相关的可变性如何影响浮游动物的生物量、产量、分布，以及沿海地区浮游动物的保留和损失，以及（ii）比较气候变异和变化（如厄尔尼诺-拉尼娜周期和制度变迁）对CCS和CGOA中海洋动物种群（幼发拉氏体）的影响。这两种方法都直接响应GLOBEC-NEP合成计划的既定目标。此外，该项目将为多个博士科学家和本科生提供机会，他们可以直接与PIs合作，也可以参加拟议的研讨会，参与GLOBEC合成。

Project.Title: Safer and more effective use of medicines in patients with diabetes and rheumatoid arthritis.

Title_Other.Title: 糖尿病和类风湿关节炎患者更安全、更有效地使用药物。
Safer and more effective use of medicines in patients with diabetes and rheumatoid arthritis.

Source.Name: National Health and Medical Research Council

Project.Title: Geometric Tomography

Title_Other.Title: Geometric Tomography
几何层析成像

Project.Abstract: ABSTRACT - DMS 0203527 Geometric tomography uses data concerning sections by planes and projections on planes of geometric objects to obtain information about these objects. The latter include general compact sets, but often they are convex bodies, polytopes, star-shaped bodies, or finite sets. One advantage of this setting is that it becomes more probable that inverse problems have a unique solution. Generally, the a priori knowledge that the unknown object is of uniform density can be exploited to retrieve more information than would otherwise be possible. This can lead to algorithms that are more effective when few measurements are available, and less sensitive to measurement errors or noise. Geometric tomography has links to functional analysis, convex geometry, Minkowski geometry, and combinatorics. The project will continue the development of geometric tomography. New directions include an extension of Lutwak's dual Brunn-Minkowski theory by the introduction of moments of sets; work towards a coherent discrete Brunn-Minkowski theory that applies to finite sets, with volume replaced by cardinality; and an investigation into the possibility of a Brunn-Minkowski theory for capacity. In related applications, the plan is to consolidate links between geometric tomography and a practical method called local stereology, and to solve an inverse problem concerning finite sets with an application to medical imaging. New discoveries about intersection bodies are anticipated, with an application to the reconstruction of star bodies from the volumes of their sections through the origin. Also included is a program designed to stimulate undergraduate research. CAT scanners are machines that save lives daily. They take X-rays in a number of different directions, and synthesize the information to create an image of a two-dimensional section of part of the body. The mathematics behind this process is called computerized tomography. It is very successful, but not perfect; the reconstructed image is only approximate, and to get a better picture with the same procedure one has to take more X-rays, causing greater expense and likelihood of side effects. In geometric tomography, only homogeneous objects are allowed - the density of the object is the same everywhere inside it. An example from medicine would be a bone or a kidney. One can use this information to find better reconstruction procedures. The scope of geometric tomography is actually much wider. Any measurement involving sections of a homogeneous object by lines or planes or its shadows on lines or planes can be considered. Because of this, it has many links to other areas, both in mathematics (there is a large overlap with convex geometry, the geometry of shapes without holes or dents) and outside. For example, a new technique called local stereology depends on measurements of planar sections of biological tissue; each section passes through a fixed point, usually the nucleus of a cell, and the measurements can be made optically rather than physically. This project continues the development of several aspects of the mathematics of geometric tomography. Also included is a program designed to stimulate undergraduate research.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 摘要-DMS 0203527几何层析成像技术利用几何物体的逐面切片和投影数据来获取这些物体的信息。后者包括一般紧集，但通常是凸体、多面体、星形体或有限集。这种设置的一个优点是，反问题有唯一解的可能性更大。一般来说，利用未知物体具有均匀密度的先验知识可以获得比以往更多的信息。这可能会导致算法在可用测量较少时更有效，并且对测量误差或噪声不太敏感。几何层析成像与功能分析、凸几何、Minkowski几何和组合学有联系。该项目将继续发展几何层析成像。新的方向包括通过引入集的矩来扩展Lutwak的对偶Brunn-Minkowski理论；致力于应用于有限集的相干离散Brunn-Minkowski理论，用基数代替体积；以及研究Brunn-Minkowski理论用于容量的可能性。在相关的应用中，我们的计划是巩固几何体层摄影术和一种叫做局部体视学的实用方法之间的联系，并结合医学成像的应用来解决一个有关有限集的反问题。对交叉体的新发现进行了展望，并将其应用于从其截面体积到原点的星体重建。其中还包括一个旨在刺激本科生研究的项目。猫扫描器是每天拯救生命的机器。他们从多个不同的方向拍摄X射线，并合成信息，以创建身体部分二维截面的图像。这个过程背后的数学称为计算机断层扫描。这是非常成功的，但不是完美的；重建的图像只是近似的，为了得到更好的图片与相同的程序，必须采取更多的X射线，造成更大的费用和副作用的可能性。在几何层析成像中，只允许均匀的物体——物体内部的密度是一样的。医学上的一个例子是骨头或肾脏。我们可以利用这些信息找到更好的重建程序。几何层析成像的范围实际上要宽得多。可以考虑任何由直线或平面或其在直线或平面上的阴影构成的均质物体截面的测量。正因为如此，它与其他领域有许多联系，无论是在数学上（与凸几何有很大的重叠，形状的几何没有孔或凹痕）还是在外部。例如，一种叫做局部体视学的新技术依赖于对生物组织的平面切片的测量；每个切片都经过一个固定点，通常是细胞核，测量可以用光学方法进行，而不是物理方法。该项目继续发展几何层析数学的几个方面。其中还包括一个旨在刺激本科生研究的项目。

Project.Title: Greenhouse gas emission from sugarcane and mangrove communities in coastal Queensland

Title_Other.Title: Greenhouse gas emission from sugarcane and mangrove communities in coastal Queensland
昆士兰沿海甘蔗和红树林群落温室气体排放

Class.ClassName: 环境生态系统、生态环境

Project.Abstract: Greenhouse gases threaten the global climate. Many estimates of vegetation as sinks and sources for greenhouse gases have a high degree of uncertainty. This project will generate important information about greenhouse gas emissions from Queensland coastal vegetation. Characterised by moist and nutrient rich conditions, sugarcane fields and mangrove ecosystems represent significant sources/sinks of potent greenhouse gases nitrous oxide and methane. Sugarcane and mangroves exposed to different nutrient inputs will allow to (i) identify mechanisms of N2O and CH4 emission, (ii) model N2O and CH4 emissions under different nutrient and climate conditions, and (iii) control/reduce emissions by improving coastal ecosystem management.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: Greenhouse gases threaten the global climate. Many estimates of vegetation as sinks and sources for greenhouse gases have a high degree of uncertainty. This project will generate important information about greenhouse gas emissions from Queensland coastal vegetation. Characterised by moist and nutrient rich conditions, sugarcane fields and mangrove ecosystems represent significant sources/sinks of potent greenhouse gases nitrous oxide and methane. Sugarcane and mangroves exposed to different nutrient inputs will allow to (i) identify mechanisms of N2O and CH4 emission, (ii) model N2O and CH4 emissions under different nutrient and climate conditions, and (iii) control/reduce emissions by improving coastal ecosystem management.

温室气体威胁着全球气候。许多关于植被作为温室气体汇和源的估计具有高度的不确定性。该项目将产生昆士兰沿海植被温室气体排放的重要信息。以潮湿和营养丰富的条件为特征，甘蔗田和红树林生态系统代表了强大的温室气体氧化亚氮和甲烷的重要来源/汇。甘蔗和红树林暴露在不同的养分输入下，将允许（i）确定N2O和CH4排放的机制，（ii）不同养分和气候条件下的N2O和CH4排放模式，以及（iii）通过改善沿海生态系统管理来控制/减少排放。

Organization.Name: Department of Natural Resources, Mines and Energy

Project.Title: The role of mutated WNK1 (WNK1/HSN2) neuronal specific isoform in HSANII

Title_Other.Title: 突变WNK1（WNK1/HSN2）神经元特异性亚型在HSANII中的作用
The role of mutated WNK1 (WNK1/HSN2) neuronal specific isoform in HSANII

Project.Abstract: Hereditary sensory and autonomic neuropathies (HSAN) are a group of diseases characterized by a reduced sensitivity to pain, which often results in unnoticed burns and mutilation of the fingers and toes. It is not uncommon that affected individuals have to undergo amputations. This proposal will focus on the type II of this disease, which is an early onset genetic disorder. In 2004, we reported the presence of mutations in the HSAN type 2 in the HSN2 gene. The goal of this proposal is to gain a better understanding of HSAN type II to open avenues for the development of a treatment. Our findings could stimulate the search for novel analgesics that would selectively target this gene.

遗传性感觉和自主神经病变（HSAN）是一组以疼痛敏感性降低为特征的疾病，常导致手指和脚趾未被注意到的烧伤和损伤。受影响的人必须接受截肢手术并不少见。这项建议将集中于这种疾病的II型，这是一种早发性遗传病。2004年，我们报道了HSN2基因中HSAN 2型的突变。本提案的目的是更好地了解HSANⅡ型，为治疗的发展开辟道路。我们的发现可以刺激寻找新的镇痛药，选择性地靶向这个基因。

Organization.Name: Centre Hospitalier de l’Université de Montréal

Project.Title: MRI: Acquisition of a Powder X-Ray Diffractometer to Enhance Faculty and Undergraduate Research and Education in Geology and Chemistry at SUNY Cortland

Title_Other.Title: MRI: Acquisition of a Powder X-Ray Diffractometer to Enhance Faculty and Undergraduate Research and Education in Geology and Chemistry at SUNY Cortland
核磁共振成像：获得粉末X射线衍射仪，以加强圣科特兰大学地质和化学系的教职员工和本科生的研究和教育

Class.ClassName: 分析作业方法、分析作业技术

Project.Abstract: 0922814 McRoberts This award is funded under the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 (Public Law 111-5). Funds from this grant will support the acquisition of a powder x-ray diffractometer (XRD) to facilitate research and research training in the Departments of Geology and Chemistry at the State University of New York at Cortland (SUNY-Cortland). The XRD will be used for phase identification of clay minerals in Mesozoic Paleoclimate studies and crystallographic characterization of novel metal-organic compounds. Two Co-I?s (Collins and Downey) are both early career scientists and new investigators to the NSF proposal process. The XRD will fill a gap in the analytical infrastructure at SUNY-Cortland, an institution that currently ranks in the top nine institutions in the U.S. that produce the largest numbers of K-12 teachers. Students exposed to modern methods of materials characterization and imparted with an understanding of data interpretation, potential error sources and analysis technique limitations are well prepared to disseminate a healthy understanding of the scientific process in our nation?s school systems.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 0922814麦克罗伯茨这个奖项是根据2009年美国复苏和再投资法案（公法111-5）资助的。这笔赠款的资金将支持收购一台粉末x射线衍射仪（XRD），以促进在纽约州立大学科特兰分校（SUNY Cortland）地质和化学系的研究和研究培训。XRD将用于中生代古气候研究中粘土矿物的物相鉴定和新型金属有机化合物的晶体学表征。两个一氧化碳？s（柯林斯和唐尼）既是早期职业科学家，也是NSF提案过程中的新调查员。XRD将填补SUNY Cortland在分析基础设施方面的一个空白，该机构目前在美国排名前九，产生的K-12教师数量最多。学生接触现代材料表征方法，了解数据解释、潜在误差源和分析技术局限性，准备好传播对我国科学过程的健康理解？学校系统。

Project.Title: Enhancing Medication Safety in Children with Polypharmacy Using Parent-Reported Symptom Assessments

Title_Other.Title: Enhancing Medication Safety in Children with Polypharmacy Using Parent-Reported Symptom Assessments
利用父母报告的症状评估提高儿童多药治疗的安全性

Project.Abstract: PROJECT SUMMARY/ABSTRACT An increasing number of children with medical complexity are exposed to polypharmacy in the ambulatory setting and take multiple high-risk medications daily. Polypharmacy can lead to serious adverse drug events (ADEs). The most vulnerable children with medical complexity exhibit a multitude of symptoms and have impairments that make the self-report of ADEs unfeasible, severely limiting the conduct of clinical trials and post-marketing drug surveillance studies to detect ADEs. Dr. James Feinstein?s overarching hypothesis is that repeated parent-reported symptom assessments (PRSA) before and after medication changes will provide clinically pertinent information, improve ADE signal detection, and enhance medication safety. This patient- oriented mentored career development award is designed to support the transition of James Feinstein, MD, MPH, an Assistant Professor of Pediatrics at the University of Colorado, into an independent clinician-scientist and to achieve his long-term career goal of becoming a national leader in pediatric polypharmacy and medication safety research. His short-term career goals are to (1) study factors involved in the escalation of polypharmacy and (2) implement a prospective PRSA system to guide and monitor pharmaceutical care for high-risk children. Dr. Feinstein will complete additional didactic and experiential training in 3 key areas necessary for his success: (1) pharmacoepidemiology and pharmacovigilance; (2) quantitative longitudinal data analysis; and (3) the design and conduct of prospective cohort studies. The University of Colorado Anschutz Medical Campus provides a unique research environment to conduct pediatric polypharmacy research, supported by collaborative research partnerships between the Adult and Child Consortium for Health Outcomes Research and Delivery Science (ACCORDS), The Skaggs School of Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences, and the Children?s Hospital Colorado Special Care Clinic for children with medical complexity. Dr. Feinstein?s renowned team of research mentors, Dr. Allison Kempe (health services research), Dr. Robert Valuck (pharmacoepidemiology), Dr. Chris Feudtner (children with complex chronic conditions), and Dr. Diane Fairclough (biostatistics), will guide completion of the proposed training and research plan. To achieve his short-term career goals, Dr. Feinstein proposes three research projects that will contribute to the implementation of a PRSA system to evaluate children with polypharmacy for medication- related issues. The specific aims are to conduct: (1) a retrospective cohort study to quantify annual polypharmacy and factors associated with escalation of polypharmacy; (2) a cross-sectional evaluation of symptoms in children with polypharmacy using PRSAs to advance our understanding of signal-to-noise and signal detection challenges; and (3) a prospective cohort study to assess whether using PRSAs prior to and after medication changes detects known ADEs. This innovative proposal could provide evidence to support the use of PRSA more broadly for the evaluation of other therapies in vulnerable children with medical complexity.

The specific aims are to conduct: (1) a retrospective cohort study to quantify annual polypharmacy and factors associated with escalation of polypharmacy; (2) a cross-sectional evaluation of symptoms in children with polypharmacy using PRSAs to advance our understanding of signal-to-noise and signal detection challenges; and (3) a prospective cohort study to assess whether using PRSAs prior to and after medication changes detects known ADEs. This innovative proposal could provide evidence to support the use of PRSA more broadly for the evaluation of other therapies in vulnerable children with medical complexity.

项目摘要/摘要越来越多的医疗复杂的儿童在门诊环境中暴露于多药环境中，每天服用多种高危药物。多药可导致严重的药物不良事件（ADE）。具有医疗复杂性的最易受伤害的儿童表现出多种症状和有缺陷，使得ADE的自我报告不可行，严重限制了检测ADE的临床试验和上市后药物监测研究的进行。詹姆斯·范斯坦医生？总的假设是，药物改变前后重复的父母报告症状评估（PRSA）将提供临床相关信息，改善ADE信号检测，提高药物安全性。这个以病人为导向的导师职业发展奖是为了支持詹姆斯·范斯坦，医学博士，科罗拉多大学儿科助理教授，成为一名独立的临床医生和科学家，并实现他的长期职业目标，成为全国领先的儿科多药和药物安全性研究。他的短期职业目标是：（1）研究与多药治疗升级有关的因素；（2）实施前瞻性的减贫战略体系，指导和监测高危儿童的药物治疗。范斯坦博士将在三个关键领域完成额外的教学和经验培训，这三个领域是他成功所必需的：（1）药物流行病学和药物警戒；（2）定量纵向数据分析；以及（3）前瞻性队列研究的设计和实施。科罗拉多大学Anschutz医学院提供了一个独特的研究环境，在成人和儿童健康结果研究和交付科学联合会（ACCORDS）、Skaggs药房和药物科学学院以及孩子们？科罗拉多州s医院医疗复杂儿童特别护理诊所。范斯坦医生？著名的研究导师团队，Allison Kempe博士（健康服务研究）、Robert Valuck博士（药物流行病学）、Chris Feudtner博士（患有复杂慢性病的儿童）和Diane Fairclough博士（生物统计学）将指导完成拟议的培训和研究计划。为了实现他的短期职业目标，范斯坦博士提出了三个研究项目，这些项目将有助于实施减贫战略体系，以评估患有多药症的儿童在药物相关问题上的表现。具体目标是：（1）一项回顾性队列研究，量化每年的多发性疾病和多发性疾病升级的相关因素；（2）使用prsa对多发性疾病儿童的症状进行横断面评估，以提高我们对信噪比和信号检测挑战的认识；（3）一项前瞻性队列研究，评估在药物改变前后使用减贫战略评估是否检测到已知的不良反应。这一创新性的提议可以提供证据，支持更广泛地使用减贫战略文件，对具有医疗复杂性的脆弱儿童进行其他疗法的评估。

Project.Title: Environmental effects of leakage from CO2 storage under the sea bed

Title_Other.Title: Miljøeffekter av lekkasje fra CO2-lagring under sjøbunn
海底CO2封存泄漏对环境的影响

Project.Abstract: The proposed project aims to investigate the environmental impacts of potential diffuse leakage from sub-seabed storage of CO2. The effect of pressure and temperature on seawater carbonate- and geochemistry in marine sediments and the water column during diffuse CO2 leakage scenarios will be studied and the subsequent impacts on benthic deep water organisms and microbial communities assessed. For this project we have access to a unique flow-through titanium pressure tank (The Karl Erik TiTank) designed and built by NTNU, SINTEF and Statoil. The tank has a volume of 1.4 m3 and can attain a pressure up to 30 bars (corresponding to approximately 300 meters depth), which enables us to carry out controlled experiments at simulated seafloor conditions. This is important since it will reveal effects that may be overlooked in traditional laboratory and field studies where the influence of hydrostatic pressure is not considered. The chemical and biological impacts associated with simulated diffuse CO2 leakage will be studied at hydrostatic pressures relevant for present and planned CO2 storage sites on the Norwegian continental shelf (e.g. Sleipner, Snøhvit). The studies are complementary to ongoing activities related to sub-seabed storage of CO2 and national and international research groups will contribute with high competence in the field of CCS research. The project will provide new knowledge important for further improvement of risk and impact assessment as well as monitoring of sub-seabed storage sites.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 拟议的项目旨在调查海底二氧化碳储存潜在扩散泄漏的环境影响。将研究扩散二氧化碳泄漏情景下压力和温度对海洋沉积物和水柱中海水碳酸盐和地球化学的影响，并评估随后对底栖深水生物和微生物群落的影响。在这个项目中，我们可以使用由NTNU、SINTEF和挪威国家石油公司设计和建造的独特的钛压力罐（Karl-Erik TiTank）。该水池的容积为1.4 m3，压力可达30巴（相当于大约300米深），这使我们能够在模拟海底条件下进行受控实验。这一点很重要，因为它将揭示传统实验室和现场研究中可能忽略的影响，其中不考虑静水压力的影响。将在与挪威大陆架现有和计划的二氧化碳储存地点（如Sleipner、Snøhvit）相关的静水压力下，研究与模拟扩散二氧化碳泄漏相关的化学和生物影响。这些研究是对正在进行的与海底二氧化碳储存有关的活动的补充，国家和国际研究小组将在碳捕获和封存研究领域发挥高水平的作用。该项目将为进一步改进风险和影响评估以及监测海底储存地点提供重要的新知识。

The proposed project aims to investigate the environmental impacts of potential diffuse leakage from sub-seabed storage of CO2. The effect of pressure and temperature on seawater carbonate- and geochemistry in marine sediments and the water column during diffuse CO2 leakage scenarios will be studied and the subsequent impacts on benthic deep water organisms and microbial communities assessed. For this project we have access to a unique flow-through titanium pressure tank (The Karl Erik TiTank) designed and built by NTNU, SINTEF and Statoil. The tank has a volume of 1.4 m3 and can attain a pressure up to 30 bars (corresponding to approximately 300 meters depth), which enables us to carry out controlled experiments at simulated seafloor conditions. This is important since it will reveal effects that may be overlooked in traditional laboratory and field studies where the influence of hydrostatic pressure is not considered. The chemical and biological impacts associated with simulated diffuse CO2 leakage will be studied at hydrostatic pressures relevant for present and planned CO2 storage sites on the Norwegian continental shelf (e.g. Sleipner, Snøhvit). The studies are complementary to ongoing activities related to sub-seabed storage of CO2 and national and international research groups will contribute with high competence in the field of CCS research. The project will provide new knowledge important for further improvement of risk and impact assessment as well as monitoring of sub-seabed storage sites.

Project.Title: Equations in groups, formal languages and complexity

Title_Other.Title: Equations in groups, formal languages and complexity
群方程、形式语言与复杂性

Project.Abstract:
Solving equations has always been a central question for mathematics. Whether searching for the roots of a polynomial or solving a differential equation, finding or approximating the solutions is an essential part of science, from pure to applied, and understanding the properties of the solutions opens up worlds of algebraic, dynamical, geometric or logical structure.
This project centres on finding and understanding the solutions of equations in infinite nonabelian discrete groups, a topic at the wild frontier between solvable and unsolvable, with far-reaching applications to algebra, logic, geometry and theoretical computer science. Understanding solutions is crucial in order to expand algebraic geometry to a non-commutative setting, to master the first order theory of a structure, to determine isomorphism between two hyperbolic groups, to advance unification theory, and to answer questions about combinatorics on words. Despite the groundbreaking work in the this area by Makanin, Razborov, Sela, Kharlampovich, Miasnikov and others, very few examples can be tackled, no implementation exists, and the area remains notoriously technical.
On the strength of my expertise and long term preparatory work towards the objectives of this project, I will push forward both the theoretical and computational side of this area by linking nondeterministic algorithms to group theoretic and geometric approaches. I aim to map the essential features of the landscape more clearly and produce not only deep results, but also accessible literature and new algorithms.
1. An important research direction will be the formal language characterisation of solutions of equations and inequations, as well as definable sets, in the most important classes of infinite groups, such as free, hyperbolic or certain nilpotent and Artin groups. Our work will give a new, combinatorial description of sets that have a complex algebraic structure.
2. Another goal of the project is to develop algorithms that solve equations in the Heisenberg group and dihedral Artin groups. At the moment no such algorithms exist, and these problems will require groundbreaking, novel approaches.
3. The most ambitious goal of the project is to exploit the information lying at the core of the new, nondeterministic algorithm due to Diekert, Elder and myself in order to extract not just formal language characterisations, but the algebraic structure of varieties in free groups, and compare this to the information given by Makanin-Razborov diagrams.
The project's most innovative dimension is its authentic interdisciplinary nature: we will use tools from computer science and combinatorics to answer questions rooted in group theory, non-commutative algebraic geometry and logic, and vice versa, we will use algebraic and geometric results in order to improve and generalise the existing computational approaches.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 解方程一直是数学的中心问题。无论是寻找多项式的根还是求解微分方程，找到或逼近解都是科学的一个重要组成部分，从纯到应用，了解解的性质可以打开代数、动力学、几何或逻辑结构的世界。 这个项目的中心是寻找和理解无限非贝利亚离散群中方程的解，这是一个介于可解和不可解之间的前沿课题，在代数、逻辑、几何和理论计算机科学中有着深远的应用。理解解对于将代数几何扩展到非交换环境、掌握结构的一阶理论、确定两个双曲群之间的同构、推进统一理论以及回答关于组合学的单词问题都是至关重要的。尽管马卡宁、拉兹博罗夫、塞拉、哈兰波维奇、米亚斯尼科夫和其他人在这一领域进行了开创性的工作，但能够处理的例子寥寥无几，没有任何实施，而且这一领域仍以技术性著称。 凭借我的专业知识和为实现本项目目标所做的长期准备工作，我将通过将不确定性算法与群论和几何方法相结合，推进这一领域的理论和计算方面的工作。我的目标是更清晰地绘制景观的基本特征，不仅产生深入的结果，而且还产生可访问的文献和新算法。 一。一个重要的研究方向将是在最重要的无限群类中，如自由群、双曲群或某些幂零群和Artin群中，方程和不等式以及可定义集解的形式语言刻画。我们的工作将给出具有复杂代数结构的集合的一个新的组合描述。 2。该项目的另一个目标是开发求解海森堡群和二面体Artin群中方程的算法。目前还不存在这样的算法，这些问题需要突破性的、新颖的方法。 三。该项目最雄心勃勃的目标是利用Diekert、Elder和我自己提出的新的不确定性算法的核心信息，以便不仅提取形式语言特征，而且提取自由群中变体的代数结构，并将其与Makanin Razborov图给出的信息进行比较。 该项目最具创新性的方面是它真正的跨学科性质：我们将使用计算机科学和组合学的工具来回答根植于群论、非交换代数几何和逻辑的问题，反之亦然，我们将使用代数和几何结果来改进和推广现有的计算方法。

Project.Title: Collaboration for increased learning about test beds and partnerships in cities

Title_Other.Title: Collaboration for increased learning about test beds and partnerships in cities
加强对城市试验床和伙伴关系的学习的协作

Project.Abstract:
Purpose and goal: There is increased interest in partnerships, networking and multi-level collaboration between industry, the public sector and civil society. Cities can works as test beds for new solutions to complex societal challenges. This project aims at developing collaboration between The School of Business, Economics and Law at University of Gothenburg and RISE in the field of test beds and partnerships in cities. The overall objective of the project is to better understand the incentives of different actors to participate in partnerships, networks and test beds in cities.
Expected results and effects: The expected effects of the collaboration are: - Improved dissemination of academic competences by bringing together academic research with needs-driven development in municipalities. - Increased understanding of partnerships and test beds in cities, and the importance for different sectors. - Increased link between scientific theory and practical knowledge. - Increased ability to facilitate cross-sectoral discussions.
Approach and implementation: The project will last for 18 months and the project manager will work on the research center around cities and partnerships that the The School of Business, Economics and Law at University of Gothenburg will start during the fall of 2017. The focus is to study and understand the importance for different actors to collaborate with cities as platforms. An important part during this period will be to plan and realize activities with actors involved in various forms of partnerships or networks with cities.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 目的和目标： 人们对工业界、公共部门和民间社会之间的伙伴关系、联网和多层次合作越来越感兴趣。城市可以作为新解决复杂社会挑战的试验田。该项目旨在发展哥德堡大学商学院、经济学院和法律学院之间的合作，并在城市的试验台和合作伙伴领域崛起。该项目的总体目标是更好地了解不同行动者参与城市伙伴关系、网络和试验床的动机。 预期结果和效果： 合作的预期效果是： -通过将学术研究与城市需求驱动的发展结合起来，改善学术能力的传播。 -加深对城市伙伴关系和试验台的理解，以及对不同部门的重要性。 -增加了科学理论和实践知识之间的联系。 -提高促进跨部门讨论的能力。 方法和实施： 该项目将持续18个月，项目经理将在哥德堡大学商业、经济和法律学院将于2017年秋季启动的城市和伙伴关系研究中心工作。重点是研究和理解不同行动者与城市作为平台进行合作的重要性。这一期间的一个重要部分将是规划和实现与参与各种形式的与城市的伙伴关系或网络的行动者的活动。

Project.Title: Neurosteroid modulation of GABA-inhibition in vivo: central auditory pathway models

Title_Other.Title: Neurosteroid modulation of GABA-inhibition in vivo: central auditory pathway models
体内GABA抑制的神经甾体调节：中枢听觉通路模型

Project.Abstract: All neurons at higher levels of the central nervous system signal in response to the outcome of various excitatory and inhibitory inputs (synapses) from other neurons. Most of the fast-acting inhibition is mediated by chloride ion influx through a channel which is gated by the neurotransmitter GABA. Termed the GABAa-receptor, this channel is known to be modulated by a wide range of pharmacological agents (e.g. valium; ethanol, many anaesthetics) which may enhance or suppress its efficacy. There are also good reasons for concluding that there is a capacity for modulation by endogenous substances. Brain synthesized steroids (neurosteroids) are known to have a potent enhancement effect upon the efficacy of GABAa-receptors, and have been implicated in a number of clinical situations, including menstrual cycle related depression. Work of others has shown that rapid synthesis of neurosteroids acts to increase inhibition in response to anxiety-inducing stimuli. Our recent work has shown that neurosteroids mediate an induced increase in inhibition in the auditory midbrain area. A surprising aspect of that study was that neurosteroids also appear to mediate ongoing levels of inhibition. This now allows us to use the many inhibitory interactions in the auditory pathway as potential models for studying the role of neurosteroid modulation of GABA inhibition in normal brain function. This is important because a number of medical treaments have the side effect of changing the synthesis of neurosteroids. We will also use an auditory system model of neurotrauma to examine the role of neurosteroids in increasing inhibition (to counter a potentially lethal increase in excitability). The work will involve electophysiological functional measurements and the development of highly sensitivity analytical protocols using an electrospray mass spectrometer for direct measurement of neurosteroids in submicrogram samples of brain tissue.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 所有处于中枢神经系统高水平的神经元都对来自其他神经元的各种兴奋性和抑制性输入（突触）的结果作出反应。大部分的快速抑制作用是由氯离子通过神经递质GABA门控的通道进入介导的。这个通道被称为GABAa受体，已知被多种药理药物（如安定、乙醇、许多麻醉剂）调节，这些药物可以增强或抑制GABAa受体的疗效。我们也有充分的理由得出结论，即存在内源性物质的调节能力。脑合成类固醇（neurosteroids）对GABAa受体的疗效有明显的增强作用，并与许多临床情况有关，包括月经周期相关的抑郁症。其他研究表明，快速合成神经甾体可以增强对焦虑刺激的抑制作用。我们最近的研究表明，神经甾体介导听觉中脑区域抑制的诱导性增加。这项研究的一个令人惊讶的方面是，神经甾体类物质似乎也能调节持续的抑制水平。这使得我们可以利用听觉通路中的许多抑制相互作用作为潜在的模型来研究神经甾体对GABA抑制在正常脑功能中的作用。这一点很重要，因为许多药物都有改变神经甾体合成的副作用。我们还将使用神经营养不良的听觉系统模型来研究神经甾体在增加抑制中的作用（以对抗潜在的致命性兴奋性增加）。这项工作将涉及到电生理功能测量和利用电喷雾质谱仪直接测量脑组织亚微克样品中神经甾体的高灵敏度分析方法的开发。

All neurons at higher levels of the central nervous system signal in response to the outcome of various excitatory and inhibitory inputs (synapses) from other neurons. Most of the fast-acting inhibition is mediated by chloride ion influx through a channel which is gated by the neurotransmitter GABA. Termed the GABAa-receptor, this channel is known to be modulated by a wide range of pharmacological agents (e.g. valium; ethanol, many anaesthetics) which may enhance or suppress its efficacy. There are also good reasons for concluding that there is a capacity for modulation by endogenous substances. Brain synthesized steroids (neurosteroids) are known to have a potent enhancement effect upon the efficacy of GABAa-receptors, and have been implicated in a number of clinical situations, including menstrual cycle related depression. Work of others has shown that rapid synthesis of neurosteroids acts to increase inhibition in response to anxiety-inducing stimuli. Our recent work has shown that neurosteroids mediate an induced increase in inhibition in the auditory midbrain area. A surprising aspect of that study was that neurosteroids also appear to mediate ongoing levels of inhibition. This now allows us to use the many inhibitory interactions in the auditory pathway as potential models for studying the role of neurosteroid modulation of GABA inhibition in normal brain function. This is important because a number of medical treaments have the side effect of changing the synthesis of neurosteroids. We will also use an auditory system model of neurotrauma to examine the role of neurosteroids in increasing inhibition (to counter a potentially lethal increase in excitability). The work will involve electophysiological functional measurements and the development of highly sensitivity analytical protocols using an electrospray mass spectrometer for direct measurement of neurosteroids in submicrogram samples of brain tissue.

Project.Title: Norwegian conference for ICT in the public sector in 2014

Title_Other.Title: 2014年挪威公共部门信息和通信技术会议
Norsk konferanse for IKT i offentlig sektor 2014

Project.Abstract:
NTNU is the initiator of the conference, which was established in 2007. The university believes there is a need for greater efforts in education and research for ICT in the public sector.
The goal is to promote development that White Paper 17, An information society for all e, proposes. Focus is on solutions and actual examples of how challenges can be solved.
The conference brings together stakeholders from all sectors in Norway, including state agencies, local and regional authorities, suppliers and researchers. It thus becomes a maiden tested for people who do not usually gather in one place, and contribute in a constructive manner to reach common goal. New contacts and opportunities created.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 南大是该会议的发起人，该会议成立于2007年。该大学认为，有必要在教育和研究公共部门信息和通信技术方面作出更大努力。 目标是促进人人共享的信息社会白皮书17提出的发展。重点是解决方案和如何解决挑战的实际例子。 会议汇集了挪威所有部门的利益攸关方，包括国家机构、地方和区域当局、供应商和研究人员。 因此，它成为一个处女测试的人通常不聚集在一个地方，并作出建设性的贡献，以达到 共同目标。创建了新的联系人和机会。

NTNU er initiativtaker til konferansen som ble opprettet i 2007. Universitetet mener det er behov for sterkere innsats innen utdanning og forskning for IKT i offentlig sektor.
Målet er å fremme utviklingen som St meld 17, Eit informasjonssamfunn for all e, legger opp til. Fokus er på løsninger og faktiske eksempler på hvordan utfordringer kan løses.
Konferansen samler aktører fra alle sektorer i Norge, herunder statlige etater, kommuner og fylkeskommuner, leverandører og forskere. Den blir dermed et mø tested for mennesker som vanligvis ikke samles på ett sted, og bidrar på en konstruktiv måte for å nå felles mål. Nye kontakter og muligheter skapes.

Project.Title: WORKSHOP: Doctoral Consortium at the IEEE ACII 2015 Conference

Title_Other.Title: 研讨会：IEEEACII 2015年会议博士联合会
WORKSHOP: Doctoral Consortium at the IEEE ACII 2015 Conference

Project.Abstract: This is funding to support travel for up to 10 students enrolled in PhD programs in U.S. institutions, to attend the 6th IEEE International Conference on Affective Computing and Intelligent Interactions (ACII 2015), to be held September 21-24 in Xi'an, China. Besides attending the main conference program, the students will participate in a Doctoral Consortium where they will share their research results with the community and receive feedback from senior researchers in the field. The ACII conference, which is held approximately every two years, is the premier international forum for interdisciplinary research on the design of systems that can recognize, interpret, and simulate human emotions and related affective phenomena. Its broad scope includes: multi-modal recognition or synthesis of human affect; psychological, cognitive, and neurological affect modeling; affective computing for social and behavioral sciences; and affective interactions for social robotics and virtual agents. The conference presents the latest research in these and related areas, and it plays an important role in shaping many scientific, academic, and educational programs. A theme of ACII 2015 will be to emphasize the biological underpinnings of affective computing, including how emotion is represented in the brain, how it prepares and shapes the body and even how certain genes can underlie affective dispositions. More information about the conference is available online at http://www.acii2015.org. By attending ACII 15 and taking part in the Doctoral Consortium, the students will not only learn the state of the art in affective computing research but will also have an opportunity to present their own work to, and receive feedback from, an invited committee of faculty and industry researchers along with other students working in related areas. Such an experience will greatly benefit the students professionally, by giving them valuable exposure to outside perspectives on their work and providing a setting in which to identify development needs and fine-tune their career objectives. Just as importantly, they will have a chance to meet established researchers and other graduate students doing similar work, to exchange ideas and to make contacts that will be invaluable to them as they progress in their scientific careers. Interacting with young researchers is also beneficial to experienced investigators, by providing fresh ideas and new perspectives. Thus, the Doctoral Consortium is a great confidence builder for the students involved, and highly stimulating to the senior researchers as well. To maximize the benefits of the NSF support, the event organizers will make a particular effort to recruit students from underrepresented groups (in particular, women and minorities) and from smaller schools or schools with less established affective computing research programs, as well as a demographically diverse set of mentors to advise these students (in terms of region, type of employment, and stage in career). In addition, no more than one student will be selected from any given educational institution. The specific goals of the doctoral consortium are: to provide a setting for face-to-face interaction and feedback on student participants' current research and constructive guidance on future directions; to promote networking among PhD students working in related area; to develop a supportive community of scholars and a spirit of collaborative research; to support a new generation of researchers with information and advice on academic, research, industrial, and non-traditional career paths; and to support technical and culture interactions between American students and their counterparts from other countries. Each accepted student will receive up to $1,000 and will be asked to volunteer to help the ACII 2015 Chairs run the conference. Students who do not have a paper accepted for presentation either at ACII 2015 or one of its associated workshops will be asked to supply an extended abstract (up to 6 pages) describing their original, unpublished doctoral work, either completed or in progress. Each participant in the Doctoral Consortium will be assigned a mentor based upon similarity of research interests and experience, who will be committed to discussing the work with the student mentee in a one-on-one setting. There will be a Doctoral Consortium poster session, in which all participants will present their doctoral work or a recent paper that is part of their doctoral work. A best paper award will be given to honor Fiorella de Rosis, who co-chaired the first ACII Doctoral Consortium in Lisbon in 2007.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 这是一笔资金，用于支持10名在美国院校攻读博士学位的学生参加9月21日至24日在中国西安举行的第六届IEEE情感计算和智能交互国际会议（ACII 2015）。除了参加主要的会议项目外，学生们还将参加一个博士联合会，在那里他们将与社区分享他们的研究成果，并从该领域的资深研究人员那里获得反馈。ACII会议大约每两年举行一次，是跨学科研究的首要国际论坛，旨在设计能够识别、解释和模拟人类情感和相关情感现象的系统。其广泛的范围包括：人类情感的多模态识别或合成；心理、认知和神经情感建模；社会和行为科学的情感计算；社会机器人和虚拟代理的情感交互。会议介绍了这些领域和相关领域的最新研究成果，对许多科学、学术和教育项目的形成发挥了重要作用。ACII 2015的一个主题将是强调情感计算的生物学基础，包括情感在大脑中的表现方式，情感如何准备和塑造身体，甚至某些基因如何构成情感倾向的基础。有关会议的更多信息，请访问http://www.aci2015.org。通过参加ACII 15并参加博士联合会，学生们不仅将学习情感计算研究的最新水平，而且将有机会将自己的工作介绍给他人，并从中获得反馈，由教师和行业研究人员以及其他在相关领域工作的学生组成的受邀委员会。这样的经历将使学生在专业上受益匪浅，让他们有价值地接触外界对他们工作的看法，并提供一个环境，在其中确定发展需要和微调他们的职业目标。同样重要的是，他们将有机会与从事类似工作的知名研究人员和其他研究生见面，交流想法，建立联系，这对他们在科学事业上的进步是非常宝贵的。与年轻的研究人员交流也有助于经验丰富的研究人员提供新的想法和新的视角。因此，博士联合会是一个伟大的信心建设者的学生参与，并高度刺激的高级研究人员以及。为了最大限度地利用国家科学基金会的支持，活动组织者将特别努力从代表性不足的群体（特别是妇女和少数民族）以及较小的学校或情感计算研究项目较少的学校招收学生，以及一组人口统计学上不同的导师来为这些学生提供建议（就地区、就业类型和职业阶段而言）。此外，从任何教育机构中挑选的学生不得超过一名。博士联合会的具体目标是：提供一个面对面交流的环境，并反馈学生参与者当前的研究成果和对未来方向的建设性指导；促进在相关领域工作的博士生建立联系；培养支持性的学者群体和合作研究精神；为新一代研究人员提供学术、研究、工业和非传统职业道路方面的信息和建议；支持美国学生与其他国家同行之间的技术和文化交流。每位被录取的学生将获得高达1000美元的奖金，并将被要求自愿帮助ACII 2015主席主持会议。如果学生在2015年ACII或其相关研讨会上没有论文可供发表，他们将被要求提供一份扩展摘要（最多6页），描述其已完成或正在进行的原始未发表博士论文。根据研究兴趣和经验的相似性，博士联合会的每位参与者将被指派一名导师，该导师将致力于在一对一的环境中与学生学员讨论工作。将有一个博士联合会海报会议，所有参与者将介绍他们的博士工作或最近的论文，这是

Project.Title: CAREER: Structure and Dynamics of Negative Ions via Photoelectron Imaging Spectroscopy

Title_Other.Title: 职业：利用光电子成像光谱学研究负离子的结构和动力学
CAREER: Structure and Dynamics of Negative Ions via Photoelectron Imaging Spectroscopy

Class.ClassName: 0202 Atomic, Molecular, Nuclear, Particle and Plasma Physics

Project.Abstract: In this project funded by the Experimental Physical Chemistry Program of the Chemistry Division, Sanov will combine femtosecond spectroscopy with photoelectron imaging to monitor the evolution of molecular orbitals in the course of chemical reactions. The initial systems to be studied include isolated and hydrated sulfur-containing molecular anions, and cluster anions. These are chosen for their practical importance and for serving as prototypes for the development of the new methodology. Photodissociation and unimolecular decomposition, dynamics at conical intersections, microscopic solvation, wave packet evolution, and bimolecular reactions in ionic clusters will be investigated. The results of this research will find immediate application in modeling the structure and dynamics of negative ions and solutions. Many important chemical processes involve ionic reactions, and the reactivity is affected strongly by interactions with the environment. In this research cluster ions are used as model micro-solutions for the studies of elementary processes relevant to biological and environmental chemistry. The results will provide insight into how the intermolecular interactions affect the behavior of electrons and chemical bonding. Photoelectron imaging experiments will be incorporated in the undergraduate Physical Chemistry program as a way of providing the students with hands-on research experience. A fast-track Internet-based mechanism for publishing the results of student research will be developed. Students will be trained in research techniques in preparation for advanced studies and for entry into the scientific/technical workforce.

在这个由化学部实验物理化学计划资助的项目中，Sanov将结合飞秒光谱和光电子成像来监测化学反应过程中分子轨道的演化。研究的初始体系包括分离和水合含硫分子阴离子和簇阴离子。之所以选择这些方法，是因为它们具有实际的重要性，并作为新方法论开发的原型。将研究离子团簇中的光离解和单分子分解、锥形交叉处的动力学、微观溶剂化、波包演化和双分子反应。这项研究的结果将在负离子和溶液的结构和动力学建模中立即得到应用。许多重要的化学过程都涉及到离子反应，反应性受到与环境相互作用的强烈影响。在本研究中，簇离子被用作模型微溶液，用于研究与生物和环境化学相关的基本过程。研究结果将有助于深入了解分子间相互作用如何影响电子和化学键的行为。光电子成像实验将作为一种为学生提供动手研究经验的方式纳入物理化学本科课程。将开发一个基于互联网的快速发布学生研究成果的机制。学生将接受研究技术方面的培训，为进修和进入科学/技术队伍做准备。

KeyWordGroup.KeyWord: 化学反应过程、化学过程

Project.Title: CC* Networking Infrastructure: The Roadrunner High-Performance Science, Engineering, and Business DMZ

Title_Other.Title: CC*网络基础设施：高性能科学、工程和商业DMZ
CC* Networking Infrastructure: The Roadrunner High-Performance Science, Engineering, and Business DMZ

Class.ClassName: 计算机安全、计算机保密

Project.Abstract: World-class research in cyber security, bioinformatics, cloud computing, machine learning, artificial intelligence, real-time computing and other related areas requires efficient and often near-immediate access to large data sets in order to reduce the time from theory to discovery. In addition, discoveries are often interdisciplinary and multi-institutional. As a result, a critical enabling feature for impactful, collaborative research is a dedicated high-speed network that is omnipresent across a campus. The University of Texas at San Antonio (UTSA), a Hispanic Serving Institution, is implementing a dedicated research network (DMZ) to facilitate data-intensive computation and research collaboration endeavors. This infrastructure fills a gap that currently exists in the "last mile" bottleneck from a research lab to the DMZ. In particular, the project calls for installation of 10 Gb/s switches across campus that, in concert with the dedicated research network, provide 5-10X faster data transfer rates. These improvements foster access by UTSA faculty and students to the campus' high-performance computing facility, high-speed data storage, and visualization laboratory as well as the Texas Advanced Computing Center (TACC) in Austin, Texas. The new network also enhances experiential learning activities such as UTSA's annual CyberPatriot competition, undergraduate research projects in cloud and high-performance computing, cloud computing ELab training for undergraduates, as well as certification programs such as the Master's level certification in cloud computing. This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

The new network also enhances experiential learning activities such as UTSA's annual CyberPatriot competition, undergraduate research projects in cloud and high-performance computing, cloud computing ELab training for undergraduates, as well as certification programs such as the Master's level certification in cloud computing. This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

在网络安全、生物信息学、云计算、机器学习、人工智能、实时计算和其他相关领域进行的世界级研究，需要对大型数据集进行高效且通常接近即时的访问，以缩短从理论到发现的时间。此外，发现往往是跨学科和多机构的。因此，对于有影响力的协作研究来说，一个关键的使能特性是一个遍布校园的专用高速网络。德克萨斯大学圣安东尼奥分校（UTSA）是一家西班牙服务机构，正在实施一个专门的研究网络（DMZ），以促进数据密集型计算和研究合作。这个基础设施填补了目前从研究实验室到DMZ的“最后一英里”瓶颈的空白。特别是，该项目要求在校园内安装10 Gb/s交换机，与专用研究网络配合，提供5-10倍的更快数据传输速率。这些改进促进了联合技术服务学院师生进入校园的高性能计算设施、高速数据存储和可视化实验室以及德克萨斯州奥斯汀的德克萨斯州高级计算中心（TACC）。新网络还加强了体验式学习活动，如联合技术服务局一年一度的网络爱国者竞赛、云计算和高性能计算领域的本科生研究项目、大学生云计算ELab培训，以及云计算领域硕士学位认证等认证项目。该奖项反映了NSF的法定使命，通过使用基金会的知识价值和更广泛的影响审查标准进行评估，被认为值得支持。

Project.Title: Identification of Glycomic Alterations during Melanoma Metastasis

Title_Other.Title: Identification of Glycomic Alterations during Melanoma Metastasis
黑色素瘤转移过程中糖代谢变化的研究

Project.Abstract:
PUBLIC ABSTRACT
Background: Skin cancer is the most common type of cancer, and melanoma is its most deadly form. With a relatively early age of onset compared to other cancers, melanoma has a high impact in terms of "life years lost." The most devastating complication of melanoma is spread to other organs (i.e., liver, lung, brain), a phenomenon called metastasis. Although promising new therapies have been recently approved, resistance seems to ensue almost unavoidably after initial responses. Therefore, in order to develop new and more therapies there is an imperative need to understand better how these tiny tumors (measured at millimeters at diagnosis) become able to reach and adapt to distant organs. Unfortunately, it is currently not possible for physicians to predict which patients with melanoma are the ones most likely to eventually develop metastasis.
Proteins in the cell membrane often acquire sugar modifications, which shape the interactions between a tumor cell and its environment. For instance, these sugar branches modify the recognition of tumor cells by the immune system. In addition, cells synthesize small RNA sequences called microRNAs (miRNAs), regions in the genome that do not code for a specific protein but can affect how genes are expressed. MiRNAs can regulate several genes at the same time, thus they may represent a potential molecular mechanism capable of modulating a complex biologic process such as melanoma metastasis. It has been recently observed that miRNAs shuttle from a cell into others within small vesicles thus potentially serving as a new way of communication between tumor and host cells.
Ideas To Be Studied: We postulate that tumor cells release little vesicles containing small RNAs that infiltrate into cells of the host in order to subdue their environment and distal organs. Under this view, tumors would behave as viral infections, and small miRNA-containing particles, as pathogens that help disseminate the disease.
Innovative Aspects: (1) The idea that melanoma cells expel microvesicles containing small RNAs that enter into surrounding and distal cells and contribute to tumor dissemination has not been previously tested. (2) We will characterize the sugar modifications in the surface of cells using a new technique developed by Dr. Lara K. Mahal and only available at her laboratory. The advantage of this technology is the ability to examine multiple sugars simultaneously in an unbiased and automated manner.
Expected Results and Future Goals: In Aim 1, we will test if microvesicles released from metastatic cells alter the biology of blood vessel cells or immune cells. In the future, those changes will be studied for their ability to facilitate melanoma spread. In Aim 2 we will identify sugar modifications caused by the vesicles released from tumor cells in the surrounding cells (blood vessels, immune cells). In Aim 3, we will identify the small RNAs transported by those small vesicles. In future studies, we will look for the same miRNAs in the blood of melanoma metastatic patients, and we will investigate if those miRNAs contribute to the ability of melanoma cells to disseminate to distal organs.

公共摘要 背景：皮肤癌是最常见的癌症类型，而黑色素瘤是其最致命的形式。与其他癌症相比，黑色素瘤发病年龄相对较低，对“寿命损失”的影响很大。黑色素瘤最具破坏性的并发症是扩散到其他器官（如肝、肺、脑），这种现象称为转移。尽管有希望的新疗法最近得到了批准，但在最初的反应之后，似乎不可避免地会出现耐药性。因此，为了开发新的和更多的治疗方法，迫切需要更好地了解这些微小的肿瘤（诊断时以毫米为单位测量）如何能够到达和适应遥远的器官。不幸的是，目前医生无法预测哪些黑色素瘤患者最有可能最终发生转移。 细胞膜中的蛋白质常常获得糖修饰，从而形成肿瘤细胞与其环境之间的相互作用。例如，这些糖分支改变了免疫系统对肿瘤细胞的识别。此外，细胞合成称为microRNAs（miRNAs）的小RNA序列，microRNAs是基因组中不编码特定蛋白质的区域，但可以影响基因的表达方式。MiRNAs可以同时调控多个基因，因此它们可能是一种潜在的分子机制，能够调节一个复杂的生物学过程，如黑色素瘤转移。最近有研究发现，miRNAs在小的囊泡内从一个细胞中穿梭到另一个细胞中，因此有可能成为肿瘤和宿主细胞之间一种新的通讯方式。 需要研究的观点：我们假设肿瘤细胞释放含有小rna的小泡，这些小rna渗透到宿主细胞中，以抑制其周围环境和远端器官。根据这一观点，肿瘤会表现为病毒感染，而含有微小miRNA的颗粒则会成为有助于传播疾病的病原体。 创新点：（1）黑色素瘤细胞排出含有小核糖核酸的微泡，这些小核糖核酸进入周围和远端细胞，并有助于肿瘤的传播，这一观点此前尚未得到验证。（2）我们将使用一种由Lara K.Mahal博士开发的新技术来表征细胞表面的糖修饰，该技术仅在她的实验室可用。这项技术的优点是能够以无偏见和自动化的方式同时检测多种糖。 预期结果和未来目标：在目标1中，我们将测试转移细胞释放的微泡是否改变血管细胞或免疫细胞的生物学特性。在未来，这些变化将被用来研究它们促进黑色素瘤扩散的能力。在目的2中，我们将鉴定由周围细胞（血管、免疫细胞）中肿瘤细胞释放的囊泡所引起的糖修饰。在目的3中，我们将鉴定由这些小囊泡转运的小rna。在未来的研究中，我们将在黑色素瘤转移患者的血液中寻找相同的miRNAs，并且我们将研究这些miRNAs是否有助于黑色素瘤细胞向远端器官传播的能力。

Project.Title: Photonic Circuits for Broadband, High Dynamic Range Analog RF Applications

Title_Other.Title: Photonic Circuits for Broadband, High Dynamic Range Analog RF Applications
用于宽带、高动态范围模拟射频应用的光子电路

Class.ClassName: 调制解调技术、调制解调器

Project.Abstract: Infinera and the Georgia Electronic Design Center (GEDC) will team up to create a 10 channel wavelength division multiplexed (WDM) analog transmission system capable of handling the RF systems requirements of naval aircraft. Infinera will develop an analog photonic integrated circuit (APIC) platform by incorporating a wide-bandwidth, high dynamic range analog modulator together with a tunable light source, power monitor, variable attenuator, and a high-speed electrical interconnect technology, to form an analog transmitter PIC. The transmitter modulator will be matched with a linearizing driver, designed by GEDC, to provide instantaneous bandwidths up to and exceeding 1GHz for operational frequencies from sub-100 MHz to 20 GHz. Infinera will use it's current commercial platform to design a receiver PIC capable of hybrid integration with commercial transimpedance amplifiers or application specific electronics designed by the GEDC to complete the receiver module. The APIC platform will also be developed with high yield and manufacturability in mind, sharing common epitaxial layers and processing steps with the standard telecom qualified PIC processes utilized in existing commercial devices from Infinera. The electronic driver and receiving circuits will be laid out using industry standard commercial design practices well known to the GEDC.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: Infinera and the Georgia Electronic Design Center (GEDC) will team up to create a 10 channel wavelength division multiplexed (WDM) analog transmission system capable of handling the RF systems requirements of naval aircraft. Infinera will develop an analog photonic integrated circuit (APIC) platform by incorporating a wide-bandwidth, high dynamic range analog modulator together with a tunable light source, power monitor, variable attenuator, and a high-speed electrical interconnect technology, to form an analog transmitter PIC. The transmitter modulator will be matched with a linearizing driver, designed by GEDC, to provide instantaneous bandwidths up to and exceeding 1GHz for operational frequencies from sub-100 MHz to 20 GHz. Infinera will use it's current commercial platform to design a receiver PIC capable of hybrid integration with commercial transimpedance amplifiers or application specific electronics designed by the GEDC to complete the receiver module. The APIC platform will also be developed with high yield and manufacturability in mind, sharing common epitaxial layers and processing steps with the standard telecom qualified PIC processes utilized in existing commercial devices from Infinera. The electronic driver and receiving circuits will be laid out using industry standard commercial design practices well known to the GEDC.

英菲纳公司和乔治亚电子设计中心（GEDC）将合作开发一个10通道波分复用（WDM）模拟传输系统，能够满足海军飞机的射频系统需求。Infinera将开发一个模拟光子集成电路（APIC）平台，将宽带、高动态范围模拟调制器与可调谐光源、功率监测器、可变衰减器和高速电气互连技术结合起来，形成模拟发射器PIC。发射机调制器将与一个由GEDC设计的线性化驱动器相匹配，以便在低于100兆赫至20兆赫的工作频率下提供高达或超过1兆赫的瞬时带宽。Infinera将利用其当前的商业平台设计一个能够与商业跨导放大器或GEDC设计的特定应用电子器件混合集成的接收器PIC，以完成接收器模块。APIC平台也将以高产量和可制造性发展起来，与现有的从无限大的现有商业设备中使用的标准电信合格PIC工艺共享共同的外延层和处理步骤。电子驱动器和接收电路将采用GEDC熟知的行业标准商业设计实践进行布置。

Source.Name: United States Department of the Navy

Project.Title: Forest ecosystems trophic disposition from the aspect of game nutrition

Title_Other.Title: Forest ecosystems trophic disposition from the aspect of game nutrition
从猎物营养看森林生态系统的营养配置

Class.ClassName: 环境生态系统、生态环境
自然资源调查、自然资源分析

Project.Abstract: Modern approaches to protection of forest and game require parallel utilization of technical and biotechnical proceedings. The aim of the project is to reach the most prosper coexistence of the game and their environment. Based on a comprehensive assessment of the environmental conditions of forest biocenosis a methodical procedure for quantification of spatial risk of tree browsing by ungulates game will be defined. Options for growing out of young forest stands out of the reach of the game will be analyzed depending on the prevention method. Based on the achieved results, the main principles of young stands protection will be proposed, applicable also in differentconditionsof forestrypractice. The issue of forest protection will be solved in the close relation to the nutritional requirements of game and to the options for its gratification. On the experimental fenced plot the research will also focus on the detection of damages caused by game, depending on the applied supplemental nutrition (type of food-flavoring its attractiveness and nutritional value, etc.). Significant aspects of the project will compare the nutritional value of available natural food (the branches, bark of trees) in a game environment with the test feed (content of essential nutrients, minerals and their true digestibility). Special nutritionists’ experiments will be focused to find out the general health and physical condition of the game, elimination of winter mortality, finding out the influence of feedind on concentration and migration of the game and improving the trophy quality. The main part of attemts will be carry out in laboratory conditions in Institute of Nutrition of National Agricultural and food centre – Research Institute for Animal Production. According to the fact, that it is very difficult to identify the cause of damage of trees in many cases, a part of project will be the proposition of solving the problem of demages cased by small rodents in relationship to their popula

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 现代森林和野生动物保护方法要求同时利用技术和生物技术程序。该项目的目的是达到最繁荣的共存游戏和他们的环境。在对森林生物群落环境条件进行综合评价的基础上，定义了有蹄类动物游憩的空间风险量化方法。根据预防方法，将分析在游戏范围之外的幼林中成长的选择。在此基础上，提出了幼林保护的主要原则，并适用于不同的造林条件。森林保护问题的解决，将密切关系到游戏的营养需求及其满足的选择。在实验围栏地块上，研究还将根据所应用的补充营养（使其具有吸引力和营养价值的食品类型等），重点检测游戏造成的损害。该项目的重要方面是将游戏环境中可用天然食物（树枝、树皮）的营养价值与试验饲料（必需营养素、矿物质的含量及其真正的消化率）进行比较。特别营养学家的实验将着重于了解比赛的一般健康状况和身体状况，消除冬季死亡率，了解饲养对比赛集中和迁移的影响，提高比赛的奖杯质量。ATETMTS的主要部分将在国家农业和食品中心营养研究所-动物生产研究所的实验室条件下进行。鉴于在许多情况下很难确定树木受损的原因，本项目的一部分内容将是解决小型啮齿动物对其种群的危害问题。

Project.Title: Electrochemical and NMR studies of hydrolytic metaloenzyme models

Title_Other.Title: Elektrochemické a NMR studium modelů hydrolytických metaloenzymů
水解金属辅酶模型的电化学和核磁共振研究

Class.ClassName: 金属元素、金属元素化合物

Project.Abstract: The content of the present project is the study of structure-reactivity relationships in coordination compounds, which serve as models of hydrolytic metal-enzymes. Attention will be focused on the activation of the nucleophilic function of the ligand due to its coordination with the metal ion. The model compounds, alkylheteroarylketoximes and their complexes are substances with several conjugated redoxactive centers. The detailed study of the redox behavior of ligands and their complexes and the elucidation of interactions between redox centers will provide information on the distribution of electron densities in the complex and on the method of coordination. The addition of electrochemical study of ligands and their complexes will be potentiometric and NMR study of complexing equilibria. The hydrolytic activity of the complexes will be studied by measuring kinetics of hydrolysis of model substrates under different conditions. Characteristics of the complexes obtained by electrochemical and NMR studies (redox potentials, stability constants, etc.) will be correlated with their hydrolytic efficiency, expressed by velocities

Abstract_Other.Abstract: Obsahem předkládaného projektu je studium vztahů struktura-reaktivita u koordinačních sloučenin, které slouží jako modely hydrolytických metaloenzymů. Pozornost bude soustředěna na aktivaci nukleofilní funkce ligandu vlivem její koordinace k iontu kovu.Modelové sloučeniny, alkylheteroarylketoximy a jejich komplexy, představují látky s několika konjugovanými redoxaktivními centry. Podrobné studium redox chování ligandů a jejich komplexů a objasnění vzájemných interakcí redoxaktivních center poskytne informace o rozložení elektronových hustot v komplexu a o způsobu koordinace. Doplňkem elektrochemického studia ligandů a jejich komplexů bude potenciometrické a NMR studium komplexotvorných rovnováh. Hydrolytická účinnost komplexů bude studována měřením kinetiky hydrolýz modelových substrátů za různých podmínek. Charakteristiky komplexů získané elektrochemickým a NMR studiem (redox potenciály, konstanty stability apod.) budou korelovány s jejich hydrolytickou účinností, vyjádřenou pomocí rychlostních kons

本课题的内容是研究配位化合物的结构-反应关系，作为水解金属酶的模型。由于配体与金属离子的配位作用，其亲核功能的激活将成为人们关注的焦点。模型化合物、烷基杂芳基酮肟及其配合物是具有多个共轭的还原活性中心的物质。详细研究配体及其配合物的氧化还原行为，阐明氧化还原中心之间的相互作用，将提供配合物中电子密度分布和配位方法的信息。配体和配合物的电化学研究将是络合平衡的电位和NMR研究。通过测定模型底物在不同条件下的水解动力学，研究了配合物的水解活性。通过电化学和核磁共振研究获得的配合物的特性（氧化还原电位、稳定常数等）将与其水解效率相关，用速度表示

Project.Title: UVa Framework Program in Global Health

Title_Other.Title: UVa Framework Program in Global Health
全球健康中的uva框架计划

Project.Abstract: DESCRIPTION (provided by applicant): Founded in 2001, the University of Virginia's Center for Global Health (CGH) builds on a 23-year program in Geographic Medicine. The CGH promotes the engagement of faculty and students in the development of multidisciplinary research and service projects that address global health issues. Through existing collaborations with international colleagues and institutions, CGH annually sponsors over 40 UVa students in mentored global health research and service projects abroad. In addition, 8-10 international research fellows, competitively selected from our collaborating institutions, come to UVa each year for training and research with UVa faculty mentors. Over 80 such fellows have now trained at UVa, and 100% have returned to their home countries to help build collaborative programs that include trans-university Centers for Global Health in Brazil, Philippines, Ghana, and South Africa. In the last four years, the number of global health-related courses and activities at UVa has exploded. Both undergraduate and professional students have formed interest groups related to global health, and student demand for information, career advice, and opportunities in global health has grown markedly. We therefore recognize the need for a Framework Program in Global Health to build a sustainable strategy to incorporate global health into curricular offerings across the university. We have seen how individual courses can develop and succeed. The Framework Program will reinforce links between existing courses and programs, institutionalize and formalize credit for work in global health, including the development of degree programs, and foster the creation of new opportunities for collaboration within the University and between our international partners. Our Framework Program will bring together three principal partners at UVa: the Schools of Medicine and Nursing, and the College of Arts and Sciences. It will include 5 components: 1) A Global Health Curriculum Working Group, coordinated by the Center for Global Health, to convene 8-10 faculty members from the Schools of Medicine, Nursing, and Arts and Sciences to plan and implement global health curricula and coordinate participation by their respective schools. 2) The Working Group will develop multidisciplinary global health curricula for undergraduate, graduate, and professional students across the university. 3) A University-wide conference schedule engaging UVa faculty, international fellows, and students in global health issues will invite visiting scholars from collaborating international institutions. 4) Expanded global health career planning services through website resources, internship placement, and mentoring from former global health scholars, fellows, and faculty contacts. 5) A coordinated, university-wide plan to raise funds to sustain global health programs at UVa.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: DESCRIPTION (provided by applicant): Founded in 2001, the University of Virginia's Center for Global Health (CGH) builds on a 23-year program in Geographic Medicine. The CGH promotes the engagement of faculty and students in the development of multidisciplinary research and service projects that address global health issues. Through existing collaborations with international colleagues and institutions, CGH annually sponsors over 40 UVa students in mentored global health research and service projects abroad. In addition, 8-10 international research fellows, competitively selected from our collaborating institutions, come to UVa each year for training and research with UVa faculty mentors. Over 80 such fellows have now trained at UVa, and 100% have returned to their home countries to help build collaborative programs that include trans-university Centers for Global Health in Brazil, Philippines, Ghana, and South Africa. In the last four years, the number of global health-related courses and activities at UVa has exploded. Both undergraduate and professional students have formed interest groups related to global health, and student demand for information, career advice, and opportunities in global health has grown markedly. We therefore recognize the need for a Framework Program in Global Health to build a sustainable strategy to incorporate global health into curricular offerings across the university. We have seen how individual courses can develop and succeed. The Framework Program will reinforce links between existing courses and programs, institutionalize and formalize credit for work in global health, including the development of degree programs, and foster the creation of new opportunities for collaboration within the University and between our international partners. Our Framework Program will bring together three principal partners at UVa: the Schools of Medicine and Nursing, and the College of Arts and Sciences. It will include 5 components: 1) A Global Health Curriculum Working Group, coordinated by the Center for Global Health, to convene 8-10 faculty members from the Schools of Medicine, Nursing, and Arts and Sciences to plan and implement global health curricula and coordinate participation by their respective schools. 2) The Working Group will develop multidisciplinary global health curricula for undergraduate, graduate, and professional students across the university. 3) A University-wide conference schedule engaging UVa faculty, international fellows, and students in global health issues will invite visiting scholars from collaborating international institutions. 4) Expanded global health career planning services through website resources, internship placement, and mentoring from former global health scholars, fellows, and faculty contacts. 5) A coordinated, university-wide plan to raise funds to sustain global health programs at UVa.

描述（由申请人提供）：成立于2001年，弗吉尼亚大学全球健康中心（CGH）建立在一个23年的地理医学项目的基础上。专家咨询小组促进教师和学生参与制定解决全球卫生问题的多学科研究和服务项目。通过与国际同事和机构的现有合作，CGH每年赞助40多名在海外指导全球健康研究和服务项目的UVA学生。此外，每年有8-10名国际研究人员从我们的合作机构中有竞争力地挑选出来，与大学教师导师一起到大学进行培训和研究。目前已有超过80名这样的研究员在uva接受培训，100%的人返回本国，帮助建立合作项目，其中包括巴西、菲律宾、加纳和南非的跨大学全球卫生中心。在过去的四年里，uva的全球健康相关课程和活动数量激增。无论是本科生还是专业学生，都已形成了与全球健康相关的兴趣群体，学生在全球健康领域对信息、职业建议和机会的需求显著增长。因此，我们认识到全球健康框架计划的必要性，以建立一个可持续的战略，将全球健康纳入整个大学的课程设置。我们已经看到个别课程是如何发展和成功的。该框架计划将加强现有课程和计划之间的联系，使全球卫生工作的学分制度化和正规化，包括发展学位计划，并促进在大学内部和我们的国际合作伙伴之间创造新的合作机会。我们的框架计划将汇集三个主要的合作伙伴在uva：医学院和护理学院，以及艺术和科学学院。它将包括5个组成部分：1）由全球卫生中心协调的全球卫生课程工作组，召集医学、护理、艺术和科学学院的8-10名教员，规划和实施全球卫生课程，并协调各自学校的参与。2）工作组将为全大学的本科生、研究生和专业学生制定多学科全球健康课程。3）大学范围内的会议日程安排将邀请来自合作国际机构的访问学者参加，包括uva教员、国际研究员和全球健康问题的学生。4）通过网站资源、实习安排和前全球健康学者、研究员和教员联系人的指导，扩大全球健康职业规划服务。（5）一项协调一致的、全大学范围的计划，旨在筹集资金，以维持uva的全球卫生计划。

Project.Title: Effects of Regular Exercise on Cerebrovascular Reserve in Older Adults: Role in the Prevention of Age-Related Cognitive Decline

Title_Other.Title: 定期运动对老年人脑血管储备的影响：在预防老年认知功能减退中的作用
Effects of Regular Exercise on Cerebrovascular Reserve in Older Adults: Role in the Prevention of Age-Related Cognitive Decline

Project.Abstract: Cerebral blood flow (CBF) is highly regulated by carbon dioxide and oxygen in the arterial blood. This process becomes impaired with cerebrovascular disease processes and by aging. Aging is associated with a progressive decline in CBF, which is a major risk factor for stroke. In premenopausal women, this decline is not as pronounced as in men but it appears to be accelerated after menopause and persists into old age. This biphasic phenomenon might be explained by ovarian hormone modulation of CBF before menopause, followed by a predominant influence of other factors thereafter. Physical inactivity, a modifiable risk factor for stroke and cognitive decline, may be one of those factors. However, the mechanism by which physical activity exerts its protective effect on the cerebral circulation is unclear. If physical activity is a significant modulator of CBF, one would predict that men and women who are more active would have fewer incidences of cerebrovascular disease than those who are sedentary. A suitable experimental design would require a set of studies in sedentary men and women, followed by the same studies in active men and women, and then placing the sedentary and physically-active groups on similar training programs. This approach would enable the possibility of using this knowledge to impact predictors for stroke, or at least how active living may prevent cardiovascular problems in the brain from occurring. We propose studies in sedentary men and women to address the question: What are the effects of physical activity on CBF and cognitive function in older men and women? This approach will allow us to study the interactions between the cerebral circulation and cognitive function, and may provide powerful diagnostic tools to help identify those individuals at risk of stroke. This work may have a positive impact in helping delay or prevent the onset of disabilities due to diseases like stroke.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 脑血流量（CBF）受动脉血中二氧化碳和氧气的高度调节。这一过程会因脑血管疾病过程和老化而受损。衰老与CBF的逐渐下降有关，CBF是中风的主要危险因素。在绝经前妇女中，这种下降不如男性明显，但在绝经后似乎加速，并持续到老年。这种双相现象可以解释为绝经前卵巢激素对CBF的调节，随后是其他因素的主要影响。缺乏运动是中风和认知能力下降的一个可改变的危险因素，可能是这些因素之一。然而，体力活动对脑循环的保护作用机制尚不清楚。如果体力活动是CBF的一个重要调节因素，人们可以预测，较活跃的男性和女性比久坐的男性和女性患脑血管病的几率更低。一个合适的实验设计需要对久坐的男性和女性进行一系列的研究，然后对活跃的男性和女性进行相同的研究，然后将久坐和体力活动的群体安排在类似的训练计划中。这种方法将使我们有可能利用这些知识来影响中风的预测因素，或者至少是积极的生活如何防止大脑中的心血管问题的发生。我们建议对久坐的男性和女性进行研究，以解决以下问题：体力活动对老年男性和女性的CBF和认知功能有什么影响？这种方法将使我们能够研究大脑循环和认知功能之间的相互作用，并可能提供强有力的诊断工具，帮助识别那些有中风风险的个体。这项工作可能对帮助延迟或预防中风等疾病引起的残疾有积极的影响。

Cerebral blood flow (CBF) is highly regulated by carbon dioxide and oxygen in the arterial blood. This process becomes impaired with cerebrovascular disease processes and by aging. Aging is associated with a progressive decline in CBF, which is a major risk factor for stroke. In premenopausal women, this decline is not as pronounced as in men but it appears to be accelerated after menopause and persists into old age. This biphasic phenomenon might be explained by ovarian hormone modulation of CBF before menopause, followed by a predominant influence of other factors thereafter. Physical inactivity, a modifiable risk factor for stroke and cognitive decline, may be one of those factors. However, the mechanism by which physical activity exerts its protective effect on the cerebral circulation is unclear. If physical activity is a significant modulator of CBF, one would predict that men and women who are more active would have fewer incidences of cerebrovascular disease than those who are sedentary. A suitable experimental design would require a set of studies in sedentary men and women, followed by the same studies in active men and women, and then placing the sedentary and physically-active groups on similar training programs. This approach would enable the possibility of using this knowledge to impact predictors for stroke, or at least how active living may prevent cardiovascular problems in the brain from occurring. We propose studies in sedentary men and women to address the question: What are the effects of physical activity on CBF and cognitive function in older men and women? This approach will allow us to study the interactions between the cerebral circulation and cognitive function, and may provide powerful diagnostic tools to help identify those individuals at risk of stroke. This work may have a positive impact in helping delay or prevent the onset of disabilities due to diseases like stroke.

Project.Title: Precision Positron Polarimetry - a New Technique in Weak Interaction Studies

Title_Other.Title: Precision Positron Polarimetry - a New Technique in Weak Interaction Studies
精密正电子旋光法-弱相互作用研究的新技术

Project.Title: Mulago Inpatient Noninvasive Diagnosis of Pneumocystis Pneumonia (MIND PCP) Study

Title_Other.Title: Mulago Inpatient Noninvasive Diagnosis of Pneumocystis Pneumonia (MIND PCP) Study
Mulago住院患者肺孢子虫肺炎无创诊断（MIND-PCP）研究

Project.Abstract: DESCRIPTION (provided by applicant): Respiratory infections are the leading cause of death in HIV-infected patients in Africa, and difficulty identifying their etiology is the major obstacle to successful treatment. While tuberculosis (TB) and bacterial pneumonia are common, other processes may cause pneumonia in these patients, so bronchoscopy with bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL) is often indicated for definitive diagnosis, especially when empiric treatments fail. Recent studies employing BAL in Africa show that the leading cause of such presentations is pneumocystis pneumonia (PCP), affecting about 40%. Yet, limited resources mean that BAL is rarely performed in Africa, and without a diagnosis, these patients face certain death. The long-term goal of this research is to improve survival of HIV-infected people with PCP in Africa through reliable, non-invasive, and affordable diagnostic tests for respiratory infection. This study will evaluate the use of a polymerase chain reaction (PCR) assay on oropharyngeal wash (OPW) specimens to diagnose PCP. Patients gargle saline to produce an OPW, which is simpler and safer than BAL, which is expensive and invasive. In the U.S., PCR on OPW is nearly as accurate for PCP as BAL with conventional staining. While PCR is new to Africa, it has proven cost-effective for TB diagnosis in Kenya. PCR is routinely used to measure HIV viral loads at Makerere University's Mulago Hospital in Kampala, Uganda. This is a cross-sectional study to determine the accuracy of a PCR assay on OPW for PCP diagnosis in HIV-infected patients admitted to Kampala's Mulago Hospital with pneumonia. The study will collect clinical data, OPW, and BAL from all 200 participants. BAL samples will be conventionally stained to define who has PCP. OPW samples will be tested for pneumocystis by a PCR assay targeting the major surface glycoprotein gene. The study team will estimate the accuracy of OPW relative to the BAL gold-standard. Measuring the accuracy of OPW is critical to assessing its feasibility for clinical care in Africa and for future PCP studies. This fellowship will support the candidate's Master's Degree training and protect his time for this research. This proposal closely fits the agency's mission of "supporting research training and career development of new researchers to enable conduct of clinical research related to diagnosis of lung disease." Public Relevance: Pneumonia causes most deaths in patients with HIV in developing countries. Diagnosing pneumonia by standard methods is impossible because of limited resources. This study will test if DNA- fingerprinting of special mouthwashes can accurately diagnose HIV-related pneumonia, and save lives.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 说明（由申请人提供）：呼吸道感染是非洲艾滋病毒感染者的主要死亡原因，难以确定其病因是成功治疗的主要障碍。肺结核（TB）和细菌性肺炎很常见，但其他过程也可能导致肺炎，因此支气管镜下支气管肺泡灌洗（BAL）常被认为是确诊的方法，尤其是经验性治疗失败时。最近在非洲使用BAL的研究表明，这种表现的主要原因是肺孢子虫肺炎（PCP），影响约40%。然而，有限的资源意味着BAL在非洲很少进行，如果没有诊断，这些患者将面临一定的死亡。这项研究的长期目标是通过对呼吸道感染进行可靠、无创和负担得起的诊断试验，提高非洲感染艾滋病毒的人的生存率。本研究将评价聚合酶链反应（PCR）检测口咽冲洗液（OPW）标本诊断PCP的价值。病人用盐水漱口产生OPW，比BAL更简单和安全，BAL昂贵且具有侵袭性。在美国，OPW上的PCR对PCP的准确度几乎与BAL上的常规染色一样。虽然聚合酶链反应是非洲的新技术，但它已被证明对肯尼亚的结核病诊断具有成本效益。在乌干达坎帕拉的马克雷尔大学穆拉戈医院，PCR通常被用来测量HIV病毒载量。这是一项横断面研究，旨在确定聚合酶链反应（PCR）检测法在坎帕拉穆拉戈肺炎医院（Kampala's Mulago Hospital with肺炎）收治的HIV感染患者中诊断PCP的准确性。这项研究将收集所有200名参与者的临床数据、OPW和BAL。BAL样本将常规染色以确定谁患有PCP。OPW样本将通过一种针对主要表面糖蛋白基因的PCR检测肺孢子虫。研究小组将评估OPW相对于BAL金标准的准确性。测量OPW的准确性对于评估其在非洲临床治疗和未来PCP研究的可行性至关重要。该奖学金将支持候选人的硕士学位培训，并保护他的时间进行这项研究。这项提议与该机构的任务“支持新研究人员的研究培训和职业发展，以便能够进行与肺病诊断相关的临床研究”非常吻合。公共相关性：肺炎导致发展中国家艾滋病毒患者的大多数死亡。由于资源有限，用标准方法诊断肺炎是不可能的。本研究将测试特殊漱口水的DNA指纹是否能准确诊断HIV相关肺炎，并拯救生命。

Project.Title: Thrombospondin-1 modulates haemostasis and thrombosis through regulation of the cAMP signalling pathway

Title_Other.Title: 血栓素-1通过调节camp信号通路调节止血和血栓形成
Thrombospondin-1 modulates haemostasis and thrombosis through regulation of the cAMP signalling pathway

Project.Title: Rheocast chassis component in aluminium for vehicles

Title_Other.Title: 车辆用铝合金Rheocast底盘部件
Rheocast chassis component in aluminium for vehicles

Project.Abstract:
Purpose and goal: The project aims to develop knowledge, material data and design guidelines that enable reliable use of rheocastaluminium components in fatigue loaded applications, in vehicles, with wall thicknesses in the range 2-9 mm.
Expected results and effects: A concrete goal is to reduce vehicle weight by replacing fatigue loaded steel parts with rheocast aluminium components where one of the components reduces by 34% in weight. An additional goal is knowledge build-up in the field of mechanical properties of aluminium for rheocast materials.
Approach and implementation: Critical competence to develop is the effect and control of porosity and casting skin that arises from surface segregations during the castinmg sequence. Material data shall be implemented in the design tools used by designers and component near demonstrators (TRL 6) should be developed to support production implementation. The demonstrators that are developed will be able to be transferred to sharp production objects during the project and the implementation will be taken to the purchasing departments when the properties of the demonstratiors are validated during the project.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 目的和目标： 该项目旨在开发知识、材料数据和设计指南，以便在车辆疲劳载荷应用中可靠地使用壁厚在2-9mm范围内的流变铝部件。 预期结果和效果： 一个具体的目标是通过用rheocast铝部件替换疲劳加载的钢部件来减轻车辆重量，其中一个部件的重量减少了34%。另一个目标是在流变材料用铝的机械性能领域积累知识。 方法和实施： 开发的关键能力是在castinmg序列中，由于表面分离而产生的孔隙率和铸件表皮的影响和控制。材料数据应在设计师使用的设计工具中实现，并应开发示威者附近的组件（TRL 6），以支持生产实施。开发的示威者将能够在项目期间转移到尖锐的生产对象，并在项目期间验证演示者的属性时将实施情况带到采购部门。

Purpose and goal: The project aims to develop knowledge, material data and design guidelines that enable reliable use of rheocastaluminium components in fatigue loaded applications, in vehicles, with wall thicknesses in the range 2-9 mm.
Expected results and effects: A concrete goal is to reduce vehicle weight by replacing fatigue loaded steel parts with rheocast aluminium components where one of the components reduces by 34% in weight. An additional goal is knowledge build-up in the field of mechanical properties of aluminium for rheocast materials.
Approach and implementation: Critical competence to develop is the effect and control of porosity and casting skin that arises from surface segregations during the castinmg sequence. Material data shall be implemented in the design tools used by designers and component near demonstrators (TRL 6) should be developed to support production implementation. The demonstrators that are developed will be able to be transferred to sharp production objects during the project and the implementation will be taken to the purchasing departments when the properties of the demonstratiors are validated during the project.

Project.Title: The role of PPARalpha in cardiac function and target gene expression in the failing heart

Title_Other.Title: PPARalpha在心力衰竭心脏功能及靶基因表达中的作用
The role of PPARalpha in cardiac function and target gene expression in the failing heart

Project.Abstract: Impaired fatty acid utilization is a hallmark of the failing heart and is generally considered to be a maladaptive response. Peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor-alpha (PPARalpha), a nuclear receptor, plays an important role in fatty acid metabolism through transcriptional activation. PPARalpha forms heterodimers with Retinoid X receptors (RXRs) and binds to a response element called direct repeat 1 (DR1) or PPAR response element (PPRE), whose consensus sequence is AGGTCANAGGTCA (where N is any nucleotide), with PPARalpha and RXR occupying the 5' and 3' AGGTCA sequences, respectively. PPAR target genes are downregulated in the failing heart, an effect which is well correlated with the decline in fatty acid utilization. However, the mechanism responsible for impaired expression of PPAR target genes in the failing heart is not fully understood. We have shown that pressure overload upregulates PPARalpha in the heart, while PPARalpha haploinsufficiency attenuates pressure overload-induced cardiac dysfunction. Mechanistically, we have revealed that upregulated PPARalpha; suppresses expression of target genes of the estrogen-related receptor (ERR), a nuclear receptor subfamily which planys an important role in functions, through direct binding to the ERR response element (ERRE) and recruitment of silent information regulator 1 (Sirt1) to those loci. The consensus sequence of the ERRE is TNAAGGTCA, suggesting that PPARalpha suppresses transcription when it binds to isolated AGGTCA sequences that do not provide for an RXR binding site. Interestingly, one of the AGGTCA sequences is not well conserved in many intrinsic PPREs, thereby representing imperfect DR1s. Our preliminary data show that the PPAR target genes harboring imperfect DR1s are cooperatively downregulated by PPARalpha and Sirt1 in mice. Thus, we hypothesize that downregulation of a subset of PPAR target genes results from a mechanism similar to that which suppresses ERR target genes, due to the similarity of the DNA binding sequences. We expect that dissociation of RXR from DR1 plays a key role in the transition from transcriptional activation to suppression of the PPAR target genes. The mechanism and significance will be addressed with genetically altered mouse models in conjunction with a series of molecular and biochemical assays. This proposed project will demonstrate a responsible mechanism leasing to the downregulation of genes involved in fatty acid metabolism in the failing heart.
