We expect that dissociation of RXR from DR1 plays a key role in the transition from transcriptional activation to suppression of the PPAR target genes. The mechanism and significance will be addressed with genetically altered mouse models in conjunction with a series of molecular and biochemical assays. This proposed project will demonstrate a responsible mechanism leasing to the downregulation of genes involved in fatty acid metabolism in the failing heart.

脂肪酸利用受损是心脏衰竭的一个标志，通常被认为是一种不适应反应。过氧化物酶体增殖物激活受体α（pPARalpha）是一种核受体，通过转录激活在脂肪酸代谢中发挥重要作用。PPARα与维甲酸X受体（RXRS）形成异源二聚体，并与直接重复1（DR1）或PPAR应答元件（PPRE）的应答元件结合，其一致序列为AgTcCuAgCuTa（其中N为任何核苷酸），PPARα和RXR分别占据5’和3’AgCTCA序列。PPAR靶基因在衰竭的心脏中被下调，这与脂肪酸利用率下降有很好的相关性。然而，在受损心脏中表达PPAR靶基因受损的机制尚不完全清楚。我们已经表明，压力过载上调PPARα在心脏，而PPARα单倍不足衰减压力过载引起的心功能不全。机械地，我们已经揭示上调pPARPHA；抑制雌激素受体（ER）的靶基因的表达，雌激素受体（ER）是一种核受体亚家族，它通过直接结合到ErR应答元件（ErE）和招募沉默信息调节器1（SIRT1）到这些位点，在功能中起着重要的作用。ErRE的一致序列是tNaGARTCA，提示pPARPHA抑制转录，当它结合到不提供RXR结合位点的分离的AgCTCA序列时。有趣的是，一个AgCTCA序列在许多内在PPRS中不是很保守的，从而代表不完美的DR1s。我们的初步数据表明，PPARα和SIRT1协同下调了不完全DR1s的PPAR靶基因。因此，我们假设PPAR靶基因子集的下调是由类似于抑制ErR靶基因的机制引起的，这是由于DNA结合序列的相似性。我们预期RDR从DR1的解离在转录激活到PPAR靶基因的抑制中起着关键的作用。该机制和意义将通过转基因小鼠模型和一系列的分子和生化分析来阐述。这项拟议的计划将证明一种负责任的机制，即在衰竭的心脏中，参与脂肪酸代谢的基因下调。

Organization.Name: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey
Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey

Project.Title: Holographic confocal microscopy

Title_Other.Title: Holografická konfokální mikroskopie
全息共焦显微镜

Project.Abstract: Confocal scanning microscopy offers a number of advantages (depth discrimination and the resulting optical cut, improved resolution) versus conventional optical microscopy. Sun and Leith have experimentally demonstrated that imaging with all the benefits of a confocal process can be obtained without holographic imaging using a non-coherent light source and an achromatic interferometer. In addition, the wave phase is detected. We propose to modify this experiment to match the optical schematic of conventional confocal microscopes, ie, to illuminate the object by a collimated beam (Köhler) so that the display is detected electronically and in reflected light. In the last phase of the project, we intend to use microscopic optical systems to prove the applicability of this non-stellar confocal process in microscopy.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 与传统光学显微镜相比，共焦扫描显微镜具有许多优点（深度分辨和由此产生的光学切割，提高了分辨率）。Sun和Leith实验证明，利用非相干光源和消色差干涉仪，无需全息成像，就可以获得具有共焦过程所有优点的成像。此外，还检测到波相位。我们建议修改这项实验，使之与传统共焦显微镜的光学原理相匹配，即用准直光束（Kóhler）照射物体，以便在电子和反射光中检测显示器。在项目的最后阶段，我们打算使用显微光学系统来证明这种非恒星共焦过程在显微镜中的适用性。

Konfokální rastrovací mikroskopie nabízí řadu výhod (hloubkovou diskriminaci a z ní vyplývající možnost optických řezů, zlepšenou rozlišovací schopnost) oproti běžné optické mikroskopii. Sun a Leith experimentálně prokázali, že zobrazení se všemi výhodami konfokálního procesu lze získat bez rastrování holografickou technikou, využívající nekohorentního zdroje světla a achromatického interferometru. Navíc je detekována fáze vlny. Navrhujeme modifikovat tento experiment tak, aby odpovídal optickému schematu běžných konfokálních mikroskopů, tj,, aby byl objekt osvětlen kolimovaným svazkem (Köhlerovsky), aby zobrazení bylo detekováno elektronicky a v odraženém světle. V poslední fázi projektu zamýšlíme použít mikroskopových optických soustav a tak prokázatpoužitelnost tohoto nerastrovacího konfokálního procesu v mikroskopii.

Project.Title: Multiphysical models for the prediction of the long-term mechanical properties of degradable biomaterials

Title_Other.Title: Multiphysical models for the prediction of the long-term mechanical properties of degradable biomaterials
可降解生物材料长期力学性能预测的多物理模型

Project.Abstract: Bone loss and fractures,due to e.g. osteoporosis,require the use of bone substituting materials. Injectable,degradable cements like calcium phosphates are promising for this purpose. However,their poor mechanical properties have limited their use. Despite not being approved for load-bearing applications,they have been used for such in the spine,with variable outcomes. A greater understanding of their long-term mechanical behavior would assist in avoiding their inadequate use as well as pinpointing possible new areas of use. This would be valuable as they have a superior biocompatibility in comparison to other, commonly used materials. However,there is a lack of information on the fatigue characteristics of these cements. The purpose of this project is to gain a fundamental understanding of the correlation between composition,microstructure and long-term mechanical behavior of calcium phosphate cements. The project includes experimental evaluation of the microstructure and fatigue behavior using CT scanners and dynamic material testers. The results will be used to feed and validate computational,multiphysical models that will be developed within the project. The models will then be used to predict the materials chemical and mechanical degradation over time.Based on this,informed choices can be made regarding the type of situations for which the materials are appropriate.This should lead to safer and more time and cost effective evaluations and use of these types of materials.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 由于骨质疏松等原因造成的骨丢失和骨折，需要使用骨替代材料。可注射的，可降解的水泥，如磷酸钙，在这方面是有希望的。然而，它们的机械性能差，限制了它们的使用。尽管没有被批准用于负重应用，但它们已经用于脊柱的负重应用，其结果是不同的。进一步了解它们的长期机械行为将有助于避免它们的不充分使用，并确定可能的新使用领域。这将是有价值的，因为他们有优越的生物相容性相比，其他，常用材料。然而，这些水泥的疲劳特性缺乏信息。本项目的目的是从根本上了解磷酸钙水泥的组成、微观结构和长期力学行为之间的关系。该项目包括使用CT扫描仪和动态材料试验机对微观结构和疲劳行为进行试验评估。这些结果将用于提供和验证将在项目内开发的计算、多物理模型。然后，模型将用于预测材料随时间的化学和机械降解。在此基础上，可以就材料适合的情况类型做出明智的选择。这将导致对这些类型材料进行更安全、更及时、更具成本效益的评估和使用。

Bone loss and fractures,due to e.g. osteoporosis,require the use of bone substituting materials. Injectable,degradable cements like calcium phosphates are promising for this purpose. However,their poor mechanical properties have limited their use. Despite not being approved for load-bearing applications,they have been used for such in the spine,with variable outcomes. A greater understanding of their long-term mechanical behavior would assist in avoiding their inadequate use as well as pinpointing possible new areas of use. This would be valuable as they have a superior biocompatibility in comparison to other, commonly used materials. However,there is a lack of information on the fatigue characteristics of these cements. The purpose of this project is to gain a fundamental understanding of the correlation between composition,microstructure and long-term mechanical behavior of calcium phosphate cements. The project includes experimental evaluation of the microstructure and fatigue behavior using CT scanners and dynamic material testers. The results will be used to feed and validate computational,multiphysical models that will be developed within the project. The models will then be used to predict the materials chemical and mechanical degradation over time.Based on this,informed choices can be made regarding the type of situations for which the materials are appropriate.This should lead to safer and more time and cost effective evaluations and use of these types of materials.

Project.Title: Digital science day

Title_Other.Title: 数字科学日
Digital science day

Project.Abstract: Digital Science Day (DSD) is a one-day course for teachers and technicians designed to promote and enable to use of digital technology in classroom. This exciting and diverse event will mirror the philosophy behind the Science Learning Centre Network - to stimulate national science education through imaginative and practical classroom initiatives. We exploit two of the UK's leading educational resources: (i) the National Schools Observatory (NSO - a tremendous internationally-linked UK facility with a suite of cutting-edge research quality robotic telescopes. There is dedicated access for observational projects proposed and developed by school students); (ii) the tradition of expertise and innovation in the technical production of scientific images and films. Our attractive location for the pilot sessions, the Bayfordbury Observatory and Field Station, reflects the 21st Century nature of the course - the site was recently chosen by Mercedes for a product promotion because of its 'space-age' appearance and the Patrick Moore Control Room on the site has won several architectural awards. The objectives of Digital Science day are: to inform and demonstrate the effective classroom use of digital technology (DT); in particular to show how DT enables a creative and interactive approach to experimentation and analysis with a rapid feedback and evaluation cycle. to provide a CD teacher's guide to DT and a CD trainer's guide. to encourage teachers to make full use of the fantastic learning opportunities offered by the NSO by offering hands-on help in using the website, applying for time on the telescopes, analysing the digital images from the telescopes, and making interesting integrated lessons out of these resources.

This exciting and diverse event will mirror the philosophy behind the Science Learning Centre Network - to stimulate national science education through imaginative and practical classroom initiatives. There is dedicated access for observational projects proposed and developed by school students); (ii) the tradition of expertise and innovation in the technical production of scientific images and films. Our attractive location for the pilot sessions, the Bayfordbury Observatory and Field Station, reflects the 21st Century nature of the course - the site was recently chosen by Mercedes for a product promotion because of its 'space-age' appearance and the Patrick Moore Control Room on the site has won several architectural awards. The objectives of Digital Science day are: to inform and demonstrate the effective classroom use of digital technology (DT); in particular to show how DT enables a creative and interactive approach to experimentation and analysis with a rapid feedback and evaluation cycle. to provide a CD teacher's guide to DT and a CD trainer's guide. to encourage teachers to make full use of the fantastic learning opportunities offered by the NSO by offering hands-on help in using the website, applying for time on the telescopes, analysing the digital images from the telescopes, and making interesting integrated lessons out of these resources.

数字科学日（DSD）是一个为期一天的课程，为教师和技术人员设计，旨在促进和使使用数字技术的课堂。这项激动人心的多样性活动将反映科学学习中心网络背后的理念——通过富有想象力和实践性的课堂活动来刺激国家科学教育。我们开发了英国两个领先的教育资源：（i）国家学校天文台（NSO），这是一个巨大的国际联系的英国设施，配有一套尖端的研究质量的机器人望远镜。学校学生提出和发展的观测项目有专门的通道；（二）科学图像和电影技术制作方面的专门知识和创新传统。我们吸引人的试点会议地点，贝福德伯里天文台和野外站，反映了21世纪的性质，该网站最近被梅赛德斯选择为一个产品推广，因为其'太空时代'的外观和帕特里克摩尔控制室在该网站上赢得了数个建筑奖。“数字科学日”的目标是：告知并展示数字技术（DT）在课堂上的有效使用；特别是展示DT如何在快速反馈和评估周期内实现创造性和互动性的实验和分析方法。提供一份教师指南和培训师指南。鼓励教师充分利用国家统计局提供的绝佳学习机会，方法是在使用网站、申请使用望远镜的时间、分析望远镜的数字图像以及利用这些资源制作有趣的综合课程方面提供实际帮助。

Title_Other.Title: 知识和技能-大脑受损受试者特殊记忆功能的机制。
Knowledge and Skills - Mechanisms of Special Memory Functions Tested in Brain Damaged Subjects.

Title_Other.Title: 1887年《孵化法案》（多州研究基金）——ID
HATCH ACT OF 1887 (MULTISTATE RESEARCH FUND) - ID

Source.Name: National Institute of Food and Agriculture

Project.Title: Unnatural amino acid mutagenesis in eukaryotes

Title_Other.Title: Unnatural amino acid mutagenesis in eukaryotes
真核生物中非天然氨基酸的突变

Project.Abstract: DESCRIPTION (provided by applicant): The proposed research seeks to expand the power of unnatural amino acid mutagenesis to use in eukaryotic cells. In order to do this, an orthogonal tRNA/synthetase pair will be introduced into a yeast host. tRNA synthetase active site variants will then be screened for novel specificities to interesting unnatural amino acids using a specially designed genetic selection. Once identified, the new pair will be used to deliver unnatural amino acids site specifically in yeast cells. Later, it might be possible to even move successful pairs into mammalian cell lines. The success of this project will open the door to a whole array of exciting structure/function studies of membrane bound receptors and the engineering of proteins with novel chemical or spectroscopic properties.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: DESCRIPTION (provided by applicant): The proposed research seeks to expand the power of unnatural amino acid mutagenesis to use in eukaryotic cells. In order to do this, an orthogonal tRNA/synthetase pair will be introduced into a yeast host. tRNA synthetase active site variants will then be screened for novel specificities to interesting unnatural amino acids using a specially designed genetic selection. Once identified, the new pair will be used to deliver unnatural amino acids site specifically in yeast cells. Later, it might be possible to even move successful pairs into mammalian cell lines. The success of this project will open the door to a whole array of exciting structure/function studies of membrane bound receptors and the engineering of proteins with novel chemical or spectroscopic properties.

说明（由申请人提供）：本研究旨在扩大非天然氨基酸突变在真核细胞中的应用。为了做到这一点，一个正交的tRNA/合成酶对将被引入酵母宿主。tRNA合成酶活性位点变异体将通过一个特别设计的基因选择来筛选有趣的非天然氨基酸的新特异性。一旦确定，新的一对将被用来传递非天然氨基酸位点，特别是在酵母细胞。后来，甚至有可能将成功的配对移到哺乳动物细胞系中。该项目的成功将为膜结合受体和具有新的化学或光谱特性的蛋白质工程的一系列令人兴奋的结构/功能研究打开大门。

Project.Title: MD/PhD Program Grant (starting in 2010-2011)

Title_Other.Title: MD/PhD Program Grant (starting in 2010-2011)
医学博士/博士项目资助（2010-2011年开始）

Project.Title: CAREER: Molecular Systematics of Ray-finned Fishes

Title_Other.Title: 职业：鱼鳍鱼类的分子系统学
CAREER: Molecular Systematics of Ray-finned Fishes

Project.Abstract: 9985045 Orti The ray-finned fishes (Class Actinopterygii) comprise the largest group of living fishes, with more than 23,000 species. They are the most successful of all vertebrate classes and a key component to understanding the evolutionary radiation of vertebrates. Although a well-corroborated hypothesis of relationships among all major groups of ray-finned fishes is lacking, much progress towards a phylogenetic synthesis has been achieved by cladistic analysis of morphological characters of living and fossil taxa. In contrast, molecular systematic studies among major groups of ray-finned fishes have not kept pace with morphological studies. This project involves a large-scale effort to develop suitable molecular markers for higher-level systematics and to compile a large data set of DNA sequences for candidate nuclear genes, for at least 150 representative fish taxa. At the same time, an alternative strategy is also proposed whereby ten carefully selected fish mitochondrial genomes will be sequenced and phylogenetically compared to published sequences that already include 13 complete mitochondrial genomes of sharks and rays, lungfish, and other actinopterygians. The data generated by these two approaches will be used to study phylogenetic relationships among the major groups of ray-finned fishes and to improve our understanding of the major evolutionary transitions in the radiation of fishes. The existing morphological information will be brought together with the new molecular data for analysis. The research proposed should establish a sound framework of reference for future phylogenetic studies of fishes. The goal of the educational component of the project is to develop an integrated program in systematics in general with emphases in vertebrate zoology and molecular systematics, to enhance undergraduate and graduate learning of evolutionary biology. A new five-week, hands-on laboratory course on molecular techniques for ecology and evolution will be developed. Application of both established and innovative teaching resources are proposed as a means to enhance student involvement in the learning process. Active participation in cooperative learning groups, exploration and analysis of WWW resources, and critical evaluation of the primary literature are some of the proposed activities to complement more traditional teaching practices. Web sites for the courses are an integral part to achieving these goals. The tight relationship between active research and the learning process will be emphasized throughout, steadily pursuing promising answers rather than final truths.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 9985045 Orti鱼翅（放线鳍纲）是现存鱼类中最大的一类，有23000多种。它们是所有脊椎动物中最成功的，也是理解脊椎动物进化辐射的关键组成部分。虽然缺乏一个很好地证实了所有主要类群之间关系的假说，但通过对活的和化石类群的形态特征进行分支分析，在系统发育合成方面取得了很大进展。相比之下，主要鱼群的分子系统学研究还没有跟上形态学研究的步伐。该项目涉及一项大规模的工作，为更高层次的系统学研究开发合适的分子标记，并为至少150个具有代表性的鱼类分类群编制候选核基因的DNA序列大数据集。同时，还提出了另一种策略，即对10个精心挑选的鱼类线粒体基因组进行测序，并与已公布的序列进行系统发育学比较，这些序列已经包括13个完整的鲨鱼和鳐鱼、肺鱼和其他放射虫的线粒体基因组。这两种方法所产生的数据将被用来研究主要鱼群之间的系统发育关系，并提高我们对鱼类辐射中主要进化转变的理解。现有的形态信息将与新的分子数据一起进行分析。该研究为今后鱼类系统发育研究提供了一个良好的参考框架。该项目的教育部分的目标是开发一个以脊椎动物学和分子系统学为重点的系统学综合课程，以加强进化生物学的本科生和研究生学习。一个新的为期五周的，关于生态学和进化分子技术的实践性实验室课程将被开发出来。提出利用已有的和创新的教学资源来提高学生在学习过程中的参与度。积极参与合作学习小组，探索和分析万维网资源，批判性评价小学文献资料，是对传统教学实践的补充。课程网站是实现这些目标不可或缺的一部分。积极的研究和学习过程之间的紧密关系将贯穿始终，稳步追求有希望的答案，而不是最终的真理。

Project.Title: Introducing Next Generation of STEM Students to Mesh Modeling for Simulation and Visualization

Title_Other.Title: 向下一代STEM学生介绍用于模拟和可视化的网格建模
Introducing Next Generation of STEM Students to Mesh Modeling for Simulation and Visualization

Project.Abstract: This award supports graduate and postdoctoral student participation from US universities, national labs, and non-profit research organizations to attend the 22nd International Meshing Roundtable (IMR) Conference be held in October 2013 in Orlando, FL. IMR created in 1992 is a unique conference for researchers in the field of mesh generation to exchange ideas and is also an excellent educational opportunity for students who are working on the meshing research and related applications. Potential topics for discussion in the conference include: mesh generation and modification, meshing for high-performance and distributed computing, CAD and computational geometry issues, and applications of meshing in computer graphics, finite-element analysis, computational fluid dynamics, biomedical engineering, processing of laser/CT/MRI scans, etc. Students have the opportunity to attend a short course in meshing where the lecturers are internationally known experts in mesh generation. The instructors address practical problems for the design and implementation of both unstructured and structured grid generation. The course is ideal for graduate students that just enter the field and for advance graduate and postdoctoral students that want to expand their current skills and knowledge. The workshop provides a forum to foster discussions mesh generation and will enable the identification of areas of common interest and potential collaboration among attendees from academia, National Laboratories, and industry. Priority will be given to students/postdocs presenting a paper or poster at the conference. The PI plans to diversify the accepted attendees' pool and attract underrepresented groups.

The workshop provides a forum to foster discussions mesh generation and will enable the identification of areas of common interest and potential collaboration among attendees from academia, National Laboratories, and industry. Priority will be given to students/postdocs presenting a paper or poster at the conference. The PI plans to diversify the accepted attendees' pool and attract underrepresented groups.

该奖项支持美国大学、国家实验室和非营利研究机构的研究生和博士后参加2013年10月在奥兰多举行的第22届国际啮合圆桌会议（IMR），创建于1992年的FL.IMR是一个独特的会议，供网格生成领域的研究人员交流想法，同时也是一个极好的教育机会，为从事网格研究和相关应用的学生。会议讨论的潜在主题包括：网格生成和修改、高性能和分布式计算的网格划分、CAD和计算几何问题、网格划分在计算机图形学、有限元分析、计算流体力学、生物医学工程中的应用，激光/CT/MRI扫描处理等。学生有机会参加一个简短的啮合课程，讲师是国际知名的网格生成专家。指导老师将讨论非结构化和结构化网格生成的设计和实现的实际问题。这门课程非常适合刚进入这一领域的研究生，也非常适合那些想扩展自己现有技能和知识的高级研究生和博士后。研讨会提供了一个论坛，以促进讨论网格生成，并将使来自学术界、国家实验室和工业界的与会者能够确定共同感兴趣的领域和潜在的合作。学生/博士后将优先在会议上提交论文或海报。PI计划使已被接受的与会者群体多样化，并吸引代表性不足的群体。

Source.Name: Directorate for Computer & Information Science & Engineering

Project.Title: Should Firms Enter the Product-Sharing Market?

Title_Other.Title: 企业是否应该进入产品共享市场？
Should Firms Enter the Product-Sharing Market?

Class.ClassName: 理论、技术、方法、研究、评价、策略

Project.Abstract: Abstract: Consumers often buy and own products that they do not fully use. Collaborative consumption has emerged as a major trend in recent years, as the wide adoption of mobile communication technologies has enabled consumers to easily share under-used products. Many websites, online communities, and social media platforms help consumers to share, within their local communities and sometimes even across states or countries, a wide range of products and services such as bicycles (Spinlister), boats (Boatbound, GetMyBoat), cars (RelayRides, Getaround), working or parking spaces (Citizen Space, JustPark), car rides (Lyft, Uber, Zimride), short-term rentals (Airbnb, Tujia), gardens (Shared Earth, Landshare), clothing, portable tools/appliances, electronics, and household items (FriendsWithThings, Neighborgoods). Anecdotal evidence suggests that some firms are proactively responding to this emerging trend. For example, General Motors (GM) has worked with RelayRides to make it easier for owners to rent out their under-used OnStar-enabled GM vehicles to offset the cost of ownership by introducing features such as the remote unlocking of doors by authorized renters using their smartphones (General Motors 2012). BMW has recently entered into the U.S. car-sharing market and shares/rents a certain number of cars to consumers directly through its newly launched car-sharing service called ReachNow (Loizos 2016). Several questions arise naturally from these trends: When should a firm enter the product-sharing market? If it enters, how should a firm allocate its limited products between its primary market and the product-sharing market? How should a firm optimally adjust sales price? Should a firm facilitate product sharing among consumers? How are a firm’s decisions (entry into the sharing market, pricing, and product allocation) and profit affected by consumer behavior and operational factors? To address these research questions, we will develop the following analytical framework. A firm with a limited number of products needs to allocate its products between its primary market and the sharing market, and to determine its selling price in the primary market. Consumers then decide whether or not to buy the product from the primary market. A consumer’s usage value for the product may vary over multiple periods. Therefore, in each usage period, product owners who have bought a product from the primary market decide whether to use the product themselves or to rent it out in the product-sharing market, and consumers who have not purchased the product decide whether to rent the product from the sharing market. Note that if the firm enters the product-sharing market, a consumer could rent a product from either the firm or a product owner. We will answer the research questions by solving the above multi-period multi-player game and performing sensitivity analyses with respect to various parameters. This research will help practitioners to enhance their understanding of how participation in the product-sharing market will affect a firm’s operational decisions and profitability. This research will also make a contribution to the emerging literature on collaborative consumption, as most extant studies focus on conceptually depicting the phenomenon rather than analyzing it. To the best of our knowledge, this will be the first study to analytically examine firms’ incentives to proactively participate in the product- sharing market.

摘要：消费者购买和拥有的产品往往不能充分利用。近年来，随着移动通信技术的广泛采用，使得消费者能够轻松地分享使用不足的产品，协作消费已成为一种主要趋势。许多网站、在线社区和社交媒体平台帮助消费者在当地社区内，有时甚至跨州或国家，分享各种产品和服务，如自行车（Spinlister）、船只（Boatbound、GetMyBoat）、汽车（RelayRides、Getaround），工作或停车位（公民空间、JustPark）、汽车游乐设施（Lyft、Uber、Zimride）、短期租赁（Airbnb、土家族）、花园（共享地球、土地共享）、服装、便携式工具/电器、电子产品和家居用品（友谊用品、社区用品）。坊间证据表明，一些公司正积极应对这一新兴趋势。例如，通用汽车（General Motors）与RelayRides合作，通过引入授权租车人使用智能手机遥控开锁车门等功能，使车主更容易出租使用不充分的OnStar功能的通用汽车汽车，以抵消车主的成本（General Motors 2012）。宝马最近进入了美国汽车共享市场，并通过其新推出的名为ReachNow的汽车共享服务（Loizos 2016）直接向消费者分享/租赁了一定数量的汽车。这些趋势自然而然地产生了几个问题：一个公司应该什么时候进入产品共享市场？如果进入，企业应该如何在其初级市场和产品共享市场之间分配其有限的产品？一个公司应该如何以最佳方式调整销售价格？公司是否应该促进消费者之间的产品共享？企业的决策（进入共享市场、定价和产品配置）和利润如何受到消费者行为和运营因素的影响？为了解决这些研究问题，我们将开发以下分析框架。产品数量有限的企业，需要在一级市场和共享市场之间进行产品配置，并确定其在一级市场的销售价格。然后消费者决定是否从一级市场购买产品。消费者对产品的使用价值可能在多个时期内发生变化。因此，在每个使用期内，从一级市场购买产品的产品所有者决定是自己使用产品还是在产品共享市场出租产品，没有购买产品的消费者决定是否从共享市场出租产品。请注意，如果公司进入产品共享市场，消费者可以从公司或产品所有者那里租赁产品。我们将通过求解上述多周期多人博弈，并对各种参数进行敏感性分析来回答研究问题。这项研究将有助于从业人员加深对参与产品共享市场将如何影响公司经营决策和盈利能力的理解。这项研究也将对新兴的协作消费文献做出贡献，因为大多数现存的研究都集中在概念上描述这种现象，而不是分析它。据我们所知，这将是第一个分析企业积极参与产品分享市场的动机的研究。

Project.Title: Inflatable, Rigidized Collectors and Related Components for Solar Thermal Propulsion

Title_Other.Title: Inflatable, Rigidized Collectors and Related Components for Solar Thermal Propulsion
太阳能热推进用充气、刚性集热器及相关部件

Class.ClassName: 太阳能收集、太阳能贮存

Project.Abstract: Solar Thermal Propulsion (STP) and Integrated Solar Upper Stage (ISUS) concepts are being evaluated which may have significant technical and economical benefits for transporting payloads to higher energy orbits. The performance and economy of solar thermal propulsion in this application are dependent upon deployable solar collectors of low weight and high accuracy. Collectors in which the optical shape is maintained via pressurization is a primary candidate; however, this approach involves risks from meteoroid or debris damage. A candidate approach to reduce this risk, involving foam-rigidizing the reflector surface after deployment, has been proposed by SRS Technologies and Thiokol Corporation. Inflatable concentrators have a long history of interest for use as large space structures due to the high packaging efficiency and simple deployment. However, gas inflated structures deployed on long term missions require make-up gas due to the inherent permeability and leakage caused by punctures from small particle impacts. This proposed effort will exploit recent successes in constructing inflatable concentrators and foam rigidizing efforts. The proposed work consists of foam shrinkage minimization and in-vacuum inflatable concentrator deployment and foam rigidization. Optical testing in vacuum will be performed to characterize the shape of the concentrator after inflation and rigidization.| Benefits: A higher performance and lower cost means for delivering payloads will be of benefit for both government and commercial payload launches. The film fabrication technologies are being applied in the commercial market of transparent aircraft canopies, composite molds, and commercial film manufacturing.|

太阳能热推进（STP）和集成太阳能上层（ISUS）概念正在评估中，这可能对将有效载荷传输到更高能量轨道具有重大的技术和经济效益。在这种应用中，太阳能热推进的性能和经济性取决于低重量和高精度的可展开式太阳能集热器。通过加压保持光学形状的收集器是主要的候选；然而，这种方法涉及流星体或碎片损坏的风险。SRS技术公司和Thiokol公司提出了一种降低这种风险的备选方法，包括在展开后对反射器表面进行泡沫硬化。充气浓缩器由于其包装效率高、展开简单等优点，在大型空间结构中有着悠久的应用历史。然而，在长期任务中部署的充气结构需要补充气体，这是由于小颗粒撞击穿孔造成的固有渗透性和泄漏。这项提议的努力将利用最近在建造充气浓缩器和泡沫硬化努力方面取得的成功。提出的工作包括泡沫收缩最小化、真空充气浓缩器展开和泡沫刚性化。在真空中进行光学测试，以表征充气和刚性化后浓缩器的形状。好处：提供有效载荷的更高性能和更低成本的方法将有利于政府和商业有效载荷的发射。薄膜制造技术正在透明飞机顶盖、复合材料模具和商业薄膜制造的商业市场上得到应用|

Project.Title: Språkvask av: The Controversy over the Lord's Supper in Danzig 1561-1567. Presence and Practice - Theology and Confessional Policy

Title_Other.Title: Språkvask av: The Controversy over the Lord's Supper in Danzig 1561-1567. Presence and Practice - Theology and Confessional Policy
斯普尔克瓦克瓦克：关于丹泽主晚餐的争论1561-1567。存在与实践-神学与忏悔政策

Project.Abstract:
The project sheds light on the important Lutheran communion controversy in Danzig (Gdansk) 1561-1567. Different understandings of Jesus' body presence (real presence) gave different norms for ritual practices. The one party thought that the priest pronounce the words of Jesus blessed the bread (consecration) and produced realpresensen, while others thought that this was to believe in magic, and that the presence came through performing the words prescribed. Especially strong was reacted against the other party's defense of the worship of the body of Jesus in the bread. The dispute concerned the saints compared to the material. The different views on the spoken word of God function and power was connected with the vision of the priesthood and its authority in relation to worldly power.
To receive the Eucharist meant to be reconciled with God and Christianity through eating the body of Christ. Night world historic significance in medieval and reformasjonstid can hardly be overestimated. This foremost symbol of sacred presence and the church / community unit played an important role in the Reformation struggles that contributed greatly to parallel denominations and territorialstater. Supper was an important marker of confessional affiliation and appraisal outwardly. It marked the confessional identity and implicated thus political sympathies. As unit symbol was Sacrament saturated with social and political meaning.
The basis for communion controversy lay theological tensions, but this project shows how it was embedded in the broader contexts of culture and society. For example, the City Government intervention gave the city a moderate profile that can be seen as an appropriate strategy for the city's economic, political, social, cultural and ecclesial context. The present work shows aspects of the Lutheran konfesjonskultur seldom accented outside in pure dogma historical representations. This book puts Communion struggles into other contexts than they have previously been inserted into both the involvement of the cultic context as well as the broader social.

Abstract_Other.Abstract:
Prosjektet kaster lys over den viktige lutherske nattverdsstriden i Danzig (Gdansk) 1561-1567. Ulike forståelser av Jesu legemes nærvær (realpresens) gav ulike normer for rituell praksis. Den ene parten mente at prestens uttale av Jesu ord velsignet brødet (konsekrasjon) og frembrakte realpresensen, mens den andre mente at dette var å tro på magi, og at nærværet kom gjennom å utføre det ordene foreskrev. Særlig sterkt ble det reagert mot den andre partens forsvar for tilbedelsen av Jesu legeme i brødet. Striden dreide seg om det helliges forhold til det materielle. De ulike syn på det muntlige gudsordets funksjon og kraft hang sammen med synet på prestetjenesten og dens myndighet i forhold til verdslig makt.
Å motta nattverden innebar å forenes med Gud og kristenheten gjennom å spise Kristi legeme. Nattverdens historiske betydning i middelalder og reformasjonstid kan vanskelig overvurderes. Dette fremste symbolet på hellig nærvær og kirkens/samfunnets enhet spilte en viktig rolle i de etterreformatoriske stridene som bidro sterkt til parallelle konfesjoner og territorialstater. Nattverden ble en viktig markør for konfesjonell tilhørighet og avgrensning utad. Den markerte konfesjonell identitet og impliserte dermed politiske sympatier. Som enhetssymbol var sakramentet mettet med sosial og politisk mening.
Til grunn for nattverdsstriden lå teologiske spenninger, men dette prosjektet viser hvordan den var innbakt i bredere sammenhenger i kultur og samfunn. For eksempel Byrådets inngripen gav byen en moderat profil som kan sees som en passende strategi med tanke på byens økonomiske, politiske, sosiale, kulturelle og kirkelige kontekst. Foreliggende arbeid viser sider ved den lutherske konfesjonskultur som sjelden blir betont utenom i rene dogmehistoriske fremstillinger. Denne boken setter nattverdsstridene inn i andre kontekster enn det som de tidligere har vært satt inn i, både ved å trekke inn den kultiske sammenheng såvel som den videre samfunnsmessige.

该项目揭示了在丹泽（格但斯克）1561-1567年路德教会的重要争论。对耶稣身体存在（真实存在）的不同理解为仪式实践提供了不同的规范。一方认为牧师念出耶稣的话祝福了面包（奉献）并产生了真实的存在，而另一方则认为这是相信魔法，而存在是通过执行规定的话来实现的。特别强烈的反应是反对另一方为在面包中敬拜耶稣的身体辩护。与物质相比，这场争论涉及圣徒。关于神的功能和能力的口头话语的不同观点，与祭司的远见及其与世俗权力的关系有关的权威有关。 接受圣餐意味着通过吃基督的身体来与上帝和基督教和解。中世纪和改革中的夜世界的历史意义是不可高估的。这一神圣存在和教会/社区单位的最重要象征，在宗教改革斗争中发挥了重要作用，为平行教派和领土国家作出了巨大贡献。晚餐是一个重要的标志，忏悔的从属关系和评价外部。它标志着忏悔的身份，从而牵连到政治同情。作为单位符号的圣礼浸透了社会和政治的意义。 交流争论的基础在于神学上的紧张关系，但这个项目显示了它是如何嵌入到更广泛的文化和社会背景中的。例如，市政府的干预给了该市一个温和的形象，可以被视为该市经济、政治、社会、文化和宗教背景下的适当战略。本书展示了路德教会的康费松文化，在纯教条的历史表现中很少强调外在。这本书把交融的斗争放到了其他的语境中，而不是他们以前被插入到宗教和更广泛的社会语境中。

Project.Title: Music in movement: new artistic strategies for merging musical composition and choreography.

Title_Other.Title: Music in movement: new artistic strategies for merging musical composition and choreography.
运动中的音乐：融合音乐创作和舞蹈编排的新艺术策略。

Class.ClassName: 19 Studies in Creative Arts and Writing

Project.Abstract: The point of departure for the present artistic research project is an expanded notion of musical gesture and the concept of merging the practices of choreographer and composer in the production of musical works that are concieved not merely as sonic entities but as compound units of sound and visual gesture. The project attempts to develop artistic strategies that allow musical composition and choreography to amalgamate and give rise to novel modes of expression.Building on a multimodal conception of human perception (Berthoz, 2000) recent research on musical gesture finds gestural images to be integral to the perception of music. In musical performance, these visual gesture-types and the sounding result of the actions create compound units that Godøy calls gestural-sonorous objects (Godøy, 2006). However, the theory and terminology for these new approaches to musical gesture is still in progress. The analytical approach is characterised by hybrid methods and collaborative analysis. There are several different topics that will be addressed in this analysis of the qualitative and quantitative data: 1) the development of a more refined theory of gestural-sonorous objects 2) the experimental practice of collaborative work 3) the development of strategies for merging choreography and musical composition. The final results of the research project will be a dvd-production of the performances and a book.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 当前艺术研究项目的出发点是一个扩展的音乐手势概念，以及将编舞和作曲家的实践融合到音乐作品中的概念，这些音乐作品不仅作为声音实体，而且作为声音和视觉手势的复合单位。该项目试图发展艺术策略，使音乐创作和舞蹈结合起来，并产生新的表达方式。建立在人类感知的多模态概念（Berthoz，2000）的基础上，最近对音乐手势的研究发现，手势图像是音乐感知的一个组成部分。在音乐表演中，这些视觉手势类型和动作的发声结果创造了复合单位，上帝称之为手势响亮的物体（上帝，2006）。然而，这些新的音乐手势方法的理论和术语仍在研究中。分析方法的特点是混合方法和协作分析。在对定性和定量数据的分析中，将涉及几个不同的主题：1）发展一个更精细的手势响亮物体理论2）合作工作的实验实践3）发展舞蹈和音乐创作的融合策略。该研究项目的最终成果将是一个dvd制作的表演和一本书。

The point of departure for the present artistic research project is an expanded notion of musical gesture and the concept of merging the practices of choreographer and composer in the production of musical works that are concieved not merely as sonic entities but as compound units of sound and visual gesture. The project attempts to develop artistic strategies that allow musical composition and choreography to amalgamate and give rise to novel modes of expression.Building on a multimodal conception of human perception (Berthoz, 2000) recent research on musical gesture finds gestural images to be integral to the perception of music. In musical performance, these visual gesture-types and the sounding result of the actions create compound units that Godøy calls gestural-sonorous objects (Godøy, 2006). However, the theory and terminology for these new approaches to musical gesture is still in progress. The analytical approach is characterised by hybrid methods and collaborative analysis. There are several different topics that will be addressed in this analysis of the qualitative and quantitative data: 1) the development of a more refined theory of gestural-sonorous objects 2) the experimental practice of collaborative work 3) the development of strategies for merging choreography and musical composition. The final results of the research project will be a dvd-production of the performances and a book.

Project.Title: Collaborative Research: Learning to Read a Second Language: Neural Basis and Individual Variations

Title_Other.Title: Collaborative Research: Learning to Read a Second Language: Neural Basis and Individual Variations
合作研究：学习第二语言：神经基础和个体差异

Project.Abstract: Learning to read one or more foreign languages is essential for social and economic success in this era of globalization. Decades of research have provided much insight into the cognitive and neural mechanisms of reading, especially native-language reading. Less is known, however, about how the brain associates the words we see with their pronunciations when we learn a new language. With support from the National Science Foundation, Dr. Chuansheng Chen (University of California, Irvine) and Dr. Zhong-Lin Lu (University of Southern California), will probe this issue through an innovative design with an artificial language based on written Korean. This collaboration, which also includes researchers at Beijing Normal University, will use functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) to map the neural networks of two types of reading: "sounding it out" (known as "assembled phonology") or memorizing the pronunciation of the whole word without sounding out syllable by syllable (known as "addressed phonology"). First, the (most likely distinct) neural networks for the two types of reading will be identified. Second, how these neural networks differ across people speaking different native languages (e.g., alphabetical English vs. logographic Chinese) will be studied. Third, behavioral, neuroanatomical, and neurofunctional measures will be used to predict individual differences in learning to read a new language. This project will provide solid empirical evidence for the fundamental neural bases of learning to read in a second language. Results from this study will greatly advance our understanding of the neural basis of reading, with major implications for developing more efficient second language learning programs and reading difficulty interventions. The proposed study will also provide many training opportunities for both US and Chinese graduate students and junior researchers to gain experience in international collaboration.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 在这个全球化时代，学习一种或多种外语对社会和经济的成功至关重要。几十年的研究为阅读，特别是母语阅读的认知和神经机制提供了很多的见解。然而，当我们学习一门新的语言时，大脑如何将我们看到的单词与它们的发音联系起来还不太清楚。在国家科学基金会的支持下，陈传生博士（加州大学欧文分校）和陆钟林博士（南加州大学）将通过一种基于韩语书写的人工语言的创新设计来探讨这个问题。这次合作还包括北京师范大学的研究人员，将使用功能磁共振成像（fMRI）来绘制两种类型阅读的神经网络图：“读出”（称为“组合音位学”）或在不逐字读出的情况下记住整个单词的发音（称为“寻址音位学”）。首先，将识别用于两种类型阅读的（最可能不同的）神经网络。其次，我们将研究这些神经网络在说不同母语的人之间的差异（例如，按字母顺序排列的英语和按符号排列的汉语）。第三，行为学、神经解剖学和神经功能测量将被用来预测学习一门新语言的个体差异。这个项目将为学习第二语言阅读的基本神经基础提供坚实的经验证据。这项研究的结果将大大提高我们对阅读的神经基础的理解，对开发更有效的第二语言学习程序和阅读困难干预措施具有重要意义。这项研究还将为中美研究生和初级研究人员提供许多培训机会，以获得国际合作的经验。

Learning to read one or more foreign languages is essential for social and economic success in this era of globalization. Decades of research have provided much insight into the cognitive and neural mechanisms of reading, especially native-language reading. Less is known, however, about how the brain associates the words we see with their pronunciations when we learn a new language. With support from the National Science Foundation, Dr. Chuansheng Chen (University of California, Irvine) and Dr. Zhong-Lin Lu (University of Southern California), will probe this issue through an innovative design with an artificial language based on written Korean. This collaboration, which also includes researchers at Beijing Normal University, will use functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) to map the neural networks of two types of reading: "sounding it out" (known as "assembled phonology") or memorizing the pronunciation of the whole word without sounding out syllable by syllable (known as "addressed phonology"). First, the (most likely distinct) neural networks for the two types of reading will be identified. Second, how these neural networks differ across people speaking different native languages (e.g., alphabetical English vs. logographic Chinese) will be studied. Third, behavioral, neuroanatomical, and neurofunctional measures will be used to predict individual differences in learning to read a new language. This project will provide solid empirical evidence for the fundamental neural bases of learning to read in a second language. Results from this study will greatly advance our understanding of the neural basis of reading, with major implications for developing more efficient second language learning programs and reading difficulty interventions. The proposed study will also provide many training opportunities for both US and Chinese graduate students and junior researchers to gain experience in international collaboration.

Source.Name: Directorate for Social, Behavioral & Economic Sciences

Project.Title: Antivirals for Hepatitis C Targeting Phosphoinositide Metabolism

Title_Other.Title: 抗丙型肝炎病毒药物靶向磷脂酰肌醇代谢
Antivirals for Hepatitis C Targeting Phosphoinositide Metabolism

Class.ClassName: 理论、技术、方法、研究、评价、策略

Project.Abstract: DESCRIPTION (provided by applicant): Dr. Gelman, an MD/PhD with prior training in organic chemistry and infectious diseases, whose immediate career goal is advanced training in molecular virology and related disciplines and whose long-term career goal is a position in academic medicine, proposes to study the hepatitis C virus using a novel class of small molecules, the PI4K inhibitors. The proposed work will take place at Stanford University, in Dr. Jeffrey Glenn's laboratory, with co-mentor Dr. Kevan Shokat (UCSF Cellular and Molecular Pharmacology) and consultants Dr. Gary Peltz (Anesthesia; expertise in pharmacokinetics and drug metabolism) and Dr. Michael Lin (Pediatrics/Bioengineering; expertise in imaging biological molecules in living cells). Stanford has a vibrant Infectious Diseases division and extensive career support for postdoctoral fellows as they prepare to make the transition to faculty positions. The hepatitis C virus (HCV) infects between 2-3% of the global population, or roughly 170 million people. Chronic HCV infection carries a 25% risk of cirrhosis and a smaller but significant risk of life-threatening hepatocellular cancer. Cirrhosis due to HCV is the leading indication for liver transplant in the US, but HCV invariably recurs in the transplanted organ. The current standard of care for HCV treatment is a 12-48 week (depending on genotype and response) course of peginterferon-ribavirin, which is costly, has multiple serious side effects, and is only 50-80% effective. Although multiple new classes of anti-HCV therapies are in various stages of development, multidrug combination therapy is likely to be necessary for effective control of the infection. The HCV nonstructural protein NS5A interacts specifically with membrane phosphoinositide PI(4,5)P2, or PIP2. Both this interaction and the phosphoinositide 4-kinase (PI4K) activity that generates PIP2 appear to be necessary for viral replication. The proposed research involves characterization of the potential of compounds designed to inhibit PI4K as (1) a novel class of antivirals for HCV with a mechanism unrelated to known antiviral drugs and (2) a chemical tool to investigate the HCV life cycle, and particularly the dynamics of the HCV replicase complex, using fluorescent protein tags to visualize replicase complexes in living cells. Inhibition of PI4K, which is a host enzyme, may be associated with higher barriers to development of resistance than is inhibition of viral enzymes. The hepatitis C virus (HCV), which causes liver cancer, liver failure, and thousands of deaths per year, depends on an enzyme called PI4K in the cells it infects. We will investigate a class of chemical compounds that can block PI4K to determine whether they could lead to a new class of drugs against HCV. We will also use these compounds to investigate how HCV makes copies of itself and how this process depends on the activity of PI4K.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 描述（由申请人提供）：Gelman博士，医学博士/博士，曾接受过有机化学和传染病方面的培训，其直接职业目标是分子病毒学和相关学科的高级培训，其长期职业目标是在学术医学方面的职位，提出用一类新的小分子PI4K抑制剂来研究丙型肝炎病毒。拟议的工作将在斯坦福大学杰弗里·格伦博士的实验室进行，合作导师是凯万·肖卡特博士（加州大学旧金山分校细胞和分子药理学）和顾问是加里·佩尔茨博士（麻醉；药代动力学和药物代谢方面的专业知识）和迈克尔·林博士（儿科/生物工程）；在活体细胞中成像生物分子的专业知识）。斯坦福大学有一个充满活力的传染病部门，博士后研究员在准备向教师职位过渡时得到广泛的职业支持。丙型肝炎病毒（HCV）感染全球2-3%的人口，约1.7亿人。慢性丙型肝炎病毒感染有25%的肝硬化风险和较小但严重威胁生命的肝细胞癌风险。在美国，HCV引起的肝硬化是肝移植的主要指征，但HCV总是在移植器官中复发。目前HCV治疗的护理标准是12-48周（取决于基因型和应答）的聚乙二醇干扰素利巴韦林疗程，费用昂贵，有多种严重副作用，有效率只有50-80%。尽管多种新的抗-HCV治疗方法正处于不同的发展阶段，但多药联合治疗可能是有效控制感染的必要手段。HCV非结构蛋白NS5A与膜磷脂酰肌醇PI（4,5）P2或PIP2特异性相互作用。这种相互作用和产生PIP2的磷酸肌醇4激酶（PI4K）活性似乎都是病毒复制所必需的。拟议的研究涉及到对设计用于抑制PI4K的化合物的潜力的表征，如（1）一类新的丙型肝炎病毒抗病毒药物，其机制与已知的抗病毒药物无关，以及（2）一种研究丙型肝炎病毒生命周期的化学工具，特别是丙型肝炎病毒复制酶复合物的动力学，用荧光蛋白标记法观察活细胞中的复制酶复合物。抑制宿主酶PI4K，可能比抑制病毒酶更能阻碍抗性的发展。丙型肝炎病毒（HCV）每年会导致肝癌、肝衰竭和数千人死亡，它依赖于感染细胞中一种叫做PI4K的酶。我们将研究一类能阻断PI4K的化合物，以确定它们是否能导致一类新的抗HCV药物。我们还将利用这些化合物来研究丙型肝炎病毒如何复制自身，以及这一过程如何依赖于PI4K的活性。

Project.Title: Pneumococcal infection in children and adults: from Mendelian defects of immunity to population genetic studies

Title_Other.Title: Infección neumocócica en niños y en adultos: de los defectos mendelianos de la inmunidad a los estudios genéticos poblacionales
儿童和成人肺炎球菌感染：从孟德尔免疫缺陷到群体遗传学研究

Class.ClassName: 控制论（数学）、信息论（数学）

Project.Abstract: OBJECTIVES: To study the variants of the complement proteins C2, C3, C4A, C4B, C5, CFB, CFH, MBL2 and MASP-2 in pediatric patients with invasive pneumococcal disease (IPD) and in adults with acquired pneumococcal pneumonia. the community (NNAC). To compare the frequencies of alleles, genotypes, and haplotypes of these genes in patients with NNAC and in patients with ENI with their respective healthy controls. Establish their role in the susceptibility and severity of the NNAC and in the susceptibility of the ENI. To study the incidence of primary immunodeficiencies (PID) in children with IPD. Conduct exome sequencing studies in pediatric patients with ENI to identify new forms of PID. DESIGN. Case / control (susceptibility to adult NNAC and pediatric ENI). Prospective study of adult patients with NNAC (prognosis and severity). SCOPE OF STUDY: Eleven hospitals of eight Spanish CCAA. Replication sample of ENI of France. SUBJECTS OF STUDY: At least 350-400 adult patients (> 18 years old) with NAC and at least 700-800 adult controls. At least 400-500 children (

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 目的：研究儿童侵袭性肺炎球菌病（ipd）和成人获得性肺炎球菌肺炎补体蛋白c2、c3、c4a、c4b、c5、cfb、cfh、mbl2和masp-2的变异。社区（NNAC）。比较这些基因在nnac患者和eni患者及其健康对照组中的等位基因、基因型和单倍型频率。确定它们在nnac的易感性和严重性以及eni易感性中的作用。探讨ipd儿童原发性免疫缺陷（pid）的发生率。对eni患儿进行外显子组测序研究，以确定新形式的pid。设计。病例/对照（成人nnac和儿童eni的易感性）。成年nnac患者的前瞻性研究（预后和严重程度）。研究范围：西班牙ccaa八所医院中的十一所。法国埃尼集团复制品。研究对象：至少350-400名患有NAC的成人患者（18岁以上）和至少700-800名成人对照。至少400-500名儿童（

OBJETIVOS: Estudiar las variantes de los genes de las proteínas de complemento C2, C3, C4A, C4B, C5, CFB, CFH, MBL2 y MASP-2 en pacientes pediátricos con enfermedad neumocócica invasiva (ENI) y en adultos con neumonía neumocócica adquirida en la comunidad (NNAC). Comparar las frecuencias de alelos, genotipos, y haplotipos de estos genes en pacientes con NNAC y en pacientes con ENI con sus respectivos controles sanos. Establecer su papel en la susceptibilidad y gravedad de la NNAC y en la susceptibilidad de la ENI. Estudiar la incidencia de inmunodeficiencias primarias (IDP) en niños con ENI. Realizar estudios de secuenciación del exoma a pacientes pediátricos con ENI para identificación de nuevas formas de IDP. DISEÑO. Caso/control (susceptibilidad a NNAC adultos y ENI pediátrica). Estudio prospectivo de pacientes adultos con NNAC (pronóstico y gravedad). ÁMBITO DE ESTUDIO: Once hospitales de ocho CCAA españolas. Muestra de replicación de ENI de Francia. Organization.Name: Hospital Universitario de Gran Canaria Doctor Negrín

Project.Title: EAGER: SaTC: Early-Stage Interdisciplinary Collaboration: Fair and Accurate Information Quality Assessment Algorithm

Title_Other.Title: EAGER:SaTC：早期跨学科协作：公平准确的信息质量评估算法
EAGER: SaTC: Early-Stage Interdisciplinary Collaboration: Fair and Accurate Information Quality Assessment Algorithm

Project.Abstract: Prevalence of poor-quality information in cyberspaces poses threats to civic society. To increase information quality, multiple automated algorithms for undertaking quality assessment of online information have been proposed. However, the fairness and performance of these algorithms across political and policy opinions has been challenged, undermining trust in such systems. Through a unique early-stage interdisciplinary collaboration that brings together experts from the fields of information science, computer science, communication, political science, and journalism, this project will develop accurate and fair information quality assessment algorithms, while also gleaning deeper insight into the nature of information being utilized across the ideological spectrum. The proposed research advances the science of information and will offer insights to organizations that aim to undertake automated information quality assessment, ultimately allowing for the creation of safer and trustworthy cyberspaces. The proposed project will include: (1) the creation of a large article dataset that has been robustly labeled for both quality and political ideological alignment, (2) an audit of multiple existing information quality assessment algorithms to assess their accuracy and fairness, (3) a systematic post-hoc inductive analysis of the content mislabeled by these algorithms, and (4) modification of existing algorithms to support fairer and more accurate information quality assessment. These four phases will build upon each other, leveraging the contributions of each discipline and will provide a new interdisciplinary model for SaTC-related research. This project will provide interdisciplinary training to graduate students, mentoring them in diverse methods and laying the groundwork for long-term interdisciplinary research. This project also will help broaden participation in data science professions. This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 网络空间中劣质信息的盛行对公民社会构成了威胁。为了提高信息质量，提出了多种在线信息质量评估的自动化算法。然而，这些算法在政治和政策意见中的公平性和性能受到了挑战，削弱了人们对此类系统的信任。通过一个独特的早期跨学科合作，汇集了信息科学、计算机科学、通信、政治科学和新闻领域的专家，该项目将开发准确和公平的信息质量评估算法，同时也能更深入地洞察信息在意识形态范围内被利用的本质。拟议的研究推进了信息科学，并将为旨在进行自动化信息质量评估的组织提供见解，最终允许创建更安全和可信的网络空间。拟议的项目将包括：（1）创建一个大的文章数据集，该数据集已被牢固地标记为质量和政治思想一致性，（2）对现有的多种信息质量评估算法进行审计，以评估其准确性和公平性，（3）对错误标记的内容进行系统的事后归纳分析通过这些算法，以及（4）对现有算法的改进，支持更公平、更准确的信息质量评估。这四个阶段将相互促进，利用各学科的贡献，为卫星通信相关研究提供一个新的跨学科模式。该项目将为研究生提供跨学科培训，以多种方式指导他们，并为长期跨学科研究奠定基础。该项目还将有助于扩大数据科学专业的参与。该奖项反映了NSF的法定使命，通过使用基金会的知识价值和更广泛的影响审查标准进行评估，被认为值得支持。

Prevalence of poor-quality information in cyberspaces poses threats to civic society. To increase information quality, multiple automated algorithms for undertaking quality assessment of online information have been proposed. However, the fairness and performance of these algorithms across political and policy opinions has been challenged, undermining trust in such systems. Through a unique early-stage interdisciplinary collaboration that brings together experts from the fields of information science, computer science, communication, political science, and journalism, this project will develop accurate and fair information quality assessment algorithms, while also gleaning deeper insight into the nature of information being utilized across the ideological spectrum. The proposed research advances the science of information and will offer insights to organizations that aim to undertake automated information quality assessment, ultimately allowing for the creation of safer and trustworthy cyberspaces. The proposed project will include: (1) the creation of a large article dataset that has been robustly labeled for both quality and political ideological alignment, (2) an audit of multiple existing information quality assessment algorithms to assess their accuracy and fairness, (3) a systematic post-hoc inductive analysis of the content mislabeled by these algorithms, and (4) modification of existing algorithms to support fairer and more accurate information quality assessment. These four phases will build upon each other, leveraging the contributions of each discipline and will provide a new interdisciplinary model for SaTC-related research. This project will provide interdisciplinary training to graduate students, mentoring them in diverse methods and laying the groundwork for long-term interdisciplinary research. This project also will help broaden participation in data science professions. This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

Organization.Name: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey
Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey
Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey

Source.Name: Directorate for Social, Behavioral & Economic Sciences

Project.Title: GOBASE: The organelle genome database project

Title_Other.Title: GOBASE: The organelle genome database project
GOBASE：细胞器基因组数据库项目

Project.Abstract: The amount of biological information available today through computer networks and databases is overwhelming. Yet these data remain largely unexploited, due in large part to their unorganized state. To remedy this situation in a specific instance, we have created a comparative genome database (GOBASE) that integrates data related to organelles (mitochondria and chloroplasts) from all eukaryotes. At present, this publicly accessible database (http://megasun.bch.umontreal.ca/gobase/) includes nucleotide and protein sequences, genetic maps, RNA secondary structures and biochemical and organismal information. In the next term, we intend to include in GOBASE genome data from bacteria that are closest related to the endosymbionts from which organelles derive. GOBASE is more than simply a data repository. It offers complex but easy-to-use query capabilities, and data in GOBASE have been validated, corrected and completed, and nomenclature has been standardized. A recently implemented suite of bioinformatics software tools ('workbench') now allows scientists to launch applications on data compiled within GOBASE. With its taxonomically broad scope and the new analytical features, GOBASE has become a powerful resource for comparative organelle gene and genome studies. All together, the GOBASE project provides a unique and reliable service to the scientific community, and, at the same time, offers challenging research and training opportunites.

With its taxonomically broad scope and the new analytical features, GOBASE has become a powerful resource for comparative organelle gene and genome studies. All together, the GOBASE project provides a unique and reliable service to the scientific community, and, at the same time, offers challenging research and training opportunites.

如今，通过计算机网络和数据库获得的生物信息数量之大令人望而却步。然而，这些数据在很大程度上仍然未被开发，这在很大程度上是由于它们的无组织状态。为了在特定情况下纠正这种情况，我们创建了一个比较基因组数据库（GOBASE），它集成了所有真核生物细胞器（线粒体和叶绿体）的相关数据。目前，这个可公开访问的数据库（http://megasun.bch.umontreal.ca/gobase/）包括核苷酸和蛋白质序列、遗传图谱、RNA二级结构以及生化和组织信息。在下一学期中，我们打算将来自与细胞器来源的内共生体关系最密切的细菌的GOBASE基因组数据包括在内。GOBASE不仅仅是一个数据存储库。它提供了复杂但易于使用的查询功能，GOBASE中的数据已经过验证、更正和完成，并且命名已经标准化。最近实现的一套生物信息学软件工具（workbench）现在允许科学家在GOBASE中编译的数据上启动应用程序。GOBASE以其广泛的分类范围和新的分析特性成为比较细胞器基因和基因组研究的有力资源。总而言之，GOBASE项目为科学界提供了独特而可靠的服务，同时也提供了具有挑战性的研究和培训机会。

Project.Title: NICOP - Understanding Current State and Future Trends in Global S&T Cooperation: Opportunities for cooperation in an evolving China STI system

Title_Other.Title: 了解全球科技合作的现状和未来趋势：中国科技创新体系发展中的合作机遇
NICOP - Understanding Current State and Future Trends in Global S&T Cooperation: Opportunities for cooperation in an evolving China STI system

Class.ClassName: 控制论（数学）、信息论（数学）
理论、技术、方法、研究、评价、策略

Project.Abstract: The proposed research project is innovative through its focus on developing an understanding of the nature, dynamics, priorities, and trends in science, technology and innovation (STI) cooperation China has with the European Union (EU) and the United States (US). China is becoming a significant player within the STI global community. The country’s STI system continues to evolve to meet China’s S&T needs and to place China at the global frontier. In 2016, China demonstrated its intention to invest in research facilities, especially in large modern facilities that are necessary for big science and fundamental new discoveries. Through analyzing the evolving China STI system and provincial/municipal priorities in the scope of fostering greater STI cooperation between EU-China and US-China, the ONR Global and US DoD in general will be better positioned to apply the findings to their benefit in building on established cooperation and creating more effective cooperation with the EU and China. This proactive research approach is important for the development of a better resourced and best-value international engagement strategy. The results of a research exercise will feed into a Forum that is a multi-level event, which will complement the high level strategic views of decision and policy-makers with the specific feedback and practical experience of researchers and private sector stakeholders developing collaborative work in specific STI areas that have been considered of strategic interest to the ONR Global. The main tangible outputs of the project will include a Preliminary Report (input to Forum), Forum Proceedings that will be shared with all stakeholders deemed relevant by the ONR Global, and a Project Report.

拟议的研究项目是创新性的，其重点是发展对 科学、技术和创新的性质、动态、优先事项和趋势 中国与欧盟和美国的合作。中国是 成为STI全球社区的重要参与者。国家的性传播感染系统 继续发展以满足中国的科技需求并将中国置于全球前沿。在 2016年，中国表示有意投资研究设施，尤其是大型研究设施 大型科学和基本新发现所必需的现代设施。 通过分析我国科技创新体系的演变和省、市科技创新工作的重点 加强欧中、美中、ONR全球科技创新合作的范围 而美国国防部将更好地将这些发现应用到建筑业中 与欧盟和中国建立合作关系，建立更有效的合作关系。 这种积极主动的研究方法对于开发更好的资源和 最佳价值国际参与战略。一项研究工作的结果将为 一个多层次的论坛，它将补充 具有特定反馈和研究人员实践经验的决策者和决策者 以及私营部门利益相关者在特定的性传播感染领域开展合作 已被视为ONR Global的战略利益。主要有形产出 该项目将包括一份初步报告（对论坛的投入），论坛程序将 与ONR Global认为相关的所有利益相关者共享，并提供项目报告。

Project.Title: Dysregulated Signaling in Crohn's Disease

Title_Other.Title: Dysregulated Signaling in Crohn's Disease
克罗恩病的信号调节失调

Project.Abstract:
PUBLIC ABSTRACT
Our overarching goal is to understand how dysregulated protein signaling pathways contribute to Crohn's disease (CD). Because signaling pathways are readily targetable with small molecule or antibody-based therapies, understanding CD-related protein signaling will undoubtedly lead to the identification of new treatment strategies.
CD is a chronic and debilitating inflammatory disorder of the small and large intestine. Few effective therapies are available to the 700,000 CD patients living in the United States. The genetics of CD are extremely complex, and environment plays a significant role in promoting the disease, making it difficult to identify the underlying molecular drivers of CD. In particular, the role that protein signal transduction cascades play in CD is not well understood. Our working hypothesis is that genetically and environmentally diverse individuals can present with common symptoms of CD because they share a common dysregulated protein signaling state in their gastrointestinal tracts. By extension, we postulate that new therapeutic strategies will emerge from a better understanding of CD-related protein signaling. Therefore, the objectives of our study are to (1) identify the signaling pathways that are dysregulated in CD and (2) determine which of these dysregulated pathways are pathogenic.
Our approach integrates mouse modeling, proteomics, and computational analysis to identify signaling pathways that drive the onset and progression of intestinal inflammation in mouse models. To begin, we expand upon exciting preliminary data that implicate MIP-1alpha and MIP-1beta, two related chemokines involved in neutrophilic inflammation, as drivers of CD. Next, we will identify signaling pathways that are dysregulated in several different mouse models of CD, with the goal of identifying pathogenic signaling pathways relevant to humans with genetically diverse forms of CD. The cross-species comparison will allow us to broadly identify conserved drivers of GI inflammation and, in the process, reveal the animal models that will be the most effective for preclinical therapeutic studies for CD. Finally, we will apply emerging methods in quantitative mass spectroscopy to analyze protein signaling in inflamed intestine at an unprecedented level. In the end, we hope that insights into the dysregulated signaling network will reveal therapeutic targets that are not easily gleaned from genetic analysis of CD patients.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 公共摘要 我们的首要目标是了解失调的蛋白质信号通路是如何导致克罗恩病（CD）的。由于信号通路很容易被小分子或抗体治疗所靶向，理解CD相关蛋白信号无疑将导致新的治疗策略的确定。 CD是一种慢性的、使人虚弱的小肠和大肠炎症性疾病。对生活在美国的70万CD患者几乎没有有效的治疗方法。CD的遗传极其复杂，环境对CD的发病起着重要的促进作用，使得CD的潜在分子驱动因素难以确定。尤其是蛋白质信号转导级联在CD中的作用还不清楚。我们的工作假设是，基因和环境不同的个体可能会出现CD的共同症状，因为他们在胃肠道中有一个共同的蛋白信号失调状态。因此，我们推测新的治疗策略将产生于对CD相关蛋白信号的更好理解。因此，我们的研究目标是：（1）识别CD中失调的信号通路，（2）确定这些失调的通路中哪些是致病的。 我们的方法整合了小鼠模型、蛋白质组学和计算分析，以确定在小鼠模型中驱动肠道炎症发生和发展的信号通路。首先，我们扩展了令人兴奋的初步数据，涉及MIP-1alpha和MIP-1beta这两种与中性粒细胞炎症相关的趋化因子，作为CD的驱动因子。下一步，我们将确定在几种不同的CD小鼠模型中失调的信号通路，目的是确定与具有遗传多样性CD的人类相关的致病性信号通路。跨物种比较将使我们能够广泛地确定胃肠道炎症的保守驱动因素，并在此过程中揭示对CD的临床前治疗研究最有效的动物模型。最后，我们将应用定量质谱的新兴方法，以前所未有的水平分析炎症肠中的蛋白质信号。最后，我们希望通过对失调信号网络的深入研究，能够揭示CD患者的治疗靶点，而这些靶点并不容易从CD患者的基因分析中获得。

PUBLIC ABSTRACT
Our overarching goal is to understand how dysregulated protein signaling pathways contribute to Crohn's disease (CD). Because signaling pathways are readily targetable with small molecule or antibody-based therapies, understanding CD-related protein signaling will undoubtedly lead to the identification of new treatment strategies.
CD is a chronic and debilitating inflammatory disorder of the small and large intestine. Few effective therapies are available to the 700,000 CD patients living in the United States. The genetics of CD are extremely complex, and environment plays a significant role in promoting the disease, making it difficult to identify the underlying molecular drivers of CD. In particular, the role that protein signal transduction cascades play in CD is not well understood. Our working hypothesis is that genetically and environmentally diverse individuals can present with common symptoms of CD because they share a common dysregulated protein signaling state in their gastrointestinal tracts. By extension, we postulate that new therapeutic strategies will emerge from a better understanding of CD-related protein signaling. Therefore, the objectives of our study are to (1) identify the signaling pathways that are dysregulated in CD and (2) determine which of these dysregulated pathways are pathogenic.
Our approach integrates mouse modeling, proteomics, and computational analysis to identify signaling pathways that drive the onset and progression of intestinal inflammation in mouse models. To begin, we expand upon exciting preliminary data that implicate MIP-1alpha and MIP-1beta, two related chemokines involved in neutrophilic inflammation, as drivers of CD. Next, we will identify signaling pathways that are dysregulated in several different mouse models of CD, with the goal of identifying pathogenic signaling pathways relevant to humans with genetically diverse forms of CD. The cross-species comparison will allow us to broadly identify conserved drivers of GI inflammation and, in the process, reveal the animal models that will be the most effective for preclinical therapeutic studies for CD. Finally, we will apply emerging methods in quantitative mass spectroscopy to analyze protein signaling in inflamed intestine at an unprecedented level. In the end, we hope that insights into the dysregulated signaling network will reveal therapeutic targets that are not easily gleaned from genetic analysis of CD patients.

Project.Title: Robot for Image-Targeted Prostate Cancer Biopsy

Title_Other.Title: 图像定位前列腺癌活检机器人
Robot for Image-Targeted Prostate Cancer Biopsy

Class.ClassName: 自动化技术、自动化技术设备

Project.Abstract:
PUBLIC ABSTRACT
This is a technology development project combining recent breakthrough robotic technologies with cutting edge cancer imaging methods to create a modern, digital instrument for prostate cancer (PC) biopsy. The system will be able to precisely acquire biopsy samples from regions of the gland guided by magnetic resonance imaging (MRI). The instrument impacts the Fiscal Year 2007 Prostate Cancer Research Program area of programmatic interest for the detection and diagnosis of prostate cancer in its earliest stages of development.
Early detection and diagnosis of prostate cancer is crucial in the management of the disease for achieving recurrence-free therapeutic outcomes. Widespread early detection programs in the last decades continued to decrease the mortality rate of PC, so that last year PC stepped down to the third place among the leading causes of cancer death of men in the United States. Thousands of patients with prostate cancer are being identified at an earlier and potentially more treatable stage. However, the clinical management of these patients remains a significant clinical problem since PC demonstrate a tremendous range in biologic diversity and are treated with risk and with a broad spectrum of approaches from watchful waiting to aggressive surgical, radiation-based, and thermal ablation therapies. The staging and aggressiveness of the disease and the corresponding management relies on histological confirmation of cancer based on biopsies.
Unfortunately, current PC biopsy techniques performed under transrectal ultrasound guidance suffer from sampling errors. The instrumentation currently used targets the volume of the gland systematically but is not visually guided to biopsy cancer regions. Biopsies are taken from the most probable locations of the gland where cancer is known to reside (inter-patient statistics), but is not visually guided to suspicious regions determined with imaging in each individual patient (intra-patient data). Since PC has a heterogeneous distribution throughout the gland, samples may be acquired from healthy tissues, especially in the early stages when the tumors are small. Positive biopsy sampling is an event of lower probability in the earlier stages, making the current biopsy instrumentation inappropriate for early diagnosis.
If PC biopsies could be more accurately targeted using new advances in cancer imaging, sampling errors could be reduced. Furthermore, exciting new genomic and proteomic biomarkers from biopsy tissues could be combined with cancer imaging such as MRI-based biomarkers to better characterize the aggressiveness of PC. Targeted biopsies could also be used to validate new MRI approaches by determining what combination of anatomic and functional (metabolism, diffusion, and perfusion) parameters leads to the most accurate identification of PC, and these may also be used to monitor regions of healthy and malignant prostate tissues during trials of new therapies. These could contribute to reducing the level of aggressiveness in PC therapies and validating noninvasive, totally image-based PC diagnostic methods.
We propose to develop and validate an advanced image-guided biopsy (IGB) instrument, a robot to perform the biopsy in the MRI scanner. The robot orients and operates the biopsy needle remotely controlled by the physician from the control room under image-guidance. Advanced cancer imaging methods are used to delineate cancer locations.
The time is now ripe to pursue this project because of recent technological advancements. The Johns Hopkins University (JHU) team has prepared the groundwork for MRI robots under a previous NIH grant. Its scope was to develop technology and test the feasibility of MRI robots in preparation for high-impact applications such as the proposed project. Our invention of an MRI compatible motor is a breakthrough enabling technology, because this is the first and only motor capable of operating in the MRI without interfering with the image. The radiology research at Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center (MSKCC) is at the forefront of PC imaging with MRI spectroscopy methods. The robot will be designed and manufactured in the Urology Robotics lab at JHU, integrated with the MRI methods of the MSKCC, and the combined IGB system will be preclinically tested at the MSKCC. In the initial implementation, MRI methods will be used in imaging the cancer, but the biopsy robot will be readily applicable to guiding biopsies with other imagers and cancer imaging methods.
Synergetic, multi-disciplinary expertise combines novel cancer imaging methods with breakthrough technologies for the development of an advanced image-guided digital biopsy instrument inline with modern imaging equipment. Although patients will not be studied as part of this research, this technology development project creates the basis for multi-institutional clinical trials between our, and hopefully other, institutions.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 公共摘要 这是一项技术开发项目，将最新突破性的机器人技术与尖端癌症成像方法相结合，创造一种用于前列腺癌（PC）活检的现代化数字化仪器。该系统将能够在磁共振成像（MRI）的指导下，从腺体的各个区域精确采集活检样本。该仪器影响到2007财政年度前列腺癌研究计划领域的项目利益，检测和诊断前列腺癌的早期发展阶段。 前列腺癌的早期发现和诊断对前列腺癌的治疗至关重要。在过去的几十年中，广泛的早期检测计划继续降低了前列腺癌的死亡率，因此去年前列腺癌在美国男性癌症死亡的主要原因中排名第三。成千上万的前列腺癌患者正处于一个早期和潜在的更易治疗的阶段。然而，这些患者的临床治疗仍然是一个重要的临床问题，因为PC显示了生物多样性的巨大范围，并且通过风险和广泛的方法进行治疗，从谨慎等待到积极的手术、放疗和热消融治疗。该病的分期和侵袭性以及相应的治疗依赖于基于活检的癌症组织学确认。 不幸的是，目前在经直肠超声引导下进行的PC活检技术存在采样误差。目前使用的仪器系统地瞄准腺体的体积，但没有视觉引导到活检癌区域。活检是从已知癌症存在的腺体最可能的位置（患者间统计数据）进行的，但不是通过视觉引导到每个患者的成像确定的可疑区域（患者内数据）。由于前列腺癌在整个腺体中分布不均，因此可以从健康组织中获取样本，特别是在肿瘤较小的早期。活检取样阳性在早期是一个概率较低的事件，使得目前的活检仪器不适合早期诊断。 如果能利用癌症成像的新进展更准确地定位PC活检，取样误差可以减少。此外，来自活检组织的令人兴奋的新的基因组和蛋白质组生物标记物可与肿瘤成像（如基于MRI的生物标记物）结合，以更好地表征PC的侵袭性。靶向活检还可用于通过确定解剖和功能（代谢、扩散、，和灌注）参数可以最准确地识别前列腺癌，这些参数也可以在新疗法的试验中用于监测健康和恶性前列腺组织的区域。这可能有助于降低PC治疗中的攻击性水平，并验证无创、完全基于图像的PC诊断方法。 我们建议开发和验证一种先进的图像引导活检（IGB）仪器，一种在MRI扫描仪中进行活检的机器人。机器人在图像引导下从控制室对医生远程控制的活检针进行定向和操作。先进的癌症影像学方法被用来描绘癌症的位置。 由于最近的技术进步，现在实施这个项目的时机已经成熟。约翰霍普金斯大学（JHU）的研究小组在之前的NIH资助下为核磁共振机器人做了准备。其范围是开发技术和测试磁共振机器人的可行性，为高冲击应用做准备，如拟议的项目。我们发明的磁共振兼容电机是一项突破性的使能技术，因为这是第一个也是唯一一个能够在磁共振成像中运行而不干扰图像的电机。纪念斯隆·凯特林癌症中心（MSKCC）的放射学研究是核磁共振波谱技术在PC成像中的前沿。该机器人将在JHU的泌尿外科机器人实验室设计和制造，与MSKCC的MRI方法相结合，组合的IGB系统将在MSKCC进行临床前测试。在最初的实现中，核磁共振成像方法将用于癌症的成像，但是活检机器人将

Project.Title: Mathematical Sciences: Control of Variable Coefficient Partial Differential Equations: Elastic Bodies and Schrodinger Equations

Title_Other.Title: Mathematical Sciences: Control of Variable Coefficient Partial Differential Equations: Elastic Bodies and Schrodinger Equations
数学科学：变系数偏微分方程的控制：弹性体和薛定谔方程

Project.Abstract: 9501051 Horn This project focuses on boundary controllability and stabilization of elastic systems and has the two primary objectives. The first is to address the question of controllability of a Kirchhoff plate model with nonconstant coefficients in the principal part of the differential operator and with control acting as a moment on the boundary. Because of the close relationship between the Kirchhoff plate and a time-dependent Schroedinger equation with potential, as a first step, a general technique which relies on local smoothing properties of the solution is used to establish exact boundary controllability the Schroedinger equation with continuous coefficients. These results will then be utilized to establish exact boundary controllability of the Kirchhoff plate equation. The second major goal is to resolve the issue of controllability for the equations of three- dimensional linear elasticity, an issue which naturally arises when moving from two- dimensional plate models to mathematical models of general three-dimensional elastic bodies. Results currently available assume very strict geometric conditions on the domain even when the control is acting on the entire boundary. To examine the boundary controllability problem for the fully coupled system while eliminating these stringent geometric restrictions, an approach based on energy estimates and microlocal analysis techniques will be used. Derivation of trace regularity estimates for the solution of the system of linear elasticity will be a critical step in the process. Extensions of boundary controllability results from linear, constant coefficient distributed parameter systems to systems with nonconstant coefficients are mf great importance both mathematically and physically. Accurate mathematical modeling of many important physical systems requires that spatial inhomogeneities be admitted into the model and that the physical parameters in the model be permitted to vary with time. For this reason, it is important to develop a control theory based on these more accurate models of the physical world. In particular, a control theory for such models based on boundary sensors and actuators is sought, since one of the most important applications of such a theory is to the problem of controlling large flexible structures, where the natural locations for both measurements and controls are the joints and outer edges of the structure. Because both elastic plate models and equations of linear elasticity may be used to model components, such as airfoils and solar panels, of many structures, understanding how such elements can be controlled is a significant step to the development of a comprehensive control strategy for complex systems. ***

9501051HORN本项目主要研究弹性系统的边界能控性和稳定性，有两个主要目标。第一个问题是研究在微分算子的主体部分具有非定常系数且控制作用为边界力矩的Kirchhoff板模型的能控性问题。由于基尔霍夫板与含势含时薛定谔方程的密切关系，本文首先利用解的局部光滑性质建立了具有连续系数的薛定谔方程的精确边界能控性。这些结果将用于建立Kirchhoff板方程的精确边界能控性。第二个主要目标是解决三维线弹性方程的能控性问题，这是从二维平板模型到一般三维弹性体的数学模型自然产生的问题。现有的结果假设域上有非常严格的几何条件，即使控制作用于整个边界。为了研究完全耦合系统的边界能控性问题，同时消除这些严格的几何约束，将使用基于能量估计和微局部分析技术的方法。求出线性弹性系统解的迹正则性估计是这一过程中的一个关键步骤。将线性常系数分布参数系统的边界能控性推广到非定系数系统，无论在数学上还是在物理上都具有重要意义。许多重要物理系统的精确数学建模要求在模型中引入空间不均匀性，并允许模型中的物理参数随时间变化。因此，在这些更精确的物理世界模型的基础上发展一种控制理论是很重要的。特别是，寻求基于边界传感器和致动器的这种模型的控制理论，因为这样的理论最重要的应用之一是控制大挠性结构的问题，其中测量和控制的自然位置是结构的关节和外边缘。由于弹性板模型和线弹性方程都可以用来模拟许多结构的部件，如翼型和太阳能电池板，因此了解如何控制这些部件是为复杂系统开发综合控制策略的重要一步。***
