Project.Title: INSPIRE Track 1: Geometry and Physics of Network Dynamics

Title_Other.Title: INSPIRE Track 1: Geometry and Physics of Network Dynamics
启发轨迹1：网络动力学的几何与物理

Project.Abstract: This INSPIRE award is partially funded by the Networking Technology and Systems Program in the Division of Computer and Network Systems in the Directorate for Computer Information Science and Engineering; the Mathematical Physics Program in the Division of Physics in the Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences; and the Office of Multidisciplinary Activities in the Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences. Two grand challenges in two disjoint fields of science are network dynamics prediction and quantum gravity theory. The lack of understanding of fundamental laws driving the dynamics of many complex networks, and consequently our inability to predict and control their behavior, are among the reasons why many practical problems of great significance remain unsolved for decades. The lack of a complete theory of quantum gravity, unifying all the fundamental interactions, is perhaps the most fundamental problem in physics after Einstein. Motivated by the recent results suggesting that the two problems might in fact be intimately related via a geometric duality between hyperbolic and de Sitter spaces---the former reflecting the latent geometry of complex networks, the latter representing the asymptotic geometry of spacetime in the universe---this project addresses both grand challenges and advances science in both fields by deriving fundamental laws of network dynamics. The main hypothesis that the project investigates is that one can extend and apply the canonical approach in physics used to study all the fundamental interactions in nature to a wide class of physical systems---complex networks. One part of the project focuses on finding Hamiltonians defining Hamilton's equations of network dynamics, and validating the derived equations against the dynamics of real networks. These equations are expected to be simpler than the corresponding equations in gravitational theories. Other parts of the project focus on building tools to predict this dynamics based on the derived equations, and investigating connections between this dynamics, its conformal invariance in the de Sitter/conformal field theory correspondence (dS/CFT) context, and network navigability that may lead to a different interpretation of the dark energy problem in cosmology. This interdisciplinary project combines concepts and methods from mathematical physics and network research by extending the canonical approach in physics to complex networks to advance our understanding of their dynamics, and to explore whether applying theoretical concepts in network science will advance our understanding of dark energy. This project thus opens exciting new research directions by hypothesizing a fundamental connection between Hamiltonian dynamics and network dynamics that until now have been considered completely unrelated. The transformative project thus challenges the conventional wisdom that neither the canonical approach in physics can be useful in studying complex networks, nor network science has anything to offer theoretical physics. Broader Impact: Many problems of broader impacts in science and society are blocked on network dynamics prediction. Examples include disease treatment, drug design, and a variety of link-prediction problems, which are sub-problems of network dynamics prediction. In general, connections between systems as different as the brain, the Internet, and the universe, appeal to general public, foster creative thinking, and attract wider and more diverse circles of students to science and engineering.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: This INSPIRE award is partially funded by the Networking Technology and Systems Program in the Division of Computer and Network Systems in the Directorate for Computer Information Science and Engineering; the Mathematical Physics Program in the Division of Physics in the Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences; and the Office of Multidisciplinary Activities in the Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences. This project thus opens exciting new research directions by hypothesizing a fundamental connection between Hamiltonian dynamics and network dynamics that until now have been considered completely unrelated. The transformative project thus challenges the conventional wisdom that neither the canonical approach in physics can be useful in studying complex networks, nor network science has anything to offer theoretical physics. Examples include disease treatment, drug design, and a variety of link-prediction problems, which are sub-problems of network dynamics prediction. In general, connections between systems as different as the brain, the Internet, and the universe, appeal to general public, foster creative thinking, and attract wider and more diverse circles of students to science and engineering.

该激励奖部分由计算机信息科学与工程理事会计算机与网络系统司的网络技术与系统方案、数学与物理科学理事会物理司的数学物理方案资助；以及数学和物理科学理事会的多学科活动办公室。网络动力学预测和量子引力理论是两个不相交的科学领域的两大挑战。对驱动许多复杂网络动力学的基本规律缺乏了解，因此我们无法预测和控制它们的行为，是许多具有重大意义的实际问题几十年来仍未解决的原因之一。缺乏统一所有基本相互作用的完整量子引力理论，也许是继爱因斯坦之后物理学中最基本的问题。最近的研究结果表明，这两个问题实际上可能通过双曲空间和de Sitter空间之间的几何对偶而密切相关，前者反映了复杂网络的潜在几何，后者代表了宇宙中时空的渐近几何学——本项目通过推导网络动力学的基本定律，解决了这两个领域的重大挑战并推动了科学的发展。该项目研究的主要假设是，可以将物理学中用于研究自然界所有基本相互作用的规范方法推广应用到一类广泛的物理系统——复杂网络。该项目的一部分重点是寻找哈密顿量，定义哈密顿网络动力学方程，并根据实际网络的动力学验证导出的方程。这些方程比引力理论中的相应方程要简单。该项目的其他部分侧重于建立工具，根据导出的方程预测这种动力学，并研究这种动力学之间的联系，以及在德西特/共形场理论对应（dS/CFT）上下文中的共形不变性，以及可能导致宇宙学中暗能量问题不同解释的网络导航性。这个跨学科的项目结合了数学物理和网络研究的概念和方法，将物理学中的规范方法扩展到复杂的网络，以促进我们对其动力学的理解，并探索在网络科学中应用理论概念是否会促进我们对暗能量的理解。因此，这个项目通过假设哈密顿动力学和网络动力学之间的基本联系开辟了令人兴奋的新的研究方向，直到现在，哈密顿动力学和网络动力学被认为是完全无关的。因此，这个变革性的项目挑战了传统的观点，即物理学中的规范方法在研究复杂网络时都没有用处，网络科学也没有任何东西可以提供理论物理学。更广泛的影响：许多在科学和社会中具有更广泛影响的问题在网络动力学预测中受阻。实例包括疾病治疗、药物设计和各种链路预测问题，它们是网络动力学预测的子问题。一般来说，像大脑、互联网和宇宙这样不同的系统之间的联系，吸引了大众，培养了创造性思维，吸引了更广泛和更多样化的学生到科学和工程界来。

Source.Name: Directorate for Computer & Information Science & Engineering

Project.Title: TGF-B regulation of airway smooth muscle remodeling

Title_Other.Title: TGF-B对气道平滑肌重塑的调节作用
TGF-B regulation of airway smooth muscle remodeling

Class.ClassName: 控制论（数学）、信息论（数学）

Project.Title: Structural and material modeling of textile composites based on polysiloxane matrix

Title_Other.Title: Strukturní a materiálové modelování textilních kompozitů na bázi polysiloxanové matrice
聚硅氧烷基纺织复合材料的结构与材料模拟

Class.ClassName: 材料结构、材料物理性质

Project.Abstract: Fiber composites are proven and attractive variants of structural materials used in a number of engineering industries. Recently, carbon-carbon composites (C / C) have been particularly important. However, their wider practical application prevents relatively complicated and expensive production. A suitable alternative in a number of applications is to provide material systems based on polysiloxane matrices. In relation to biomedical engineering, there are a number of studies pointing to the acceptable material properties of these systems comparable to human bones and at the same time satisfactory biocompatibility and bioactivity. Their potential use in high temperature applications is also known. The main objective of the project is to verify these assumptions by using rigorous homogenization approaches within the multilevel modeling of the proposed multi-tier construction system. Part of the project will be a comprehensive experimental program to support numerical simulations in order to ensure both material data at the level of individual components and structural elements and to determine the effective properties of layered composite structure to check the reliability of computer prediction.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 纤维复合材料是许多工程工业中使用的结构材料的一种经证实且具有吸引力的变体。近年来，碳/碳复合材料（C/C）的研究显得尤为重要。然而，它们更广泛的实际应用阻止了相对复杂和昂贵的生产。在许多应用中，一个合适的替代方案是提供基于聚硅氧烷基质的材料系统。在生物医学工程方面，有许多研究表明，这些系统的可接受材料性能与人类骨骼相当，同时具有令人满意的生物相容性和生物活性。它们在高温应用中的潜在用途也是众所周知的。该项目的主要目标是通过在多层建筑系统的多级建模中使用严格的同质化方法来验证这些假设。该项目的一部分将是一个支持数值模拟的综合实验程序，以确保在单个构件和结构单元层面上的材料数据，并确定层状复合材料结构的有效性能，以检验计算机预测的可靠性。

Vlákenné kompozity představují osvědčenou a atraktivní variantů konstrukčních materiálů používaných v řadě inženýrských odvětví. V poslední době si získaly značnou pozornost zejména kompozity typu uhlík-uhlík (C/C). Jejich širšímu praktickému uplatnění však brání poměrně komplikovaná a drahá výroba. Vhodnou alternativu v řadě aplikací nabízí materiálové systémy založené na bázi polysiloxanových matric. Ve vztahu k biomedicínckému inženýrství existuje řada studií poukazující na přijatelné materiálové vlastnosti těchto systémů srovnatelné s lidskými kostmi a zároveň uspokojivou biokompatibilitu a bioaktivitu. Jejich potenciální využití ve vysoko teplotních aplikacích je také známo. Základním cílem projektu je ověřit tyto předpoklady s využitím rigorózních homogenizační přístupů v rámci víceúrovňového modelování navrženého vícevrtsvého konstrukčního systému. Součástí projektu bude obsáhlý experimentální program na podporu numerických simulací s cílem zajistit jednak materiálová data na úrovni jednotlivých složek a konstrukčních prvků a jednak stanovit efektivní vlastnosti vrstevnaté kompozitní struktury pro kontrolu spolehlivosti počítačové predikce.

Project.Title: Structure-function studies on proteins important for cellular survival and proliferation: ribonucleotide reductases and glypicans

Title_Other.Title: 对细胞生存和增殖有重要意义的蛋白质的结构功能研究：核糖核酸还原酶和glypicans
Structure-function studies on proteins important for cellular survival and proliferation: ribonucleotide reductases and glypicans

Project.Abstract: We apply multiple methods: X-ray crystallography, small angle X-ray scattering, cross-linking mass-spectrometry and electron microscopy, to the study of two important biological systems:Ribonucleotide reductases (RNRs), which produce the building blocks for DNA synthesis and repair. RNRs are allosterically regulated for overall activity and substrate specificity. We study the large macromolecular complexes implicated in the activity regulation of several aerobic RNRs from human pathogens. We hope to exploit the structural information to generate new drugs that kill human bacterial pathogens by disrupting their allosteric regulation. We also study the structural basis for radical generation in anaerobic RNRs, of interest for the wider family of glycyl radical enzymes. Glypicans: cell surface proteoglycans of great importance for cell signalling during development and for cancer therapy. Their core proteins are decorated with functionally important heparan sulphate (HS) chains attached to a C-terminal tail. The specificity of HS attachment depends on the core protein structure and its interactions with members of the exostosin family, EXTL2 and EXTL3. The structures of these proteins will reveal the details of attachment of HS and also explain why only HS is attached and not e.g. chondroitin sulphate. We are also investigating the structures of other glypicans such as glypican-3 (an important player in aggressive liver cancer) and glypican-4 (implicated in diabetes).

Abstract_Other.Abstract: We apply multiple methods: X-ray crystallography, small angle X-ray scattering, cross-linking mass-spectrometry and electron microscopy, to the study of two important biological systems:Ribonucleotide reductases (RNRs), which produce the building blocks for DNA synthesis and repair. RNRs are allosterically regulated for overall activity and substrate specificity. We study the large macromolecular complexes implicated in the activity regulation of several aerobic RNRs from human pathogens. We hope to exploit the structural information to generate new drugs that kill human bacterial pathogens by disrupting their allosteric regulation. We also study the structural basis for radical generation in anaerobic RNRs, of interest for the wider family of glycyl radical enzymes. Glypicans: cell surface proteoglycans of great importance for cell signalling during development and for cancer therapy. Their core proteins are decorated with functionally important heparan sulphate (HS) chains attached to a C-terminal tail. The specificity of HS attachment depends on the core protein structure and its interactions with members of the exostosin family, EXTL2 and EXTL3. The structures of these proteins will reveal the details of attachment of HS and also explain why only HS is attached and not e.g. chondroitin sulphate. We are also investigating the structures of other glypicans such as glypican-3 (an important player in aggressive liver cancer) and glypican-4 (implicated in diabetes).

我们运用X射线晶体学、小角X射线散射、交联质谱和电子显微镜等多种方法，对核糖核苷酸还原酶（RNRs）这两种重要的生物体系进行了研究，RNRs是DNA合成和修复的基石。RNRs通过变构调节整体活性和底物特异性。我们研究了大分子复合物与人类病原菌好氧rnr活性调控的关系。我们希望利用这些结构信息，通过破坏人类细菌病原体的变构调节来产生杀死它们的新药。我们还研究了厌氧RNRs中自由基生成的结构基础，这对更广泛的糖基自由基酶家族有意义。Glypicans：细胞表面蛋白多糖，在发育过程中对细胞信号和癌症治疗具有重要意义。它们的核心蛋白被功能上重要的硫酸乙酰肝素（HS）链修饰，这些链附着在C末端的尾部。HS附着的特异性取决于其核心蛋白结构及其与exostosin家族成员EXTL2和EXTL3的相互作用。这些蛋白质的结构将揭示HS附着的细节，并解释为什么只有HS附着而不是硫酸软骨素。我们也在研究其他glypican的结构，如glypican-3（侵袭性肝癌的重要参与者）和glypican-4（与糖尿病有关）。

Project.Title: Growth and Development of Root Systems in Loblolly Pine Seedlings

Title_Other.Title: 火炬松幼苗根系的生长发育

Project.Title: Computable Stability Theory

Title_Other.Title: Computable Stability Theory
可计算稳定性理论

Project.Abstract: Andrews proposes a program of research spanning classical computability theory, classical model theory, and especially the interplay between computability theory and model theory. More specifically, the proposed research will develop the emerging field of Computable Stability Theory, where the methods of stability theory plays a key role is the study of effective properties of first order theories. Stability theory is the part of model theory which focuses on the underlying geometrical or structural nature of the mathematical objects. Generally speaking, the more underlying structure the mathematical object respects, the easier it is to compute information about the object. This forms a back-and-forth relationship between stability and computability, and this interplay is the focus of Computable Stability Theory. Questions arising from Computable Stability Theory lead to new questions in classical model theory as well as computability, which sheds light on both subjects. Among these questions is when quantifier elimination to some level can be derived from geometrical properties. Computable Stability Theory endeavors to explore the basic statement that "structurally simple objects ought to be easier to compute." Model theory, a branch of mathematical logic, offers tools to analyze structural simplicity by studying objects in the context of their first order language. The understanding of the language associated to an object or class of objects can often be translated to a deeper understanding of the objects themselves. Computability theory studies questions of computation and relative computation with regard to mathematical objects. By combining tools from both fields, Andrews will examine the question of when structural simplicity does and when it does not translate into computational simplicity.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 安德鲁斯提出了一个跨越经典可计算理论、经典模型理论，特别是可计算理论与模型理论相互作用的研究方案。更具体地说，本文的研究将发展可计算稳定性理论的新兴领域，其中稳定性理论的方法起着关键作用的是一阶理论有效性质的研究。稳定性理论是模型理论的一部分，它关注数学对象潜在的几何或结构性质。一般来说，数学对象所考虑的底层结构越多，计算有关对象的信息就越容易。这在稳定性和可计算性之间形成了一种前后的关系，这种相互作用是可计算稳定性理论的焦点。可计算稳定性理论中的问题导致了经典模型理论中的新问题和可计算性问题，对这两个问题都有启示在这些问题中，量词消去何时能从几何性质中导出某种程度的量词消去。可计算稳定性理论致力于探索“结构简单的对象应该更容易计算”这一基本命题。模型理论是数学逻辑的一个分支，它通过在对象的一阶语言环境中研究对象来提供分析结构简单性的工具。对与一个对象或一类对象相关联的语言的理解通常可以翻译成对对象本身的更深入的理解。可计算性理论研究与数学对象有关的计算和相关计算问题。通过结合这两个领域的工具，Andrews将研究何时结构简单化，何时结构简单化不能转化为计算简单化的问题。

Among these questions is when quantifier elimination to some level can be derived from geometrical properties. Computable Stability Theory endeavors to explore the basic statement that "structurally simple objects ought to be easier to compute." Model theory, a branch of mathematical logic, offers tools to analyze structural simplicity by studying objects in the context of their first order language. The understanding of the language associated to an object or class of objects can often be translated to a deeper understanding of the objects themselves. Project.Title: New Directions in Random Walk

Title_Other.Title: New Directions in Random Walk
随机游动中的新方向

Project.Abstract: The PI will open and pursue several new areas of research in random walks on graphs. Among them are expected time for a random walk or Brownian particle to cover all the edges of a network; coupling of random walks in order to avoid collisions; strategies for searching and patrolling graphs; and some new ideas on "mixing time," that is, the time required for a random walk to reach a random state. The random walk on a graph has been a fundamental construction in discrete probability. The concept has numerous applications in computer science and statistical physics, and a strong connection to the theory of electrical networks. The proposed work has additional possible applications to disparate fields such as software design and policing; it brings game theory, as well as combinatorics and probability, into the random walk picture.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: The PI will open and pursue several new areas of research in random walks on graphs. Among them are expected time for a random walk or Brownian particle to cover all the edges of a network; coupling of random walks in order to avoid collisions; strategies for searching and patrolling graphs; and some new ideas on "mixing time," that is, the time required for a random walk to reach a random state. The random walk on a graph has been a fundamental construction in discrete probability. The concept has numerous applications in computer science and statistical physics, and a strong connection to the theory of electrical networks. The proposed work has additional possible applications to disparate fields such as software design and policing; it brings game theory, as well as combinatorics and probability, into the random walk picture.

PI将在图的随机游动中开辟和追求几个新的研究领域。其中，期望随机游走或布朗粒子覆盖网络的所有边缘；随机游动的耦合以避免碰撞；搜索和巡逻图的策略；以及关于“混合时间”的一些新想法，即随机游走所需的时间达到随机状态。图上的随机游动是离散概率的基本构造。这一概念在计算机科学和统计物理学中有着广泛的应用，并与电网络理论有着密切的联系。所提出的工作在不同的领域，如软件设计和警务方面有额外的可能应用；它将博弈论、组合学和概率纳入随机游走图。

Project.Title: Current Density Based Electrical Impedance Tomography, an Emerging Hybrid Imaging Technique

Title_Other.Title: 基于电流密度的电阻抗断层成像技术
Current Density Based Electrical Impedance Tomography, an Emerging Hybrid Imaging Technique

Project.Abstract: This award is funded under the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 (Public Law 111-5). The investigator and his collaborators study a new non-invasive method for imaging the electrical conductivity of the inside of the body. Inner knowledge of the conductivity has found applications in various fields ranging from Medicine, Geophysics, Environmental Sciences, to Nondestructive Testing and Mine Detection, to mention only some. The model is based on the Maxwell system and combines methods from Electrical Impedance Tomography and Current Density Imaging. The novelty lies in the augmentation of the Maxwell model with the knowledge of the magnitude of the current density field generated while maintaining a voltage at the boundary. The latter data is currently obtained by using Magnetic Resonance measurements of the magnetic field. Mathematically, the problem is to study minimal surfaces in a singular Riemannian space with a metric determined by the magnitude of the current density field. Alternatively, the problem can be reduced to a Non-smooth Optimization problem. Taking advantage of the tools from the areas of Inverse Problems, Partial Differential Equations, Riemannian Geometry, Geometric Measure Theory and Non-smooth Optimization the investigator and his collaborators aim to change the existing and accepted theories and provide mathematical support and methods to image inner conductivity accurately and with high resolution. This investigation belongs to the current government research priority on Information Technology. The results of this study are to produce new methodologies for non-invasive imaging of the interior of conductive bodies, such as the human body. The benefits to society are important since one componenent of the results of this study concerns the affordability of the new methods applied to Medical Imaging. More precisely, the new technology is to complement the classical Magnetic Resonance Imaging scan, method which is fairly expensive at the moment. This investigation integrates research and education in two ways. On the one hand, an integrate part is the training and mentoring of graduate and undergraduate students, including from the under-represented categories of students. On the other hand, the investigator is concurrently designing a special topics course, whose scope is based on this study.

该奖项根据2009年美国复苏和再投资法案（公法111-5）获得资助。研究者和他的合作者研究了一种新的非侵入性方法来成像身体内部的导电性。导电性的内部知识在医学、地球物理学、环境科学、无损检测和矿山探测等各个领域都有应用，仅举一些例子。该模型基于Maxwell系统，结合了电阻抗成像和电流密度成像的方法。其新颖之处在于，在保持边界电压的同时，利用电流密度场的大小对Maxwell模型进行了扩充。后一种数据目前是通过磁场的磁共振测量获得的。数学上，问题是研究奇异黎曼空间中的极小曲面，其度量由电流密度场的大小决定。或者，该问题可以简化为非光滑优化问题。利用反问题、偏微分方程、黎曼几何等领域的工具，几何测量理论和非光滑优化的研究者和他的合作者的目的是改变现有的和公认的理论，并提供数学支持和方法，以准确和高分辨率的图像内传导率。本次调查属于当前政府信息技术研究的重点。这项研究的结果是为非侵入性成像的导电体内部，如人体产生新的方法。这项研究结果的一个组成部分涉及到应用于医学成像的新方法的可承受性，因此对社会的益处是重要的。更准确地说，这项新技术是对目前相当昂贵的经典磁共振成像扫描方法的补充。本次调查从两个方面整合了研究和教育。一方面，综合部分是研究生和本科生的培训和指导，包括来自代表性不足的学生类别。另一方面，研究者同时也在设计一门专题课程，其范围以本研究为基础。

Project.Title: Novel Approaches to Empirical Force Field Models in Molecular Modeling via Multidimensional Scaling

Title_Other.Title: 多维标度分子模拟中经验力场模型的新方法
Novel Approaches to Empirical Force Field Models in Molecular Modeling via Multidimensional Scaling

Project.Abstract: The project focuses on new computational methods for the determination of biomolecular structure, which is crucial to our understanding of how biomolecules such as proteins perform the functions they do. This functional understanding, in turn, figures in the development of techniques for disease diagnosis and treatment. A widely used approach to determining the structure of biomolecules is the minimization of the molecule''s potential energy, computed using a force-field model. The potential energy accounts for such features as the stretching of bonds between atoms, the deformation of bond angles, and the interactions of non-bonded atoms (e.g., electrostatic forces). Of interest are molecular configurations that have very low potential energies, since biomolecules fold themselves into shapes that tend to minimize the potential energy: Nature is an optimizer. One seeks physically meaningful molecular configurations by applying computational techniques to systematically vary the locations of the atoms to reduce the potential energy. A serious difficulty encountered when applying computational algorithms to energy minimization arises when the search needs to move through configurations with high potential energies on the way to configurations with low potential energies. For instance, moving atoms close past one another increases the potential energy due to repulsive forces. Minimization algorithms have difficulty dealing with this situation since they cannot be sure in advance that allowing increases in potential energy will ultimately lead to configurations with lower energy. As a consequence, algorithms may halt at structures that minimize the potential energy only among nearby configurations, but not overall, and are not of physical interest. This project explores a new approach to address this difficulty. We pose the problem in terms of the interatomic distances, rather than the locations of the atoms, rewriting the potential energy in terms of these distances. Roughly speaking, our approach corresponds to adding fictitious copies of each atom, one for each of the other atoms. Of course, we must also add conditions that ensure that all the fictitious copies of an atom ultimately coalesce into a single atom. However, we use conditions that can be relaxed at intermediate steps of the energy minimization process and are only enforced as we approach a solution. This approach benefits from adding a large number of extra dimensions to the search space. As an analogy, imagine a search for the lowest point in North America, Death Valley, starting from Chicago. As purely earthbound voyagers we might be fooled into stopping at a local low point at the foot of the Rockies or around the Great Salt Lake, just as optimization algorithms might halt at local energy minimizers. But if we relax the requirement of traveling by land and allow travel by air, then we can pass over local minimizers on the ground to arrive at the desired destination. Preliminary tests have shown that our approach greatly improves the behavior of the more notoriously troublesome energy terms. This project will investigate its use for molecular structure determination and will examine extensions to other applications such as drug docking and finding transition mechanisms for chemical reactions.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 该项目的重点是确定生物分子结构的新的计算方法，这对于我们理解蛋白质等生物分子如何发挥其功能至关重要。这种功能性的理解，反过来，在疾病诊断和治疗技术的发展中起着重要作用。确定生物分子结构的一种广泛使用的方法是用力场模型计算分子势能的最小化。势能解释了原子间键的拉伸、键角的变形和非键原子的相互作用（如静电力）等特征。令人感兴趣的是具有非常低势能的分子构型，因为生物分子将自己折叠成倾向于使势能最小化的形状：自然界是一个优化器。人们通过应用计算技术系统地改变原子的位置以减少势能来寻求物理意义上的分子构型。将计算算法应用于能量最小化时遇到的一个严重困难是，当搜索需要通过具有高势能的配置，然后才能到达具有低势能的配置。例如，由于排斥力的作用，相互靠近的移动原子增加了势能。最小化算法很难处理这种情况，因为它们不能事先确定，允许势能的增加最终会导致能量较低的配置。因此，算法可能会停在结构上，这些结构只在附近的结构中最小化势能，而不是在整体上，并且不具有物理意义。这个项目探索了解决这个困难的新方法。我们提出的问题是原子间的距离，而不是原子的位置，根据这些距离重写势能。粗略地说，我们的方法相当于添加每个原子的虚拟拷贝，每个原子对应一个其他原子。当然，我们还必须添加一些条件，以确保一个原子的所有虚拟副本最终合并为一个原子。然而，我们使用的条件可以在能量最小化过程的中间步骤放宽，并且只有在我们接近解时才强制执行。这种方法得益于在搜索空间中添加大量额外维度。作为一个类比，想象一下从芝加哥开始在北美寻找最低点死亡谷。作为纯粹的地球旅行者，我们可能会被愚弄到停在落基山脉脚下或大盐湖附近的一个局部低点，就像优化算法可能停在局部能量最小化点一样。但是，如果我们放松了陆上旅行的要求，允许空中旅行，那么我们就可以越过地面上的局部极小值，到达期望的目的地。初步测试表明，我们的方法大大改善了更为臭名昭著的麻烦的能量项的行为。该项目将研究其在分子结构测定中的应用，并将研究其在药物对接和寻找化学反应过渡机制等其他应用中的扩展。

Project.Title: Heparan Sulphate Proteoglycan in Drosophila

Title_Other.Title: Heparan Sulphate Proteoglycan in Drosophila
果蝇硫酸乙酰肝素蛋白多糖

Project.Abstract: DESCRIPTION (provided by applicant) Many intercellular signaling events in both vertebrates and in Drosophila have been shown to require one class of cell surface proteins, the heparan sulphate proteoglycans (HSPG's). HSPG's are proteins with attached chains of modified sugars polymers, called heparan sulphate (HS). Both the core proteins and the HS chains of HSPG's have been shown to be important for many signaling events. The goals of this proposal are to 1) identify null mutants in the Drosophila dally gene, which encodes the core protein of a glypican-like HSPG 2) identify suppressors and enhancers of daily that will yield mutations in the HS synthetic enzymes as well as other modifiers, and 3) ascertain the role that each of the identified Drosophila O-sulphotransferases (OST) plays in developmental signaling using RNA interference. Several genetic and molecular assays will be used to determine if a particular mutation or reduction of one of the OST's affects the Wingless, Hedgehog, FGF, or Decapentaplegic signaling pathways. These studies will greatly expand our understanding of the roles of HSPG's in signaling and development.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: DESCRIPTION (provided by applicant) Many intercellular signaling events in both vertebrates and in Drosophila have been shown to require one class of cell surface proteins, the heparan sulphate proteoglycans (HSPG's). HSPG's are proteins with attached chains of modified sugars polymers, called heparan sulphate (HS). Both the core proteins and the HS chains of HSPG's have been shown to be important for many signaling events. The goals of this proposal are to 1) identify null mutants in the Drosophila dally gene, which encodes the core protein of a glypican-like HSPG 2) identify suppressors and enhancers of daily that will yield mutations in the HS synthetic enzymes as well as other modifiers, and 3) ascertain the role that each of the identified Drosophila O-sulphotransferases (OST) plays in developmental signaling using RNA interference. Several genetic and molecular assays will be used to determine if a particular mutation or reduction of one of the OST's affects the Wingless, Hedgehog, FGF, or Decapentaplegic signaling pathways. 描述（由申请人提供）脊椎动物和果蝇中的许多细胞间信号事件已被证明需要一类细胞表面蛋白，硫酸乙酰肝素蛋白多糖（HSPG）。HSPG是一种带有修饰糖聚合物链的蛋白质，称为硫酸乙酰肝素（HS）。HSPG的核心蛋白和HS链对许多信号事件都具有重要作用。本提案的目的是：1）在果蝇dally基因中识别零突变，该基因编码一种类似于HSPG的glypican核心蛋白；2）识别每天产生HS合成酶突变的抑制物和增强剂以及其他修饰剂，（3）利用RNA干扰，确定果蝇O-硫转移酶（OST）在发育信号传导中的作用。一些基因和分子分析将被用来确定一个OST的特定突变或减少是否影响无翅、刺猬、FGF或十肽能信号通路。这些研究将大大扩展我们对HSPG在信号传导和发育中作用的认识。

Source.Name: National Institute of General Medical Sciences

Project.Title: Functional connectivity of isolated neuronal circuits in primary visual cortex

Title_Other.Title: 初级视皮层神经元回路的功能连接
Functional connectivity of isolated neuronal circuits in primary visual cortex

Project.Abstract: DESCRIPTION (provided by applicant): The function of the nervous system is dependent on complex interactions between networks of neurons. Understanding how these networks function in both health and disease is dependent on understanding the function of the fine-scale connections between neurons. The research proposed here is aimed at revealing the functions of specific connections between similar and different types of neurons in the same or different cortical layer. A rabies-based tracing system will reveal the direct monosynaptic connections between neurons in the primary visual cortex of mice. Visual stimulation combined with calcium imaging will then reveal the visual response properties of connected neurons. This method will be the first to simultaneously assess both connectivity and function in a live animal without limitations on the distance between connected cells. The cortical sources and functional contributions of excitatory and inhibitory inputs to single functionally characterized excitatory neurons will be uncovered, and the principles by which a single neuron integrates many inputs to produce a single functional output will be studied. The results of these experiments will shed light on various hypotheses about the functional roles of fine-scale connections in cortical information processing.

Understanding how these networks function in both health and disease is dependent on understanding the function of the fine-scale connections between neurons. The research proposed here is aimed at revealing the functions of specific connections between similar and different types of neurons in the same or different cortical layer. Visual stimulation combined with calcium imaging will then reveal the visual response properties of connected neurons. This method will be the first to simultaneously assess both connectivity and function in a live animal without limitations on the distance between connected cells. The cortical sources and functional contributions of excitatory and inhibitory inputs to single functionally characterized excitatory neurons will be uncovered, and the principles by which a single neuron integrates many inputs to produce a single functional output will be studied. The results of these experiments will shed light on various hypotheses about the functional roles of fine-scale connections in cortical information processing.

描述（申请人提供）：神经系统的功能依赖于神经元网络之间复杂的相互作用。了解这些神经网络在健康和疾病中的作用取决于了解神经元之间精细连接的功能。本研究旨在揭示同一或不同皮质层中相似或不同类型神经元之间的特异性连接功能。基于狂犬病的追踪系统将揭示小鼠初级视觉皮层神经元之间的直接单突触连接。视觉刺激结合钙离子成像将揭示连接神经元的视觉反应特性。这种方法将是第一种在不限制连接细胞之间距离的情况下同时评估活体动物的连接性和功能的方法。揭示兴奋性和抑制性输入对单一功能性兴奋性神经元的皮层来源和功能贡献，研究单个神经元整合多个输入产生单一功能性输出的原理。这些实验的结果将有助于阐明关于精细尺度连接在皮层信息处理中的功能作用的各种假设。

Project.Title: Passivation Technologies for Improved Operability and Radiation Tolerance in VLWIR HgCdTe Focal Plane Arrays

Title_Other.Title: 提高vlwir-hgcdte焦平面阵列可操作性和抗辐射能力的钝化技术
Passivation Technologies for Improved Operability and Radiation Tolerance in VLWIR HgCdTe Focal Plane Arrays

Project.Abstract: HgCdTe, with its high quantum efficiency, remains the material of choice for most high-performance infrared detector applications. By varying its alloy composition, HgCdTe can be used for short wavelength to very long wavelength infrared (VLWIR); however, its use in VLWIR (12-16 microns) applications is problematic, even when grown on lattice-matched CdZnTe substrates, due to material and substrate quality issues. Ongoing work by Amethyst Research is proving hydrogenation effective in passivating defects and improving carrier lifetime/mobility in HgCdTe/Si infrared focal plane arrays (IRFPAs), offering the potential for increased producibility of large arrays, extended effective spectral response to longer wavelengths, and reduced cooling requirements. Recent research by Amethyst suggests that hydrogenation may also be effective in defect mitigation and the attendant operability improvements of HgCdTe/ZnCdTe focal plane arrays. There is also evidence to suggest that hydrogenation may improve radiation hardness of the HgCdTe/ZnCdTe, providing a self-healing material with immunity to a variety of defect sources. Amethyst proposes to investigate hydrogenation of HgCdTe/ZnCdTe for defect passivation and radiation hardening. Amethyst’s collaboration with BAE, Raytheon Vision Systems and Teledyne Imaging Sensors (formerly Rockwell Scientific), the country’s major IRFPA manufacturers, will ensure rapid transition of this manufacturing technology to MDA platforms.

HgCdTe以其高量子效率，仍然是大多数高性能红外探测器应用的首选材料。通过改变合金成分，HgCdTe可用于短波长到非常长波长的红外（VLWIR）；然而，由于材料和衬底质量问题，即使在晶格匹配的CdZnTe衬底上生长，其在VLWIR（12-16微米）应用中的应用也存在问题。紫水晶研究所正在进行的工作正在证明氢化作用在钝化hgcdte/si红外焦平面阵列（irfpa）中的缺陷和提高载流子寿命/迁移率方面是有效的，这为提高大阵列的可生产性、扩展对较长波长的有效光谱响应以及降低冷却要求提供了潜力。amethyst最近的研究表明，氢化也可以有效地减少hgcdte/zncdte焦平面阵列的缺陷，并提高其可操作性。也有证据表明氢化可以提高hgcdte/zncdte的辐射硬度，提供一种对各种缺陷源具有免疫力的自愈材料。紫晶研究了hgcdte/zncdte加氢对缺陷钝化和辐射硬化的影响。Amethyst与BAE、雷神视觉系统和Teledyne成像传感器（前身为Rockwell Scientific）的合作，将确保该制造技术快速过渡到MDA平台。

Project.Title: Style-adaptation of non-verbal behaviour for social robots

Title_Other.Title: 社交机器人非言语行为的风格适应
Style-adaptation of non-verbal behaviour for social robots

Project.Abstract: As humans, we continuously adapt our behaviour to the situation we are present in. In communication with other humans, we automatically adjust our communicative style in so that it is appropriate for the context. This continuous adaptation is an inherent part of human functioning, and one of the key success factors to human communicative abilities. It is also an aspect that is fundamentally lacking in current speech based interfaces in VPAs and social robots. When engaged in face-to-face interaction, humans sub-consciously mimic each other in many ways. We reliably adopt poses, facial expressions, mannerisms and speaking styles of our interlocutors. This phenomenon, known as behavioural mimicry, emerges during infancy and is a fundamental mechanism in how we learn social codes and behaviours, but stays throughout our lives as an important social function. Mimicry has been shown to increase empathy, liking and affiliation between the individuals, and it has been referred to as a social glue (Lakin et al, 2003) because it helps to create strong ties and relationships. In addition, mimicry has been shown to increase learning and attention in tutoring situations (Martin, 2010). This project aims to investigate fundamental co-adaptation behaviours in face-to-face human robot interaction, and collect the data and knowledge required to build social robots that are able to engage in face-to-face interaction and continuously adapt their behaviour towards that of the user.

We reliably adopt poses, facial expressions, mannerisms and speaking styles of our interlocutors. This phenomenon, known as behavioural mimicry, emerges during infancy and is a fundamental mechanism in how we learn social codes and behaviours, but stays throughout our lives as an important social function. Mimicry has been shown to increase empathy, liking and affiliation between the individuals, and it has been referred to as a social glue (Lakin et al, 2003) because it helps to create strong ties and relationships. In addition, mimicry has been shown to increase learning and attention in tutoring situations (Martin, 2010). This project aims to investigate fundamental co-adaptation behaviours in face-to-face human robot interaction, and collect the data and knowledge required to build social robots that are able to engage in face-to-face interaction and continuously adapt their behaviour towards that of the user.

作为人类，我们不断地调整我们的行为以适应我们所处的环境。在与其他人的交流中，我们会自动调整我们的交流方式，使之适合上下文。这种持续的适应是人类功能的内在组成部分，也是人类交际能力成功的关键因素之一。这也是目前VPAs和社交机器人中基于语音的界面所缺乏的一个方面，当人们进行面对面的交互时，会在很多方面下意识地模仿对方。我们可靠地采用我们对话者的姿势、面部表情、习性和说话风格。这种现象被称为行为模仿，在婴儿时期就出现了，是我们学习社会规范和行为的基本机制，但在我们的一生中却一直作为一种重要的社会功能存在。模仿被证明可以增加个体之间的移情、喜欢和联系，它被称为一种社会粘合剂（Lakin等人，2003），因为它有助于建立牢固的联系和关系。此外，在辅导情境中，模仿可以提高学习和注意力（Martin，2010）。该项目旨在研究面对面人机交互中的基本协同适应行为，并收集构建能够进行面对面交互并不断适应用户行为的社交机器人所需的数据和知识。

Project.Title: Lung and HIV Analytical Data Coordinating Center (LHAD-CC)

Title_Other.Title: Lung and HIV Analytical Data Coordinating Center (LHAD-CC)
肺和艾滋病分析数据协调中心

Class.ClassName: 自动化数据处理、自动化数据处理系统

Project.Abstract: DESCRIPTION (provided by applicant): The purpose of this application is to establish the Lung and HIV Analytical Data Coordinating Center (LHAD- CC) that will collaborate with the research sites funded under the companion FOA RFA-HL-13-026. Together, our sites will form a new collaborative network (HLDN). LHAD-CC will provide leadership in contributing scientific leadership and epidemiological, statistical, genetic, clinical, and basic pulmonary research expertise while providing essential support for the success of the HLDN including coordination of the research network (e.g. facilitating collaborations, arranging meetings, specimen tracking), data management for the research network (e.g. establishment of a stable and efficient web-based data management system, quality control, and data harmonization), and analytical support for collaborative projects. The specific aims of LHAD-CC are: (1) To provide scientific leadership for the HLDN in developing novel methodology; (2) To optimize the contributions of the network for HLDN in the understanding of the pathogenesis of lung disease in an era of effective treatment of HIV through collaboration and scientific partnership; (3) To coordinate research initiatives and scientific presentations; to facilitate communication amongst network investigators, Working Groups and committees; to orchestrate study protocol development; and to disseminate key scientific findings (Dossier, Archives, & Study Website); (4) To adapt, maintain, and refine our current stable and efficient web- based data management system to the needs of HLDN. We will tailor our current systems for: tracking the storage and transfer of biological specimens at a central repository, producing annual public data sets, and conducting training in methods in order to facilitate the appropriate use of study data for local research; (5 To implement a quality assurance program in partnership with the clinical sites that integrates expertise in data management, study coordination, statistical methodology, and scientific disciplines. This program will monitor study-wide quality and promote adherence and training for data collection.

说明（由申请人提供）：本申请的目的是建立肺和艾滋病毒分析数据协调中心（LHAD-CC），该中心将与FOA RFA-HL-13-026资助的研究地点合作。我们的网站将共同组成一个新的协作网络（HLDN）。LHAD-CC将在提供科学领导和流行病学、统计学、遗传学、临床和基础肺研究专业知识方面发挥领导作用，同时为HLDN的成功提供必要的支持，包括协调研究网络（例如促进合作、安排会议、标本跟踪），研究网络的数据管理（例如建立一个稳定和有效的基于网络的数据管理系统、质量控制和数据协调），以及对协作项目的分析支持。其具体目标是：（1）为HLDN开发新方法提供科学领导；（2）通过合作和科学伙伴关系，优化HLDN网络在了解有效治疗HIV时代肺部疾病发病机制方面的贡献；（3）协调研究倡议和科学演示；促进网络调查人员、工作组和委员会之间的沟通；协调研究方案的制定；传播关键的科学发现（档案、档案和研究网站）；（4）调整、维护，并根据HLDN的需求，完善了我们目前稳定高效的基于web的数据管理系统。我们将调整现有的系统，以便：跟踪生物样本在中央储存库的储存和转移情况，制作年度公共数据集，并进行方法培训，以便适当利用研究数据进行当地研究；（5）与临床站点合作实施质量保证计划，整合数据管理、研究协调、统计方法和科学学科方面的专业知识。这项计划将监测整个学习的质量，并促进数据收集的遵守和培训。

Project.Title: CAREER:Unraveling processes for vertical and lateral carbon fluxes in salt marshes: an outdoor laboratory for research and phenomena-driven education

Title_Other.Title: 职业：解开盐沼中垂直和横向碳通量的过程：研究和现象驱动教育的室外实验室
CAREER:Unraveling processes for vertical and lateral carbon fluxes in salt marshes: an outdoor laboratory for research and phenomena-driven education

Class.ClassName: 植物和森林对气候的影响

Project.Abstract: Salt marshes have the potential to store large amounts of carbon, because they are highly productive ecosystems but have low organic matter decomposition rates. Unfortunately, these ecosystems are threatened by disturbances such as sea-level rise, land-use change, nutrient runoff, and ocean acidification. Changes in the spatial and temporal dynamics of processes regulating carbon fluxes could ultimately dictate the role of these ecosystems as net sources or sinks of carbon. The project will provide new insights regarding the biological and physical processes that regulate carbon fluxes in tidal salt marshes. The project also has a significant educational component that will integrate minority Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math undergraduate and graduate students into research, educational, and outreach activities. Specifically, the project will empower underrepresented students by providing research and networking opportunities, and to enhance social capital by strengthening the network of students, science professionals, and researchers. An outdoor laboratory will be maintained at a tidal salt marsh at the St Jones Reserve in Delaware, and the carbon cycle in salt marshes will be used as the engaging phenomenon to provide real-world learning, so students can explore, examine, and use science ideas to explain the ecosystem functions of salt marshes. This project will integrate multiple sensors and techniques to better understand the processes and timescales that control carbon fluxes in salt marshes. By combining a variety of measurements such as micrometeorological techniques, near-remote sensing of canopy phenology with discrete sampling techniques of sediment and water carbon dynamics, this project tackles three interrelated research objectives. The goal is to investigate ecological processes underlying vertical and lateral carbon fluxes in salt marshes: a) assess the influence of plant phenology on ecosystem scale CO2 and CH4 fluxes, b) elucidate the role of sediment CO2 and CH4 on ecosystem fluxes, and c) determine the influence of tides (i.e., neap vs. spring tides) on vertical and lateral carbon fluxes. The project will provide educational opportunities for 8th grade students and will be aligned with the Next Generation Science Standards (NGSS). Finally, the outcomes of this project will provide a baseline for interaction with science professionals and policy makers through outreach activities in collaboration with ongoing state and national initiatives.

盐沼具有储存大量碳的潜力，因为它们是高产生态系统，但有机物分解率较低。不幸的是，这些生态系统受到诸如海平面上升、土地利用变化、养分流失和海洋酸化等干扰的威胁。调节碳通量过程的时空动态变化最终可能决定这些生态系统作为碳的净源或净汇的作用。该项目将提供有关潮汐盐沼中调节碳通量的生物和物理过程的新见解。该项目还有一个重要的教育组成部分，将少数民族科学、技术、工程和数学本科生和研究生纳入研究、教育和推广活动。具体来说，该项目将通过提供研究和建立网络的机会来增强代表性不足的学生的能力，并通过加强学生、科学专业人员和研究人员的网络来增强社会资本。在特拉华州圣琼斯保护区的潮汐盐沼将维持一个室外实验室，并将盐沼中的碳循环作为吸引人的现象，提供现实世界的学习，因此学生可以探索、检验和使用科学思想来解释盐沼的生态系统功能。该项目将集成多种传感器和技术，以更好地了解控制盐沼碳通量的过程和时间尺度。本计画将微气象技术、冠层物候之近距离遥感与沉积物及水碳动态之离散取样技术等多种测量方法结合起来，处理三个相关之研究目标。目的是研究盐沼中垂直和侧向碳通量的生态过程：a）评估植物物候学对生态系统尺度CO2和CH4通量的影响；b）阐明沉积物CO2和CH4对生态系统通量的作用；c）确定潮汐的影响（即。，小潮与大潮）对垂直和横向碳通量的影响。该项目将为八年级学生提供教育机会，并将与下一代科学标准（NGSS）保持一致。最后，该项目的成果将通过与正在进行的国家和国家倡议协作开展外联活动，为与科学专业人员和决策者的互动提供一个基线。

Project.Title: Targeting Sclerostin to Reverse Established Osteoporosis: Aptamer Characterization and Evaluation for Drug Discovery

Title_Other.Title: 以硬结蛋白为靶点逆转已建立的骨质疏松症：适体特性和药物发现评价
Targeting Sclerostin to Reverse Established Osteoporosis: Aptamer Characterization and Evaluation for Drug Discovery

Project.Title: Neighborhoods, Speech Patterns, and Schooling

Title_Other.Title: Neighborhoods, Speech Patterns, and Schooling
社区、语言模式和学校教育

Project.Abstract: DESCRIPTION (provided by applicant): This proposal requests funding to launch a research program to understand how and why speech patterns vary across neighborhoods, as well as the implications of speech for the schooling outcomes of disadvantaged children. Speech is socially constructed, and so neighborhood environments may have some effect on the use of dialects such as African-American Vernacular English (AAVE). Previous research suggests use of AAVE is negatively associated with academic achievement, which could occur if AAVE makes it more difficult to read and write standard American English (SAE), or because use of AAVE may engender discrimination from teachers. We have assembled a team of leading economists and socio-linguists to address these questions by exploiting unique new speech data collected using comparable speech measures as part of the HUD-funded Moving to Opportunity (MTO) randomized mobility experiment, and as part of a major population study, the National Longitudinal Survey of Youth, 1997 cohort (NLSY97). We request funding for the following main aims: 1. Transcribe speech samples from MTO and NLSY97, categorize speech through listener perceptions of the speaker's race, as well as linguistic analysis, which will include measurement of phonological, morphosyntactic, phonetic, and acoustic features; 2. Document the amount of across-neighborhood variation in speech that exists in the national NLSY97 sample, and determine how much of this variation is accounted for by family background; 3. Estimate the causal effects of neighborhood environments on the speech patterns of some of our nation's most disadvantaged minority children by exploiting the experimental design of MTO; 4. Use the NLSY97 to establish where in the national speech distribution MTO youth fall as a way of understanding the magnitude of speech impacts and the generalizability of the MTO results; 5. Exploit variation in MTO children's age at baseline to determine how the sensitivity of speech to environmental conditions varies by age (which has been a major question in the socio-linguistics field); 6. Determine whether the speech patterns of male and female youth respond differently to neighborhood social environments, as research in socio-linguistics suggests could be the case and which in turn could potentially explain gender differences in MTO impacts on youth found in previous MTO research; 7. Estimate non-experimentally the association between speech and schooling outcomes in the MTO and NLSY97 data, and whether speech mediates neighborhood effects on schooling; 8. Create versions of the MTO and NLSY97 datasets to be made available for secondary analysis. Successfully addressing these aims would generate new evidence about how and why speech varies across neighborhoods and the potential implications of this speech variation for schooling outcomes, and would also help motivate and guide future research that seeks to identify the causal speech-schooling link. PUBLIC HEALTH RELEVANCE: This proposal requests funding to launch a research program to understand how and why speech patterns vary across neighborhoods, as well as the implications of speech patterns for the schooling outcomes of children growing up in disadvantaged communities. Our research seeks to shed additional light on the out-of-school factors that contribute to disparities in schooling and related life outcomes across neighborhoods, which may help guide the design of new education and social policy interventions to remediate these disparities.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 说明（由申请人提供）：本提案要求资助启动一个研究项目，以了解不同社区的语言模式如何和为什么不同，以及语言对弱势儿童的教育结果的影响。言语是社会建构的，因此邻里环境可能会对非裔美国白话英语（AAVE）等方言的使用产生一定的影响。先前的研究表明，AAVE的使用与学业成绩呈负相关，如果AAVE增加了标准美国英语（SAE）的读写难度，或者AAVE的使用可能会引起教师的歧视，那么学业成绩可能会出现负相关。我们已经召集了一个由著名经济学家和社会语言学家组成的团队，通过利用独特的新语音数据来解决这些问题，这些数据是在HUD资助的移动到机会（MTO）随机迁移实验中使用可比语音测量收集的，作为一项主要的人口研究的一部分，1997年全国青年纵向调查队列（NLSY97）。我们要求为以下主要目标提供资金：1。转录来自MTO和NLSY97的语音样本，通过听者对说话者种族的感知以及语言分析对语音进行分类，包括语音、形态句法、语音和声学特征的测量；2。记录国家NLSY97样本中存在的跨邻域语音变异量，并确定有多少变异是由家庭背景造成的。利用MTO的实验设计，估计邻里环境对我国部分弱势少数民族儿童言语模式的因果影响。利用NLSY97建立青少年在全国言语分布中的位置，以此了解言语影响的程度和言语影响结果的普遍性。利用MTO儿童在基线年龄的变化来确定言语对环境条件的敏感性是如何随年龄变化的（这一直是社会语言学领域的一个主要问题）；6。确定男性和女性青年的言语模式是否对邻里社会环境有不同的反应，正如社会语言学的研究所表明的那样，这可能是事实，反过来也可能解释先前MTO研究中发现的MTO对青年影响的性别差异；7。在MTO和NLSY97数据中非实验性地估计言语与学校教育结果之间的关联，以及言语是否介导邻里关系对学校教育的影响；8。创建MTO和NLSY97数据集的版本，以便进行二次分析。成功地实现这些目标将产生新的证据，证明不同社区的语言是如何变化的，为什么会变化，以及这种语言变化对学校教育结果的潜在影响，也将有助于激励和指导未来的研究，以期找出导致语言教育的因果关系。公共卫生相关性：这项提案要求资助启动一项研究计划，以了解不同社区的语言模式如何以及为什么不同，以及语言模式对在弱势社区长大的儿童的教育结果的影响。我们的研究试图进一步阐明导致学校教育差异的校外因素和社区间相关生活结果，这可能有助于指导设计新的教育和社会政策干预措施，以弥补这些差异。

DESCRIPTION (provided by applicant): This proposal requests funding to launch a research program to understand how and why speech patterns vary across neighborhoods, as well as the implications of speech for the schooling outcomes of disadvantaged children. Speech is socially constructed, and so neighborhood environments may have some effect on the use of dialects such as African-American Vernacular English (AAVE). Previous research suggests use of AAVE is negatively associated with academic achievement, which could occur if AAVE makes it more difficult to read and write standard American English (SAE), or because use of AAVE may engender discrimination from teachers. We have assembled a team of leading economists and socio-linguists to address these questions by exploiting unique new speech data collected using comparable speech measures as part of the HUD-funded Moving to Opportunity (MTO) randomized mobility experiment, and as part of a major population study, the National Longitudinal Survey of Youth, 1997 cohort (NLSY97). We request funding for the following main aims: 1. Transcribe speech samples from MTO and NLSY97, categorize speech through listener perceptions of the speaker's race, as well as linguistic analysis, which will include measurement of phonological, morphosyntactic, phonetic, and acoustic features; 2. Document the amount of across-neighborhood variation in speech that exists in the national NLSY97 sample, and determine how much of this variation is accounted for by family background; 3. Estimate the causal effects of neighborhood environments on the speech patterns of some of our nation's most disadvantaged minority children by exploiting the experimental design of MTO; 4. Use the NLSY97 to establish where in the national speech distribution MTO youth fall as a way of understanding the magnitude of speech impacts and the generalizability of the MTO results; 5. Exploit variation in MTO children's age at baseline to determine how the sensitivity of speech to environmental conditions varies by age (which has been a major question in the socio-linguistics field); 6. Determine whether the speech patterns of male and female youth respond differently to neighborhood social environments, as research in socio-linguistics suggests could be the case and which in turn could potentially explain gender differences in MTO impacts on youth found in previous MTO research; 7. Estimate non-experimentally the association between speech and schooling outcomes in the MTO and NLSY97 data, and whether speech mediates neighborhood effects on schooling; 8. Create versions of the MTO and NLSY97 datasets to be made available for secondary analysis. Successfully addressing these aims would generate new evidence about how and why speech varies across neighborhoods and the potential implications of this speech variation for schooling outcomes, and would also help motivate and guide future research that seeks to identify the causal speech-schooling link. PUBLIC HEALTH RELEVANCE: This proposal requests funding to launch a research program to understand how and why speech patterns vary across neighborhoods, as well as the implications of speech patterns for the schooling outcomes of children growing up in disadvantaged communities. Our research seeks to shed additional light on the out-of-school factors that contribute to disparities in schooling and related life outcomes across neighborhoods, which may help guide the design of new education and social policy interventions to remediate these disparities.

Project.Title: UNCOVERING THE MOST PRIMITIVE HUMAN BLOOD STEM CELL POPULATION AND ITS ROLES IN REGENERATION

Title_Other.Title: 揭示最原始的人类造血干细胞群体及其在再生中的作用
UNCOVERING THE MOST PRIMITIVE HUMAN BLOOD STEM CELL POPULATION AND ITS ROLES IN REGENERATION

Class.ClassName: 环境污染、环境污染防治
理论、技术、方法、研究、评价、策略

Project.Abstract:
Blood is an extremely important tissue as it has a number of functions that are central to our survival such as supplying oxygen and nutrients to cells and tissues, removing waste materials, transporting hormones, transmitting messages, protecting the body from infection and foreign bodies, preventing excessive bleeding and regulating acidity levels and body temperature. In order to execute these complex functions efficiently, most of the blood components are constantly being replaced. In fact, blood is one of the most highly regenerative tissues, with approximately one trillion cells arising daily in adult human bone marrow. To maintain this staggering production of cells, the blood tissue is hierarchically organised and is sustained by few blood stem cells or "mother" of all blood cells that have the capacity to copy themselves while still contributing to the pool of different blood cells. A substantial amount of our current knowledge of the blood system has arisen from mouse studies. However, mice and humans differ in size, ecology, lifespan, and age to reproductive maturity, imposing different selective pressures in dealing with stress and ageing. Indeed, larger body size increases the regeneration demand on human stem cells. Longer lifespan in humans greatly increases the risk of accumulating deleterious damages, which imposes greater pressure on defence mechanisms. Despite the valuable contribution of laboratory mice in the understanding of blood biology, it is of utmost importance to study human blood cells due to the differences that exist between these two species.
Current laboratory methods used to identify and separate human blood stem cells are still not efficient enough to attain a pure stem cell population. Indeed, such methods isolate stem cells mixed with their progenies. This has hampered the accurate investigation on how human blood works, repairs and ages in a healthy manner or in disease condition. Using a novel and simplified method, our research team has identified a group of rare primitive blood cells that may represent the purest blood stem cell population known to date. We therefore aim to prove that indeed these newly identified primitive blood cells are truly stem cells (able to give rise to all blood cell types and to copy themselves). We will also investigate when and how these primitive cells work during blood regeneration. As stem cell transplantation is used to treat several conditions in which the bone marrow is no longer able to produce healthy blood cells, this work will have a world-leading impact on many aspects of biomedicine such as in transplantation and blood transfusion. Furthermore, as we age so do our blood cells. As ageing of blood cells is strongly linked to the decline in function of the immune system and also to the increase in cardiovascular diseases, the identification of a pure blood stem cell population will allow a proper and deeper examination of such conditions associated with ageing of the blood system. Thus, this work could have a long-lasting impact on many areas of human health.
Technical Summary Within the primitive CD34+ stem/progenitors (defined as CD34+CD38-CD45RA-) it is possible to isolate four sub-populations based on CD90 and CD49f expressions (simply as CD90+or-CD49f+or-). CD90+CD49f+ and CD90-CD49f- cells were proved to be highly enriched in HSCs and multipotent progenitors respectively. However, the CD90+CD49f+ HSC-enriched population is still heterogeneous as it contains many progenitors. We began to study the relationship between these four populations and uncovered novel findings that in addition to the CD90+CD49f+ population, the CD90-CD49f+ population also harbours long-term self-renewing HSCs and both CD49f+ populations are interchangeable and founders of all CD34+ stem/progenitors. Using scRNA-Seq in both CD49f+ cells we have identified and characterised a common sub-population with high regenerative capacity. This novel sub-population expresses endothelial protein C receptor (defined as CD34+CD38-CD45RA-EPCR+; simply CD34+EPCR+) and appears to contain all the long-term self-renewing HSCs from the two CD49f+ populations. Therefore, we propose to prove our hypothesis that CD34+EPCR+ may represent the purest human HSCs described to date. We also aim to characterise the transcriptomic network that regulates CD34+EPCR+ cells' multipotency and early cell commitment. In combination with a new xenograft model (NSG-KitW41/W41-hmSCF) we will evaluate the regeneration capacity of CD34+EPCR+ HSCs by elucidating an outstanding and crucial question in transplantation biology- if haematopoietic progenitors can sustain haematopoiesis when HSCs are no longer functional or depleted. The potential outcomes of this internationally competitive proposal not only will massively improve the frequency of human HSCs (from 1 to 10-20 cells to 1 to 2 cells) thus, matching the frequency of "pure" HSC population in mice, but it also allows the identification and precise study of HSCs from adult marrow as CD49f expression is almost negligible in bone marrow CD34+ cells.

CD90+CD49f+ and CD90-CD49f- cells were proved to be highly enriched in HSCs and multipotent progenitors respectively. However, the CD90+CD49f+ HSC-enriched population is still heterogeneous as it contains many progenitors. We began to study the relationship between these four populations and uncovered novel findings that in addition to the CD90+CD49f+ population, the CD90-CD49f+ population also harbours long-term self-renewing HSCs and both CD49f+ populations are interchangeable and founders of all CD34+ stem/progenitors. 血液是一种极其重要的组织，因为它具有许多对我们的生存至关重要的功能，如向细胞和组织提供氧气和营养、清除废物、运输激素、传递信息、保护身体免受感染和异物，防止过度出血，调节酸度和体温。为了有效地执行这些复杂的功能，大多数血液成分都在不断地被替换。事实上，血液是最具再生能力的组织之一，成人骨髓中每天大约有一万亿个细胞。为了维持这种惊人的细胞生成，血液组织是分层组织的，由很少的血干细胞或所有血液细胞的“母亲”维持，这些细胞有能力复制自己，同时仍为不同的血细胞池贡献力量。我们目前对血液系统的大量知识来自于对老鼠的研究。然而，小鼠和人类在体型、生态、寿命和生殖成熟期等方面都存在差异，在应对压力和衰老时会施加不同的选择压力。事实上，更大的体型增加了对人类干细胞的再生需求。人类寿命的延长大大增加了累积有害损伤的风险，这对防御机制造成了更大的压力。尽管实验鼠在了解血液生物学方面做出了有价值的贡献，但由于这两个物种之间存在差异，研究人类血细胞至关重要。 目前用于鉴定和分离人类造血干细胞的实验室方法仍不足以获得纯干细胞群。事实上，这样的方法可以分离出与其后代混合的干细胞。这妨碍了对人类血液如何以健康的方式或在疾病状态下工作、修复和老化的准确调查。我们的研究团队使用一种新颖而简单的方法，鉴定出了一组稀有的原始血细胞，它们可能代表了迄今为止已知的最纯的造血干细胞群体。因此，我们的目的是证明这些新鉴定的原始血细胞确实是干细胞（能够产生所有类型的血细胞并复制它们自己）。我们还将研究这些原始细胞在血液再生过程中的工作时间和方式。由于干细胞移植用于治疗骨髓不再能够产生健康血细胞的几种情况，这项工作将在移植和输血等生物医学的许多方面产生世界领先的影响。此外，随着年龄的增长，我们的血细胞也会变老。由于血细胞的老化与免疫系统功能的下降以及心血管疾病的增加有着密切的联系，因此，鉴定纯血干细胞群将有助于对与血液系统老化有关的此类情况进行适当和深入的检查。因此，这项工作可能对人类健康的许多领域产生长期影响。 技术总结 在原始CD34+干/祖细胞（定义为CD34+CD38-CD45RA-）中，可以根据CD90和CD49f的表达（简单地说为CD90+或-CD49f+或-）分离出四个亚群。CD90+CD49f+和CD90-CD49f-细胞分别在HSCs和多能干细胞中高度富集。然而，由于CD90+CD49f+HSC中含有大量的前体细胞，因此CD90+CD49f+HSC富集群体仍然是异质的。我们开始研究这四个群体之间的关系，发现除了CD90+CD49f+群体外，CD90-CD49f+群体还具有长期自我更新的hsc，CD49f+群体是可互换的，是所有CD34+干/祖细胞的奠基人。利用两个CD49f+细胞中的scRNA-Seq，我们鉴定并鉴定了一个具有高再生能力的普通亚群。这个新的亚群表达内皮蛋白C受体（定义为CD34+CD38-CD45RA-EPCR+；简单地说是CD34+EPCR+），并且似乎包含来自两个CD49f+群的所有长期自我更新hsc。因此，我们建议证明我们的假设，CD34+EPCR+可能代表迄今为止所描述的最纯粹的人类hsc。我们还旨在描述调节CD34+EPCR+细胞多能性和早期细胞承诺的转录网络。结合新的异种移植模型（NSG-KitW41/W41 hmSCF），我们将评估

Project.Title: Upgrade of Data Acquisition and Processing Systems for two High Resolution and One ESI Mass Spectrometers

Title_Other.Title: 两台高分辨率和一台ESI质谱仪数据采集和处理系统的升级
Upgrade of Data Acquisition and Processing Systems for two High Resolution and One ESI Mass Spectrometers

Project.Abstract: This award from the Chemistry Research Instrumentation and Facilities Program will assist faculty in the Department of Chemistry at Texas A&M University to upgrade the Data Acquisition and Processing Systems for two High Resolution and one ESI Mass Spectrometers. The mass spectrometers will support research projects focused on the generation of synthetic peptides, screening of combinatorial peptide libraries, characterization of synthetic mimics for beta sheet initiation, synthesis of organometallics to mimic enzyme containing metal active sites, selective alkylation of cysteine containing proteins and peptides by alkylphenols, synthesis of complex natural products, characterization of bioremediation proteins, metal-ligand complexation, and genetically engineered synthesis of vitamin B12. Mass spectrometry (MS) is a technique used to probe intimate structural details and to obtain the molecular compositions of a vast array of organic, bioorganic, and organometallic molecules. The addition of the technique of electrospray extends the range of MS to protein and nucleic acid molecular weights far beyond any other technique. The use of electrospray ionization in combination with high resolution provides the latest technique available in mass spectrometry. It affords the chemist one of the most powerful tools available for the characterization of compounds. The acquisition of this capability in mass spectrometry is essential for the prosecution of frontier research in many fields of chemistry.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 这项来自化学研究仪器和设施项目的奖励将帮助德克萨斯A&M大学化学系的教员升级两台高分辨率和一台ESI质谱仪的数据采集和处理系统。质谱仪将支持研究项目，重点是合成肽的产生、组合肽库的筛选、β片起始合成模拟物的表征、模拟含金属酶活性位点的有机金属化合物的合成，烷基酚选择性烷基化含半胱氨酸的蛋白质和多肽，合成复杂的天然产物，生物修复蛋白的表征，金属配体络合，以及维生素B12的基因工程合成。质谱法（MS）是一种用来探测密切的结构细节和获得大量有机、生物有机和有机金属分子的分子组成的技术。电喷雾技术的加入将质谱的范围扩大到蛋白质和核酸的分子量，远远超过任何其他技术。电喷雾电离结合高分辨率的应用为质谱分析提供了最新技术。它为化学家提供了一个最强大的工具来表征化合物。在质谱学中获得这种能力对于许多化学领域前沿研究的开展是至关重要的。

Project.Title: Collaborative Research: Worker Insecurity and the Institutionalization of Part-Time Work

Title_Other.Title: Collaborative Research: Worker Insecurity and the Institutionalization of Part-Time Work
协同研究：工人不安全感与兼职制度化

Project.Abstract: SES-1324000 PI: Andrew Fullerton Oklahoma State University SES-1324019 PI: Jeffrey Dixon Holy Cross College Part-time work is an important potential source of insecurity that workers around the world face, but it is understudied in the context of worker insecurity, partly because of the cross-national variation in the meanings and measurements of part-time work. This project examines the relationship between part-time work and several forms of perceived worker insecurity, including the perceived threat of job loss in the near future, worries about the threat of job loss, and the perceived difficulty of finding a comparable job in the labor market. Focusing on multiple levels of analysis, this project asks: Do part-time workers feel more insecure than full-time workers? Does this vary by country? At the country level, what is the relationship between the size of the part-time workforce and average levels of insecurity? Based on individual-level data from the 2005 International Social Survey Program (ISSP) Work Orientations III module linked to macro-level data, preliminary results reveal that workers in part-time jobs feel more insecure than workers in full-time jobs, all else equal. However, the size of the part-time gap in worker insecurity varies substantially across countries, and countries with higher rates of part-time work tend to have lower levels of average worker insecurity. To account for these seemingly contradictory findings, the investigators develop a model of the "institutionalization of part-time work," which refers to the creation and perpetuation of scripts and shared rules that guide decisions and actions regarding employers' use of part-time work. Using this framework, the research hypothesizes that the gap in perceived worker insecurity between part-time and full-time workers will be smallest in countries in which part-time work has been institutionalized to such a degree that: A) a substantial number of men work part-time (even if most part-time workers are women), B) part-time workers have the same legal protections and benefits as full-time workers, C) most part-time workers are employed in those positions voluntarily, and D) part-time work is not concentrated in low-wage occupations. This model will be tested with ISSP and other survey data linked to macro-level data, including a country-level dataset that will contain aggregate measures of part-time work and other labor market characteristics for more than 50 countries and several time points between 2000 and 2010. Broader Impacts The knowledge gained from this study about the sources of perceived worker insecurity has important implications for scholars and policy makers concerned with the consequences of part-time and other forms of non-standard work on workers' health, families, and communities. The results will also bear on debates about "flexicurity" policies in parts of Europe, which are intended to reconcile employer preferences for flexible work arrangements (such as part-time work) with employment security for workers. Furthermore, the new country-level dataset will be made available to interested scholars, teachers, and researchers to examine part-time work and other types of non-standard work. These data can also be supplemented with other macro- or micro-level data to examine other socioeconomic outcomes. Additionally, this project will involve undergraduate and graduate students who have an interest in quantitative methods of research, comparative sociology, and work and occupations, and the researchers will seek assistants who will help in each stage of this project and gain valuable research skills as a result. Finally, the principal investigators will produce several presentations and scholarly publications based on this project.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: SES-1324000 PI: Andrew Fullerton Oklahoma State University SES-1324019 PI: Jeffrey Dixon Holy Cross College Part-time work is an important potential source of insecurity that workers around the world face, but it is understudied in the context of worker insecurity, partly because of the cross-national variation in the meanings and measurements of part-time work. This project examines the relationship between part-time work and several forms of perceived worker insecurity, including the perceived threat of job loss in the near future, worries about the threat of job loss, and the perceived difficulty of finding a comparable job in the labor market. Focusing on multiple levels of analysis, this project asks: Do part-time workers feel more insecure than full-time workers? Does this vary by country? At the country level, what is the relationship between the size of the part-time workforce and average levels of insecurity? Based on individual-level data from the 2005 International Social Survey Program (ISSP) Work Orientations III module linked to macro-level data, preliminary results reveal that workers in part-time jobs feel more insecure than workers in full-time jobs, all else equal. However, the size of the part-time gap in worker insecurity varies substantially across countries, and countries with higher rates of part-time work tend to have lower levels of average worker insecurity. To account for these seemingly contradictory findings, the investigators develop a model of the "institutionalization of part-time work," which refers to the creation and perpetuation of scripts and shared rules that guide decisions and actions regarding employers' use of part-time work. Using this framework, the research hypothesizes that the gap in perceived worker insecurity between part-time and full-time workers will be smallest in countries in which part-time work has been institutionalized to such a degree that: A) a substantial number of men work part-time (even if most part-time workers are women), B) part-time workers have the same legal protections and benefits as full-time workers, C) most part-time workers are employed in those positions voluntarily, and D) part-time work is not concentrated in low-wage occupations. This model will be tested with ISSP and other survey data linked to macro-level data, including a country-level dataset that will contain aggregate measures of part-time work and other labor market characteristics for more than 50 countries and several time points between 2000 and 2010. Broader Impacts The knowledge gained from this study about the sources of perceived worker insecurity has important implications for scholars and policy makers concerned with the consequences of part-time and other forms of non-standard work on workers' health, families, and communities. The results will also bear on debates about "flexicurity" policies in parts of Europe, which are intended to reconcile employer preferences for flexible work arrangements (such as part-time work) with employment security for workers. Furthermore, the new country-level dataset will be made available to interested scholars, teachers, and researchers to examine part-time work and other types of non-standard work. These data can also be supplemented with other macro- or micro-level data to examine other socioeconomic outcomes. Additionally, this project will involve undergraduate and graduate students who have an interest in quantitative methods of research, comparative sociology, and work and occupations, and the researchers will seek assistants who will help in each stage of this project and gain valuable research skills as a result. Finally, the principal investigators will produce several presentations and scholarly publications based on this project.

SES-1324000 PI:Andrew Fullerton Oklahoma州立大学SES-1324019 PI:Jeffrey Dixon Holy Cross College兼职工作是世界各地工人面临的一个重要的潜在不安全源，但在工人不安全的背景下，这一点还未被充分研究，部分原因是在以下方面的含义和测量值存在跨国差异：兼职工作。该项目研究了非全日制工作与几种感知到的工人不安全感之间的关系，包括感知到的近期失业威胁、对失业威胁的担忧以及在劳动力市场上寻找可比工作的感知困难。该项目关注多个层面的分析，问：兼职员工是否比全职员工感到更不安全？这是否因国家而异？在国家一级，非全日制劳动力的规模与平均不安全水平之间有什么关系？根据2005年国际社会调查计划（ISSP）工作方向III模块中与宏观数据相关的个人层面数据，初步结果显示，从事兼职工作的工人比从事全职工作的工人感到更不安全，其他方面都是平等的。然而，各国工人不安全感的非全日制差距的大小差别很大，非全日制工作率较高的国家，工人的平均不安全感往往较低。为了解释这些看似矛盾的调查结果，调查人员建立了一个“兼职制度化”的模式，即创造和延续指导雇主使用兼职的决定和行动的脚本和共同规则。利用这一框架，研究假设，在非全日制工作制度化程度达到以下程度的国家，非全日制工人和全日制工人在工人不安全感方面的差距最小：a）相当多的男子从事非全日制工作（即使大多数非全日制工人是妇女），B） 非全日制工人与全日制工人享有同样的法律保护和福利，C）大多数非全日制工人自愿受雇于这些职位，D）非全日制工作不集中于低工资职业。这一模型将通过国际社会服务计划和其他与宏观数据挂钩的调查数据进行检验，包括一个国家一级的数据集，该数据集将包含2000年至2010年期间50多个国家和几个时间点的非全日制工作和其他劳动力市场特征的综合衡量。从这项研究中获得的关于工人不安全感来源的知识对关注兼职和其他形式的非标准工作对工人健康、家庭和社区的影响的学者和决策者具有重要影响。这一结果还将影响到欧洲部分地区有关“灵活保障”政策的辩论，这些政策旨在协调雇主对灵活工作安排（如兼职）的偏好与工人的就业保障。此外，新的国家一级数据集将提供给感兴趣的学者、教师和研究人员，以审查兼职工作和其他类型的非标准工作。这些数据还可以与其他宏观或微观数据相补充，以检查其他社会经济结果。此外，该项目还将涉及对定量研究方法、比较社会学、工作和职业感兴趣的本科生和研究生，研究人员将寻求助手，在项目的每个阶段提供帮助，并因此获得宝贵的研究技能。最后，主要调查人员将根据这个项目制作几篇报告和学术出版物。

Source.Name: Directorate for Social, Behavioral & Economic Sciences

Project.Title: CALCIUM PRIMARY CELLS WITH IMPROVED ANODE STABILITY AND ENERGY DENSITY

Title_Other.Title: CALCIUM PRIMARY CELLS WITH IMPROVED ANODE STABILITY AND ENERGY DENSITY
提高阳极稳定性和能量密度的钙原电池

Class.ClassName: 非金属元素、非金属元素化合物

Project.Abstract: THE GOALS OF THE PROGRAM ARE TO DECREASE ANODE CORROSION AND DISCHARGE OVER-POTENTIAL, AND TO INCREASE THE CAPACITY OF CALCIUM SOLUBLE CATHODE PRIMARY CELLS, BY USING A NOVEL SULFUR DIOXIDE BASED ELECTROLYTE. IN THE PRESENCE OF CALCIUM IONS AND THE NEW ELECTROLYTE, SULFUR DIOXIDE WAS REDUCED ON CARBON IN EXPERIMENTAL CELLS TO CALCIUM SULFIDE, NOT CALCIUM DITHIONITE. ONE CERTAIN ADVANTAGE IS THAT TWO EQUIVALENTS ARE OBTAINED PER MOLE OF SULFUR DIOXIDE INSTEAD OF ONE, AS IN THE LI/SO2 PRIMARY CELL. WE PROPOSE TO DETERMINE WHETHER D SIZE PROTOTYPE CALCIUM CELLS WITH SUPERIOR CAPACITY CAN BE CONSTRUCTED. THE CAC12 FILM HAS BEEN BLAMED FOR THE CORROSION AND POLARIZATION OF THE ANODES IN CALCIUM/OXYHALIDE CELLS, SINCE CAC12 IS AN ANION CONDUCTOR, NOT A CATION CONDUCTOR AS IS THE SALT FILM ON LITHIUM ANODES IN LITHIUM CELLS. IF THE SALT FILM ON CALCIUM IN THE NEW ELECTROLYTE IS ALSO CAS, WHICH IS A CATION CONDUCTOR, THEN CALCIUM ANODES MAY DISCHARGE BY THE SAME MECHANISM WHICH ALLOWS LITHIUM ANODES TO DISCHARGE EFFICIENTLY. USING PROTOTYPE D CELLS AND THE NEW ELECTROLYTE, WE PROPOSE TO DETERMINE WHETHER CALCIUM CORROSION AND POLARIZATION CAN BE REDUCED.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 该方案的目标是通过使用一种新型的二氧化硫基电解液，减少阳极腐蚀和放电过电位，提高钙溶性阴极原电池的容量。在钙离子和新电解液存在下，实验细胞内二氧化硫在碳上还原为硫化钙，而不是连二亚硫酸钙。一个特定的优点是每摩尔二氧化硫获得两个当量，而不是一个当量，如在LI/SO2一次电池中。我们建议确定是否可以构建具有高容量的D大小的原型钙细胞。由于CAC12是一种负离子导体，而不是锂电池中锂阳极上的盐膜，因此CAC12膜被认为是钙/氧卤电池中阳极腐蚀和极化的原因。如果新电解液中钙上的盐膜也是作为阳离子导体的CAS，则钙阳极可以通过相同的机制放电，从而使锂阳极能够有效地放电。利用原型D电池和新的电解液，我们提出确定是否可以减少钙腐蚀和极化。

THE GOALS OF THE PROGRAM ARE TO DECREASE ANODE CORROSION AND DISCHARGE OVER-POTENTIAL, AND TO INCREASE THE CAPACITY OF CALCIUM SOLUBLE CATHODE PRIMARY CELLS, BY USING A NOVEL SULFUR DIOXIDE BASED ELECTROLYTE. IN THE PRESENCE OF CALCIUM IONS AND THE NEW ELECTROLYTE, SULFUR DIOXIDE WAS REDUCED ON CARBON IN EXPERIMENTAL CELLS TO CALCIUM SULFIDE, NOT CALCIUM DITHIONITE. ONE CERTAIN ADVANTAGE IS THAT TWO EQUIVALENTS ARE OBTAINED PER MOLE OF SULFUR DIOXIDE INSTEAD OF ONE, AS IN THE LI/SO2 PRIMARY CELL. WE PROPOSE TO DETERMINE WHETHER D SIZE PROTOTYPE CALCIUM CELLS WITH SUPERIOR CAPACITY CAN BE CONSTRUCTED. THE CAC12 FILM HAS BEEN BLAMED FOR THE CORROSION AND POLARIZATION OF THE ANODES IN CALCIUM/OXYHALIDE CELLS, SINCE CAC12 IS AN ANION CONDUCTOR, NOT A CATION CONDUCTOR AS IS THE SALT FILM ON LITHIUM ANODES IN LITHIUM CELLS. IF THE SALT FILM ON CALCIUM IN THE NEW ELECTROLYTE IS ALSO CAS, WHICH IS A CATION CONDUCTOR, THEN CALCIUM ANODES MAY DISCHARGE BY THE SAME MECHANISM WHICH ALLOWS LITHIUM ANODES TO DISCHARGE EFFICIENTLY. USING PROTOTYPE D CELLS AND THE NEW ELECTROLYTE, WE PROPOSE TO DETERMINE WHETHER CALCIUM CORROSION AND POLARIZATION CAN BE REDUCED.

Source.Name: United States Department of the Navy

Project.Title: Infrastrukturtiltak v/NLH

Title_Other.Title: Infrastrukturtiltak v/NLH
基础设施方法v/NLH

Project.Abstract: Main objectives for 2004: to encourage and bring into ideas with high potential for value creation from scientists and specialists. The focus will be directed at research institutes and research groups where the value creation potential is highest. Business office will together with Bioparken engage in active outreach work against these institutes / research groups / researchers. It will also seek to strengthen the commercialization efforts in the Aquaculture Protein Centre (APC) and the Centre for Integrated Genetics (CIGENE). NLH will work closely with institutes and centers to help create a positive attitude towards entrepreneurship and commercialization of research. Particular attention will be directed towards creating and developing network and cooperation with national and international business. NLH will develop a professional device for inside pickup, assessment and investment in business ideas from research in close cooperation with Bioparken and network of resource persons internally and externally. Bioparken and NLH have submitted their joint application for project funding for RENEW. The application is sent from Biopark.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: Hovedmål for 2004: å stimulere til og hente inn i ideer med høyt verdiskapingspotensial fra forskere og fagmiljøer. Fokus vil være rettet mot institutter og forskergrupper der verdiskapingspotensialet er høyest. Næringslivskontoret vil sammen med Bioparken drive aktivt oppsøkende arbeid mot disse instituttene/forskergruppene/forskerne. Man vil samtidig søke å styrke kommersialiseringsarbeidet i Aquaculture Protein Centre (APC) og Centre for Integrated Genetics (CIGENE). NLH vil arbeide tett med institutter og sentre for å bidra til å skape en positiv holding til entreprenørskap og kommersialisering av forskning. Særskilt oppmerksomhet vil være rettet mot å skape og videreutvikle nettverk og samarbeid med nasjonalt og internasjonalt næringsliv. NLH vil videreutvikle et profesjonelt apparat for innehenting, vurdering og investering i forretningsideer fra forskningen i nært samarbeid med Bioparken og nettverk av ressurspersoner internt og eksternt. Bioparken og NLH har sendt inn egen felles søknad om prosjektmidler til FORNY. Søknaden er sendt fra Bioparken.

2004年的主要目标：鼓励和引进科学家和专家提出的具有创造价值潜力的想法。重点将放在价值创造潜力最大的研究机构和研究小组。商务处将与生物市场部一起积极开展针对这些机构/研究小组/研究人员的外联工作。它还将设法加强水产养殖蛋白质中心（APC）和综合遗传学中心（CIGENE）的商业化努力。NLH将与各研究所和中心密切合作，帮助建立一种积极的态度，对创业精神和商业化的研究。将特别注意建立和发展与国内和国际商业的网络和合作。NLH将与Bioparken和内部及外部资源人员网络密切合作，开发一种专业的设备，用于从研究中获取、评估和投资商业理念。Bioparken和NLH已经提交了续签项目资金的联合申请。申请表由Biopark寄出。

Project.Title: The International & Humanitarian Law Library - A global dimension in Australian legal research infrastructure

Title_Other.Title: 国际和人道主义法图书馆——澳大利亚法律研究基础设施的全球层面
The International & Humanitarian Law Library - A global dimension in Australian legal research infrastructure

Project.Abstract: All researchers in international and humanitarian law in Australian Law Schools will use this infrastructure to improve their research. So will similar researchers from Universities worldwide, enhancing Australia's reputation in this field. Australia's Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade, and other government agencies involved in international law, co-operation and trade, will obtain similar benefits from resources not available within government, assisting the Australian Government's moves toward greater involvement in international institutions. Researchers from non-government organisations with international engagements will benefit from free access, as will all Australians who wish to better inform themselves in these fields.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 澳大利亚法学院的所有国际法和人道主义法研究人员都将利用这一基础设施改进他们的研究。来自世界各地大学的类似研究人员也将如此，从而提高澳大利亚在这一领域的声誉。澳大利亚外交和贸易部以及其他参与国际法、合作和贸易的政府机构将从政府内部无法获得的资源中获得类似的好处，协助澳大利亚政府进一步参与国际机构。参与国际活动的非政府组织的研究人员将受益于自由进入，所有希望在这些领域更好地了解自己的澳大利亚人也将受益。

All researchers in international and humanitarian law in Australian Law Schools will use this infrastructure to improve their research. So will similar researchers from Universities worldwide, enhancing Australia's reputation in this field. Australia's Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade, and other government agencies involved in international law, co-operation and trade, will obtain similar benefits from resources not available within government, assisting the Australian Government's moves toward greater involvement in international institutions. Researchers from non-government organisations with international engagements will benefit from free access, as will all Australians who wish to better inform themselves in these fields.
