加拿大卫生部建议在婴儿出生后的前六个月采用纯母乳喂养，因为已知母乳喂养对婴儿和母亲的健康有益（如营养、免疫和发育）。这导致许多医院采用了循证的、得到国际认可的婴儿友好倡议（BFI），该倡议已被证明提高了纯母乳喂养率。然而，在高病床占用率期间，BFI的成功可能会受到危害。由于对妇产单位的普查不断变动，非妇产病人（非服务性）占用床位的情况越来越普遍。产房的非服务性病人在分娩后的头24小时内，当有效的母乳喂养措施建立起来时，可能会将护理工作从新妈妈身上转移开。需要进行研究，以检查出院时非服务患者对纯母乳喂养率的影响。利用来自新不伦瑞克省三个妇产部门的健康记录数据，我将研究系统级因素的影响（即。，考虑到母亲（如以前的母乳喂养、分娩方式）和婴儿（如妊娠周、第一小时内与母亲皮肤接触）的特点后，出院时纯母乳喂养的可能性的医院入住率和前24小时的非服务患者人数。我提议，当更多的非服务性病人在产科病房时，纯母乳喂养的可能性将降低。调查结果将为针对纯母乳喂养的卫生政策提供依据，这一点很重要，因为目前只有不到14%的加拿大母亲符合加拿大卫生部的建议。研究结果将有助于了解非服务的患者对纯母乳喂养的影响，并为今后研究改变保健分娩方式对母婴结局的影响提供基础。

Project.Title: Hybrid hybrid matrices and signal processing techniques for monitoring the air quality in relation to atmospheric pollutants and olfactory harassment.

Title_Other.Title: 混合混合矩阵和信号处理技术，用于监测与大气污染物和嗅觉骚扰有关的空气质量。
Matrici ibride di sensori e tecniche di elaborazione dei segnali per il monitoraggio della qualita' dell'aria in relazione ad inquinanti atmosferici e a molestie olfattive.

Class.ClassName: 脂肪族醛和酮（羰基化合物）及其衍生物的生产

Project.Abstract: This program aims to study, develop and characterize experimentally hybrid matrices of solid-state gas and vapor sensors that have the advantage of the combined use of devices with diversified and complementary transduction mechanisms, technologies and spectrum response, specifically: (A) gravimetric sensors in film technology often with polymer coatings B) semiconductor metal oxide sensors in thin film technology For sensors of the type a) it is expected to investigate the possibility of simultaneously measuring the electrical impedance of the polymeric coating in addition to its mass, to obtain intrinsically multiparametric sensors. The matrices will be flanked by electronic circuits of multi-component conditioning and processing of signals, and by intelligence techniques Artificial for extraction and synthesis of information from the measurement data complexity. The research will focus on the detection of the most common atmospheric pollutants such as CO, NOX, O3, SO2 and volatile organic compounds (VOCs) (with reference to the dictates of current legislation), and the principal compounds responsible for olfactory harassment such as H2S, Mercaptans, NH 3 and amines, thiols, aromatic compounds including phenols, volatile fatty acids, acetaldehyde and some ketones such as butanone. For compounds that need to be found at concentrations of the ppb order (parts per billion), it is expected to improve the minimum sensitivity detection threshold by using known pre-treatment techniques, such as accumulation and preconcentration columns, Optimized for the various compounds to be analyzed. The expected result of the research is to identify and develop components and procedures that can form the basis for the subsequent development of a modular system of air quality monitoring distributed in the territory that can overcome the cost limitations And bulk Of the analytical instrumentation currently in use for pollutants and Provide a concrete alternative to the olfattometric panels for harassment olfactory.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: Il presente programma si pone l'obiettivo di studiare, sviluppare e caratterizzare sperimentalmente matrici ibride di sensori a stato solido per gas e vapori che presentano il vantaggio dell'uso combinato di dispositivi con meccanismi di trasduzione, tecnologie e spettri di risposta diversificati e complementari, specificamente: a) sensori gravimetrici in tecnologia a film spesso con rivestimenti polimerici b) sensori ad ossidi metallici semiconduttori in tecnologia a film sottile Per i sensori del tipo a) Ã¨ previsto di investigare la possibilit di misurare simultaneamente l'impedenza elettrica del rivestimento polimerico oltre alla sua massa, per ottenere sensori intrinsecamente multiparametrici. Le matrici saranno affiancate da circuiti elettronici di condizionamento ed elaborazione multicomponente dei segnali, e da tecniche di intelligenza artificiale per l'estrazione e la sintesi dell'informazione dalla complessit dei dati di misura. La ricerca sar diretta alla rilevazione dei piÃ¹ comuni inquinanti atmosferici, quali CO, NOX, O3, SO2 e composti organici volatili (VOC) (in riferimento ai dettami delle norme legislative vigenti), e dei principali composti responsabili di molestie olfattive, quali H2S, mercaptani, NH3 ed ammine, tioli, aromatici inclusi i fenoli, acidi grassi volatili, acetaldeide ed alcuni chetoni quali butanone. Per i composti che Ã¨ necessario individuare a concentrazioni dell'ordine del ppb (parti per miliardo) Ã¨ previsto di migliorare la soglia minima di rilevabilit dei sensori mediante l'utilizzo di tecniche note di pretrattamento, quali le colonne di accumulo e preconcentrazione, ottimizzate per i diversi composti da analizzare. Il risultato atteso della ricerca Ã¨ individuare e mettere a punto componenti e procedure che possano costituire gli elementi base per il successivo sviluppo di un sistema modulare di monitoraggio della qualit dell'aria distribuito sul territorio, in grado di superare le limitazioni in termini di costo e ingombro della strumentazione analitica attualmente in uso per gli inquinanti e di fornire una concreta alternativa ai panel olfattometrici per le molestie olfattive.

本项目旨在研究、开发和表征固态气体和蒸汽传感器的实验混合矩阵，这些混合矩阵具有多种互补的传导机制、技术和光谱响应装置的组合使用优势，具体如下： （A）薄膜技术中的重量传感器，通常带有聚合物涂层 b）薄膜技术中的半导体金属氧化物传感器 对于a）型传感器，除质量外，还应研究同时测量聚合物涂层电阻的可能性，以获得本质上的多参数传感器。 矩阵的两侧将有多分量调节和信号处理的电子电路，以及智能技术 人工提取和合成信息，从测量数据的复杂性。 这项研究的重点是检测最常见的大气污染物，如一氧化碳、氮氧化物、臭氧、二氧化硫和挥发性有机化合物（VOCs）（参照现行法规），以及引起嗅觉骚扰的主要化合物，如H2S、硫醇、NH3和胺、硫醇，芳香族化合物包括酚类、挥发性脂肪酸、乙醛和一些酮，如丁酮。对于需要在ppb级（十亿分之一）浓度下发现的化合物，通过使用已知的预处理技术（如积累柱和预浓缩柱）来提高最低灵敏度检测阈值，并针对待分析的各种化合物进行优化。 这项研究的预期结果是确定和发展组成部分和程序，为随后发展一个分布在该地区的模块化空气质量监测系统奠定基础，该系统可克服成本限制和体积 目前用于污染物和 为骚扰提供一个具体的替代olfattmetric面板 嗅觉。

Source.Name: Ministry of Education, Universities and Research

Project.Title: BI-METALLIC SELF-FORGING FRAGMENT (SFF) WARHEAD FOR ENHANCED BEHIND-ARMOR EFFECTS

Title_Other.Title: BI-METALLIC SELF-FORGING FRAGMENT (SFF) WARHEAD FOR ENHANCED BEHIND-ARMOR EFFECTS
增强后装甲效应的双金属自锻破片战斗部

Class.ClassName: 特种武器、特种武器防护设备

Project.Abstract: THE LETHALITY OF ANY DIRECTED-ENERGY WARHEAD IS MEASURED BY ITS ABILITY TO CAUSE IRREPARABLE DAMAGE TO THE VULNERABLE COMPONENTS THAT EXIST BEHIND THE PROTECTIVE ARMOR. THIS DAMAGE IS INCURRED BY THE IMPACT OF THESE COMPONENTS BY EITHER THE PENETRATOR MATERIAL ITSELF OR BY TARGET SPALL MATERIAL GENERATED BY THE INTERACTION OF THE PENETRATOR AND PROTECTIVE ARMOR. SIGNIFICANT IMPROVEMENT IN LETHALITY CAN BE ATTAINED BY THE INCLUSION OF A PYROPHORIC OR INCENDIARY MATERIAL IN THE ATTACKING PENETRATOR. THIS MATERIAL, UPON IMPACT, HAS BEEN SHOWN TO PRODUCE OVERPRESSURE AND THE EXISTANCE OF A THERMAL PULSE WITHIN INTERIOR VEHICLE COMPARTMENTS. ONE PROMISING CONCEPT IS THE INCLUSION OF SUCH AN ENERGETIC MATERIAL IN A "FOLLOWTHROUGH" SELF-FORGING FRAGMENT (SFF) PENETRATOR.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 任何直接能量战斗部的致命性都是通过它对防护装甲背后的脆弱部件造成无法弥补的损害来衡量的。这种损伤是由于这些部件受到穿甲弹材料本身的冲击或由穿甲弹和防护装甲相互作用产生的目标层裂材料造成的。通过在攻击性穿甲弹中加入自燃或燃烧材料，可以显著提高杀伤力。这种材料在撞击时已经显示出产生超压，并且在车厢内部车厢内存在热脉冲。一个有希望的概念是将这种高能材料包含在一个“后继”自锻破片（SFF）穿甲弹中。

THE LETHALITY OF ANY DIRECTED-ENERGY WARHEAD IS MEASURED BY ITS ABILITY TO CAUSE IRREPARABLE DAMAGE TO THE VULNERABLE COMPONENTS THAT EXIST BEHIND THE PROTECTIVE ARMOR. THIS DAMAGE IS INCURRED BY THE IMPACT OF THESE COMPONENTS BY EITHER THE PENETRATOR MATERIAL ITSELF OR BY TARGET SPALL MATERIAL GENERATED BY THE INTERACTION OF THE PENETRATOR AND PROTECTIVE ARMOR. SIGNIFICANT IMPROVEMENT IN LETHALITY CAN BE ATTAINED BY THE INCLUSION OF A PYROPHORIC OR INCENDIARY MATERIAL IN THE ATTACKING PENETRATOR. THIS MATERIAL, UPON IMPACT, HAS BEEN SHOWN TO PRODUCE OVERPRESSURE AND THE EXISTANCE OF A THERMAL PULSE WITHIN INTERIOR VEHICLE COMPARTMENTS. ONE PROMISING CONCEPT IS THE INCLUSION OF SUCH AN ENERGETIC MATERIAL IN A "FOLLOWTHROUGH" SELF-FORGING FRAGMENT (SFF) PENETRATOR.

Project.Title: A Novel Systemic and Mucosal Adjuvant for Biodefense

Title_Other.Title: 一种新型的全身黏膜生物防御佐剂
A Novel Systemic and Mucosal Adjuvant for Biodefense

Project.Abstract: DESCRIPTION (provided by applicant): The importance of the innate immune response as both the first line of defense against infection and a powerful trigger of adaptive immunity, and the definition of signaling pathways involved with this response, have led to intense testing of individual members of these pathways as molecular adjuvants. However, in the case of viral infection, the complete innate immune response is triggered by the presence of viral particles and their constituent components. Our approach is based on the idea that the viral particle itself, if it could be made safe and applicable to a wide range of vaccine modalities, would be a broad and effective inducer of innate immunity, in other words, an excellent adjuvant. Our studies to date indicate that propagation-defective Venezuelan equine encephalitis virus (VEE) replicon particles safely exhibit potent systemic and mucosal adjuvant activity when administered with subunit or inactivated vaccines. To build on these results with the goal of producing a safe and effective second generation adjuvant for biodefense, we propose the following four aims: Aim 1 - to further define VEE adjuvant activity in mice;Aim 2 - with our collaborators, to test adjuvant activity for specific biodefense vaccines, including avian influenza, poxviruses, Rift Valley Fever virus, Guanarito and Junin hemorrhagic fever viruses, and F. tularensis;Aim 3 - in collaboration with the Center for Comparative Medicine at U.C.-Davis, to determine the level of adjuvant activity in primates;and Aim 4 - to develop a scalable manufacturing process for adjuvant production.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 描述（由申请人提供）：先天性免疫应答作为抵抗感染的第一道防线和适应性免疫的强大触发因素的重要性，以及与此应答相关的信号通路的定义，导致了对这些通路的单个成员作为分子佐剂的强烈测试。然而，在病毒感染的情况下，完全的天然免疫反应是由病毒颗粒及其组成成分的存在触发的。我们的方法是基于这样的想法，即病毒颗粒本身，如果能够使其安全并适用于广泛的疫苗模式，将是天然免疫的广泛而有效的诱导物，换句话说，是一种极好的佐剂。迄今为止，我们的研究表明，委内瑞拉马脑炎病毒（VEE）复制子颗粒在接种亚单位或灭活疫苗时，安全地表现出强大的全身和粘膜佐剂活性。为了建立在这些结果的基础上，以生产安全有效的第二代生物防御佐剂为目标，我们提出以下四个目标：目标1-进一步定义小鼠的VEE佐剂活性；目标2-与我们的合作者一起，测试特定生物防御疫苗的佐剂活性，包括禽流感、痘病毒，裂谷热病毒、瓜那里奥和朱宁出血热病毒以及图拉伦西斯菌；目标3-与加州大学戴维斯分校比较医学中心合作，确定灵长类动物佐剂活性水平；目标4-开发可扩展的佐剂生产工艺。

DESCRIPTION (provided by applicant): The importance of the innate immune response as both the first line of defense against infection and a powerful trigger of adaptive immunity, and the definition of signaling pathways involved with this response, have led to intense testing of individual members of these pathways as molecular adjuvants. However, in the case of viral infection, the complete innate immune response is triggered by the presence of viral particles and their constituent components. Our approach is based on the idea that the viral particle itself, if it could be made safe and applicable to a wide range of vaccine modalities, would be a broad and effective inducer of innate immunity, in other words, an excellent adjuvant. Our studies to date indicate that propagation-defective Venezuelan equine encephalitis virus (VEE) replicon particles safely exhibit potent systemic and mucosal adjuvant activity when administered with subunit or inactivated vaccines. To build on these results with the goal of producing a safe and effective second generation adjuvant for biodefense, we propose the following four aims: Aim 1 - to further define VEE adjuvant activity in mice;Aim 2 - with our collaborators, to test adjuvant activity for specific biodefense vaccines, including avian influenza, poxviruses, Rift Valley Fever virus, Guanarito and Junin hemorrhagic fever viruses, and F. tularensis;Aim 3 - in collaboration with the Center for Comparative Medicine at U.C.-Davis, to determine the level of adjuvant activity in primates;and Aim 4 - to develop a scalable manufacturing process for adjuvant production.

Project.Title: Enabling Point of Care Screening for Sepsis Using Rapid Single Cell Analysis

Title_Other.Title: Enabling Point of Care Screening for Sepsis Using Rapid Single Cell Analysis
利用快速单细胞分析进行脓毒症监护点筛查

Project.Abstract: Project Summary Sepsis, an uncontrolled systemic inflammatory immune response to local infection by bacteria or fungi, is responsible for more deaths than prostate cancer, breast cancer, and AIDS combined, accounts for more than 40% of ICU costs, and is the most expensive inpatient condition in the U.S. (~$20B in annual U.S. healthcare expenditures in 2011). While it has been demonstrated that the time to initiating aggressive treatment is critical to improving outcomes (currently 30-50% mortality) and decreasing costs (>$22,000/case), emergency medicine physicians suffer from a lack of compelling diagnostic tools for detection of sepsis in the emergency department (ED), where >80% of sepsis cases originate in the hospital. CytoVale aims to improve the sepsis treatment paradigm by offering a platform to detect abnormal systemic inflammation at initial presentation. Our diagnostic platform will offer a cost-effective, robust, and rapid sample-to-decision assay (< 10 minutes), in which activated white blood cells that are indicative of uncontrolled systemic inflammation are interrogated in a label-free manner. In order to impact quality of care, the instrument must be situated at the point-of-care (POC), where it can provide rapid results to impact patient care. Currently, this is not feasible, due to manual operations required to prepare samples for the assay (e.g., centrifugation, pipetting) and the lack of an in- sample calibration. Here, we propose to capitalize on the success of our Phase 1 progress of automating the process of sample preparation by now developing a fully integrated module that combines the sample preparation and deformability cytometry microfluidics into a single cartridge and instrument. This will allow for the identification and triaging of patients earlier in their disease process at the ED POC from a finger-prick of blood. Additional cost and patient comfort benefits arise from the ability to track the course of disease and design treatments specific to patient response; saving days spent in the hospital and associated costs. Cytovale also proposes to develop and integrate a deformable sample control. Mechanical standard particles will be used as internal controls within each sample run, to ensure fidelity of the instrument readings and diagnostic accuracy. Not only will this help verify reliability and consistency of experiments, but will also supply a much needed calibration particle to the growing field of cellular biophysics. Combined, these aims will expand accessibility of powerful cell-based assays at the POC.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 项目摘要脓毒症是一种对细菌或真菌局部感染不受控制的全身炎症免疫反应，比前列腺癌、乳腺癌和艾滋病加起来造成的死亡要多，占ICU费用的40%以上，而且是美国最昂贵的住院病患（2011年美国每年的医疗支出约为200亿美元）。虽然已经证明，开始积极治疗的时间对于改善预后（目前30-50%的死亡率）和降低成本（每例超过22000美元）至关重要，但急诊医生在急诊室（ED）缺乏令人信服的脓毒症诊断工具，80%以上的败血症病例来自医院。CytoVale旨在通过提供一个平台来检测最初出现的异常全身炎症，从而改进脓毒症的治疗模式。我们的诊断平台将提供一种成本效益高、健壮、快速的样本到决定分析（<10分钟），在该分析中，以无标签的方式询问表示不受控制的全身炎症的活化白细胞。为了影响护理质量，仪器必须位于护理点（POC），在这里它可以提供快速的结果来影响患者护理。目前，这是不可行的，因为手动操作需要为分析准备样品（如离心，移液管）和缺乏样品内校准。在这里，我们建议利用我们第一阶段自动化样品制备过程的成功，现在开发一个完全集成的模块，将样品制备和变形性细胞术微流体组合成一个单一的药筒和仪器。这将允许在ED-POC的疾病过程中，从手指的血液点刺早期识别和分诊患者。额外的成本和患者舒适性收益来自于跟踪疾病进程和设计针对患者反应的治疗方案的能力；节省住院时间和相关成本。Cytovale还建议开发和集成可变形样品控制。机械标准粒子将用作每次样品运行的内部控制，以确保仪器读数的保真度和诊断精度。这不仅有助于验证实验的可靠性和一致性，也将为细胞生物物理学的发展领域提供一个急需的校准粒子。综合起来，这些目标将扩大POC强大的细胞分析的可及性。

While it has been demonstrated that the time to initiating aggressive treatment is critical to improving outcomes (currently 30-50% mortality) and decreasing costs (>$22,000/case), emergency medicine physicians suffer from a lack of compelling diagnostic tools for detection of sepsis in the emergency department (ED), where >80% of sepsis cases originate in the hospital. CytoVale aims to improve the sepsis treatment paradigm by offering a platform to detect abnormal systemic inflammation at initial presentation. Our diagnostic platform will offer a cost-effective, robust, and rapid sample-to-decision assay (< 10 minutes), in which activated white blood cells that are indicative of uncontrolled systemic inflammation are interrogated in a label-free manner. In order to impact quality of care, the instrument must be situated at the point-of-care (POC), where it can provide rapid results to impact patient care. Currently, this is not feasible, due to manual operations required to prepare samples for the assay (e.g., centrifugation, pipetting) and the lack of an in- sample calibration. Here, we propose to capitalize on the success of our Phase 1 progress of automating the process of sample preparation by now developing a fully integrated module that combines the sample preparation and deformability cytometry microfluidics into a single cartridge and instrument. This will allow for the identification and triaging of patients earlier in their disease process at the ED POC from a finger-prick of blood. Additional cost and patient comfort benefits arise from the ability to track the course of disease and design treatments specific to patient response; saving days spent in the hospital and associated costs. Cytovale also proposes to develop and integrate a deformable sample control. Project.Title: Perceptual image difference metrics - a unifying approach to image representation and reproduction

Title_Other.Title: 感知图像差异度量-一种统一的图像表示和再现方法
Perceptual image difference metrics - a unifying approach to image representation and reproduction

Class.ClassName: 遥感图像识别、遥感图像处理

Project.Abstract: One of the major goals for a wide range of image representation and reproduction techniques is to keep an image processed by an image processing chain perceptually as close as possible to the original. Perceptual differences between two representations or reproductions of an image can be determined by psychophysical experiments or by algorithmic metrics. While being better at capturing perceptual differences, the former are inherently time consuming, non quantitative, and error prone, due to observer subj ectivity. The latter are objective, quantifiable and easy to evaluate numerically, which makes them better suited for performance assessment of image processing algorithms; they are, however, still immature. Therefore, this project has two main goals: the first is to develop new perceptual image difference metrics, and the second is to use them in new ways to improve the state of the art in image representation and reproduction techniques. Hence, in the first part of the project we will focus on the metri cs themselves, by analysing and evaluating current image difference metrics, and by developing new metrics based on improved colour difference metrics, perceptual predictors, saliency maps, and multilevel methods. We will create a good test dataset; this is of paramount importance to the success of the development of new metrics. In the second part of the project, we will use the proposed image difference metrics with numerical optimisation, variational techniques and heuristic search methods to develop n ew frameworks for optimising different image representation and reproduction algorithms. Specifically, these frameworks will be used to optimise algorithms for image compression, high dynamic range tone mapping, colour gamut mapping, and halftoning. The p roject will educate one PhD candidate and three master students, employ one postdoctoral researcher, and facilitate international exchange.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 广泛的图像表示和再现技术的主要目标之一是使由图像处理链处理的图像在感知上尽可能接近原始图像。图像的两种表现或再现之间的知觉差异可以通过心理物理实验或算法度量来确定。前者更善于捕捉知觉差异，但由于观察者的主观性，前者固有的耗时、非定量和易出错。后者客观、可量化、易于数值评估，更适合于图像处理算法的性能评估，但还不成熟。因此，本项目有两个主要目标：一是开发新的感知图像差异度量，二是以新的方式使用它们，以提高图像表示和再现技术的水平。因此，在项目的第一部分中，我们将通过分析和评估当前的图像差异度量，以及基于改进的色差度量、感知预测、显著性地图和多级方法开发新的度量，重点关注度量本身。我们将创建一个好的测试数据集；这对于新指标的开发成功至关重要。在项目的第二部分中，我们将使用所提出的图像差分度量，结合数值优化、变分技术和启发式搜索方法，开发n个新的框架来优化不同的图像表示和再现算法。具体来说，这些框架将用于优化图像压缩、高动态范围色调映射、色域映射和半色调的算法。项目将培养一名博士研究生和三名硕士研究生，聘请一名博士后研究员，促进国际交流。

Perceptual differences between two representations or reproductions of an image can be determined by psychophysical experiments or by algorithmic metrics. While being better at capturing perceptual differences, the former are inherently time consuming, non quantitative, and error prone, due to observer subj ectivity. The latter are objective, quantifiable and easy to evaluate numerically, which makes them better suited for performance assessment of image processing algorithms; they are, however, still immature. Therefore, this project has two main goals: the first is to develop new perceptual image difference metrics, and the second is to use them in new ways to improve the state of the art in image representation and reproduction techniques. Hence, in the first part of the project we will focus on the metri cs themselves, by analysing and evaluating current image difference metrics, and by developing new metrics based on improved colour difference metrics, perceptual predictors, saliency maps, and multilevel methods. We will create a good test dataset; this is of paramount importance to the success of the development of new metrics. In the second part of the project, we will use the proposed image difference metrics with numerical optimisation, variational techniques and heuristic search methods to develop n ew frameworks for optimising different image representation and reproduction algorithms. Specifically, these frameworks will be used to optimise algorithms for image compression, high dynamic range tone mapping, colour gamut mapping, and halftoning. The p roject will educate one PhD candidate and three master students, employ one postdoctoral researcher, and facilitate international exchange.

Project.Title: Discovery of Peptidomimetic Antagonists of Estrogen Receptor - Coactivator Interactions: A Novel Strategy to Combat Tamoxifen Drug Resistance

Title_Other.Title: 雌激素受体辅激活物相互作用的肽模拟拮抗剂的发现：对抗他莫昔芬耐药的新策略
Discovery of Peptidomimetic Antagonists of Estrogen Receptor - Coactivator Interactions: A Novel Strategy to Combat Tamoxifen Drug Resistance

Class.ClassName: 理论、技术、方法、研究、评价、策略

Project.Abstract:
TECHNICAL ABSTRACT
Tamoxifen chemotherapy is widely employed to treat estrogen receptor (ER)-positive breast cancers. Although this therapy is initially successful, the majority of tumors become resistant to tamoxifen within a few years. The development of resistance to tamoxifen is thought to require interactions between ERs and coactivator proteins, which link ERs to the general transcriptional machinery. Thus, the discovery of novel drugs that block these protein-protein interactions may provide a new strategy to combat drug resistance. This proposal aims to test the hypothesis that combinatorial chemical libraries of N-alkylglycine (Peptoid) peptodomimetics will yield potent, stable, and cell-permeable inhibitors of ER-coactivator interactions. Compounds that competitively displace ER-bound coactivator peptides will be identified through in vitro screening of the synthetic compound library. Subsequent evaluation of these compounds with whole-cell transcriptional assays will identify novel compounds with potential activity against tamoxifen-resistant breast cancers. The objectives include (1) synthesis of a ¿one-bead-one-compound¿ combinatorial chemical library of Peptoid peptidomimetics; (2) application of analytical chemistry methodology to decode the chemical composition of specific compound ¿hits¿ identified on individual polymeric beads; (3) identification of specific compounds that competitively displace coactivator peptides bound to the ER; and (4) evaluation of the potency of compounds identified with whole-cell competition transcriptional assays. These assays will quantify ER activity at specific DNA sites (AP-1) correlated with the partial agonist activity of tamoxifen. This research may identify novel small molecules that block critical ER-coactivator interactions in vivo, which would allow evaluation of this strategy in animal models of drug-resistant breast cancer.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 技术摘要 他莫昔芬化疗广泛应用于雌激素受体阳性乳腺癌的治疗。虽然这种疗法最初是成功的，但大多数肿瘤在几年内对三苯氧胺产生抗药性。抗他莫昔芬的发展被认为需要ERs和共激活蛋白之间的相互作用，这将ERS与一般转录机制连接起来。因此，新药物的发现可以阻断这些蛋白质-蛋白质相互作用，这可能为对抗耐药性提供了一种新的策略。本研究旨在验证N-烷基甘氨酸（Peptoid）拟肽化合物的组合化学文库将产生有效、稳定且细胞可渗透的内质网辅活化剂相互作用抑制剂的假设。竞争性地取代内质网结合的辅活化肽的化合物将通过合成化合物库的体外筛选进行鉴定。这些化合物的全细胞转录测定的后续评估将识别具有抗他莫昔芬耐药乳腺癌的潜在活性的新化合物。其目的包括：（1）合成一种蛋白样多肽类化合物组合化学文库；（2）应用分析化学方法对单个聚合物珠上鉴定的特定化合物hits的化学成分进行解码；（3）鉴定竞争性地取代与内质网结合的辅活化肽的特定化合物；以及（4）评价通过全细胞竞争转录分析鉴定的化合物的效力。这些检测将量化与他莫昔芬部分激动剂活性相关的特定DNA位点（AP-1）的ER活性。这项研究可能在体内发现新的小分子阻断关键的ER辅活化子相互作用，这将有助于在耐药乳腺癌动物模型中评估这一策略。

TECHNICAL ABSTRACT
Tamoxifen chemotherapy is widely employed to treat estrogen receptor (ER)-positive breast cancers. Although this therapy is initially successful, the majority of tumors become resistant to tamoxifen within a few years. The development of resistance to tamoxifen is thought to require interactions between ERs and coactivator proteins, which link ERs to the general transcriptional machinery. Thus, the discovery of novel drugs that block these protein-protein interactions may provide a new strategy to combat drug resistance. This proposal aims to test the hypothesis that combinatorial chemical libraries of N-alkylglycine (Peptoid) peptodomimetics will yield potent, stable, and cell-permeable inhibitors of ER-coactivator interactions. Compounds that competitively displace ER-bound coactivator peptides will be identified through in vitro screening of the synthetic compound library. Subsequent evaluation of these compounds with whole-cell transcriptional assays will identify novel compounds with potential activity against tamoxifen-resistant breast cancers. The objectives include (1) synthesis of a ¿one-bead-one-compound¿ combinatorial chemical library of Peptoid peptidomimetics; (2) application of analytical chemistry methodology to decode the chemical composition of specific compound ¿hits¿ identified on individual polymeric beads; (3) identification of specific compounds that competitively displace coactivator peptides bound to the ER; and (4) evaluation of the potency of compounds identified with whole-cell competition transcriptional assays. These assays will quantify ER activity at specific DNA sites (AP-1) correlated with the partial agonist activity of tamoxifen. This research may identify novel small molecules that block critical ER-coactivator interactions in vivo, which would allow evaluation of this strategy in animal models of drug-resistant breast cancer.

Project.Title: Ventilation Model and CNS Injury in Baboons with Bronchopulmonary Dysplasia

Title_Other.Title: Ventilation Model and CNS Injury in Baboons with Bronchopulmonary Dysplasia
支气管肺发育不良狒狒的通气模型与中枢神经系统损伤

Project.Abstract: DESCRIPTION (provided by applicant): Advances in prenatal and neonatal care have significantly improved survival of the prematurely born infant, particularly the most immature. However, as these children approach school age, it is recognized that up to 50% face neurobehavioral challenges. The nature of the cerebral injury that underlies all of these neurobehavioral deficits is not yet fully understood, but common patterns of injury are found in the cerebral white matter including hemorrhage and cystic infarction known as periventricular leukomalacia (PVL). It is also increasingly recognized that there is primary or secondary injury in the cortical and deep gray matter and the hippocampus, which may relate to subsequent intellectual impairments. It is critical that we gain insight into how particular neonatal practices, such as respiratory support, may alter the nature and the severity of cerebral injury in these vulnerable infants. In this study we propose to investigate the nature of cerebral injury in a prematurely born primate model (Papio sp) developed as a model of bronchopulmonary dysplasia, utilizing both magnetic resonance imaging (MR) and histopathology. Our hypothesis is that the prematurely born baboon (Papio sp) will display a pattern of cerebral injury, evident on MR imaging and histopathology, similar to that found in the prematurely born human infant. This pattern of injury will vary in relation to the nature of postnatal therapies, particularly randomized ventilatory strategies. For each of the specific aims the methodologies are identical and will utilize both state-of-the-art advanced MR imaging techniques and histopathological studies in all subjects. The advanced MR imaging techniques will include conventional MR imaging, quantitative volumetric 3-dimensional imaging and diffusion tensor imaging with collaborations between three-world class research MR sites (Washington University, Melbourne University and Harvard Medical School). The histopathology will include immuno-histochemistry including structural classification, cellular characteristics - neuronal and glial, and growth factor and biochemical development. Although histopathological techniques will be the cornerstone of defining the nature and severity of the cerebral injury, the MR studies will allow a direct comparison between this model and the human infant in whom identical protocols of advanced MR studies in vivo are being currently undertaken in our program. These studies may provide insight into the relationship of neonatal respiratory care to risk of cerebral injury, and thus direct us to the safest modes of ventilatory support for the immature brain.

说明（由申请人提供）：产前和新生儿护理的进展大大提高了早产儿，特别是最不成熟的早产儿的存活率。然而，随着这些儿童接近上学年龄，人们认识到高达50%的儿童面临神经行为挑战。所有这些神经行为缺陷的基础是脑损伤，其本质尚不完全清楚，但常见的损伤模式见于脑白质，包括出血和称为室周白质软化症（PVL）的囊性梗死。人们也越来越认识到，大脑皮层和深部灰质以及海马体存在原发性或继发性损伤，这可能与随后的智力损伤有关。至关重要的是，我们要深入了解特殊的新生儿做法，如呼吸支持，可能会改变这些脆弱婴儿脑损伤的性质和严重程度。在这项研究中，我们建议利用磁共振成像（MR）和组织病理学研究早产灵长类动物模型（Papio-sp）作为支气管肺发育不良模型的脑损伤性质。我们的假设是，早产狒狒（Papio sp）会表现出一种脑损伤的模式，在MR成像和组织病理学上都很明显，类似于早产人类婴儿。这种损伤模式与产后治疗的性质有关，特别是随机通气策略。对于每一个具体的目的，方法是相同的，并将利用最先进的先进磁共振成像技术和组织病理学研究的所有科目。先进的磁共振成像技术将包括常规磁共振成像、定量三维容积成像和扩散张量成像，以及三个世界级研究磁共振场地（华盛顿大学、墨尔本大学和哈佛医学院）之间的合作。组织病理学将包括免疫组织化学，包括结构分类，细胞特征-神经元和胶质细胞，生长因子和生化发展。尽管组织病理学技术将是确定脑损伤性质和严重程度的基石，但磁共振研究将允许直接比较该模型和人类婴儿之间的差异，在我们的计划中，目前正在进行相同的体内先进磁共振研究方案。这些研究有助于深入了解新生儿呼吸护理与脑损伤风险之间的关系，从而指导我们对未成熟脑进行最安全的通气支持。

Project.Title: THREE DIMENSIONAL EQUILIBRIUM RECONSTRUCTION AND MHD STUDIES IN STELLARATORS

Title_Other.Title: THREE DIMENSIONAL EQUILIBRIUM RECONSTRUCTION AND MHD STUDIES IN STELLARATORS
恒星的三维平衡重建与mhd研究

Class.ClassName: 0202 Atomic, Molecular, Nuclear, Particle and Plasma Physics

Project.Abstract: 3D Equilibrium Reconstruction and MHD studies in StellaratorsPI: Professor James Hanson, Auburn UniversityThe long-term research program to generate electricity through the controlled release of energy from thermonuclear fusion reactions in magnetically confined plasmas has been remarkably successful in improving plasma confinement times, and increasing plasma densities and temperatures. This improvement has come from increased knowledge of plasma physics, gained by careful experimentation coupled with sophisticated theory and computer simulations. Equilibrium reconstruction is a structured mechanism for reconciling experimental observations from many plasma diagnostic instruments with predictions from a simplified description of the confined plasma – a model magnetohydrodynamic (MHD) equilibrium. Accurate knowledge of the MHD equilibrium is necessary for accurate assessment of the stability of the plasma and the transport of particles and energy within the plasma. Axisymmetric (2D) equilibrium reconstruction has been instrumental to the improved understanding and performance of tokamaks. However, an axisymmetric model is not adequate for stellarators and high-performance tokamaks. The V3FIT 3D equilibrium reconstruction code was developed by the Principal Investigator and others to extend the benefits of 2D equilibrium reconstruction to non-axisymmetric (3D) plasma experiments. The code is now used regularly and routinely on stellarators (the Compact Toroidal Hybrid at Auburn University, the Helically Symmetric Experiment at the University of Madison, Wisconsin, and the W7-X Stellarator in Greifswald, Germany), reversed-field pinches (the Madison Symmetric Torus at the University of Madison, Wisconsin and RFX-mod in Padova, Italy) and tokamaks (DIII-D at General Atomics in San Diego) around the world.  The objectives of this proposed research are to further develop the capabilities of the non-axisymmetric (3D) equilibrium reconstruction code V3FIT, to support experiments that utilize V3FIT (particularly the W7-X stellarator in Germany and the CTH device at Auburn), and to improve understanding of stellarator discharges by performing simulations of stellarator plasma dynamics using the extended MHD code NIMROD.

Stellatorspi的三维平衡重建和磁流体动力学研究：James Hanson教授，奥本大学通过在磁约束等离子体中控制释放热核聚变反应的能量来发电的长期研究计划在改善等离子体约束时间方面取得了显著的成功，增加等离子体密度和温度。这种改进来自于对等离子体物理知识的增加，这些知识是通过细致的实验，结合复杂的理论和计算机模拟而获得的。平衡重建是一种结构机制，用于将许多等离子体诊断仪器的实验观测结果与对受限等离子体的简化描述（模型磁流体动力学（mhd）平衡）的预测进行协调。准确了解mhd平衡对于准确评估等离子体的稳定性以及粒子和能量在等离子体中的传输是必要的。轴对称（2d）平衡重建有助于提高对托卡马克的理解和性能。然而，轴对称模型不适合于恒星和高性能托卡马克。v3fit三维平衡重建程序是由主要研究者和其他人开发的，旨在将二维平衡重建的好处扩展到非轴对称（3d）等离子体实验。该代码现在经常用于恒星（奥本大学的紧密环形混合体，威斯康星麦迪逊大学的螺旋对称实验，以及德国格里夫斯瓦尔德的W7-X恒星发生器）。反场挤压（威斯康星麦迪逊大学麦迪逊对称环和帕多瓦的rfx mod，意大利）和世界各地的托卡马克（圣地亚哥通用原子公司的DIII-D）的研究目标是进一步发展非轴对称（3D）平衡重建代码V3Fit的能力，支持利用v3fit（特别是德国的w7-x和奥本的cth装置）进行的实验，并通过使用扩展mhd代码nimrod对恒星等离子体动力学进行模拟，提高对恒星放电的理解。

Project.Title: Conceptually new, potentially safer obesity treatment:clinical safety trial with precisely engineered silica

Title_Other.Title: Conceptually new, potentially safer obesity treatment:clinical safety trial with precisely engineered silica
概念上新的、潜在更安全的肥胖治疗：精确工程二氧化硅的临床安全性试验

Project.Abstract:
Purpose and goal: Sigrid Therapeutics is developing a medical treatment for obesity, based on precisely engineered porous silica particles. Determining the clinical safety profile of the product particle was the purpose of this Vinnova funded application. The aim was to study potential side effects of the compound in increasing doses, 3,6 and up to 9 grams daily in both obese and health male individuals. The goal was successfully carried out.
Expected results and effects: The compiled data of the approximately 3 months long clinical trial reveals that Sigrid´s specifically engineered porous silica particles are safe and well tolerated at higher doses. No related side effects of porous silica have been observed. A number of interesting biomarkers have been observed but these will be discussed in upcoming publications.
Approach and implementation: The project was divided into three work packages: I) Production and Formulation of material for the clinical safety trial, performed in collaboration with SP Process Development. II) A Two-Phase Clinical Study at Karolinska Institute. Effects on the gastrointestinal function, blood levels of lipophilic vitamins, trace elements, blood lipids and inflammation markers were measured and silica levels traced in faeces and urine samples throughout the study. III) Analysis and Compilation of data collected from the participants. All three work packages were successfully carried out.

目的和目标： Sigrid Therapeutics正在开发一种基于精密工程多孔二氧化硅颗粒的肥胖症医疗方法。确定产品颗粒的临床安全性是本次Vinnova资助应用的目的。目的是研究该化合物的潜在副作用，增加剂量，3，6和高达9克的肥胖和健康男性个体每天。这个目标成功地实现了。 预期结果和效果： 这项长达3个月的临床试验的汇编数据显示，Sigrid特别设计的多孔二氧化硅颗粒在较高剂量下是安全和耐受性良好的。未观察到多孔二氧化硅的相关副作用。已经观察到许多有趣的生物标记物，但这些将在即将出版的出版物中讨论。 方法和实施： 该项目分为三个工作包：I）与SP工艺开发合作，生产和制定临床安全试验材料。二） 卡罗林斯卡研究所的两阶段临床研究。在整个研究过程中，测量了对胃肠功能的影响、血液中亲脂维生素、微量元素、血脂和炎症标记物的水平以及粪便和尿液中的二氧化硅水平。三） 分析和汇编从参与者那里收集的数据。三个工作包都顺利完成。

Project.Title: MRI: The UNF-FSU Neutron Detector Array RESONEUT for Rare Ion Beams

Title_Other.Title: 核磁共振：用于稀有离子束的UNF-FSU中子探测器阵列解析
MRI: The UNF-FSU Neutron Detector Array RESONEUT for Rare Ion Beams

Class.ClassName: 0202 Atomic, Molecular, Nuclear, Particle and Plasma Physics
自然科学实验方法、自然科学实验设备

Project.Abstract: This award will develop a new type of low-energy neutron detector array, which is to be used at the Resolut radioactive beam facility of Florida State University (FSU). The proposed detector systems use a combination of a p-Terphenyl crystal with a novel type of compact "Planacon" photo multiplier to achieve high sensitivity for low energy neutrons and pulse-shape discrimination to suppress gamma-ray and X-ray background. Four prototype-systems for these detectors have been assembled and tested at FSU. This proposal seeks to acquire all components required for a detector array of twelve detectors, which will be assembled and tested by undergraduate researchers at the University of North Florida (UNF). The complete system will be commissioned in experiments at the John D. Fox accelerator laboratory of Florida State University. The detector array will enable an experimental program to study proton-resonances in the astrophysical rapid proton capture process(rp-process), which will create further opportunities for involvement of UNF undergraduate students in research projects. The integration of the novel low-energy neutron detector array into the Resolut radioactive beam facility of Florida State University will enable the efficient detection of the remaining neutron from a nuclear collision in which the proton in a deuteron is transferred to an incident heavier nucleus. Such reactions are used as surrogates for studying and calibrating nuclear reaction rates for the rapid proton captures by nuclei that constitute the rp-process which is considered to be a component of explosive stellar nucleosynthesis. This project will provide transformational learning opportunities for undergraduate researchers at UNF who will assemble and test the detector systems, participate in the subsequent commissioning experiments for the neutron detector array at the John D. Fox accelerator laboratory, and analyze data from the commissioning experiments. Following completion of this project, UNF faculty and undergraduates will continue to collaborate on experiments with the nuclear physics group at FSU and the neutron detector array will be available to all users of the Resolut facility.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 该奖项将开发一种新型低能中子探测器阵列，用于佛罗里达州立大学（FSU）的Resolut放射性束装置。所提出的探测器系统使用对三苯基晶体与新型紧凑型“Planacon”光电倍增器的组合，以实现对低能中子的高灵敏度和抑制伽马射线和X射线背景的脉冲形状识别。这些探测器的四个原型系统已经在FSU组装和测试。这项提议旨在获得一个由12个探测器组成的探测器阵列所需的所有组件，这些探测器将由北佛罗里达大学（UNF）的本科生研究员组装和测试。整个系统将在佛罗里达州立大学约翰福克斯加速器实验室进行实验。探测器阵列将使一个实验项目能够研究天体物理快速质子俘获过程（rp过程）中的质子共振，这将为UNF本科生参与研究项目创造更多机会。将新型低能中子探测器阵列集成到佛罗里达州立大学的Resolut放射性束装置中，将能够有效地探测核碰撞中剩余的中子，其中氘核中的质子被转移到入射的较重核中。这些反应被用作研究和校准核反应速率的替代物，用于由核快速捕获质子，这一过程被认为是爆炸性恒星核合成的一个组成部分。该项目将为联合国基金会的本科生研究人员提供转型学习机会，他们将组装和测试探测器系统，参与约翰·D·福克斯加速器实验室中子探测器阵列的后续调试实验，并分析调试实验的数据。该项目完成后，UNF教员和本科生将继续与FSU的核物理小组合作进行实验，Resolut设施的所有用户都可以使用中子探测器阵列。

Such reactions are used as surrogates for studying and calibrating nuclear reaction rates for the rapid proton captures by nuclei that constitute the rp-process which is considered to be a component of explosive stellar nucleosynthesis. This project will provide transformational learning opportunities for undergraduate researchers at UNF who will assemble and test the detector systems, participate in the subsequent commissioning experiments for the neutron detector array at the John D. Fox accelerator laboratory, and analyze data from the commissioning experiments. Following completion of this project, UNF faculty and undergraduates will continue to collaborate on experiments with the nuclear physics group at FSU and the neutron detector array will be available to all users of the Resolut facility.

Project.Title: Coupling promoter choice and alternative RNA splicing in the mammalian Protocadherin gene cluster

Title_Other.Title: Coupling promoter choice and alternative RNA splicing in the mammalian Protocadherin gene cluster
哺乳动物原钙粘蛋白基因簇中偶联启动子的选择和选择性RNA剪接

Project.Abstract: TITLE: ?Coupling promoter choice and alternative RNA splicing in the mammalian Protocadherin gene cluster? PROJECT SUMMARY: Eukaryotic gene expression is regulated by a complex network of functional coupling between the processes of transcription initiation, elongation and RNA processing. The mammalian Protocadherin (Pcdh) gene cluster provides a remarkable and fundamentally important system to study the underlying mechanisms of this coupling process. The proteins encoded by the Pcdh gene cluster play an essential role in neural circuit assembly by providing individual neurons with a unique cell surface ?code? that forms the basis of self-recognition. The Pcdh cell surface code is generated by a complex process of stochastic promoter choice, alternative RNA splicing and combinatorial assembly of Pcdh cis-dimers at the cell surface. The transcriptional process involves ?stochastic? activation of individual Pcdh gene promoters through long-range enhancer-promoter DNA looping (which requires the DNA binding protein CTCF), transcription of as much as 250,000 base pairs of DNA, followed by splicing of a promoter proximal 5' splice site to a distant 3' splice site. Although significant progress has been made in understanding the genomic DNA organization, single neuron expression, and chromosome domain configuration of the clustered Pcdh, the mechanisms by which transcriptional initiation and elongation, and RNA processing are coupled remain unknown. Recent studies have revealed a remarkable organization of highly conserved RNA duplex structures in the Pcdh pre-mRNAs, and a striking pattern of convergent transcription at Pcdh promotors. These preliminary observations have lead to a model in which these RNA secondary structures regulate 5' splice site choice, and a novel mechanism for promoter choice. Aim 1 of this proposal is to Determine the architecture of Pcdh ? and ? RNA precursors in mammalian cells and investigate their functions, and Aim 2 is to Determine the role of CTCF in regulating transcription and processing of Pcdh? RNAs. A variety of approaches will be used to accomplish these aims, including the in vivo analysis of RNA secondary structures using chemical probes and RNASeq methods, single molecule visualization methods to image the translocation of RNA polymerase as it proceeds through the gene cluster, and gene editing methods to identify regulatory elements required for transcription and splicing. The proposed studies are poised to reveal novel and exciting regulatory mechanisms governing eukaryotic gene regulation. Moreover, as Pcdh proteins play a central role in neural circuit assembly, and they have been implicated in neurological diseases, understanding the details of Pcdh gene expression will not only provide fundamental insights into novel mechanisms of gene expression, but also lead to a better understanding of the genetic basis of neurological diseases, such as autism. Thus, the proposed research is of direct relevance to human health.

标题：？哺乳动物原钙粘蛋白基因簇中偶联启动子的选择和选择性RNA剪接？项目摘要：真核基因的表达是由转录起始、延伸和RNA加工过程之间的复杂功能耦合网络调控的。哺乳动物原钙粘蛋白（Pcdh）基因簇为研究这一偶联过程的潜在机制提供了一个重要的系统。Pcdh基因簇编码的蛋白质通过为单个神经元提供独特的细胞表面，在神经回路组装中发挥着重要作用？密码？这是自我认知的基础。Pcdh细胞表面编码是由随机启动子选择、选择性RNA剪接和Pcdh顺式二聚体在细胞表面的组合组装等复杂过程产生的。转录过程包括？随机的？通过远程增强子启动子DNA环（需要DNA结合蛋白CTCF）激活单个Pcdh基因启动子，转录多达250000对碱基DNA，然后将启动子近端5'剪接位点剪接到远处3'剪接位点。尽管在研究聚簇Pcdh的基因组DNA组织、单神经元表达和染色体结构方面取得了重大进展，但转录起始和延伸以及RNA处理的耦合机制仍不清楚。最近的研究揭示了Pcdh前mRNAs中高度保守的RNA双链结构的显著组织，以及Pcdh启动子的显著的聚合转录模式。这些初步观察结果为RNA二级结构调控5'剪接位点的选择提供了一个模型，并为启动子的选择提供了一种新的机制。本提案的目的1是确定Pcdh的体系结构？然后呢？哺乳动物细胞中的RNA前体及其功能的研究，目的2是确定CTCF在Pcdh的转录和加工中的作用？核糖核酸。为实现这些目标，将采用多种方法，包括使用化学探针和RNASeq方法对RNA二级结构进行活体分析，采用单分子可视化方法对RNA聚合酶在通过基因簇时的移位进行成像，以及识别转录和剪接所需调控元件的基因编辑方法。本研究旨在揭示真核生物基因调控的新机制。此外，由于Pcdh蛋白在神经回路组装中起着核心作用，并且它们与神经系统疾病有关，了解Pcdh基因表达的细节不仅可以为基因表达的新机制提供基本的见解，同时也有助于更好地理解自闭症等神经系统疾病的遗传基础。因此，本研究对人类健康具有直接意义。

Source.Name: National Institute of General Medical Sciences

Project.Title: Quantitative magnetic resonance imaging of multiple sclerosis

Title_Other.Title: 多发性硬化的定量磁共振成像
Quantitative magnetic resonance imaging of multiple sclerosis

Project.Abstract: Multiple sclerosis (MS) is a devastating condition and is the most common chronic neurological disease affecting young adults in Canada. Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) has revolutionized the detection of MS in the brain and spinal cord and is now an essential tool in the diagnosis and monitoring of the disease. However, as it is routinely used, MRI is very sensitive to MS disease detection in the white matter of the brain but is not good at differentiating between different characteristics of MS lesions such as inflammation versus destruction of myelin, an important component of brain tissue. Conventional MRI is also not very sensitive to MS disease in the grey matter of the brain. In this application we propose to develop a new MRI technique that will enable whole brain quantitative assessment of tissue destruction. After verifying the performance of this technique using postmortem MS brains we will use it to study the pattern of white matter and grey matter damage in MS patients. Specifically, we wish to determine if damage to the grey matter is the result of prior damage to the white matter or is independent. We will also study the relationship between the location of brain tissue damage and specific aspects of the patients' disability. This project will provide new tools for comprehensive and quantitative assessment of tissue damage in MS patients and will reveal new information on the natural evolution of the disease. This research will also enable the evaluation of badly needed new therapies that attempt to slow or stop the progression of this disease.

多发性硬化症（MS）是一种破坏性疾病，是加拿大年轻人最常见的慢性神经系统疾病。磁共振成像（MRI）已经彻底改变了对脑和脊髓MS的检测，现在已经成为诊断和监测该疾病的重要工具。然而，由于常规使用，MRI对脑白质MS病变的检测非常敏感，但不善于区分MS病变的不同特征，如炎症与髓鞘破坏，髓鞘是脑组织的重要组成部分。传统的磁共振成像对脑灰质的多发性硬化症也不是很敏感。在这个应用中，我们建议开发一种新的磁共振成像技术，使全脑组织破坏的定量评估成为可能。在用死后MS大脑验证了这项技术的性能后，我们将用它来研究MS患者的白质和灰质损伤模式。具体来说，我们希望确定灰质损伤是先前白质损伤的结果还是独立的。我们还将研究脑组织损伤的位置与患者残疾的具体方面之间的关系。该项目将为MS患者组织损伤的综合定量评估提供新的工具，并将揭示该疾病自然演变的新信息。这项研究也将有助于评估急需的新疗法，试图减缓或阻止这种疾病的进展。

Project.Title: Collaborative Research: Effects of Eddies and Waves on the Westward Transport off Central California

Title_Other.Title: Collaborative Research: Effects of Eddies and Waves on the Westward Transport off Central California
协同研究：涡旋和波浪对加州中部向西输送的影响

Project.Abstract: The study focuses on understanding the role of mesoscale variability and Rossby waves in the offshore propagation of kinetic energy, heat, salt and tracers to the west [referred as westward transport (WT)] in the California Current System (CCS). In-situ observations, remote-sensed observations, and numerical modeling are used to nowcast meso-scale eddy variability in the CCS off Central California and to quantify associated WT. The goal is to understand how eddies, jets and waves as well as their interactions affect WT and to determine the scales responsible for this process. Parameterization schemes for WT will also be developed in a form sufficiently simplified to be verified from sparse observations and to permit biological and climate applications. While each component of the study has its own stand-alone objectives, components are combined in a synergistic way to produce the desired nowcast product based on fusion of model results and data. Model integrations through a hierarchy of regional ROMS (UCLA) nested with a global SODA will be used as guidance in constructing reliable three-dimensional dynamics of the region of interest on mesoscale and sub-mesoscale. Satellite data (SST, altimetry and color), drifter (WOCE) and subsurface (Argo and RAFOS) float observations, and hydrographic (CTD/VMADCP) data will be used to provide a physical description of the CCS independent of the model and as a basis for independent model validation. The ROMS is validated through the feature-oriented approach using multiple metrics to find an accepted model configuration for reproduction of along- and across-shore transport in the most accurate manner. WT characteristics are revised and updated through correlation and scaling analyses applied to model results and data. The project will contribute to understanding the westward transport induced by eddies and waves in a subtropical eastern-boundary upwelling system as well as the across slope exchange on climate time scales. Eddies and waves play a major role in the transport of mass and momentum, thus affecting transport, drag, and dissipation in mesoscale flows. Due to their long lifetimes, eddies and waves redistribute the cold water upwelled near the margin that may also affect the overlying atmosphere and hence through air-sea interactions impacting both weather and climate. A significant deviation of the westward transport from conventional diffusion necessitates search for new types of parameterizations for heat and salt transport accounting for long time lag correlation effects. The proposal suggests and develops such a parameterization in context of the telegraph transport model, which may be useful for forecasting biological productivity along the Central California coast and in climate applications of oceanic models. A set of mathematical tools for image analysis, for identification and classification of coherent eddies and waves, data merging, Lagrangian analysis and model-data comparison is developed for the analysis of output fields of high-resolution oceanic models and observations. The project will involve graduate students and post-docs including women from the Naval Postgraduate School (Monterey, CA) as well as other Monterey area institutions. Research results will be converted into teaching aids for graduate and undergraduate courses at the Naval Postgraduate School and MLML. These educational materials will also be used for a graduate-level marine science textbook. Contributions will also be made to state-of-the-art surveys of marine sciences. Results should have relevance for biological productivity, fisheries, oil and gas recovery operations and navigation. Activities will include open communications and presentations to the public, policy-makers, private companies and local government officials.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 这项研究的重点是了解中尺度变率和Rossby波在加利福尼亚海流系统（CCS）中动能、热量、盐和示踪物向西部（称为向西输送（WT））的离岸传播中的作用。利用现场观测、遥感观测和数值模拟，对加利福尼亚中部沿海的CCS中尺度涡变进行了实时预报，并对相关的WT进行了量化。目的是了解涡旋、喷流和波浪及其相互作用如何影响WT，并确定这一过程的尺度。还将以一种充分简化的形式制定水处理参数化方案，以便从稀疏观测中得到验证，并允许生物和气候应用。虽然研究的每个组成部分都有自己的独立目标，但各组成部分以协同的方式组合，在模型结果和数据融合的基础上生成所需的nowcast产品。通过嵌套全球SODA的区域ROMS（UCLA）层次结构的模型集成，将被用于指导在中尺度和亚中尺度上构建感兴趣区域的可靠三维动力学。卫星数据（SST、测高和颜色）、漂移（WOCE）和地下（Argo和RAFOS）浮标观测以及水文（CTD/VMADCP）数据将用于提供独立于模型的CCS物理描述，并作为独立模型验证的基础。通过使用多个指标的面向特征的方法验证ROMS，以找到一个可接受的模型配置，以最准确的方式再现沿海岸和跨海岸运输。通过应用于模型结果和数据的相关性和标度分析来修正和更新WT特征。本计画将有助于了解副热带东面边界上升流系统中涡旋和波浪所引起的西行输运，以及气候时间尺度上的跨坡交换。涡和波在质量和动量的输运中起主要作用，从而影响中尺度流的输运、阻力和耗散。由于它们的生命周期长，涡旋和波浪重新分配了边缘附近上升的冷水，这也可能影响上覆大气，因此通过海气相互作用影响天气和气候。西行输运与常规扩散的显著偏离，需要寻找考虑长时间滞后相关效应的热盐输运参数化新类型。该建议建议在电报传输模型的背景下提出并发展了这种参数化，这可能有助于预测加利福尼亚中部沿海的生物生产力和海洋模型的气候应用。为了分析高分辨率海洋模式和观测的输出场，开发了一套图像分析、相干涡和波的识别和分类、数据合并、拉格朗日分析和模式数据比较的数学工具。该项目将涉及研究生和博士后，包括来自海军研究生院（加州蒙特利）和其他蒙特利地区机构的妇女。研究成果将转化为海军研究生院和MLML的研究生和本科生课程的教具。这些教材也将用于研究生水平的海洋科学教科书。还将对海洋科学的最新调查作出贡献。结果应与生物生产力、渔业、石油和天然气开采作业和航行有关。活动将包括向公众、决策者、私营公司和地方政府官员进行公开交流和演讲。

Project.Title: Regulation of Flow-Induced K+ Wasting by the Collecting Duct

Title_Other.Title: 集流管对流动性K+消耗的调节
Regulation of Flow-Induced K+ Wasting by the Collecting Duct

Class.ClassName: 理论、技术、方法、研究、评价、策略

Project.Abstract: The goal of the project is to elucidate the role of local Ca2+ signaling in regulating flow-dependent, but inappropriate, K+ secretion by the cortical collecting ducts (CCD) of the late distal tubule (LDT). Such flow-dependent K+ wasting is wide-spread occurring in conditions of volume expansion, loop-diuretic use and in salt-losing tubulopathies, such as Bartter and Gitelman syndromes. It can lead to hypokalemia, volume depletion, and low blood pressure. While the mechanism of this flow-dependent K+ wasting is thought to involve flow-induced Ca2+ influx, leading to activation of Ca2+-dependent 'BK' K+ channel in the LTD, the mechanism remains controversial, especially with regard to the Ca2+ sensitivity of BK and whether this channel can fully account for the K+ loss. We recently identified the Ca2+-permeable TRPV4 channel as the key flow-sensitive Ca2+ influx pathway that may underlie flow-sensitive K+ secretion by the CCD. Importantly, we have now identify a new Ca2+-dependent K+ channel, SK3, with a much higher Ca2+ affinity than BK, which is highly expressed at the luminal border of CCD cells. Activation of SK3 hyperpolarizes the cell leading to enhanced Ca2+ influx which would, in turn, support activation of the low-affinity BK. We hypothesis that high flow activates TRPV4 to induce Ca2+ influx which would first activate SK3, further enhancing Ca2+ influx, with subsequently activation of BK and generation of flow-induced K+ secretion. The study has two aims: 1) To characterize the flow-dependent properties of TRPV4 and to elucidate the role of TRPV4 in regulating flow-dependent activation of SK3 and BK K+ channels in CCD, and 2) To verify the functional interactions among TRPV4, SK3 and BK, in CCD and to critically assess the importance of these interactions in dysregulated, flow-dependent, K+ wasting in genetically modified animal models of K+ excretion. The project is innovative in the use of cell culture models and native, split-opened CCDs to define key aspects of the regulatory pathways (using Ca2+ imaging, electrophysiology, immunofluorescence, biochemical/molecular strategies), with verification of the findings in genetically modified animal models of dysregulated K+ wasting. The outcome of these studies will provide new insights into our understanding of the molecular basis of flow-sensitive K+ excretion in the kidney and will identify potential new therapeutic targets for development of treatment strategies in K+ wasting pathologies.

The project is innovative in the use of cell culture models and native, split-opened CCDs to define key aspects of the regulatory pathways (using Ca2+ imaging, electrophysiology, immunofluorescence, biochemical/molecular strategies), with verification of the findings in genetically modified animal models of dysregulated K+ wasting. The outcome of these studies will provide new insights into our understanding of the molecular basis of flow-sensitive K+ excretion in the kidney and will identify potential new therapeutic targets for development of treatment strategies in K+ wasting pathologies.

该项目的目的是阐明局部Ca2+信号在调节晚期远端小管（LDT）皮质集合管（CCD）的流量依赖性但不适当的K+分泌中的作用。这种依赖于血流的K+消耗广泛存在于体积膨胀、循环利尿剂使用和盐丢失性肾小管病变中，如Bartter和Gitelman综合征。它会导致低钾血症、容量衰竭和低血压。虽然这种依赖于流动的K+消耗的机制被认为涉及流动诱导的Ca2+流入，导致LTD中Ca2+依赖的BK+通道的激活，但该机制仍然存在争议，特别是关于BK的Ca2+敏感性以及该通道是否能完全解释K+损失。我们最近发现Ca2+通透性TRPV4通道是CCD分泌流动敏感K+的关键性Ca2+内流通道。重要的是，我们现在已经鉴定出一种新的钙依赖性钾通道SK3，它比BK具有更高的钙亲和力，BK在CCD细胞的管腔边缘高度表达。SK3的激活使细胞超极化，从而导致Ca2+内流增强，进而支持低亲和力BK的激活。我们假设高流量激活TRPV4，诱导Ca2+内流，首先激活SK3，进一步增强Ca2+内流，随后激活BK，产生流量诱导的K+分泌。本研究有两个目的：1）研究TRPV4的流量依赖性，阐明TRPV4在调节CCD中SK3和BK K+通道的流量依赖性激活中的作用；2）验证TRPV4、SK3和BK在CCD中的功能相互作用，并批判性地评估这些相互作用在失调中的重要性，K+排泄的转基因动物模型中的流量依赖性K+消耗。该项目创新性地使用细胞培养模型和天然、分离开放的ccd来定义调控途径的关键方面（使用Ca2+成像、电生理学、免疫荧光、生化/分子策略），并验证了在基因修饰的K+消耗失调动物模型中的发现。这些研究的结果将为我们理解肾脏中流动敏感K+排泄的分子基础提供新的见解，并将为制定K+消耗性疾病的治疗策略确定潜在的新治疗靶点。

Organization.Name: The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston
The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston

Project.Title: Mechanisms of HSF1-mediated Repression of TNF-alpha

Title_Other.Title: HSF1介导的TNF-α抑制机制
Mechanisms of HSF1-mediated Repression of TNF-alpha

Class.ClassName: 理论、技术、方法、研究、评价、策略

Project.Abstract: DESCRIPTION (provided by applicant): Fever is an evolutionarily conserved response, the key feature of which is a temporary, regulated increase in core temperature. We have shown that the temperature increase itself is an immune modulator, one key feature of which is attenuation of the proinflammatory cytokine, tumor necrosis factor-alpha(TNF). We showed that sub-heat shock febrile-range hyperthermia (FRH) activates the heat/stress-activated transcription factor, heat shock factor-1 (HSF1) to a distinct repressor form. We identified an HSF1 binding site in the murine TNFalpha 5'UTR that represses TNF promoter activity and found evidence of additional HSF1-dependent repressors in the TNF promoter. In rnacrophages exposed to FRH, TNF transcription begins normally after treatment with bacterial lipopolysaccharide (LPS), but ends early, thereby reducing TNF expression to a brief short pulse. This raised the question of how TNF transcription could begin at all in the presence of a trans-repressor. In this regard, we found that HSF1 is transiently inactivated after LPS treatment that HSF1 inactivation coincides with onset of TNF transcription, and that subsequent HSF1 reactivation coincides with TNF transcriptional silencing. Preliminary data indicates that the inactivation and reactivation of HSF1 is caused by its phosphorylation and subsequent dephosphorylation over a 60-minute cycle. We hypothesize that LPS activate a cycle of HSF1 phosphorylation/dephosphorylation and that this process temporally restricts TNF expression. The overall goal of this research proposal is to elucidate the molecular mechanisms through which HSF1 modifies TNF expression in macrophages. Specifically, we will use novel HSFl-null macrophage model to: (i) define the mechanisms through which HSF1 represses TNF expression focusing on its interaction with the proximal TNF promoter and the associated enhanceosome, and its effect on local chromatin structure; (ii) identify HSF1 domains required for transrepression of TNF; (iii) elucidate the LPS-activated phosphorylation event(s) that transiently inactivate HSF1 trans-repression, thus allowing transient TNF expression in FRH-treated cells; and (iv) determine whether HSF1 directly blocks TLR signaling, whether HSF1 binds directly to the inhibited signaling elements, and identify the active HSF1 domains. The proposed studies will provide new insight into how the biochemical events that regulate host defenses is modified by the temperature increase that occurs during fever.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 描述（由申请人提供）：发烧是一种进化上保守的反应，其主要特征是核心温度的暂时性、可调节的升高。我们已经证明，温度升高本身是一种免疫调节因子，其一个关键特征是促炎细胞因子肿瘤坏死因子α（TNF）的衰减。我们发现亚热休克热疗（FRH）激活了热/应激激活的转录因子HSF1（heat-shock-factor-1）形成一种独特的抑制形式。我们在小鼠TNFalpha 5'UTR中鉴定了一个抑制肿瘤坏死因子启动子活性的HSF1结合位点，并在肿瘤坏死因子启动子中发现了额外的HSF1依赖性抑制因子。在暴露于FRH的rnacrophages中，TNF转录在细菌脂多糖（LPS）处理后正常开始，但提前结束，从而将TNF表达降低到短暂的短脉冲。这就提出了一个问题，即在反式阻遏物存在的情况下，肿瘤坏死因子的转录是如何开始的。在这方面，我们发现在LPS处理后HSF1暂时失活，HSF1失活与肿瘤坏死因子转录的开始一致，随后HSF1的激活与肿瘤坏死因子转录的沉默一致。初步数据表明，HSF1的失活和再活化是由其磷酸化和随后在60分钟周期内的去磷酸化引起的。我们假设LPS激活HSF1磷酸化/去磷酸化的循环，并且这个过程暂时限制了TNF的表达。这项研究的总体目标是阐明HSF1调节巨噬细胞中TNF表达的分子机制。具体地说，我们将使用新的HSFl空巨噬细胞模型来：（i）定义HSF1抑制肿瘤坏死因子表达的机制，重点是它与近端肿瘤坏死因子启动子和相关的增强体的相互作用，以及它对局部染色质结构的影响；（ii）识别肿瘤坏死因子转抑制所需的HSF1结构域；（iii）阐明脂多糖激活的磷酸化事件短暂地使HSF1反式抑制失活，从而允许在FRH处理的细胞中瞬时表达肿瘤坏死因子；和（iv）确定HSF1是否直接阻断TLR信号传导，HSF1是否直接与被抑制的信号传导元件结合，并识别HSF1的活性结构域。这项研究将提供一个新的见解，即调节宿主防御的生化事件是如何被发烧时的温度升高所改变的。

DESCRIPTION (provided by applicant): Fever is an evolutionarily conserved response, the key feature of which is a temporary, regulated increase in core temperature. We have shown that the temperature increase itself is an immune modulator, one key feature of which is attenuation of the proinflammatory cytokine, tumor necrosis factor-alpha(TNF). We showed that sub-heat shock febrile-range hyperthermia (FRH) activates the heat/stress-activated transcription factor, heat shock factor-1 (HSF1) to a distinct repressor form. We identified an HSF1 binding site in the murine TNFalpha 5'UTR that represses TNF promoter activity and found evidence of additional HSF1-dependent repressors in the TNF promoter. In rnacrophages exposed to FRH, TNF transcription begins normally after treatment with bacterial lipopolysaccharide (LPS), but ends early, thereby reducing TNF expression to a brief short pulse. This raised the question of how TNF transcription could begin at all in the presence of a trans-repressor. In this regard, we found that HSF1 is transiently inactivated after LPS treatment that HSF1 inactivation coincides with onset of TNF transcription, and that subsequent HSF1 reactivation coincides with TNF transcriptional silencing. Preliminary data indicates that the inactivation and reactivation of HSF1 is caused by its phosphorylation and subsequent dephosphorylation over a 60-minute cycle. We hypothesize that LPS activate a cycle of HSF1 phosphorylation/dephosphorylation and that this process temporally restricts TNF expression. The overall goal of this research proposal is to elucidate the molecular mechanisms through which HSF1 modifies TNF expression in macrophages. Specifically, we will use novel HSFl-null macrophage model to: (i) define the mechanisms through which HSF1 represses TNF expression focusing on its interaction with the proximal TNF promoter and the associated enhanceosome, and its effect on local chromatin structure; (ii) identify HSF1 domains required for transrepression of TNF; (iii) elucidate the LPS-activated phosphorylation event(s) that transiently inactivate HSF1 trans-repression, thus allowing transient TNF expression in FRH-treated cells; and (iv) determine whether HSF1 directly blocks TLR signaling, whether HSF1 binds directly to the inhibited signaling elements, and identify the active HSF1 domains. The proposed studies will provide new insight into how the biochemical events that regulate host defenses is modified by the temperature increase that occurs during fever.

Source.Name: National Institute of General Medical Sciences

Project.Title: Identification of high affinity aptamers using massively parallel DNA sequencing

Title_Other.Title: Identification of high affinity aptamers using massively parallel DNA sequencing
大规模并行DNA测序鉴定高亲和力适体

Project.Abstract:
The vast majority of molecules are far too small to be seen with the unaided eye. In most cases the only way to detect them is with other molecules that fit round them like a key fits round a lock. The human body produces molecules like this called antibodies. When we are invaded by harmful bacteria antibodies stick to them and mark them out for destruction. Many years ago scientists realized that they could use antibodies to detect almost any kind of molecule. This opened the door to a whole range of new technologies in medicine, healthcare and research. DNA is familiar to most people as the molecule that contains the information for living things, but it can also fold into three-dimensional shapes that resemble antibodies. The shape of these structures depends on the sequence of information encoded in the DNA. Twenty years ago scientists speculated that it might be possible to combine the information properties of DNA with its ability to recognize other molecules. In a process that resembles natural selection they mixed many different DNA sequences with a single type of protein molecule. Most of them did not stick, but quite a few did, some of them more tightly than others. The scientists then used the information in DNA to make many copies of the sequences that stuck and mixed this amplified population with the protein again. This time some of the DNA that survived the first round of selection was excluded by sequences that stuck to the protein more tightly. These sequences were discarded while those that stuck were amplified to produce an even more enriched population. After many rounds of selection and amplification only a few sequences remained. The scientists called these surviving sequences aptamers after a Latin word that describes the way that other molecules fit into them like a key fits into a lock. Aptamers have many advantages over antibodies. They are smaller and more robust, and once the information encoded in an aptamer is known large amounts of it can be made inexpensively. With advantages like these it might be thought that aptamers would have supplanted antibodies long ago, but twenty years after their discovery they are still the poor-relation. The problem is that aptamers do not stick to other molecules as tightly as antibodies and recently scientists have found out why. The natural selection process used to identify them not only eliminates sequences that do not stick to the protein at all but also sequences that stick to it less strongly than the strongest. If these weaker sequences are joined to the strongest sequence a new aptamer is produced that sticks to the protein hundreds of times more tightly than the original. Technologies that read the information encoded in DNA are known as sequencing technologies. When aptamers were first discovered twenty years ago it required a great deal of effort to read the sequence of a single aptamer even though it contained less than a hundred bits of information. Now by contrast the entire 3 billion bits of information in the human genome can be read in only a few days. These advances have made it feasible to read the information encoded in all the DNA sequences that bind to a protein and not just the few that bind to it most strongly. This is what we will do in this project. When we have read all the sequences we will assemble them into a vast table using the same computing techniques that scientists use to understand the human genome. This table will tell us how sequences can be linked together to make an aptamer that sticks to molecules as tightly as an antibody. By making aptamers that stick as tightly as antibodies we will break down the barrier that is preventing their other advantages from being used. The will lead to new and improved tests that allow scientists and physicians to detect many different kinds of molecule in the same minute spot of blood, and new drugs that seek out and destroy cancer cells and harmful viruses.
Technical Summary At present antibodies are the main class of recognition molecule for non-nucleic acid target molecules. Aptamers are alternatives to antibodies that have many potential advantages. Up until now they have been identified by the SELEX process which involves multiple cycles of in vitro selection and amplification. A literature review shows that in general aptamers identified by SELEX have lower affinities than antibodies. This shortcoming is a barrier to their more widespread use. Recent work has shown that aptamer affinities can be increased by linking them to sequences that are eliminated in SELEX. This suggests that the affinities of aptamers would be improved if such sequences could be identified. The main aim of the proposed work is to show that aptamers with improved affinities can be identified by one-step in vitro selection and massively parallel DNA sequencing. In Step 1 a random library of approximately 1015 oligonucleotides will be incubated with a protein target molecule attached to magnetic beads. In Step 2 the 105 sequences that bound most strongly to the target will be clonally amplified on hydrogel micro-beads. In Step 3 the beads will be loaded into a multiwell plate, and in Step 4 the oligonucleotides attached to the beads will be sequenced. In Step 5 the sequences will be assembled to produce a table of aligned base frequencies. This table will be based on thousands of sequences and therefore differences in affinity contributed by individual bases will be evident from their higher frequency at a given locus. Importantly this table will contain information about sequences that contribute to affinity, but which would be eliminated in SELEX. Consensus sequences derived from the table will be validated by comparison with aptamers identified by SELEX. A secondary aim of the work is to show how clonally amplified beads attached to millions of potential aptamer sequences can be interrogated for functions other than simple binding to a target molecule.

绝大多数分子太小，肉眼看不见。在大多数情况下，检测它们的唯一方法是用其他分子围绕它们，就像钥匙围绕锁一样。人体产生这样的分子，称为抗体。当我们被有害细菌入侵时，抗体会粘在它们身上，并把它们标记出来以备销毁。许多年前，科学家们意识到他们可以用抗体来检测几乎任何一种分子。这为医学、医疗和研究领域的一系列新技术打开了大门。DNA作为包含生物信息的分子，大多数人都很熟悉，但它也可以折叠成类似抗体的三维形状。这些结构的形状取决于DNA中编码的信息序列。20年前，科学家们推测，将DNA的信息特性与其识别其他分子的能力结合起来是可能的。在一个类似自然选择的过程中，他们将许多不同的DNA序列与一种单一的蛋白质分子混合。他们中的大多数人没有坚持，但也有不少人坚持，其中一些人比其他人更紧密。然后，科学家们利用DNA中的信息复制了许多序列，这些序列再次将扩增后的群体与蛋白质混合在一起。这一次，在第一轮选择中幸存下来的一些DNA被那些与蛋白质结合更紧密的序列排除在外。这些序列被丢弃，而那些卡住的序列被放大以产生更丰富的种群。经过多轮的筛选和扩增，只剩下少量的序列。科学家们把这些幸存的序列称为适体适体（aptamers），用拉丁语的一个词来形容其他分子与它们的结合方式，就像钥匙与锁的结合一样。适配子比抗体有许多优点。它们更小更强壮，一旦知道了适体编码的信息，大量的信息就可以廉价地制造出来。有了这样的优势，人们可能会认为适配子早就可以取代抗体，但在发现抗体20年后，它们仍然是一个贫苦的亲戚。问题是适体不像抗体那样紧密地粘附在其他分子上，最近科学家们发现了原因。用于鉴定它们的自然选择过程不仅排除了完全不粘蛋白的序列，而且还排除了粘蛋白强度低于最强的序列。如果这些较弱的序列连接到最强的序列上，就会产生一种新的适体，这种适体与蛋白质的结合比原来的紧密数百倍。读取DNA编码信息的技术称为测序技术。二十年前，当适配子第一次被发现时，尽管它包含的信息不到一百位，但要读取一个适配子的序列却需要很大的努力。相比之下，人类基因组中的全部30亿位信息只需几天就可以读取。这些进展使得读取所有与蛋白质结合的DNA序列中编码的信息成为可能，而不仅仅是少数与蛋白质结合最紧密的序列。这就是我们在这个项目中要做的。当我们阅读完所有的序列后，我们将使用科学家用来理解人类基因组的相同计算技术，把它们组装成一张巨大的表格。这张表将告诉我们如何将序列连接在一起，形成一种像抗体一样紧密地粘附在分子上的适体。通过制造能像抗体一样紧密粘附的适体，我们将打破阻碍其其他优点被利用的屏障。这将导致新的和改进的检测方法，使科学家和医生能够在同一小片血液中检测出许多不同种类的分子，以及寻找和摧毁癌细胞和有害病毒的新药。 技术总结 目前抗体是非核酸靶分子的主要识别分子。适体是抗体的替代品，具有许多潜在的优势。到目前为止，它们已被SELEX过程所鉴定，该过程涉及多个体外选择和扩增周期。文献综述表明，SELEX鉴定的适体一般比抗体亲和力低。这一缺点阻碍了它们的广泛应用。最近的研究表明，通过将适配子亲和力与SELEX中消除的序列相连接，可以增加适配子亲和力。这表明，如果能够识别出这类序列，适配子的亲和力将得到提高。本研究的主要目的是通过一步体外选择和大规模平行DNA测序来鉴定亲和力提高的适体。在步骤1中，约1015个寡核苷酸的随机文库将与附着在磁珠上的蛋白靶分子一起孵育。在第2步中，105个与目标结合最紧密的序列将在水凝胶微珠上克隆扩增。在步骤3中，将珠装入多孔板中，在步骤4中，将对附在珠上的寡核苷酸进行序列测定。在步骤5中，将组装序列以生成对齐基频表。这张表将基于数千个序列，因此单个碱基所贡献的亲和力差异将从它们在给定位点的较高频率中明显可见。重要的是，该表将包含有助于亲和力的序列的信息，但在SELEX中将消除这些信息。将通过与SELEX鉴定的适体进行比较来验证从表中得到的一致序列。第二个目标

Source.Name: Biotechnology and Biological Sciences Research Council

Project.Title: An adsorbent to extract rubidium from sea water

Title_Other.Title: 从海水中提取铷的吸附剂
An adsorbent to extract rubidium from sea water

Class.ClassName: 海水资源开发、海水资源综合利用

Project.Abstract: Disposal of rejected brine from seawater reverse osmosis desalination plants causes major pollution problems and existing solutions are expensive. Recovery of valuable metals such as rubidium (Rb) after further concentration of the brine will lead to environmental and economic benefits. This project aims to develop a novel electrospun nanofibre membrane distillation membrane to economically concentrate the brine and to develop novel adsorbents and desorbents to recover the valuable Rb. It is expected that the concentration and recovery of Rb will lead to a sustainable way of handling the brine, as the concentration cost can be offset by the selling of Rb.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 海水反渗透海水淡化厂的废碱液处理造成了严重的污染问题，现有的解决方案价格昂贵。卤水进一步浓缩后回收铷（Rb）等有价金属将产生环境效益和经济效益。本项目旨在开发一种新型的电纺纳米纤维膜蒸馏膜，以经济地浓缩卤水，并开发新的吸附剂和解吸剂以回收有价值的铷。由于Rb的销售可以抵消浓缩成本，预计Rb的浓缩和回收将导致卤水的可持续处理方式。

Disposal of rejected brine from seawater reverse osmosis desalination plants causes major pollution problems and existing solutions are expensive. Recovery of valuable metals such as rubidium (Rb) after further concentration of the brine will lead to environmental and economic benefits. This project aims to develop a novel electrospun nanofibre membrane distillation membrane to economically concentrate the brine and to develop novel adsorbents and desorbents to recover the valuable Rb. It is expected that the concentration and recovery of Rb will lead to a sustainable way of handling the brine, as the concentration cost can be offset by the selling of Rb.

Project.Title: Insulin Resistance in Adolescents at High Risk for PCOS

Title_Other.Title: 多囊卵巢综合征高危青少年的胰岛素抵抗
Insulin Resistance in Adolescents at High Risk for PCOS

Class.ClassName: 理论、技术、方法、研究、评价、策略

Project.Abstract: DESCRIPTION (provided by applicant): The applicant previously focused his research on molecular aspects of steroid hormone biosynthesis. He recently assumed a position as Assistant Professor of Pediatrics in the UCLA School of Medicine. To further his career, as an independent investigator, he has established relationships with experts in the fields of ovarian physiology, insulin signaling, sensitivity and secretion. Under their mentored supervision, the candidate will initiate studies to address the childhood origins of the polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS). PCOS is a heterogeneous clinical entity characterized by the post-pubertal onset of menstrual irregularities and excessive production of male hormones. PCOS is the most common endocrine disorder of women of reproductive age, affecting 5-10% of women worldwide. Insulin resistance is a necessary antecedent of both type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) and the hormonal imbalances characteristic of PCOS. As insulin resistance is a transient physiologic phenomenon of normal pubertal maturation, the applicant hypothesizes that the requisite insulin resistance of PCOS must be expressed initially during pubertal progression. Cross- sectional and longitudinal studies will describe the patterns of insulin sensitivity that emerge throughout puberty in young women. Initially, the applicant will contrast the insulin sensitivity achieved on frequently sampled intravenous (iv) glucose tolerance tests between two matched sets of 25 subjects from families with, and without, histories of PCOS, at each of two distinct stages of puberty. He will then test the hypothesis that insulin resistance evolving throughout puberty in 40 girls at high risk for development of PCOS differs qualitatively and quantitatively in its pattern of expression, when compared with an equal number of adolescent controls. The applicant will measure specific biophysical and biochemical parameters to determine whether changes in these easily-obtained indices correlate with and predict changes in insulin sensitivity. To begin to elucidate the cellular mechanism for this unique form of insulin resistance, the applicant further proposes to obtain needle biopsies of insulin-responsive muscle from select subjects who demonstrate extremes of insulin sensitivity in the cross- sectional study. The applicant will assess the integrity and function of specific molecules necessary for cellular transmission of the insulin signal, to determine whether changes in these effectors might be responsible for evolving insulin resistance in at-risk individuals. This work will provide insight into the earliest relationship between PCOS and insulin resistance, at the whole-body and cellular level. Enhanced understanding of these fundamental events may permit earlier detection and intervention, thus preventing the profound physiological consequences of unabated T2DM associated with PCOS.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 描述（由申请人提供）：申请人以前集中于类固醇激素生物合成的分子方面的研究。他最近在加州大学洛杉矶分校医学院担任儿科助理教授。作为一名独立研究者，为了进一步发展他的事业，他与卵巢生理学、胰岛素信号、敏感性和分泌等领域的专家建立了联系。在他们的指导下，候选人将开始研究多囊卵巢综合征（PCOS）的儿童起源。多囊卵巢综合征（PCOS）是一种异质性的临床疾病，其特征是青春期后月经失调和男性激素分泌过多。多囊卵巢综合征（PCOS）是育龄妇女最常见的内分泌疾病，影响着全球5-10%的妇女。胰岛素抵抗是2型糖尿病（T2DM）和多囊卵巢综合征（PCOS）激素失衡的必要前因。由于胰岛素抵抗是青春期正常发育过程中的一种短暂生理现象，申请人假设多囊卵巢综合征必需的胰岛素抵抗必须在青春期发育过程中最初表达。横断面和纵向研究将描述年轻女性青春期出现的胰岛素敏感性模式。最初，申请人将对比两组匹配的25名受试者在青春期的两个不同阶段在有和没有多囊卵巢综合征病史的家庭中通过频繁静脉注射（iv）葡萄糖耐量试验获得的胰岛素敏感性。然后，他将验证这样一个假设，即40名患有多囊卵巢综合征的高危女孩在整个青春期的胰岛素抵抗的表达模式在质量和数量上与同等数量的青少年对照组相比有所不同。申请人将测量特定的生物物理和生化参数，以确定这些容易获得的指标的变化是否与胰岛素敏感性的变化相关并预测其变化。为了开始阐明这种独特形式的胰岛素抵抗的细胞机制，申请人进一步建议从在横断面研究中表现出极端胰岛素敏感性的受试者那里获得胰岛素反应性肌肉的针状活检。申请人将评估胰岛素信号细胞传输所必需的特定分子的完整性和功能，以确定这些效应器的变化是否可能导致高危人群胰岛素抵抗的形成。这项工作将在全身和细胞水平上提供对多囊卵巢综合征和胰岛素抵抗之间最早关系的了解。加强对这些基本事件的了解，可能有助于早期发现和干预，从而防止与多囊卵巢综合征相关的未减弱的2型糖尿病的深刻生理后果。

Source.Name: National Institute of Child Health and Human Development

Project.Title: Research Initiation Award: Dynamic Program Slicing

Title_Other.Title: Research Initiation Award: Dynamic Program Slicing
研究启动奖：动态程序切片

Class.ClassName: 程序设计、数据库、软件工程

Project.Abstract: 9308895 Korel This project will investigate dynamic program slicing and its application in the debugging of large programs. Slicing has been shown to be useful in program debugging. The major idea behind slicing is to identify that part of the program that might potentially contain the fault. It has been shown that by taking a particular program execution into account, dynamic slicing may significantly reduce the size of the slice as compared to static slicing. As a result, dynamic slicing is better suited for the purpose of debugging than static slicing. Our objective in this project is to continue our earlier research on dynamic slicing and algorithmic debugging. The investigation will involve constructing a dynamic slicing environment, extending the theory of dynamic slicing, development of new methods of dynamic slice derivation, and evaluating the effectiveness of dynamic slicing in the process of debugging of large programs. ***

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 9308895korel本项目将研究动态程序切片及其在大型程序调试中的应用。切片在程序调试中被证明是有用的。切片背后的主要思想是识别程序中可能包含错误的部分。研究表明，与静态切片相比，动态切片考虑了特定程序的执行，可以显著减小切片的大小。因此，动态切片比静态切片更适合用于调试。我们在这个项目中的目标是继续我们先前的动态切片和算法调试的研究。研究内容包括构建动态切片环境、扩展动态切片理论、开发新的动态切片推导方法、评估动态切片在大型程序调试过程中的有效性。***

9308895 Korel This project will investigate dynamic program slicing and its application in the debugging of large programs. Slicing has been shown to be useful in program debugging. The major idea behind slicing is to identify that part of the program that might potentially contain the fault. It has been shown that by taking a particular program execution into account, dynamic slicing may significantly reduce the size of the slice as compared to static slicing. As a result, dynamic slicing is better suited for the purpose of debugging than static slicing. Our objective in this project is to continue our earlier research on dynamic slicing and algorithmic debugging. The investigation will involve constructing a dynamic slicing environment, extending the theory of dynamic slicing, development of new methods of dynamic slice derivation, and evaluating the effectiveness of dynamic slicing in the process of debugging of large programs. ***

Source.Name: Directorate for Computer & Information Science & Engineering

Project.Title: ANTIOXIDANT EXPERIMENTAL THERAPY OF CIRCULATORY SHOCK

Title_Other.Title: ANTIOXIDANT EXPERIMENTAL THERAPY OF CIRCULATORY SHOCK
循环性休克的抗氧化实验治疗

Project.Abstract: In recent studies, our group have presented evidence that mercaptoethylguanidine (MEG) and related agents such as its dimeric form guanidinoethyldisulfide (GED) are promising inducible nitric oxide synthase (iNOS) inhibitors with selectivity for the inducible isoform (iNOS). In addition, we have obtained data, which demonstrated that these compounds are scavengers of the cytotoxic oxidant peroxynitrite. Based on the role NO and peroxynitrite plays in the pathogenesis of circulatory shock, Inotek Corporation is in the process of the development of mercaptoalkylguanidines for the experimental therapy of circulatory shock. Inotek is now also developing a "second generation" class of iNOS inhibitor/peroxynitrite scavenger compounds, exemplified by the compounds selenoethylguanidine and selenopropylguanidine. Preliminary in vitro data suggest that substitution of the sulfur group to selenium increases the reactivity of the compound with peroxynitrite by about 100- fold. In addition, selenoguanidines maintain their iNOS inhibitory effects. The first aim of the current study is to synthesize selenoethylguanidine (SEG), and perform in vitro studies to characterize its effects as NOS inhibitor, determine their isoform selectivity, and their peroxynitrite scavenging activity. The second aim of the study is to test SEG in a rat model of endotoxic shock, where NO and peroxynitrite play a key role in disease development. The results of the present application will permit application for Phase 2 SBIR funding to support: pre-clinical pharmaceutical testing (further testing in animal models, advanced toxicity determinations, pathology, stability, pharmacokinetics, in vivo efficacy), IND application to the FDA, and Phase 1 clinical trial). PROPOSED COMMERCIAL APPLICATIONS: The annual anticipated revenues for an effective therapeutic to prevent and treat cardiovascular chock is over $20 billion in the US alone.

In addition, we have obtained data, which demonstrated that these compounds are scavengers of the cytotoxic oxidant peroxynitrite.
