在最近的研究中，我们发现巯基乙基胍（MEG）及其二聚形式的胍基乙基二硫醚（GED）等相关药物是具有诱导亚型（iNOS）选择性的诱导型一氧化氮合酶（iNOS）抑制剂。此外，我们还获得了一些数据，证明这些化合物是细胞毒性氧化剂过氧亚硝酸盐的清除剂。基于NO和过氧亚硝酸盐在循环性休克发病机制中的作用，Inotek公司正在开发巯基烷基胍，用于循环性休克的实验治疗。Inotek目前也在开发一种“第二代”iNOS抑制剂/过氧亚硝酸盐清除剂化合物，以硒代乙基胍和硒代丙基胍化合物为例。初步的体外实验数据表明，用硒取代硫基可以使化合物与过氧亚硝酸盐的反应性提高约100倍。此外，硒胍还具有抑制iNOS的作用。本研究的第一个目的是合成硒乙基胍（SEG），并在体外研究其作为NOS抑制剂的作用，测定其亚型选择性和清除过氧亚硝酸盐的活性。本研究的第二个目的是在内毒素休克大鼠模型中检测SEG，NO和过氧亚硝酸盐在疾病发展中起关键作用。本申请的结果将允许申请第2阶段SBIR资金支持：临床前药物试验（在动物模型中的进一步试验、高级毒性测定、病理学、稳定性、药代动力学、体内疗效）、向FDA申请IND和第1阶段临床试验。拟议商业应用：仅在美国，一种有效预防和治疗心血管阻塞的治疗药物的年预期收入就超过200亿美元。

Source.Name: National Heart Lung and Blood Institute

Project.Title: Identification and Characterization of Signaling Complexes Required for Egg Activation at Fertilization

Title_Other.Title: 受精卵激活所需信号复合物的鉴定与表征
Identification and Characterization of Signaling Complexes Required for Egg Activation at Fertilization

Class.ClassName: 理论、技术、方法、研究、评价、策略
碱土金属、碱土金属合金

Project.Abstract: 0110790 Foltz Fertilization initiates the start of the development of a new organism. Sperm binding and fusion launch the egg from a quiescent state into an active state, committed to cell cycle entry. How does the meeting of these two cells signal the activation of development? In particular, the release of Ca2+ from internal egg stores is a hallmark of egg activation and has been the focus of intensive study. Studies using echinoderm (sea urchin and sea star) gametes have suggested a model for a signal transduction pathway that leads to initiation of Ca2+ release. The working model is that sperm-egg interaction activates a Src family tyrosine kinase(s) (SFK) that in turn (directly or indirectly) activates PLCg, causing the production of IP3 and subsequent release of Ca2+ from internal stores in the egg. This research will test the current signaling pathway model by identifying and characterizing the endogenous components in the egg, evaluating their interactions, and investigating their mode of regulation. The results of the proposed experiments should provide insight into how signaling components are organized in the sea urchin egg and interact with one another to trigger egg activation. There are two specific aims. First, the Src-type egg tyrosine kinase(s) that is activated at fertilization will be identified and characterized. cDNAs encoding egg SFKs are being cloned and antibodies will be raised against the proteins. The necessity of the SFK(s) for Ca2+ release will be tested by inhibiting its function using a dominant-interfering approach. The antibodies will be used to characterize the protein's activity at fertilization, localization in the egg, and potential interaction with PLCg and other egg signaling or cytoskeletal components. The second aim will investigate the mechanism of PLCg activation. The interaction of an egg SFK(s) with egg PLCg will be investigated, as will the localization and tyrosine phosphorylation state of PLCg. Together, the results from the proposed work should provide insight into how sperm-egg interaction results in one of the most important and universal events of egg activation, the release of Ca2+ in the egg.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 0110790福兹受精启动了一个新有机体的发育。精子结合和融合使卵子从静止状态进入活跃状态，致力于细胞周期的进入。这两个细胞的相遇如何标志着发育的激活？特别是，鸡蛋内部储存的钙离子的释放是鸡蛋激活的一个标志，一直是深入研究的焦点。利用棘皮动物（海胆和海星）配子的研究已经提出了一个导致钙释放开始的信号传导途径模型。其工作模式是精卵相互作用激活Src家族酪氨酸激酶（SFK），进而（直接或间接）激活PLCg，导致IP3的产生和Ca2+的释放。本研究将通过识别和表征鸡蛋中的内源性成分，评估它们之间的相互作用，并研究它们的调节方式，来检验目前的信号通路模型。这些实验的结果应该能让我们深入了解海胆卵中的信号成分是如何组织的，以及它们之间如何相互作用来触发卵细胞的激活。有两个具体目标。首先，Src型卵子酪氨酸激酶（s）在受精时被激活，将被鉴定和表征。编码卵子sfk的cdna正在克隆中，并将针对这些蛋白产生抗体。通过使用主要干扰方法抑制其功能来测试SFK（s）释放Ca2+的必要性。这些抗体将被用来表征蛋白质在受精时的活性、在卵子中的定位以及与PLCg和其他卵子信号或细胞骨架成分的潜在相互作用。第二个目的是研究PLCg激活的机制。将研究卵子SFK（s）与卵子PLCg的相互作用，以及PLCg的定位和酪氨酸磷酸化状态。总之，这项工作的结果应该能让我们深入了解精卵相互作用是如何导致卵子活化的最重要和最普遍的事件之一，即卵子中钙的释放。

Project.Title: Unusual Stereochemical Opportunities in Extended Helical Conformations

Title_Other.Title: Unusual Stereochemical Opportunities in Extended Helical Conformations
延伸螺旋构象中不寻常的立体化学机会

Class.ClassName: 工业计划理论、工业管理体制理论

Project.Abstract: This grant from the Organic Dynamics Program of the Chemistry Division and the Polymers Program of the Division of Materials Research supports the continuing work of Professor Green and Dr. Levon at the Polytechnic University. The results of this research will give new understanding and insight to the right or left hand helical nature of polymers. The factors that control the preferential formation of right- or left- handed helices will be explored. Since bio-polymers, such as peptides and DNA, can exist in right- or left- handed helices, this work is of particular interest. Drs. Green and Levon will provide new and important information in three areas, of which all are related to how the chirality of the monomers effect the helical chirality of the polymers. In the first area, the effect of a chiral center on the chiral helicity of isocyanate polymers will be studied. It has been found that a chiral center by virtue of deuterium substitution in R-1- deuteriohexylisocyanate had a profound effect on the helical chirality of the polyisocyanate. This observation will be studied further as well as the helical chirality of the polymer resulting from R-2-deuteriohexylisocyanate. In the second area, a study will be made of the relationship between helical twist of a side chain containing a biphenyl group in an N-carboxyanhydride monomer and helicity of the polyglutamate polymer. In the third area, the gelation of polyisocyanides as function of the stereochemistry of the monomer will be investigated.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 这项来自化学部有机动力学计划和材料研究部聚合物计划的拨款支持了理工大学格林教授和莱文博士的持续工作。这项研究的结果将使人们对聚合物的左右螺旋性质有新的认识和见解。将探索控制左右手螺旋优先形成的因素。由于生物聚合物，如肽和DNA，可以存在于右手或左手螺旋，这项工作是特别感兴趣的。Green博士和Levon博士将在三个方面提供新的重要信息，这些信息都与单体的手性如何影响聚合物的螺旋手性有关。首先，研究了手性中心对异氰酸酯聚合物手性螺旋度的影响。发现在R-1-氘异氰酸酯中，氘取代的手性中心对多异氰酸酯的螺旋手性有着深刻的影响。这一观察结果将进一步研究，以及由R-2-氘异氰酸酯生成的聚合物的螺旋手性。在第二个领域，将研究N-羧酸酐单体中含联苯侧链的螺旋扭曲与聚谷氨酸聚合物的螺旋度之间的关系。在第三个方面，将研究多异氰酸酯的凝胶化作用，作为单体立体化学的函数。

This grant from the Organic Dynamics Program of the Chemistry Division and the Polymers Program of the Division of Materials Research supports the continuing work of Professor Green and Dr. Levon at the Polytechnic University. The results of this research will give new understanding and insight to the right or left hand helical nature of polymers. The factors that control the preferential formation of right- or left- handed helices will be explored. Since bio-polymers, such as peptides and DNA, can exist in right- or left- handed helices, this work is of particular interest. Drs. Green and Levon will provide new and important information in three areas, of which all are related to how the chirality of the monomers effect the helical chirality of the polymers. In the first area, the effect of a chiral center on the chiral helicity of isocyanate polymers will be studied. It has been found that a chiral center by virtue of deuterium substitution in R-1- deuteriohexylisocyanate had a profound effect on the helical chirality of the polyisocyanate. This observation will be studied further as well as the helical chirality of the polymer resulting from R-2-deuteriohexylisocyanate. In the second area, a study will be made of the relationship between helical twist of a side chain containing a biphenyl group in an N-carboxyanhydride monomer and helicity of the polyglutamate polymer. In the third area, the gelation of polyisocyanides as function of the stereochemistry of the monomer will be investigated.

Project.Title: CAREER: Activated Escape in Nonequilibrium Micromechanical Oscillators - Research and Education Program

Title_Other.Title: CAREER: Activated Escape in Nonequilibrium Micromechanical Oscillators - Research and Education Program
职业：非平衡微机械振荡器中的激活逃逸-研究和教育项目

Project.Abstract: Non-Technical Abstract: Fluctuations play a crucial role in many physical and biological phenomena at the micro- and nanoscale. A system can be induced to switch out of a metastable state when fluctuations are sufficiently large. Even though such transitions may occur infrequently, they largely determine the behavior of systems with multiple stable states. The goal of this Faculty Early Career Award at the University of Florida is to study fluctuation-induced switching in a mechanical device with features as small as a millionth of a meter. When this device is periodically driven, it oscillates with one of two distinct amplitudes. In the presence of fluctuations, the oscillation amplitude switches between the two stable values. The research will focus on revealing generic fluctuation phenomena that occur not only in our micro-scale mechanical system but also in other nonequilibrium systems. Such studies will answer open questions and enhance the understanding of fluctuations in systems that are far from equilibrium. Even though the proposed research is of fundamental nature, the findings could open possibilities for new detection schemes and signal-processing applications using micro-scale mechanical devices. In terms of outreach, the program will provide summer research experiences for high school students. Furthermore, demonstration materials will be developed for the students to bring back to their schools to further enhance the educational impact. Micromechanical devices will also be used to enhance teaching in an introductory mechanics course. Technical Abstract: The goal of this Faculty Early Career Award at the University of Florida is to study activated switching between coexisting stable states in systems far from thermal equilibrium. Experimental studies will be carried out using an underdamped nonlinear micromechanical torsional oscillator. Under a sufficiently strong periodic driving field, the oscillator possesses two stable dynamical states with different oscillation amplitudes within a certain range of driving frequencies. The research will focus on revealing the scaling behaviors of the activation barrier with varying system parameters and generic features of fluctuations in the parameter range where stationary populations of the stable states are close to each other. Such studies will allow verification of the existing predictions, answer open questions on fluctuations in nonequilibrium systems and stimulate new theoretical research. Even though the proposed research is of fundamental nature, the findings could open possibilities for novel sensing schemes and signal-processing applications using micromechanical devices. In terms of outreach, the program will provide summer research experiences for high school students. Furthermore, demonstration materials will be developed for the students to bring back to their schools to further enhance the educational impact. Micromechanical devices will also be used to enhance teaching in an introductory mechanics course.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 非技术摘要：涨落在许多微观和纳米尺度的物理和生物现象中起着至关重要的作用。当涨落足够大时，可以诱导系统从亚稳态状态切换出去。即使这种转变很少发生，但它们在很大程度上决定了具有多个稳定状态的系统的行为。弗罗里达大学（University of Florida）教师早期职业奖（Faculty Early Career Award）的目标是研究一种机械装置中的波动诱导开关，这种装置的特点只有百万分之一米。当这个装置被周期性地驱动时，它以两个不同的振幅之一振荡。在存在涨落的情况下，振荡幅度在两个稳定值之间切换。这项研究将集中于揭示一般波动现象，不仅发生在我们的微观机械系统，而且也发生在其他非平衡系统。这些研究将回答开放性问题，并增进对远离均衡的系统波动的理解。尽管所提出的研究是基础性的，但这一发现可能为使用微尺度机械装置的新检测方案和信号处理应用开辟可能性。在推广方面，该计划将为高中生提供暑期研究经验。此外，还将制作示范材料，供学生带回学校，进一步提高教育影响力。微机械装置也将用于加强机械入门课程的教学。技术摘要：佛罗里达大学教师早期职业奖的目标是研究在远离热平衡的系统中共存的稳定状态之间的激活切换。将使用欠阻尼非线性微机械扭转振荡器进行实验研究。在足够强的周期驱动场作用下，在一定的驱动频率范围内，振荡器具有两个振荡幅度不同的稳定动态。研究的重点是揭示系统参数变化时激活势垒的标度行为以及稳定态的平稳布居数相近时参数范围内涨落的一般特征。这样的研究将允许验证现有的预测，回答关于非平衡系统波动的开放性问题，并激发新的理论研究。尽管所提出的研究是基础性的，但这一发现可能为使用微机械装置的新型传感方案和信号处理应用开辟可能性。在推广方面，该计划将为高中生提供暑期研究经验。此外，还将制作示范材料，供学生带回学校，进一步提高教育影响力。微机械装置也将用于加强机械入门课程的教学。

A system can be induced to switch out of a metastable state when fluctuations are sufficiently large. The goal of this Faculty Early Career Award at the University of Florida is to study fluctuation-induced switching in a mechanical device with features as small as a millionth of a meter. When this device is periodically driven, it oscillates with one of two distinct amplitudes. In the presence of fluctuations, the oscillation amplitude switches between the two stable values. The research will focus on revealing generic fluctuation phenomena that occur not only in our micro-scale mechanical system but also in other nonequilibrium systems. Such studies will answer open questions and enhance the understanding of fluctuations in systems that are far from equilibrium. Even though the proposed research is of fundamental nature, the findings could open possibilities for new detection schemes and signal-processing applications using micro-scale mechanical devices. In terms of outreach, the program will provide summer research experiences for high school students. Furthermore, demonstration materials will be developed for the students to bring back to their schools to further enhance the educational impact. Micromechanical devices will also be used to enhance teaching in an introductory mechanics course. The research will focus on revealing the scaling behaviors of the activation barrier with varying system parameters and generic features of fluctuations in the parameter range where stationary populations of the stable states are close to each other. Such studies will allow verification of the existing predictions, answer open questions on fluctuations in nonequilibrium systems and stimulate new theoretical research. Even though the proposed research is of fundamental nature, the findings could open possibilities for novel sensing schemes and signal-processing applications using micromechanical devices. Project.Title: Spectral Analysis

Title_Other.Title: Spectral Analysis
光谱分析

Project.Abstract: 9707661 Simon The spectral analysis of Schrodinger operators with slowly decaying or ergodic potentials will be studied. Making use of recent results of Last-Simon, Kiselev-Last-Simon, and Jitomirskaya-Last, the project examines fractal properties of spectral measures and related issues of long time for quantum dynamics. A major thrust will be to attempt to extend to general dimension the ideas, techniques, and results developed for one-dimensional systems. Among open questions which will be examined is the existence of mixed singular continuous and absolutely continuous spectra in explicit models. Spectral analysis of differential operators has been a major theme of twentieth century analysis and theoretical physics. Recent studies have shown that potentialities that were allowed by classical works of Weyl, Titchmarsh, Hartman, and Wintner not only occur, but are not pathological as was suggested by these classical works. Links were made with ideas of chaos science, particularly with notions of Hausdorff dimension. It is proposed to study these ideas further, to extend them from the model one space dimension of earlier works to physically relevant three dimensions, and to explore the consequences for the long-time dynamics of quantum systems.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 9707661 Simon研究具有缓慢衰减或遍历势的薛定谔算符的谱分析。利用Last Simon、Kiselev Last Simon和Jitomirskaya Last的最新结果，本项目研究了光谱测量的分形性质以及量子动力学长期以来的相关问题。一个主要的主旨将是尝试将一维系统开发的思想、技术和结果扩展到一般维度。在公开的问题中，将要检验的是显式模型中混合奇异连续谱和绝对连续谱的存在性。微分算子的谱分析是二十世纪分析和理论物理学的一个重要课题。最近的研究表明，韦尔、蒂奇马斯、哈特曼和温特纳的经典作品所允许的潜力不仅存在，而且不像这些经典作品所暗示的那样是病态的。与混沌科学的思想，特别是豪斯多夫维度的概念有联系。我们建议进一步研究这些想法，将它们从先前的模型一维空间扩展到物理相关的三维空间，并探索量子系统长期动力学的结果。

9707661 Simon The spectral analysis of Schrodinger operators with slowly decaying or ergodic potentials will be studied. Making use of recent results of Last-Simon, Kiselev-Last-Simon, and Jitomirskaya-Last, the project examines fractal properties of spectral measures and related issues of long time for quantum dynamics. A major thrust will be to attempt to extend to general dimension the ideas, techniques, and results developed for one-dimensional systems. Among open questions which will be examined is the existence of mixed singular continuous and absolutely continuous spectra in explicit models. Spectral analysis of differential operators has been a major theme of twentieth century analysis and theoretical physics. Recent studies have shown that potentialities that were allowed by classical works of Weyl, Titchmarsh, Hartman, and Wintner not only occur, but are not pathological as was suggested by these classical works. Links were made with ideas of chaos science, particularly with notions of Hausdorff dimension. It is proposed to study these ideas further, to extend them from the model one space dimension of earlier works to physically relevant three dimensions, and to explore the consequences for the long-time dynamics of quantum systems.

Project.Title: LUNG PERFUSION BY POSITRON EMISSSION TOMOGRAPHY

Title_Other.Title: LUNG PERFUSION BY POSITRON EMISSSION TOMOGRAPHY
正电子发射断层扫描肺灌注

Project.Abstract: Pulmonary edema, the most immediate consequence of acute injury to the pulmonary endothelium, is the principal cause of hypoxemia, respiratory distress, and the need for mechanical ventilatory support during the acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS). Recently, we reported that specific thromboxane receptor blockade could reduce experimental pulmonary edema accumulation. The severity of hypoxemia in ARDS is off-set by a redistribution of pulmonary blood flow away from edematous lung units. We also found recently, using the quantitative imaging technique of positron emission tomography, that perfusion redistribution could be prevented by pretreatment with low-dose endotoxin, which resulted in markedly increased endogenous prostacyclin production by a cyclooxygenase (COX)-2 dependent mechanism. The result was systemic hypotension as well as pulmonary vasodilation with severe hypoxemia. The dramatic increases in prostacyclin production after low-dose endotoxin were dependent on the presence of lung injury, implying a synergistic effect. Thus, we propose the following specific aims: Specific Aim 1: to determine the mechanisms responsible for the physiologic and biochemical synergistic effects of low-dose endotoxin with experimentally-induced acute lung injury. Specific Aim 2: to determine the relationship between changes in lung COX-2 expression and lung arachidonic acid utilization, and increased prostacyclin production, in patients with ARDS. Specific Aim 3: to determine the impact of specific thromboxane receptor blockade on pulmonary capillary pressures and extravascular lung water accumulation in patients with ARDS. To accomplish these specific aims, we will employ novel radiopharmaceuticals and highly specific inhibitors of key putative pathways in studies which will evaluate the role of neutrophils, tumor necrosis factor, platelet activating factor, phospholipase A2 activation, COX-2 expression, pulmonary venoconstriction, and altered arachidonic acid kinetics, in both experimental animals and patients with ARDS. These studies will help determine how changes in pulmonary perfusion affect the physiologic expression of acute lung injury. They will also extend previous work targeted toward improving outcomes associated with ARDS by limiting pulmonary edema accumulation.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 肺水肿是急性肺内皮损伤的最直接后果，是急性呼吸窘迫综合征（ARDS）时低氧血症、呼吸窘迫和机械通气支持的主要原因。最近，我们报道了特异性血栓素受体阻滞剂可以减少实验性肺水肿的积聚。ARDS患者低氧血症的严重程度是由水肿肺单位的肺血流量重新分布引起的。最近，我们还发现，利用正电子发射断层扫描的定量成像技术，低剂量内毒素预处理可以防止灌注再分布，这导致环氧合酶（COX）-2依赖机制显著增加内源性前列环素的产生。结果是全身性低血压，肺血管舒张，严重低氧血症。低剂量内毒素后前列环素的显著增加依赖于肺损伤的存在，这意味着一种协同作用。因此，我们提出以下具体目标：具体目标1：确定小剂量内毒素与实验性急性肺损伤生理生化协同作用的机制。目的2：探讨急性呼吸窘迫综合征（ARDS）患者肺组织COX-2表达变化与肺花生四烯酸利用及前列环素生成增加的关系。目的3：探讨特异性血栓素受体阻滞剂对ARDS患者肺毛细血管压力和血管外肺积水的影响。为了达到这些特定的目的，我们将在研究中使用新型的放射性药物和关键假定途径的高度特异性抑制剂，这些药物将评估中性粒细胞、肿瘤坏死因子、血小板活化因子、磷脂酶A2激活、COX-2表达、肺静脉阻力，改变实验动物和ARDS患者的花生四烯酸动力学。这些研究将有助于确定肺灌注的变化如何影响急性肺损伤的生理表达。他们还将通过限制肺水肿的积聚来扩展先前的工作，以改善与ARDS相关的结果。

Pulmonary edema, the most immediate consequence of acute injury to the pulmonary endothelium, is the principal cause of hypoxemia, respiratory distress, and the need for mechanical ventilatory support during the acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS). Recently, we reported that specific thromboxane receptor blockade could reduce experimental pulmonary edema accumulation. The severity of hypoxemia in ARDS is off-set by a redistribution of pulmonary blood flow away from edematous lung units. We also found recently, using the quantitative imaging technique of positron emission tomography, that perfusion redistribution could be prevented by pretreatment with low-dose endotoxin, which resulted in markedly increased endogenous prostacyclin production by a cyclooxygenase (COX)-2 dependent mechanism. The result was systemic hypotension as well as pulmonary vasodilation with severe hypoxemia. The dramatic increases in prostacyclin production after low-dose endotoxin were dependent on the presence of lung injury, implying a synergistic effect. Thus, we propose the following specific aims: Specific Aim 1: to determine the mechanisms responsible for the physiologic and biochemical synergistic effects of low-dose endotoxin with experimentally-induced acute lung injury. Specific Aim 2: to determine the relationship between changes in lung COX-2 expression and lung arachidonic acid utilization, and increased prostacyclin production, in patients with ARDS. Specific Aim 3: to determine the impact of specific thromboxane receptor blockade on pulmonary capillary pressures and extravascular lung water accumulation in patients with ARDS. To accomplish these specific aims, we will employ novel radiopharmaceuticals and highly specific inhibitors of key putative pathways in studies which will evaluate the role of neutrophils, tumor necrosis factor, platelet activating factor, phospholipase A2 activation, COX-2 expression, pulmonary venoconstriction, and altered arachidonic acid kinetics, in both experimental animals and patients with ARDS. These studies will help determine how changes in pulmonary perfusion affect the physiologic expression of acute lung injury. They will also extend previous work targeted toward improving outcomes associated with ARDS by limiting pulmonary edema accumulation.

Source.Name: National Heart Lung and Blood Institute

Project.Title: Distribution of Fractures in Layered Media Undergoing Extension

Title_Other.Title: Distribution of Fractures in Layered Media Undergoing Extension
层状介质中裂缝的扩展分布

Project.Title: Activation mechanisms of the Hypoxia Inducible Factor-1a (HIF-1a) and the HIF-Like-Factor

Title_Other.Title: Activation mechanisms of the Hypoxia Inducible Factor-1a (HIF-1a) and the HIF-Like-Factor
缺氧诱导因子-1a（HIF-1a）和类HIF因子的激活机制

Project.Abstract: A continual supply of oxygen is essential for normal functioning of the human body. When oxygen levels become limiting, the body attempts to rectify the situation by increasing the number of oxygen carrying red blood cells and promoting development of new blood vessels to increase the blood supply to tissues. Cells also adapt by altering their internal biochemistry and metabolism to decrease energy needs. These changes are the result of a genetic reprogramming within the cells. A major question is how the cells sense they are in a low oxygen environment and by what mechanisms they initiate genetic reprogramming. We are studying two proteins which have the ability to alter activity of genes when cells are stressed by hypoxia (low oxygen), and seek to discover how the proteins switch from latent forms to active forms in response to hypoxia. A greater understanding of the molecular mechanisms involved in the cellular hypoxic response is important to the development of new therapeutics for disease states involving disrupted oxygen flow (eg heart attack and stroke). Drugs which would block the hypoxic induced development of blood vessels could also be extremely beneficial in cancer treatment, as blocking blood supply to growing tumours can result in their starvation and shrinkage.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: A continual supply of oxygen is essential for normal functioning of the human body. When oxygen levels become limiting, the body attempts to rectify the situation by increasing the number of oxygen carrying red blood cells and promoting development of new blood vessels to increase the blood supply to tissues. Cells also adapt by altering their internal biochemistry and metabolism to decrease energy needs. These changes are the result of a genetic reprogramming within the cells. A major question is how the cells sense they are in a low oxygen environment and by what mechanisms they initiate genetic reprogramming. We are studying two proteins which have the ability to alter activity of genes when cells are stressed by hypoxia (low oxygen), and seek to discover how the proteins switch from latent forms to active forms in response to hypoxia. A greater understanding of the molecular mechanisms involved in the cellular hypoxic response is important to the development of new therapeutics for disease states involving disrupted oxygen flow (eg heart attack and stroke). Drugs which would block the hypoxic induced development of blood vessels could also be extremely beneficial in cancer treatment, as blocking blood supply to growing tumours can result in their starvation and shrinkage.

持续的供氧对人体的正常功能是必不可少的。当氧气水平变得有限时，身体试图通过增加携带氧气的红细胞的数量和促进新血管的发展来增加组织的血液供应来纠正这种状况。细胞也通过改变其内部生物化学和新陈代谢来适应，以减少能量需求。这些变化是细胞内基因重新编程的结果。一个主要的问题是细胞在低氧环境中如何感知它们，以及它们通过什么机制启动基因重编程。我们正在研究两种蛋白质，它们在细胞受到缺氧（低氧）胁迫时能够改变基因的活性，并试图发现这些蛋白质是如何因缺氧而从潜在形式转变为活性形式的。进一步了解细胞缺氧反应的分子机制，对于开发新的治疗方法，治疗包括氧流量中断（如心脏病发作和中风）的疾病非常重要。阻断缺氧诱导的血管发育的药物在癌症治疗中也非常有益，因为阻断肿瘤生长的血液供应会导致肿瘤的饥饿和萎缩。

Source.Name: National Health and Medical Research Council

Project.Title: Development of Tobacco Control Trial among Migrant Workers in Guangzhou, China

Title_Other.Title: Development of Tobacco Control Trial among Migrant Workers in Guangzhou, China
广州市外来务工人员控烟试验进展

Project.Abstract: <p>First, the package would be designed by tailoring the WHO 5A's model into 5A's group consulting intervention package through literature review, in-depth interview and focus group discussion. The 5A's group consulting package intervention includes: 1. Factsheets detailing key information on smoking, SHS. 2. Guidelines for group guiders on how to deliver the 5A's group consulting (activities for different audiences: smokers, non-smokers exposed to SHS). 3. A leaflet that contains the key facts about smoking and SHS that can be disseminated to migrant workers after consulting. Second, we aim to recruit 8 factories (clusters) and all the migrant workers working in these factories from industrial zone of Guangzhou, China. The clusters will be randomized to the intervention and control group in a 1:1 ratio. Clusters allocated to the intervention arm will be offered the 5A's group consulting package. Factories will complete a factory survey of basic factory information, all participants will complete a questionnaire (about the status of tobacco exposure, knowledge and attitude of tobacco, and demographic information), and a non-smoking individual will provide a salvia sample which will be tested for cotinine. All these participant outcomes (questionnaire and salvia cotinine) will be measured before and after the 3-month intervention in both arms of the trial. In addition, a purposive sample of participants will be invited for interviews to investigate the facilitators and barriers for integrating 5A's group consulting package into workplace settings and how these can be enhanced or addressed at the end of this trial.</p>

Abstract_Other.Abstract: <p>首先，通过文献回顾、深入访谈和焦点小组讨论，将世界卫生组织5A的模式裁剪成5A的团体咨询干预方案，从而设计出该方案。5A的团体咨询一揽子干预措施包括：1。详细介绍吸烟的关键信息的情况介绍。2。如何提供5A团体咨询（针对不同受众的活动：吸烟者、接触SHS的非吸烟者）的团体指南。三。包含吸烟和SHS关键事实的传单，咨询后可分发给农民工。第二，我们的目标是从中国广州工业区招聘8家工厂（集群）和所有在这些工厂工作的农民工。这些集群将以1:1的比例随机分配给干预组和对照组。分配给干预部门的集群将提供5A的集团咨询服务。工厂将完成工厂基本信息的工厂调查，所有参与者将完成一份问卷调查（关于烟草接触状况、烟草知识和态度以及人口统计信息），一名无烟个人将提供一份丹参样品，用于科替宁的检测。所有这些参与者的结果（问卷调查和丹参可替宁）将在试验的两臂进行3个月干预前后进行测量。此外，还将邀请一个有目的的参与者样本进行访谈，以调查将5A集团咨询服务包整合到工作场所环境中的促进者和障碍，以及如何在本试验结束时加强或解决这些障碍</p>

The 5A's group consulting package intervention includes: 1. Factsheets detailing key information on smoking, SHS. 2. The clusters will be randomized to the intervention and control group in a 1:1 ratio. Clusters allocated to the intervention arm will be offered the 5A's group consulting package. Factories will complete a factory survey of basic factory information, all participants will complete a questionnaire (about the status of tobacco exposure, knowledge and attitude of tobacco, and demographic information), and a non-smoking individual will provide a salvia sample which will be tested for cotinine. All these participant outcomes (questionnaire and salvia cotinine) will be measured before and after the 3-month intervention in both arms of the trial. In addition, a purposive sample of participants will be invited for interviews to investigate the facilitators and barriers for integrating 5A's group consulting package into workplace settings and how these can be enhanced or addressed at the end of this trial.</p>

Project.Title: Changes in Proteoglycan Structure as Markers in Osteoarthritis

Title_Other.Title: Changes in Proteoglycan Structure as Markers in Osteoarthritis
骨关节炎标志物蛋白多糖结构的变化

Project.Abstract: ABSTRACT CONTINUED:To determine the occurrence and distribution of atypical structures within the CS GAG side chains of proteoglycans isolated from: a) normal and osteoarthritic human articular cartilage; b) an animal model of OA - the Hartley strain of guinea pig that spontaneously develops OA-like lesions with age. Proteoglycans will be isolated from cartilage samples and characterized using conventional biochemical methods and immunochemical methods and immunochemical procedures using monoclonal antibodies that are specific for cartilage proteoglycan structures.To perform in vitro cell culture studies to investigate the biosynthesis of proteoglycans containing these atypical carbohydrate structures. Articular cartilage chondrocytes will be grown in cell culture systems and the proteoglycans metabolically labelled with radiolabeled sulfate and/or 35 S-methionine to investigate the biosynthesis of proteoglycans containing these atypical structures.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: ABSTRACT CONTINUED:To determine the occurrence and distribution of atypical structures within the CS GAG side chains of proteoglycans isolated from: a) normal and osteoarthritic human articular cartilage; b) an animal model of OA - the Hartley strain of guinea pig that spontaneously develops OA-like lesions with age. Proteoglycans will be isolated from cartilage samples and characterized using conventional biochemical methods and immunochemical methods and immunochemical procedures using monoclonal antibodies that are specific for cartilage proteoglycan structures.To perform in vitro cell culture studies to investigate the biosynthesis of proteoglycans containing these atypical carbohydrate structures. Articular cartilage chondrocytes will be grown in cell culture systems and the proteoglycans metabolically labelled with radiolabeled sulfate and/or 35 S-methionine to investigate the biosynthesis of proteoglycans containing these atypical structures.

文摘（续）：确定从正常和骨关节炎的人关节软骨分离的蛋白多糖cs-gag侧链中非典型结构的发生和分布；b）OA的动物模型-豚鼠的Hartley株，随着年龄的增长，自发形成OA样病变。将从软骨样品中分离蛋白多糖，并使用常规生化方法、免疫化学方法和免疫化学方法，使用软骨蛋白多糖结构特异性单克隆抗体对其进行表征。研究含有这些非典型碳水化合物结构的蛋白聚糖的生物合成。关节软骨软骨细胞将在细胞培养系统中生长，并用放射性标记的硫酸盐和/或35s-蛋氨酸标记蛋白多糖，以研究含有这些非典型结构的蛋白多糖的生物合成。

Project.Title: Testing metabotropic glutamate receptor and GABA ligands in a mouse model of Fragile X Syndrome

Title_Other.Title: Testing metabotropic glutamate receptor and GABA ligands in a mouse model of Fragile X Syndrome
脆性X综合征小鼠模型代谢型谷氨酸受体和GABA配体的检测

Project.Abstract: Fragile X Syndrome (FXS) is the most common cause of inherited mental retardation in humans. Affected individuals display developmental delays including learning disabilities, mild to severe mental impairment, behavioural management challenges, attention deficit hyperactivity disorder, sensory problems and autistic-like behaviours. Medical complications, such as seizures, may occur in up to 25% of affected individuals. Fortunately, affected individuals and carriers can now be accurately identified with a simple DNA based blood test. However, no drugs exist that stop or reverse the deterioration of neurons that takes place in the patients; such treatments are desperately needed. Exciting results have recently been published by several research groups who reported that drugs that block a class of neurotransmitter receptor in the brain, called metabotropic glutamate receptors, can reverse many of the symptoms of FXS in animal models. Preliminary studies also suggest that drugs affecting the levels of the neurotransmitter GABA in the brain may also be useful as treatments for the disorder. In the research proposed here, we plan to a) optimize drug testing procedures whereby a reasonably large selection of drugs can be tested within the given time frame, and b) evaluate new, as-yet untested drugs that act on these receptors. The drugs will be tested in the mouse model of Fragile X. We are particularly interested in testing drugs that are able to penetrate into the brain after peripheral administration. We expect that the results from this study will provide clarification of the feasibility of this drug treatment strategy and may reveal some insight into the basic brain defect caused by loss of this gene. We also emphasize that results obtained from this study could potentially be applicable to other human disorders of the central nervous system such as autism, which shows several parallels to FXS.

脆性X综合征（FXS）是人类遗传性智力低下的最常见原因。受影响的个体表现出发育迟缓，包括学习障碍、轻度至重度精神障碍、行为管理挑战、注意缺陷多动障碍、感觉问题和类似孤独症的行为。医疗并发症，如癫痫，可能发生在多达25%的受影响的个人。幸运的是，现在可以通过简单的基于DNA的血液检测准确地识别出受影响的个体和携带者。然而，目前还没有药物可以阻止或逆转患者体内神经元的恶化；迫切需要这样的治疗。一些研究小组最近发表了令人兴奋的结果，他们报告说，阻断大脑中一类神经递质受体（称为代谢性谷氨酸受体）的药物可以逆转动物模型中FXS的许多症状。初步研究还表明，影响大脑中神经递质GABA水平的药物也可能是治疗这种疾病的有效方法。在本文提出的研究中，我们计划a）优化药物测试程序，以便在给定的时间范围内对相当多的药物进行测试；b）评估作用于这些受体的新的、尚未测试的药物。这些药物将在脆性X小鼠模型中进行测试。我们特别感兴趣的是测试在外周给药后能够渗透到大脑的药物。我们期望这项研究的结果将澄清这种药物治疗策略的可行性，并可能揭示这种基因丢失导致的基本脑缺陷。我们还强调，从这项研究中获得的结果可能适用于其他人类中枢神经系统疾病，如自闭症，这显示了与FXS的几个相似之处。

Project.Title: Clinical Registry of Dental Outcomes in Head and Neck Cancer Patients (ORARAD)

Title_Other.Title: Clinical Registry of Dental Outcomes in Head and Neck Cancer Patients (ORARAD)
头颈部肿瘤患者牙科结局的临床登记（orarad）

Project.Abstract: Most head and neck (H&N) cancer patients receive high-dose radiation therapy (RT), often combined with surgery or chemotherapy. Unfortunately, high-dose RT has significant adverse effects on oral and maxillofacial tissues. Salivary gland damage frequently causes hyposalivation, increasing risk of dental caries and tooth loss. Furthermore, radiation impairs ability of bone to heal, leading to a life-long risk of osteoradionecrosis (ORN), which presents as exposed intraoral bone and is often precipitated by dental extractions. Therefore, these patients are caught in a vicious circle, being at higher risk of needing dental extractions, but with extractions to be avoided post-RT due to the risk for ORN. To attempt to reduce such complications, pre-RT dental assessment is considered a best practice. However, pre-RT dental management practices vary widely and are largely based on expert opinion, due to lack of adequate evidence. Available data are mostly from studies using older RT modalities without concurrent chemotherapy. Current use of Intensity-Modulated Radiation Therapy (IMRT) has potential to reduce severity/incidence of oral complications. Conversely, concurrent use of chemotherapy with RT may aggravate toxicities. However, definitive data do not exist on the extent or severity of oral complications due to current therapeutic regimens, or on risk factors for adverse outcomes. Also, some oral complications, such as periodontal changes, are particularly understudied in this population. This constitutes an important gap in knowledge because it hampers the pre- and post-RT dental management of these patients. The objective of this research is to collect data on dental outcomes in H&N cancer patients receiving modern RT modalities and identify risk factors for adverse outcomes. We will accomplish these objectives by pursuing the following specific aims: 1) Measure 2-year changes in dental caries and periodontal disease, and 2-year rates of tooth loss, after modern RT regimens, and assess risk factors for caries increment, progression of periodontal disease, and tooth loss. 2) Measure 6-month and 18- month changes in stimulated whole salivary flow after modern RT regimens, and assess risk factors for decreased salivary flow. 3) Measure the incidence of exposed intraoral bone after modern RT regimens, and assess risk factors for exposed intraoral bone. We will accomplish these aims by completing our ongoing NIH- funded multi-center prospective cohort study, which has already enrolled 568 of the necessary 575 subjects. Dental and other oral outcomes, and data on risk factors, are recorded in H&N cancer patients before start of RT and every 6 months for 2 years after RT. The proposed research is innovative because this is the first multi-center study with a large enough sample size to identify risk factors associated with adverse dental outcomes in H&N cancer patients after modern RT. Our strong preliminary data clearly demonstrate the feasibility of achieving these aims. This study is highly significant because it will directly provide data to facilitate evidence-based dental management of patients receiving current modalities of H&N RT.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 大多数头颈部（H&N）癌症患者接受大剂量放射治疗（RT），通常与手术或化疗相结合。不幸的是，大剂量rt对口腔颌面部组织有明显的不良反应。唾液腺损伤经常导致唾液减少，增加龋齿和牙齿脱落的风险。此外，放射损伤了骨的愈合能力，导致了终生的骨放射性坏死（orn）风险，表现为暴露在口腔内的骨，通常是由牙科拔牙引起的。因此，这些患者陷入了恶性循环，需要拔牙的风险更高，但由于发生orn的风险，拔牙在rt后必须避免。为了减少这种并发症，rt前牙科评估被认为是一种最佳实践。然而，由于缺乏足够的证据，rt前的牙科管理实践差异很大，且主要基于专家意见。可用的数据大多来自于使用较老的rt模式而没有同时进行化疗的研究。目前使用调强放射治疗（imrt）有可能降低口腔并发症的严重程度/发生率。相反，同时使用化疗和放疗可能会加重毒性。然而，关于目前治疗方案引起的口腔并发症的程度或严重程度，或不良结果的危险因素，尚不存在确切的数据。此外，一些口腔并发症，如牙周病的变化，在这一人群中尤其缺乏研究。这构成了一个重要的知识差距，因为它妨碍了这些患者的放疗前和放疗后牙科管理。本研究的目的是收集接受现代rt治疗的h&n癌症患者的牙科预后数据，并确定不良预后的危险因素。我们将通过以下具体目标来实现这些目标：1）测量现代rt治疗后2年龋病和牙周病的变化以及2年的牙齿丢失率，并评估龋病增加、牙周病进展的危险因素。还有牙齿脱落。2）测量现代RT治疗后6个月和18个月受激全唾液流量的变化，并评估唾液流量减少的危险因素。3）测量现代RT治疗后暴露于口内骨的发生率，评估暴露于口内骨的危险因素。我们将通过完成正在进行的NIH资助的多中心前瞻性队列研究来实现这些目标，该研究已经在575名受试者中招收了568名。牙科和其他口腔结果，以及危险因素数据，在放疗开始前和放疗后2年内每隔6个月对H&N癌症患者进行一次记录。该研究具有创新性，因为这是第一个多中心研究，具有足够大的样本量，可以确定与H&N癌症患者不良牙科结局相关的危险因素在现代rt之后，我们强大的初步数据清楚地证明了实现这些目标的可行性。这项研究是非常重要的，因为它将直接提供数据，以促进循证牙科管理的病人接受目前的H&N RT模式。

Most head and neck (H&N) cancer patients receive high-dose radiation therapy (RT), often combined with surgery or chemotherapy. Unfortunately, high-dose RT has significant adverse effects on oral and maxillofacial tissues. Salivary gland damage frequently causes hyposalivation, increasing risk of dental caries and tooth loss. Furthermore, radiation impairs ability of bone to heal, leading to a life-long risk of osteoradionecrosis (ORN), which presents as exposed intraoral bone and is often precipitated by dental extractions. Therefore, these patients are caught in a vicious circle, being at higher risk of needing dental extractions, but with extractions to be avoided post-RT due to the risk for ORN. To attempt to reduce such complications, pre-RT dental assessment is considered a best practice. However, pre-RT dental management practices vary widely and are largely based on expert opinion, due to lack of adequate evidence. Available data are mostly from studies using older RT modalities without concurrent chemotherapy. Current use of Intensity-Modulated Radiation Therapy (IMRT) has potential to reduce severity/incidence of oral complications. Conversely, concurrent use of chemotherapy with RT may aggravate toxicities. However, definitive data do not exist on the extent or severity of oral complications due to current therapeutic regimens, or on risk factors for adverse outcomes. Also, some oral complications, such as periodontal changes, are particularly understudied in this population. This constitutes an important gap in knowledge because it hampers the pre- and post-RT dental management of these patients. The objective of this research is to collect data on dental outcomes in H&N cancer patients receiving modern RT modalities and identify risk factors for adverse outcomes. We will accomplish these objectives by pursuing the following specific aims: 1) Measure 2-year changes in dental caries and periodontal disease, and 2-year rates of tooth loss, after modern RT regimens, and assess risk factors for caries increment, progression of periodontal disease, and tooth loss. 2) Measure 6-month and 18- month changes in stimulated whole salivary flow after modern RT regimens, and assess risk factors for decreased salivary flow. 3) Measure the incidence of exposed intraoral bone after modern RT regimens, and assess risk factors for exposed intraoral bone. We will accomplish these aims by completing our ongoing NIH- funded multi-center prospective cohort study, which has already enrolled 568 of the necessary 575 subjects. Dental and other oral outcomes, and data on risk factors, are recorded in H&N cancer patients before start of RT and every 6 months for 2 years after RT. The proposed research is innovative because this is the first multi-center study with a large enough sample size to identify risk factors associated with adverse dental outcomes in H&N cancer patients after modern RT. Our strong preliminary data clearly demonstrate the feasibility of achieving these aims. This study is highly significant because it will directly provide data to facilitate evidence-based dental management of patients receiving current modalities of H&N RT.

Source.Name: National Institute of Dental and Craniofacial Research

Project.Title: An All-Sky Radio Survey for Millisecond Pulsars, Exotic Binary Systems, and Transients

Title_Other.Title: An All-Sky Radio Survey for Millisecond Pulsars, Exotic Binary Systems, and Transients
毫秒脉冲星、奇异双星系统和瞬变的全天无线电观测

Project.Abstract: This award will support an ambitious high time resolution survey of the entire sky visible with the Green Bank Telescope. The primary science driver for this experiment is to discover millisecond pulsars to add to the NANOGrav (North American Nanohertz Observatory for Gravitational Waves) pulsar timing array for gravitational wave detection. The survey will also discover exotic binary systems, transient pulsars, and other classes of transient sources. Roughly 20% of the sky has already been covered in the first phase of this survey, with 11 new pulsars discovered through processing 5% of these data. Simulations suggest that the full survey will discover 50?100 millisecond pulsars and about 200 normal pulsars. The direct detection of gravitational waves is one of the foremost goals of modern physics and may offer unique insights into galaxy formation, the early stages of the universe, and even cosmic strings. Finding new, high-precision millisecond pulsars to add to pulsar timing arrays will facilitate the principal goals of this project. The survey will likely detect pulsars in exotic binary systems which will provide tests of general relativity and probe extreme density nuclear physics. The survey will be sensitive to transient signals that will permit exploration of the full range of pulsar intermittency and discover completely new astrophysical phenomena. Furthermore, all of the new pulsars discovered will be useful for improving our understanding of the properties of the nearby, local pulsar population. With support from this award, this group will create undergraduate fellowship programs at West Virginia University and the University of Virginia that will allow students to participate in survey observations, processing, and follow-up. These programs are expected to increase retention of students in science and engineering majors and offer both undergraduate and graduate students peer-mentoring opportunities.

这个奖项将支持一个雄心勃勃的高时间分辨率调查整个天空可见的绿岸望远镜。这项实验的主要科学驱动力是发现毫秒脉冲星，并将其添加到NANOGrav（北美引力波纳米赫兹天文台）的引力波探测脉冲星定时阵列中。这项调查还将发现奇异的双星系统、瞬变脉冲星和其他种类的瞬变源。在这次调查的第一阶段，大约20%的天空已经被覆盖，通过处理5%的数据发现了11个新的脉冲星。模拟显示，整个调查将发现50？100毫秒脉冲星和大约200个正常脉冲星。对引力波的直接探测是现代物理学的首要目标之一，可能为星系的形成、宇宙的早期阶段甚至宇宙弦提供独特的见解。寻找新的、高精度的毫秒脉冲星加入脉冲星定时阵列将有助于本项目的主要目标。这项调查很可能在奇异的二元系统中发现脉冲星，这将提供广义相对论的测试，并探测极端密度核物理。这项调查将对瞬变信号敏感，这将允许探索脉冲星间歇的全部范围，并发现全新的天体物理现象。此外，所有新发现的脉冲星都将有助于我们更好地了解附近地方脉冲星种群的特性。在该奖项的支持下，该小组将在西弗吉尼亚大学和弗吉尼亚大学设立本科生奖学金项目，允许学生参与调查观察、处理和跟踪。预计这些项目将增加理工科专业学生的留校率，并为本科生和研究生提供同侪辅导机会。

Project.Title: Bacterial Invasion and Trafficking within the Bladder

Title_Other.Title: Bacterial Invasion and Trafficking within the Bladder
细菌在膀胱内的侵袭和转运

Project.Abstract: DESCRIPTION (provided by applicant): Strains of uropathogenic Escherichia coli (UPEC) are the principal causative agents of urinary tract infections (UTIs), which continuously rank among the most common of infectious diseases. UPEC can invade host bladder epithelial cells and subsequently multiply, forming large intracellular inclusions that resemble biofilms. Alternately, intracellular UPEC can persist at low levels in a more quiescent, non-replicating state that may serve as a reservoir for chronic and recurrent acute UTIs. Mounting evidence indicates that UPEC entry into host cells and tissues within the urinary tract promotes bacterial persistence in the face of both innate and adaptive host defenses, as well as antibiotic treatments. Virtually all UPEC isolates encode filamentous adhesive organelles called type 1 pili. We have found that the type 1 pilus adhesin FimH can engage host 1321 integrin receptors in a non-canonical fashion and thereby activate signaling cascades that result in the actin-dependent internalization of UPEC. Our preliminary data indicate that FimH-mediated bacterial invasion of host cells is dependent upon crosstalk between the actin and microtubule cytoskeletal networks, although the nature of this crosstalk remains undefined. The entry process also requires input from clathrin and distinct clathrin-associated adaptor proteins. Clathrin is best characterized for its role in the uptake of small molecules such as growth factors, but its ability to promote internalization of much larger particles like UPEC and other invasive pathogens has only recently been appreciated and remains poorly understood. The primary objectives of this application are to define the host factors that mediate UPEC invasion of bladder epithelial cells, with a focus on the functional roles of microtubule-actin crosstalk and clathrin. The impact that host cell invasion has on the establishment and persistence of UPEC within the host will also be assessed. It is hoped that the proposed work will provide a more complete understanding of the pathogenesis of acute, recurrent, and chronic UTIs, ultimately facilitating the development of improved therapeutics for treating and preventing these exceptionally common infections.

The impact that host cell invasion has on the establishment and persistence of UPEC within the host will also be assessed. It is hoped that the proposed work will provide a more complete understanding of the pathogenesis of acute, recurrent, and chronic UTIs, ultimately facilitating the development of improved therapeutics for treating and preventing these exceptionally common infections.

描述（由申请人提供）：泌尿系致病性大肠杆菌（UPEC）菌株是泌尿系感染（UTIs）的主要致病菌，一直是最常见的传染病之一。UPEC可以侵入宿主膀胱上皮细胞并随后增殖，形成类似生物膜的大的细胞内包涵体。另外，细胞内UPEC可以在较低水平上以更安静、非复制的状态持续存在，这可能是慢性和复发性急性UTIs的蓄水池。越来越多的证据表明，UPEC进入泌尿道内的宿主细胞和组织，可促进细菌在天然和适应性宿主防御以及抗生素治疗面前的持久性。几乎所有UPEC分离物都编码丝状粘附细胞器，称为1型菌毛。我们发现，1型菌毛粘附素FimH能以非典型的方式与宿主1321整合素受体结合，从而激活信号级联，导致肌动蛋白依赖的UPEC内化。我们的初步数据表明，FimH介导的细菌对宿主细胞的侵袭依赖于肌动蛋白和微管细胞骨架网络之间的串扰，尽管这种串扰的性质仍不清楚。进入过程还需要来自氯氰菊酯和不同的氯氰菊酯相关衔接蛋白的输入。Clathrin的最大特点是它在小分子（如生长因子）的吸收中发挥作用，但它促进更大颗粒（如UPEC和其他侵入性病原体）内化的能力直到最近才得到重视，而且仍然缺乏了解。该应用的主要目的是确定介导UPEC侵袭膀胱上皮细胞的宿主因子，重点是微管肌动蛋白串扰和氯菊酯的功能作用。还将评估宿主细胞入侵对宿主体内UPEC的建立和持续性的影响。希望这项工作能使人们更全面地了解急性、复发性和慢性尿路感染的发病机制，最终有助于开发治疗和预防这些异常常见感染的改良疗法。

Source.Name: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases

Project.Title: Tests of the Equiv#aence of Competitors and Asymmetry of Competition Hypotheses in Multispecies Woody Communities

Title_Other.Title: 多树种木本群落中竞争对手等价性和竞争假设不对称性的检验
Tests of the Equiv#aence of Competitors and Asymmetry of Competition Hypotheses in Multispecies Woody Communities

Project.Abstract: Despite the central importance of competition in ecological theory, field tests of hypotheses about plant competition are rare. Two current major hypotheses are the Competitive Equivalence Hypothesis and the Asymmetrical Competition Hypothesis. No attempts have been made to apply these hypotheses to woody plant communities. The P.I.s propose experiments that will test both the Competitive Equivalence Hypothesis and the Asymmetrical Competition Hypothesis using individuals of Betula alleghaniensis and Fagus grandifolia. The proposed research is based on three working hypotheses: 1) Aboveground competition for light is of equal or greater importance to the growth and survival of seedlings than belowground competition for soil resources. This is an underlying assumption of the remaining two hypotheses. 2) Target seedlings will respond equally to equal densities of similar-sized neighbors of different species. This is the Competitive Equivalence Hypothesis. 3) Target seedlings will show reductions in growth directly proportional to the sizes of equal densities of different-sized neighbors. This is the null form of the Asymmetrical Competition Hypothesis. The investigators will create replicated neighborhoods around central target individuals by thinning existing high-density areas to leave neighbors of the desired density, species, and size. Response of target seedlings will be measured as growth in height and stem diameter, and analyzed as relative growth rate. Responses will be measured over two years from the time of treatment. Results will determine whether the above hypotheses accurately describe the competitive interactions among these woody species and how the species differ in their competitive effects on one another.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 尽管竞争在生态学理论中占有重要地位，但对植物竞争假说的实地检验却很少。目前的两个主要假设是竞争等价假设和非对称竞争假设。没有人试图将这些假设应用于木本植物群落。该研究所提出的实验将同时检验竞争等价性假设和非对称竞争假设，实验对象是白桦和山楂。本研究基于三个工作假设：1）地上对光的竞争比地下对土壤资源的竞争对幼苗的生长和存活具有同等或更大的重要性。这是其余两个假设的基本假设。2） 目标幼苗将对不同物种大小相似的邻居的相同密度做出同样的反应。这是竞争等价假设。3） 目标幼苗的生长量将与不同大小邻居的等密度大小成正比。这是非对称竞争假说的无效形式。研究人员将通过稀释现有的高密度区域，留下所需密度、物种和大小的邻居，在中心目标个体周围创建复制社区。以株高和茎粗生长量为指标，以相对生长速率为指标进行分析。反应将在治疗后两年内进行测量。结果将决定上述假设是否准确地描述了这些木本物种之间的竞争性相互作用，以及这些木本物种之间竞争效应的差异。

Despite the central importance of competition in ecological theory, field tests of hypotheses about plant competition are rare. Two current major hypotheses are the Competitive Equivalence Hypothesis and the Asymmetrical Competition Hypothesis. No attempts have been made to apply these hypotheses to woody plant communities. The P.I.s propose experiments that will test both the Competitive Equivalence Hypothesis and the Asymmetrical Competition Hypothesis using individuals of Betula alleghaniensis and Fagus grandifolia. The proposed research is based on three working hypotheses: 1) Aboveground competition for light is of equal or greater importance to the growth and survival of seedlings than belowground competition for soil resources. This is an underlying assumption of the remaining two hypotheses. 2) Target seedlings will respond equally to equal densities of similar-sized neighbors of different species. This is the Competitive Equivalence Hypothesis. 3) Target seedlings will show reductions in growth directly proportional to the sizes of equal densities of different-sized neighbors. This is the null form of the Asymmetrical Competition Hypothesis. The investigators will create replicated neighborhoods around central target individuals by thinning existing high-density areas to leave neighbors of the desired density, species, and size. Response of target seedlings will be measured as growth in height and stem diameter, and analyzed as relative growth rate. Responses will be measured over two years from the time of treatment. Results will determine whether the above hypotheses accurately describe the competitive interactions among these woody species and how the species differ in their competitive effects on one another.

Project.Title: Computational Subatomic Physics

Title_Other.Title: 计算亚原子物理学
Computational Subatomic Physics

Class.ClassName: 0202 Atomic, Molecular, Nuclear, Particle and Plasma Physics

Project.Abstract:
Subatomic physics is a very special branch of science, addressing unusual and complex problems. The reason is that atomic nuclei are too large to approach microscopically every constituent (of the order of 100 hadrons or 1000 partons), but too small and n on-linear to treat them statistically or thermodynamically as macroscopic bodies . This principal complexity requires exceptional intellectual involvement, and superior theoretical training, and forefront computational facilities.
The Bergen Computationa l Physics Laboratory (BCPL) addresses these problems at different energy scales, from intermediate to ultra-relativistic energies, using a very wide variety of theoretical tools and methods. These tasks are at the limit of our present computational possib ilities, so that we have to exploit all available hardware and software resources for our problems. A few, most dominant basic research problems will be mentioned further on in this proposal.
This proposal aims for a collaborative project between the Uni versities of Bergen and Oslo. The 18 BONTT researchers and 7 students (listed in the next section) belong to four subunits of the universities. The scientific coordinator of the project is L.P. Csernai at UiB and his deputy is L. Bravina at UiO. The tas ks, responsibilities and financing will be shared between the two universities according to the joint decision of the 6 Principle Investigators.
The project aims at consolidating and furthering the methodological and computational physics aspects of the BONTT research activity, which is the strongest joint trend in the work of the research team. On the other hand the scientific activity of the team is very broad and versatile which is an essential strength of our team.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 亚原子物理学是一门非常特殊的科学，它解决了不寻常和复杂的问题。原因是原子核太大，无法在显微镜下接近每一个组成部分（约100个强子或1000个部分子），但太小且呈线性，无法在统计或热力学上将其视为宏观物体。这种主要的复杂性需要特殊的智力参与、卓越的理论训练和前沿的计算设施。 伯根计算物理实验室（BCPL）使用各种各样的理论工具和方法，在不同的能量尺度上，从中间能量到超相对论能量，解决这些问题。这些任务是在我们目前计算能力的极限，因此我们必须利用所有可用的硬件和软件资源来解决我们的问题。本提案将进一步提及一些最具优势的基础研究问题。 本提案旨在卑尔根大学和奥斯陆大学之间的合作项目。18名博特研究人员和7名学生（下一节列出）属于大学的四个亚单位。这个项目的科学协调员是UiB的L.P.Csernai，他的副手是UiO的L.Bravina。根据6名主要调查人员的共同决定，两所大学将分担助教、责任和经费。 该项目旨在巩固和推进BONTT研究活动的方法学和计算物理学方面，这是研究小组工作中最强烈的共同趋势。另一方面，团队的科学活动是非常广泛和多方面的，这是我们团队必不可少的力量。

The reason is that atomic nuclei are too large to approach microscopically every constituent (of the order of 100 hadrons or 1000 partons), but too small and n on-linear to treat them statistically or thermodynamically as macroscopic bodies . This principal complexity requires exceptional intellectual involvement, and superior theoretical training, and forefront computational facilities.
The Bergen Computationa l Physics Laboratory (BCPL) addresses these problems at different energy scales, from intermediate to ultra-relativistic energies, using a very wide variety of theoretical tools and methods. These tasks are at the limit of our present computational possib ilities, so that we have to exploit all available hardware and software resources for our problems. A few, most dominant basic research problems will be mentioned further on in this proposal.
This proposal aims for a collaborative project between the Uni versities of Bergen and Oslo. The 18 BONTT researchers and 7 students (listed in the next section) belong to four subunits of the universities. The scientific coordinator of the project is L.P. Csernai at UiB and his deputy is L. Bravina at UiO. The tas ks, responsibilities and financing will be shared between the two universities according to the joint decision of the 6 Principle Investigators.
The project aims at consolidating and furthering the methodological and computational physics aspects of the BONTT research activity, which is the strongest joint trend in the work of the research team. On the other hand the scientific activity of the team is very broad and versatile which is an essential strength of our team.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: Vývoj nových technik pro přípravu magnetických, zejména biokompatibilních kompozitních materiálů, a jejich využití v oblasti biotechnologické produkce vonných látek.

Project.Title: Comparative Genomics of Anopheline Mosquitoes

Title_Other.Title: Comparative Genomics of Anopheline Mosquitoes
按蚊的比较基因组学

Project.Abstract: DESCRIPTION (provided by applicant): Anopheline mosquitoes constitute the primary vectors of malaria. Recent developments in mosquito research, that were highlighted by the publication of a draft genome sequence of the primary African malaria vector Anopheles gambiae, provide exciting opportunities to greatly enhance our understanding of mosquito genetics, behavior, and physiology. New insights in mosquito biology will undoubtedly facilitate the development of novel strategies to combat malaria and other mosquito-borne diseases. The basic concept underlying this proposal is to combine comparative inquiry with modern genomic technology to help realize the promise of the An. gambiae genome project. The long-term objective of this exploratory R21 project is to develop an efficient method of multi-species comparisons of targeted genomic regions to illuminate what makes a mosquito a competent vector for pathogens, an anthropophilic biter, and an adaptive survivor under different ecological conditions. Here we will target genomic regions that contain odorant receptor (GPRor) genes or gene clusters because of their potential roles in host-seeking behavior of An. gambiae. We will pursue three Specific Aims: 1) Sequence 12 randomly picked BAC clones from An. stephensi to obtain baseline information on the relative genomic organization and evolutionary divergence between An. stephensi and An. gambiae. 2) Target 6 regions that contain GPRor genes or gene clusters for pair-wise comparisons between An. stephensi and An. gambiae to examine the evolutionary divergence, conserved regulatory elements, and expansions/loss/rearrangements of these genes. 3) Further target 2 GPRor regions for multi-species comparisons to efficiently identify potential regulatory elements, detect local gene expansions/loss/rearrangements, and examine possible correlations between these genetic changes and biological adaptations.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 描述（由申请人提供）：按蚊是疟疾的主要传播媒介。最近在蚊子研究方面的进展，特别是发表了非洲疟原虫媒介冈比亚按蚊的基因组序列草案，为我们进一步了解蚊子的遗传学、行为学和生理学提供了令人兴奋的机会。蚊子生物学的新见解无疑将有助于制定防治疟疾和其他蚊媒疾病的新战略。这项提议的基本概念是将比较研究与现代基因组技术相结合，以帮助实现An的承诺。冈比亚基因组计划。这一探索性R21项目的长期目标是开发一种有效的方法，对目标基因组区域进行多物种比较，以阐明蚊子在不同的生态条件下是什么使其成为病原体、嗜人叮咬者和适应性幸存者的有效载体。在这里，我们将针对包含气味受体（GPRor）基因或基因簇的基因组区域，因为它们在An的宿主寻找行为中具有潜在的作用。冈比亚。我们将追求三个特定的目标：1）序列12随机挑选BAC克隆从一个。stephensi获得了关于相对基因组组织和进化分化之间的基线信息。斯蒂芬斯和安。冈比亚。2） 针对包含GPRor基因或基因簇的6个区域，进行基因间的成对比较。斯蒂芬斯和安。冈比亚研究这些基因的进化差异、保守的调控元件和扩展/丢失/重排。3） 进一步针对2个GPRor区域进行多物种比较，以有效地识别潜在的调控因子，检测局部基因扩增/丢失/重排，并检查这些遗传变化与生物适应之间的可能相关性。

DESCRIPTION (provided by applicant): Anopheline mosquitoes constitute the primary vectors of malaria. Recent developments in mosquito research, that were highlighted by the publication of a draft genome sequence of the primary African malaria vector Anopheles gambiae, provide exciting opportunities to greatly enhance our understanding of mosquito genetics, behavior, and physiology. New insights in mosquito biology will undoubtedly facilitate the development of novel strategies to combat malaria and other mosquito-borne diseases. The basic concept underlying this proposal is to combine comparative inquiry with modern genomic technology to help realize the promise of the An. gambiae genome project. The long-term objective of this exploratory R21 project is to develop an efficient method of multi-species comparisons of targeted genomic regions to illuminate what makes a mosquito a competent vector for pathogens, an anthropophilic biter, and an adaptive survivor under different ecological conditions. Here we will target genomic regions that contain odorant receptor (GPRor) genes or gene clusters because of their potential roles in host-seeking behavior of An. gambiae. We will pursue three Specific Aims: 1) Sequence 12 randomly picked BAC clones from An. stephensi to obtain baseline information on the relative genomic organization and evolutionary divergence between An. stephensi and An. gambiae. 2) Target 6 regions that contain GPRor genes or gene clusters for pair-wise comparisons between An. stephensi and An. gambiae to examine the evolutionary divergence, conserved regulatory elements, and expansions/loss/rearrangements of these genes. 3) Further target 2 GPRor regions for multi-species comparisons to efficiently identify potential regulatory elements, detect local gene expansions/loss/rearrangements, and examine possible correlations between these genetic changes and biological adaptations.

Project.Title: Prevalence and fitness of drug resistant minority variant mutations in Plasmodium

Title_Other.Title: Prevalence and fitness of drug resistant minority variant mutations in Plasmodium
疟原虫少数耐药变异株的流行与适应度

Project.Abstract: DESCRIPTION (provided by applicant): Drug-resistant P. falciparum malaria is a major public health problem. Molecular markers for most types of drug resistance have been identified and could serve as surveillance tools. However, individuals in high-transmission areas, like sub-Saharan Africa, usually carry many genetically diverse P. falciparum subpopulations ("variants"). Standard PCR methods are incapable of detecting drug-resistance mutations in variants representing <20% of the parasites in an individual host ("minority variants"). Thus, standard assays underestimate the prevalence of patients infected with resistant parasites because they miss patients with resistant minority variants. We have developed Heteroduplex Tracking Assays (HTAs) which can detect drug-resistant minority variants and accurately measure the relative abundance of variant populations. In a Malawi pilot study, we demonstrated a high prevalence of minority variant pfcrt76 mutations (a marker for chloroquine resistance) which were missed by standard PCR. We have now developed HTA's for minority variants at 3 other important loci (dhfr59, dhfr164, dhps540, for antifolate resistance). We will use these assays to (1) determine whether the prevalence of drug-resistant P. falciparum is higher when measured by HTA than by standard PCR;and (2) measure in-host fitness gains and losses of resistant minority variants in drug- treated and untreated individuals. Prevalence of pfcrt76, dhfr59, dhfr164 and/or dhps540 will be measured by HTA and standard PCR cross-sectionally in samples from Malawi, Zambia, Madagascar, and the DR Congo. Pfcrt76 and dhfr164 fitness will be measured in paired enrollment and recrudescent samples from sulfadoxine-pyrimethamine (SP)- treated patients in Malawi and chloroquine-treated patients in Madagascar. The results of this study have important public health implications. The detection of drug-resistant minority variants - with proven fitness - could enable earlier detection of emerging drug- resistance and greater lead-time to plan changes in drug policy. PUBLIC HEALTH RELEVANCE Better surveillance methods for drug-resistant malaria could be of great benefit to malaria control programs. We are trying to develop a method to measure drug-resistant parasites even when they are the minority of parasites in a single host. This could permit the earlier detection of emerging drug resistance.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 描述（由申请人提供）：抗药性恶性疟原虫疟疾是一个重大的公共卫生问题。大多数耐药类型的分子标记已经被鉴定出来，可以作为监测手段。然而，像撒哈拉以南非洲这样的高传播地区的个体通常携带许多遗传多样的恶性疟原虫亚群（“变种”）。标准的PCR方法无法检测单个宿主（少数变异）中代表<20%寄生虫的变异的耐药性突变。因此，标准分析低估了感染抗药性寄生虫的患者的患病率，因为他们错过了少数耐药变异的患者。我们开发了异源双链追踪分析（HTAs），可以检测少数耐药变异，并准确测量变异群体的相对丰度。在马拉维的一项试点研究中，我们证明了少数变异株pfcrt76突变（氯喹抗性的一个标记）的高患病率，而这些突变被标准PCR漏掉了。我们现在已经在其他3个重要位点（dhfr59，dhfr164，dhps540，抗披针形抗体）上开发了少数变异的HTA。我们将使用这些分析来（1）确定用HTA测定的抗药性恶性疟原虫的流行率是否高于用标准PCR测定的流行率；以及（2）测定药物治疗和未治疗个体中抗药性少数群体变异的宿主适合度得失。在马拉维、赞比亚、马达加斯加和刚果民主共和国的样本中，通过HTA和标准PCR横断面测量pfcrt76、dhfr59、dhfr164和/或dhps540的患病率。在马达加斯加的马拉维和氯喹治疗的患者中，采用配对登记和复发的样本来测量病人的健康状况。本研究结果具有重要的公共卫生意义。对少数耐药变异株的检测——经证实是合适的——可以使对新出现的耐药株的早期检测成为可能，并有更大的准备时间来计划药物政策的变化。公共卫生相关性更好的抗药性疟疾监测方法可能对疟疾控制计划非常有益。我们正在尝试开发一种方法来测量抗药性寄生虫，即使它们是单一宿主中的少数寄生虫。这可以使人们更早地发现新出现的耐药性。

DESCRIPTION (provided by applicant): Drug-resistant P. falciparum malaria is a major public health problem. However, individuals in high-transmission areas, like sub-Saharan Africa, usually carry many genetically diverse P. falciparum subpopulations ("variants"). Thus, standard assays underestimate the prevalence of patients infected with resistant parasites because they miss patients with resistant minority variants. We have developed Heteroduplex Tracking Assays (HTAs) which can detect drug-resistant minority variants and accurately measure the relative abundance of variant populations. In a Malawi pilot study, we demonstrated a high prevalence of minority variant pfcrt76 mutations (a marker for chloroquine resistance) which were missed by standard PCR. We have now developed HTA's for minority variants at 3 other important loci (dhfr59, dhfr164, dhps540, for antifolate resistance). We will use these assays to (1) determine whether the prevalence of drug-resistant P. falciparum is higher when measured by HTA than by standard PCR;and (2) measure in-host fitness gains and losses of resistant minority variants in drug- treated and untreated individuals. Prevalence of pfcrt76, dhfr59, dhfr164 and/or dhps540 will be measured by HTA and standard PCR cross-sectionally in samples from Malawi, Zambia, Madagascar, and the DR Congo. Pfcrt76 and dhfr164 fitness will be measured in paired enrollment and recrudescent samples from sulfadoxine-pyrimethamine (SP)- treated patients in Malawi and chloroquine-treated patients in Madagascar. The results of this study have important public health implications. The detection of drug-resistant minority variants - with proven fitness - could enable earlier detection of emerging drug- resistance and greater lead-time to plan changes in drug policy.
