Project.Title: Antarctic Notothenioid Fish Freeze Avoidance and Genome-wide Evolution for Life in the Cold

Title_Other.Title: 南极脊椎动物在寒冷环境中的避冻和全基因组进化
Antarctic Notothenioid Fish Freeze Avoidance and Genome-wide Evolution for Life in the Cold

Project.Abstract: Antarctic notothenioid fishes exhibit two adaptive traits to survive in frigid temperatures. The first of these is the production of anti-freeze proteins in their blood and tissues. The second is a system-wide ability to perform cellular and physiological functions at extremely cold temperatures.The proposal goals are to show how Antarctic fishes use these characteristics to avoid freezing, and which additional genes are turned on, or suppressed in order for these fishes to maintain normal physiological function in extreme cold temperatures. Progressively colder habitats are encountered in the high latitude McMurdo Sound and Ross Shelf region, along with somewhat milder near?shore water environments in the Western Antarctic Peninsula (WAP). By quantifying the extent of ice crystals invading and lodging in the spleen, the percentage of McMurdo Sound fish during austral summer (Oct-Feb) will be compared to the WAP intertidal fish during austral winter (Jul-Sep) to demonstrate their capability and extent of freeze avoidance. Resistance to ice entry in surface epithelia (e.g. skin, gill and intestinal lining) is another expression of the adaptation of these fish to otherwise lethally freezing conditions. The adaptive nature of a uniquely characteristic polar genome will be explored by the study of the transcriptome (the set of expressed RNA transcripts that constitutes the precursor to set of proteins expressed by an entire genome). Three notothenioid species (E.maclovinus, D. Mawsoni and C. aceratus) will be analysed to document evolutionary genetic changes (both gain and loss) shaped by life under extreme chronic cold. A differential gene expression (DGE) study will be carried out on these different species to evaluate evolutionary modification of tissue-wide response to heat challenges. The transcriptomes and other sequencing libraries will contribute to de novo ice-fish genome sequencing efforts.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 南极的脊椎动物鱼具有两种适应特征，可以在寒冷的温度下生存。首先是在血液和组织中产生抗冻蛋白。第二个是全系统在极冷的温度下执行细胞和生理功能的能力，这个提议的目标是展示南极鱼类如何利用这些特性来避免冰冻，以及哪些额外的基因被激活，或被抑制以使这些鱼类在极冷的温度下保持正常的生理功能。在高纬度麦克默多海峡和罗斯陆架地区，栖息地逐渐变冷，附近的气候也变得温和了些？南极半岛西部的滨水环境。通过量化冰晶在脾脏中的侵入和倒伏程度，将南极夏季（10月-2月）的麦克默多响尾鱼与南极冬季（7月-9月）的WAP潮间带鱼进行比较，以证明它们的防冻能力和程度。表面上皮（如皮肤、鳃和肠粘膜）的抗冰性是这些鱼类适应其他致命冰冻条件的另一种表现。通过对转录组（构成由整个基因组表达的一组蛋白质的前体的一组表达的RNA转录物）的研究，将探索具有独特特征的极性基因组的适应性。将对三种非脊椎动物（E.maclovinus、D.Mawsoni和C.acertus）进行分析，以记录极端慢性寒冷条件下生命形成的进化遗传变化（包括得失）。将对这些不同物种进行差异基因表达（DGE）研究，以评估对热挑战的组织范围响应的进化修饰。转录体和其他测序文库将有助于从头开始的冰鱼基因组测序工作。

Antarctic notothenioid fishes exhibit two adaptive traits to survive in frigid temperatures. The first of these is the production of anti-freeze proteins in their blood and tissues. The second is a system-wide ability to perform cellular and physiological functions at extremely cold temperatures.The proposal goals are to show how Antarctic fishes use these characteristics to avoid freezing, and which additional genes are turned on, or suppressed in order for these fishes to maintain normal physiological function in extreme cold temperatures. Progressively colder habitats are encountered in the high latitude McMurdo Sound and Ross Shelf region, along with somewhat milder near?shore water environments in the Western Antarctic Peninsula (WAP). By quantifying the extent of ice crystals invading and lodging in the spleen, the percentage of McMurdo Sound fish during austral summer (Oct-Feb) will be compared to the WAP intertidal fish during austral winter (Jul-Sep) to demonstrate their capability and extent of freeze avoidance. Resistance to ice entry in surface epithelia (e.g. skin, gill and intestinal lining) is another expression of the adaptation of these fish to otherwise lethally freezing conditions. The adaptive nature of a uniquely characteristic polar genome will be explored by the study of the transcriptome (the set of expressed RNA transcripts that constitutes the precursor to set of proteins expressed by an entire genome). Three notothenioid species (E.maclovinus, D. Mawsoni and C. aceratus) will be analysed to document evolutionary genetic changes (both gain and loss) shaped by life under extreme chronic cold. A differential gene expression (DGE) study will be carried out on these different species to evaluate evolutionary modification of tissue-wide response to heat challenges. The transcriptomes and other sequencing libraries will contribute to de novo ice-fish genome sequencing efforts.

Organization.Name: University of Illinois at Urbana Champaign
University of Illinois at Urbana Champaign
University of Illinois at Urbana Champaign

Project.Title: Large Properties at Small Cardinals

Title_Other.Title: 小基数上的大属性
Large Properties at Small Cardinals

Project.Abstract: Large cardinals are deeply used in set theory as many problems that are independent from the classical theory ZFC can be solved under the assumption that large cardinals exist. One of the most rich and fruitful research areas in contemporary set theory is the study of those properties of large cardinals that can hold even at small cardinals. Two properties of that kind are particularly interesting, the strong tree property and the super tree property. These properties provide a simple combinatorial characterisations of very strong large cardinal notions, namely strongly compact cardinals and supercompact cardinals. Although the strong and super tree property are associated with such strong large cardinals, they can be satisfied even by small cardinals such as aleph_2. The project focuses on some potential applications of such properties at small cardinals. Two conjectures are stated, the first one implies that the strong tree property has strong consequences in the arithmetic of infinite cardinals, namely we conjecture that the strong tree property at aleph_2 implies the singular cardinal hypothesis. The second conjecture concerns the study of infinite almost abelian groups, more precisely we ask whether the super tree property at a small cardinal kappa implies that every almost free abelian group of size kappa is free. The project is concerned more generally with developing combinatorial characterisations of all large cardinal notions and it proposed a systematic analysis of the combinatorial principles associated with large cardinals.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 大基数在集合理论中被大量使用，因为许多问题与经典理论无关，在大基数存在的假设下，可以解决ZFC问题。当代集合论中最丰富和最富有成果的研究领域之一是研究即使在小基数下也能容纳的大基数的性质。这类属性有两个特别有趣的属性，强树属性和超级树属性。这些性质提供了非常强的大基数概念的简单组合特征，即强紧基数和超紧基数。虽然强树和超树的性质与如此强的大基数相关联，但即使是像aleph_2这样的小基数也可以满足它们。该项目主要关注这些属性在小基数上的一些潜在应用。本文提出了两个猜想，第一个猜想暗示了强树性质在无穷基数运算中有很强的结果，即我们猜想aleph 2的强树性质暗示了奇异基数假设。第二个猜想是关于无限几乎阿贝尔群的研究，更确切地说，我们问在一个小基数kappa上的超树性质是否意味着每个大小为kappa的几乎自由阿贝尔群都是自由的。该项目更广泛地关注于发展所有大基数概念的组合特征，并提出了一个与大基数相关的组合原理的系统分析。

Large cardinals are deeply used in set theory as many problems that are independent from the classical theory ZFC can be solved under the assumption that large cardinals exist. One of the most rich and fruitful research areas in contemporary set theory is the study of those properties of large cardinals that can hold even at small cardinals. Two properties of that kind are particularly interesting, the strong tree property and the super tree property. These properties provide a simple combinatorial characterisations of very strong large cardinal notions, namely strongly compact cardinals and supercompact cardinals. Although the strong and super tree property are associated with such strong large cardinals, they can be satisfied even by small cardinals such as aleph_2. The project focuses on some potential applications of such properties at small cardinals. Two conjectures are stated, the first one implies that the strong tree property has strong consequences in the arithmetic of infinite cardinals, namely we conjecture that the strong tree property at aleph_2 implies the singular cardinal hypothesis. The second conjecture concerns the study of infinite almost abelian groups, more precisely we ask whether the super tree property at a small cardinal kappa implies that every almost free abelian group of size kappa is free. The project is concerned more generally with developing combinatorial characterisations of all large cardinal notions and it proposed a systematic analysis of the combinatorial principles associated with large cardinals.

Project.Title: Involvement of glypican-1 in Alzheimer´s disease

Title_Other.Title: glypican-1在阿尔茨海默病中的作用
Involvement of glypican-1 in Alzheimer´s disease

Project.Abstract: Glypican-1 is a polyanionic protein abundant in human brain. It consists of a core protein substituted with heparan sulphate (HS) chains. It has been known for decades that HS chains are constituents of amyloid fibrils. The origin and function of HS in the deposits of aggregated proteins is still unknown. We have shown recycling of glypican-1 from cell-surface to endosomes in neuronal cells. Our results indicate that glypican-1 functions as a chaperone by releasing its supercharged HS chains that form stable conjugates with oxidized aggregation-prone proteins such as scrapie prion and prevent their aggregation and accumulation. We aim to study involvement of glypican-1 in amyloid precursor protein (APP) processing and functional interplay between recycling glypican-1 and amyloid beta in Alzheimer´s disease by investigating: 1) presence of HS-amyloid beta conjugates in in vitro and in vivo models of Alzheimer´s disease using primary cortical neurons and organotypic cultures of hippocampus from wild type mice and a transgenic mice model of Alzheimer´s disease, 2) anti-amyloidogenic properties of glypican-1 using in vitro and in vivo models of Alzheimer´s disease where attempts will be made to manipulate APP processing and level of amyloid beta by manipulating conjugate formation using agents that increase/decrease the level of amyloid-associated HS and 3) presence and function of HS-amyloid beta conjugates in human brain tissue from Alzheimer´s patients and control group.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: Glypican-1 is a polyanionic protein abundant in human brain. It consists of a core protein substituted with heparan sulphate (HS) chains. It has been known for decades that HS chains are constituents of amyloid fibrils. The origin and function of HS in the deposits of aggregated proteins is still unknown. We have shown recycling of glypican-1 from cell-surface to endosomes in neuronal cells. Our results indicate that glypican-1 functions as a chaperone by releasing its supercharged HS chains that form stable conjugates with oxidized aggregation-prone proteins such as scrapie prion and prevent their aggregation and accumulation. We aim to study involvement of glypican-1 in amyloid precursor protein (APP) processing and functional interplay between recycling glypican-1 and amyloid beta in Alzheimer´s disease by investigating: 1) presence of HS-amyloid beta conjugates in in vitro and in vivo models of Alzheimer´s disease using primary cortical neurons and organotypic cultures of hippocampus from wild type mice and a transgenic mice model of Alzheimer´s disease, 2) anti-amyloidogenic properties of glypican-1 using in vitro and in vivo models of Alzheimer´s disease where attempts will be made to manipulate APP processing and level of amyloid beta by manipulating conjugate formation using agents that increase/decrease the level of amyloid-associated HS and 3) presence and function of HS-amyloid beta conjugates in human brain tissue from Alzheimer´s patients and control group.

Glypican-1是一种富含人脑的多阴离子蛋白。它由一个被硫酸乙酰丙酯（HS）链取代的核心蛋白组成。几十年来人们已经知道HS链是淀粉样纤维的组成部分。HS在聚集蛋白沉积中的起源和作用尚不清楚。我们已经证明了glypican-1在神经元细胞中从细胞表面循环到内切体。我们的结果表明，glypican-1通过释放其增压的HS链发挥伴侣的作用，这些HS链与氧化的易聚集蛋白如crapie-prion形成稳定的结合物，并阻止其聚集和积累。我们的目的是研究glypican-1在Alzheimer病淀粉样前体蛋白（APP）加工中的作用以及glypican-1和β-淀粉样蛋白在Alzheimer病中的功能相互作用，方法是：1）用原代皮层神经元和器官型细胞在Alzheimer病的体内外模型中存在HS-β-淀粉样结合物野生型小鼠海马培养和阿尔茨海默病转基因小鼠模型，2） glypican-1在阿尔茨海默病体内外模型中的抗淀粉样变特性，在该模型中，将尝试通过使用增加/降低淀粉样蛋白相关联的HS水平的试剂来操纵APP处理和淀粉样β水平，以及3）HS淀粉样β的存在和功能阿尔茨海默病患者和对照组脑组织中的结合物。

Project.Title: PAPM EAGER: A Plant Observatory for remote sensing of biochemical reactions in vivo

Title_Other.Title: PAPM EAGER: A Plant Observatory for remote sensing of biochemical reactions in vivo
PAPM-EAGER：一个用于活体生化反应遥感的植物观测站

Class.ClassName: 碱土金属、碱土金属合金

Project.Abstract: Phenotyping plants under real world conditions is highly challenging. The Frommer lab (Stanford) developed a suite of genetically encoded biosensors that report subcellular levels of ions or metabolites (e.g. ions, sugars) or that report the activity of particular transporters with high temporal resolution. Typically, plants expressing these sensors are analyzed using fluorescence microscopy. This project will explore whether ion levels can be quantified (here the signaling intermediate calcium as a proof of concept) in specific regions of plant leaves using a remote imaging system. The Kramer lab at MSU developed a growth chamber that can mimic and replay field conditions and simultaneously phenotype photosynthetic parameters using a fluorescence imaging system. This collaboration brings together these two innovative platforms: the dynamic environmental imaging system (DEPI), and genetically encoded ultrasensitive fluorescent biosensor technology. The project aims to develop a novel system that can monitor genetically encoded sensors in intact plants with unprecedented depth and the parallel option for high throughput phenotyping of photosynthesis. The project will lay the groundwork for establishing systems and tools as community resources with the potential to transform photosynthesis research programs around the world. This high-risk project will lay the basis for phenotyping genetic variants in Arabidopsis as well as crops and expand the usefulness of genetically encoded biosensors to large scale screening. In addition, this project will train a postdoctoral scientist with experience in physical chemistry in phenotyping. The project will also train high school students and undergraduate students, and where possible minority students will be engaged in this endeavor. Such an imaging system would present a completely novel tool for phenotyping molecular events in intact plants and thus present a new tool for screening genetic variants and to discover new biology at the whole plant level. The project will demonstrate the potential of this technology by monitoring novel ultrasensitive calcium sensors to test long-standing hypotheses regarding the role of calcium in signaling processes and the response patterns in leaves in fluctuating environmental conditions and specific signaling processes. One of the challenges is the sensitivity of the combined plant-imaging system. The Frommer lab developed novel ultrasensitive calcium sensors that will be used here and that may enable us to observe calcium dynamics over the whole growth cycle in populations of 100s of plants simultaneously. This approach, if successful, could be expanded to other fluorescent biosensors and implemented for crop plant screening. At the same time, such a system may uncover new biology in the areas of plant cell signaling and chloroplast ion dynamics.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 在现实世界条件下，植物的表型是极具挑战性的。Frommer实验室（斯坦福）开发了一套基因编码生物传感器，可报告亚细胞水平的离子或代谢物（如离子、糖）或报告具有高时间分辨率的特定转运体的活性。通常，表达这些传感器的植物是用荧光显微镜分析的。这个项目将探索是否可以使用远程成像系统在植物叶片的特定区域量化离子水平（这里的信号中间钙作为概念的证明）。MSU的Kramer实验室开发了一个生长室，可以模拟和重放野外条件，同时利用荧光成像系统显示光合参数。这项合作将这两个创新平台结合在一起：动态环境成像系统（DEPI）和基因编码的超灵敏荧光生物传感器技术。该项目旨在开发一种新的系统，能够以前所未有的深度监测完整植物中的基因编码传感器，并为光合作用的高通量表型分析提供并行选择。该项目将为建立系统和工具奠定基础，使之成为社区资源，有可能改变世界各地的光合作用研究项目。这一高风险项目将为拟南芥和作物的表型遗传变异奠定基础，并将基因编码生物传感器的用途扩大到大规模筛选。此外，该项目还将培养一名在表型方面具有物理化学经验的博士后科学家。该项目还将培训高中生和本科生，在可能的情况下，少数民族学生将参与这项工作。这种成像系统将为完整植物的表型分子事件提供一种全新的工具，从而为筛选遗传变异和在整个植物水平上发现新生物学提供一种新的工具。该项目将通过监测新型超灵敏钙传感器来证明这项技术的潜力，以测试长期以来关于钙在信号传导过程中的作用以及在波动的环境条件和特定信号传导过程中叶子的反应模式的假设。其中一个挑战是联合设备成像系统的灵敏度。Frommer实验室开发了新型超灵敏钙传感器，将在这里使用，这可能使我们能够在100多株植物的整个生长周期中同时观察钙的动态。如果成功的话，这种方法可以扩展到其他荧光生物传感器，并应用于作物筛选。同时，这样一个系统可能揭示植物细胞信号和叶绿体离子动力学领域的新生物学。

This high-risk project will lay the basis for phenotyping genetic variants in Arabidopsis as well as crops and expand the usefulness of genetically encoded biosensors to large scale screening. In addition, this project will train a postdoctoral scientist with experience in physical chemistry in phenotyping. The project will also train high school students and undergraduate students, and where possible minority students will be engaged in this endeavor. One of the challenges is the sensitivity of the combined plant-imaging system. The Frommer lab developed novel ultrasensitive calcium sensors that will be used here and that may enable us to observe calcium dynamics over the whole growth cycle in populations of 100s of plants simultaneously. This approach, if successful, could be expanded to other fluorescent biosensors and implemented for crop plant screening. Project.Title: Mechanisms and evolution of signal pattern recognition

Title_Other.Title: 信号模式识别的机理与发展
Mechanisms and evolution of signal pattern recognition

Class.ClassName: 理论、技术、方法、研究、评价、策略

Project.Abstract: DESCRIPTION (provided by applicant): The overall goal of the proposed research is to gain knowledge about mechanisms and evolution of signal pattern recognition. The research exploits the advantages of acoustic communication in frogs as a model system for exploring: (1) combinations of physical properties of signals that convey biologically significant information; (2) the operating principles by which nervous systems processes and extract such information; and (3) patterns of evolutionary change in signal pattern recognition. Because frogs do not require acoustic experience to produce or to recognize signals, this system can yield knowledge bearing on analogous problems in the recognition and discrimination of speech sounds by infants. That is, all languages draw from a common set of phonetic segments, and infants with little linguistic experience can discriminate among phonetic segments that do not even occur in the language that they will ultimately learn. This research thus addresses questions about inborn mechanisms of pattern recognition that make possible the development of normal speech, which, in turn, is important for human mental health. The proposed research will use playbacks of computer-synthesized signals that simulate male communication sounds; females respond to these sounds with positive phonotaxis and discriminate subtle differences in one or more properties. The research addresses interactions of discrimination criteria based on the frequency content of the signal and differences in fine-scale temporal properties. These interactions will be quantified in two closely related species; these results will then be used to select tests to be conducted with seven other species that are more or less closely related. These data, in conjunction with an independently derived estimate of the phylogenetic relationships of all nine species, will be used to assess how pattern recognition might have evolved. Mechanistic and environmental factors that could explain evolutionary trends will also be identified. Ultimately, this research will be important for framing testable hypotheses about sensory mechanisms underlying pattern recognition and for guiding the execution of such studies.

The research exploits the advantages of acoustic communication in frogs as a model system for exploring: (1) combinations of physical properties of signals that convey biologically significant information; (2) the operating principles by which nervous systems processes and extract such information; and (3) patterns of evolutionary change in signal pattern recognition. Because frogs do not require acoustic experience to produce or to recognize signals, this system can yield knowledge bearing on analogous problems in the recognition and discrimination of speech sounds by infants. That is, all languages draw from a common set of phonetic segments, and infants with little linguistic experience can discriminate among phonetic segments that do not even occur in the language that they will ultimately learn. This research thus addresses questions about inborn mechanisms of pattern recognition that make possible the development of normal speech, which, in turn, is important for human mental health. The proposed research will use playbacks of computer-synthesized signals that simulate male communication sounds; females respond to these sounds with positive phonotaxis and discriminate subtle differences in one or more properties. The research addresses interactions of discrimination criteria based on the frequency content of the signal and differences in fine-scale temporal properties. 描述（由申请人提供）：本研究的总体目标是获得有关信号模式识别机制和演化的知识。这项研究利用青蛙的声学通讯作为探索的模型系统的优点：（1）传递生物学上重要信息的信号的物理特性的组合；（2）神经系统处理和提取这些信息的工作原理；（3）信号的进化变化模式。模式识别。由于青蛙不需要声学经验来产生或识别信号，这个系统可以产生与婴儿识别和辨别语音的类似问题有关的知识。也就是说，所有的语言都是从一组共同的语音片段中提取出来的，没有多少语言经验的婴儿可以辨别出哪种语音片段甚至不会出现在他们最终要学习的语言中。因此，本研究探讨了模式识别的内在机制，使正常语音的发展成为可能，进而对人类的心理健康具有重要意义。拟议的研究将使用计算机合成信号的回放，模拟男性的交流声音；女性对这些声音的反应具有积极的语音特性，并在一个或多个属性上区分细微的差异。这项研究探讨了基于信号频率含量和精细尺度时间特性差异的判别准则之间的相互作用。这些相互作用将在两个密切相关的物种中进行量化；然后，这些结果将用于选择与其他七个或多或少有密切关系的物种进行的试验。这些数据，连同对所有9个物种的系统发育关系的独立估计，将被用来评估模式识别可能是如何进化的。还将确定能够解释进化趋势的机制和环境因素。最终，这项研究将对构建关于模式识别的感觉机制的可测试假设和指导此类研究的执行具有重要意义。

Source.Name: National Institute on Deafness and Other Communication Disorders

Project.Title: Development of shellfish modelling, assessment and management methods

Title_Other.Title: Development of shellfish modelling, assessment and management methods
贝类建模、评估和管理方法的发展

Class.ClassName: 控制论（数学）、信息论（数学）

Project.Abstract: Description Summary Objectives:- Through modelling, field studies, and case studies, for a range of shellfish species: a) develop simple models and harvest rules; b) develop models to manage spatially distributed stocks; c) develop biological reference points and management objectives for different types of shellfish; d) provide a review of long-term monitoring, assessment, and management priorities for shellfish. Key Customer Purpose:- Provide a thorough review of current shellfish monitoring and assessment and management programmes, recommend necessary changes, and establish priorities for future biological investigations, fishery monitoring, assessment and management.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 说明 总结目标：通过建模、实地研究和案例研究，对一系列贝类物种：a）开发简单的模型和收获规则；b）开发管理空间分布种群的模型；c）开发不同类型贝类的生物参考点和管理目标；d）审查贝类的长期监测、评估和管理优先事项。主要客户目的：-对当前贝类监测、评估和管理方案进行全面审查，提出必要的修改建议，并确定未来生物调查、渔业监测、评估和管理的优先事项。

Description Summary Objectives:- Through modelling, field studies, and case studies, for a range of shellfish species: a) develop simple models and harvest rules; b) develop models to manage spatially distributed stocks; c) develop biological reference points and management objectives for different types of shellfish; d) provide a review of long-term monitoring, assessment, and management priorities for shellfish. Key Customer Purpose:- Provide a thorough review of current shellfish monitoring and assessment and management programmes, recommend necessary changes, and establish priorities for future biological investigations, fishery monitoring, assessment and management.

Organization.Name: Centre for Environment, Fisheries and Aquaculture Science

Source.Name: Department for Environment Food and Rural Affairs

Project.Title: Ex Vivo Model for Assessing the Vaginal Disposition of PrEP Antiretrovirals

Title_Other.Title: Ex Vivo Model for Assessing the Vaginal Disposition of PrEP Antiretrovirals
体外评价抗逆转录病毒药物阴道配置的模型

Project.Abstract: DESCRIPTION (provided by applicant): The global HIV/AIDS pandemic is in its 30th year, yet infection rates remain alarmingly high, with 2.6 million people worldwide having become infected in 2009. These troubling statistics highlight the need for efficacious antiretroviral chemoprophylaxis as a preventative measure for at-risk populations. Two large-scale clinical trials recently have shown that pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) prevents infection in a significant proportion of individuals. The CAPRISA 004 trial showed that HIV-susceptible women who adhered to a regimen involving the application of 1% tenofovir vaginal gel prior to intercourse achieved a 54% reduction in HIV transmission. In the iPrEx trial, men and transgender women who have sex with men receiving once-daily emtricitabine (FTC) and tenofovir disoproxil fumarate (TDF) achieved a 44% reduction in HIV acquisition. These highly encouraging results provide a clear rationale for future clinical studies based on systemic and topical PrEP, likely using a combination of antiretroviral agents such as TDF and FTC. In preparation for these trials, the NIAID has identified the development of novel ex vivo systems for the evaluation of antiretroviral agents as a key priority area. Antiretroviral drugs have unpredictable pharmacokinetic (PK) properties involving extensive drug metabolism and transport by membrane-associated carrier proteins. Combination drug therapy often introduces complex drug-drug interactions that can result in toxic or sub-therapeutic drug concentrations and compromise treatment. The objective of this application is to establish cell culture models that faithfully recreate the membrane drug transport processes in the vaginal epithelium and to use these systems to study the transcellular transport of the TDF-FTC drug combination ex vivo. The permeability of biological membranes is one of the most important determinants of a drug's PK profile. Drugs pass through cells by a combination of passive transcellular and carrier-mediated processes. Given the paucity of knowledge on the expression of molecular transporters in the genital tract of humans and animal models, representative ex vivo studies predictive of in vivo PK currently are not possible. We propose to address this urgent need through the following three research phases: (1) Measure baseline gene expression of molecular transporters (membrane proteins) in vaginal tissue from humans and animal models used in the evaluation of topical microbicide formulations; (2) Develop an ex vivo model and apply it to the TDF-FTC combination through the creation of novel, and the utilization of existing, vaginal cell culture systems; and (3) Evaluate ex vivo model predictions by conducting in vivo PK studies using intravaginal rings delivering TDF and FTC topically to the genital tract.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 描述（由申请人提供）：全球艾滋病毒/艾滋病大流行已进入第30个年头，但感染率仍高得惊人，2009年全世界有260万人感染。这些令人不安的统计数据强调了有效的抗逆转录病毒化学预防作为高危人群预防措施的必要性。两个大规模的临床试验最近表明，暴露前预防（PREP）防止感染的相当比例的个人。CAPRISA 004试验表明，那些在性交前坚持使用1%替诺福韦阴道凝胶的易感染艾滋病的妇女，艾滋病病毒的传播率降低了54%。在IPREX试验中，男性和变性妇女与男性发生性接触，每日一次服用恩曲他滨（FTC）和替诺福韦-富马酸二氧丙氧酯（TDF），HIV获得率降低了44%。这些非常令人鼓舞的结果为今后基于全身和局部准备的临床研究提供了明确的理论基础，可能使用抗逆转录病毒药物如TDF和FTC的组合。在准备这些试验时，NIAID已确定开发用于评价抗逆转录病毒药物的新型体外系统是一个关键的优先领域。抗逆转录病毒药物具有不可预测的药代动力学（PK）特性，涉及广泛的药物代谢和膜相关载体蛋白的转运。联合药物治疗经常引入复杂的药物-药物相互作用，可能导致毒性或亚治疗药物浓度和妥协治疗。本申请的目的是建立细胞培养模型，忠实地再现阴道上皮细胞膜药物转运过程，并利用这些系统研究TDF-FTC药物组合的体外跨细胞转运。生物膜的通透性是决定药物PK谱的重要因素之一。药物通过被动的跨细胞和载体介导的过程通过细胞。鉴于对人类生殖道和动物模型中分子转运体表达的了解不足，目前还无法预测体内PK的典型体外研究。我们建议通过以下三个研究阶段来解决这一迫切需要：（1）测量用于评价局部杀菌剂制剂的人类和动物模型阴道组织中分子转运蛋白（膜蛋白）的基线基因表达；（2）建立体外模型并将其应用于TDF- FTC组合，通过建立新的，以及现有的阴道细胞培养系统的利用；和（3）通过使用阴道内环向生殖道提供TDF和FTC的体内PKK研究来评价体外模型预测。

DESCRIPTION (provided by applicant): The global HIV/AIDS pandemic is in its 30th year, yet infection rates remain alarmingly high, with 2.6 million people worldwide having become infected in 2009. These troubling statistics highlight the need for efficacious antiretroviral chemoprophylaxis as a preventative measure for at-risk populations. Two large-scale clinical trials recently have shown that pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) prevents infection in a significant proportion of individuals. The CAPRISA 004 trial showed that HIV-susceptible women who adhered to a regimen involving the application of 1% tenofovir vaginal gel prior to intercourse achieved a 54% reduction in HIV transmission. In the iPrEx trial, men and transgender women who have sex with men receiving once-daily emtricitabine (FTC) and tenofovir disoproxil fumarate (TDF) achieved a 44% reduction in HIV acquisition. These highly encouraging results provide a clear rationale for future clinical studies based on systemic and topical PrEP, likely using a combination of antiretroviral agents such as TDF and FTC. In preparation for these trials, the NIAID has identified the development of novel ex vivo systems for the evaluation of antiretroviral agents as a key priority area. Antiretroviral drugs have unpredictable pharmacokinetic (PK) properties involving extensive drug metabolism and transport by membrane-associated carrier proteins. Combination drug therapy often introduces complex drug-drug interactions that can result in toxic or sub-therapeutic drug concentrations and compromise treatment. The objective of this application is to establish cell culture models that faithfully recreate the membrane drug transport processes in the vaginal epithelium and to use these systems to study the transcellular transport of the TDF-FTC drug combination ex vivo. The permeability of biological membranes is one of the most important determinants of a drug's PK profile. Drugs pass through cells by a combination of passive transcellular and carrier-mediated processes. Given the paucity of knowledge on the expression of molecular transporters in the genital tract of humans and animal models, representative ex vivo studies predictive of in vivo PK currently are not possible. We propose to address this urgent need through the following three research phases: (1) Measure baseline gene expression of molecular transporters (membrane proteins) in vaginal tissue from humans and animal models used in the evaluation of topical microbicide formulations; (2) Develop an ex vivo model and apply it to the TDF-FTC combination through the creation of novel, and the utilization of existing, vaginal cell culture systems; and (3) Evaluate ex vivo model predictions by conducting in vivo PK studies using intravaginal rings delivering TDF and FTC topically to the genital tract.

Source.Name: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases

Project.Title: Applications for Diagnostic and Pharmaceutical Research of a Lab-on-A-Chip Based on Dielectrophoretic Fields

Title_Other.Title: Applicazioni alla diagnostica e alla ricerca farmaceutica di un Lab-on-a-chip basato su campi dielettroforetici
基于介电泳场的芯片实验室在诊断和药物研究中的应用

Class.ClassName: 自然科学实验方法、自然科学实验设备

Project.Abstract: This Research Program involves the design, development, implementation and testing of Labs-on-a-Chips based on dielectrophoretic processes that can be used for molecular diagnostics and for the development of new drugs, including nano- and microparticle systems. Labs-on-a-chip validation on biological protocols for molecular diagnosis and phenotypic characterization using monoclonal antibodies and / or peptides, as well as DNA-based and nucleic acid peptides (PNAs). Specific Search Program Goals: 1. Development of Labs-on-a-chip prototypes made with PCB for the study of the possibilities offered by dielectrophoretic cage technology. Development and use of a Lab-on-a-chip based on dielectrophoretic cages with integrated silicon technologies. This device allows to create 20-micrometre-diameter dielectrophoretic potential cages, allowing individual cells / microspheres / liposomes to move. 2. Production and characterization of nano- and micro-particle systems (liposomes, niosomes, nanoparticles) for internalization and cell transfer experiments on Labs-on-a-chip. 3. Production and characterization of polysaccharide-based microcapsules. 4. Production and characterization of liposomes for Labs-on-a-chip applications. 5. Molecular diagnosis using monoclonal antibodies and peptides. Verification of the possibility to use Lab-on-a-chip for diagnostic purposes, using microparticles functionalized with monoclonal antibodies or peptides recognized by cellular receptors. 6. Molecular diagnosis using ODN, PNA and PCR products. This part of the project involves the production of microspheres for the transport of molecular probes and PCR products capable of altering the DEP properties of the microspheres. to. Identification of W1282X and DF508 mutations of cystic fibrosis; b. Identification of mutations for beta-thalassemia; c. Identifying Roundup-Ready transgenic sequences; d. Identification of transgenic sequences Bt-176; is. Diagnosis of HIV-1 infection. 7. Targeting bioactive target molecules using Lab-on-a-chip products. The ability to convey a certain amount of nucleic acid molecules (genes, oligonucleotides, PNAs, chimeras PNA-DNA) to target tumor cells is evaluated. This goal will be achieved through several phases. A. Developing experimental conditions for the movement of microspheres and liposomes in the Lab-on-a-chip. B. Developing experimental conditions for the movement of microspheres or liposomes carrying therapeutic molecules (ODN antisense, PNA, PNA / DNA hybrids, PNA-DNA chimeras). C. Evaluation of the velocity of interaction between microspheres carrying drugs and target cells. D. Identification of experimental conditions that allow "sorting". E. Examination of alteration of gene expression after treatment. Target cells will be K562 and MCF-7 cells to which microspheres containing chromomycin (K562), tallimustine (K562), ODN and PNA decoy will be directed against transcriptional factors such as NF-kB, GATA-1, Sp1, ER, OCT-1 (K562 and MCF-7). 8. Analysis of the effects of treatments described by quantitative RT-PCR on a single cell. 9. In vitro and in vivo biocompatibility studies of nano and microparticle transport systems as a precondition for clinical use.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: Il presente Programma di Ricerca prevede progettazione, sviluppo, realizzazione e verifica di Labs-on-a-chip basati su processi dielettroforetici utilizzabili per diagnostica molecolare e per sviluppo di nuovi farmaci, anche utilizzando sistemi nano- e micro-particellari. La validazione dei Labs-on-a-chip su protocolli biologici per diagnosi molecolare e caratterizzazione fenotipica utilizzer anticorpi monoclonali e/o peptidi, nonchÃ© sonde basate su DNA e acidi peptido nucleici (PNA). Obiettivi specifici del Programma di Ricerca: 1. Sviluppo di prototipi di Labs-on-a-chip realizzati con la tecnologia per circuiti stampati (PCB) per lo studio delle possibilit offerte dalla tecnologia a gabbie dielettroforetiche. Sviluppo e utilizzo di un Lab-on-a-chip basato su gabbie dielettroforetiche con tecnologie integrate su silicio. Questo dispositivo permette di creare gabbie di potenziale dielettroforetico dellâ ordine dei 20 microm di lato, permettendo la movimentazione di singole cellule/microsfere/liposomi. 2. Produzione e caratterizzazione di sistemi nano- e micro-particellari (liposomi, niosomi, nanoparticelle) per esperimenti di internalizzazione e trasferimento cellulare su Labs-on-a-chip. 3. Produzione e caratterizzazione di microcapsule a base polisaccaridica. 4. Produzione e caratterizzazione di liposfere per applicazioni su Labs-on-a-chip. 5. Diagnostica molecolare utilizzando anticorpi monoclonali e peptidi. Verr verificata la possibilit di utilizzare Lab-on-a-chips a fini diagnostici, utilizzando microparticelle funzionalizzate con anticorpi monoclonali o peptidi riconosciuti da recettori cellulari. 6. Diagnostica molecolare utilizzando ODN, PNA e prodotti di PCR. Questa parte del progetto prevede la produzione di microsfere per il trasporto di sonde molecolari e prodotti PCR capaci di alterare le propriet DEP delle microsfere. a. Identificazione delle mutazioni W1282X e DF508 della fibrosi cistica; b. identificazione delle mutazioni per la beta-talassemia; c. identificazione delle sequenze transgeniche di Roundup-Ready; d. identificazione delle sequenze transgeniche Bt-176; e. diagnosi di infezione da HIV-1. 7. Veicolazione di molecole bioattive a cellule bersaglio utilizzando i Lab-on-a-chip prodotti. Sar valutata la possibilit di veicolare una certa quantit di molecole di acidi nucleici (geni, oligonucleotidi, PNAs, chimere PNA-DNA) a cellule tumorali bersaglio. Questo obiettivo sar raggiunto attraverso diverse fasi. A. messa a punto delle condizioni sperimentali per il movimento di microsfere e liposomi nel Lab-on-a-chip. B. messa a punto delle condizioni sperimentali per il movimento di microsfere o liposomi che portano molecole terapeutiche (ODN antisenso, PNA, ibridi PNA/DNA, chimere PNA-DNA). C. valutazione della velocit di interazione tra microsfere che portano farmaci e le cellule bersaglio. D. identificazione delle condizioni sperimentali che permettono il "sorting". E. Esame dellâ alterazione dellâ espressione genica dopo il trattamento. Le cellule bersaglio saranno le cellule K562 e MCF-7 alle quali saranno dirette microsfere contenenti cromomicina (K562), tallimustina (K562), ODN e PNA decoy contro fattori trascrizionali quali NF-kB, GATA-1, Sp1, ER, OCT-1 (K562 e MCF-7). 8. Analisi degli effetti dei trattamenti descritti mediante RT-PCR quantitativa su una singola cellula. 9. Studi di biocompatibilit in vitro e in vivo dei sistemi di trasporto nano e microparticellari prodotti quale premessa ad un eventuale uso clinico.

这项研究计划包括设计、开发、实施和测试基于介电泳过程的芯片实验室，可用于分子诊断和新药开发，包括纳米和微粒系统。使用单克隆抗体和/或肽以及基于DNA和核酸肽（PNA）的分子诊断和表型鉴定生物协议的芯片实验室验证。 特定搜索计划目标： 一。利用印刷电路板制作的芯片上实验室原型的开发，以研究介电电泳笼技术提供的可能性。基于集成硅技术的介电泳笼的芯片实验室的开发和使用。这个装置可以制造20微米直径的介电电位笼，允许单个细胞/微球/脂质体移动。 2。用于芯片上实验室内化和细胞转移实验的纳米和微粒系统（脂质体、囊泡、纳米颗粒）的制备和表征。 三。多糖微胶囊的制备与表征。 四。芯片实验用脂质体的制备与表征。 5个。利用单克隆抗体和多肽进行分子诊断。利用经单克隆抗体或细胞受体识别的肽功能化的微粒验证将芯片上实验室用于诊断目的的可能性。 6。利用ODN、PNA和PCR产物进行分子诊断。该项目的这一部分涉及生产用于运输分子探针的微球和能够改变微球DEP性质的PCR产物。到。囊性纤维化W1282X和DF508突变的鉴定；b.β地中海贫血突变的鉴定；c.抗草甘膦转基因序列的鉴定；d.转基因序列Bt-176的鉴定；is。HIV-1感染的诊断。 7号。使用芯片上的实验室产品瞄准生物活性靶分子。评估将一定数量的核酸分子（基因、寡核苷酸、PNA、嵌合PNA-DNA）传递到靶向肿瘤细胞的能力。这一目标将通过几个阶段实现。A.为微球和脂质体在芯片实验室中的运动开发实验条件。B.为载治疗分子的微球或脂质体（ODN反义，PNA，PNA/DNA杂交，PNA-DNA嵌合体）的运动开发实验条件。C.载药微球与靶细胞相互作用速度的评价。D.确定允许“分类”的实验条件。E.检查治疗后基因表达的变化。靶细胞将是K562和MCF-7细胞，其中含有色霉素（K562）、塔利莫司汀（K562）、ODN和PNA诱饵的微球将针对NF-kB、GATA-1、Sp1、ER、OCT-1（K562和MCF-7）等转录因子。 8个。用定量RT-PCR方法分析处理对单个细胞的影响。 9号。作为临床应用先决条件的纳米和微粒传输系统的体内外生物相容性研究。

Source.Name: Ministry of Education, Universities and Research

Project.Title: Coherent Broadband Fiber-Array Laser (CBFAL)

Title_Other.Title: 相干宽带光纤阵列激光器（CBFAL）
Coherent Broadband Fiber-Array Laser (CBFAL)

Project.Abstract: Compact, high power, 100 kW class plug-in efficient lasers, although difficult to develop, are critical for various applications. Existing solutions to this problem, based on coherent or incoherent combining of multiple fiber channels, have shown limited success. A new paradigm must be considered, encompassing both fundamental properties and practical results, to meet the challenging requirements of perfecting compact and high-power effective laser systems with high-quality output beam. An alternative solution to this problem is to couple the fiber channels inside a combined open cavity. Preliminary experimental data has demonstrated that this automatically solves the problem of mutual phase synchronization of the multiple channels. This proposal describes an innovative approach to developing a power-scalable fiber-array laser with a united output beam. The proposed method is inherently robust and auto-matches the spectral and polarization characteristics of individual channels. This should allow development of a laser system with an output power exceeding the multi-kW level. This Phase I effort includes design and analysis of a prototype system, along with laboratory measurements, to demonstrate concept feasibility. In addition, a commercialization strategy will be identified in order to market the system. During Phase II a prototype system will be built, tested, and demonstrated. BENEFIT: It is anticipated that the technology developed in this project will enable the construction of viable commercial high-power CW fiber array lasers. A scalable, high-power laser system composed of a variable number of phase-matched channels will find immediate application in industries such as high-precision laser cutting, welding and cleaning, commercial marking and packaging, medical and surgical applications, and remote sensing and free-space communications. Possible military applications include target acquisition, non-visible high brightness illuminators, ranging and tracking, and long-range missile interception. They can also be used to identify and track chemical and biological weapons of mass destruction.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 紧凑、大功率、100kw级插入式高效激光器虽然很难开发，但对于各种应用来说都是至关重要的。基于多个光纤通道的相干或非相干组合的现有解决方案已显示出有限的成功。必须考虑一种新的范式，包括基本特性和实际结果，以满足完善具有高质量输出光束的紧凑和高功率有效激光系统的挑战性要求。解决这个问题的另一种方法是将光纤通道耦合到一个组合的开放腔中。初步实验数据表明，该方法自动解决了多通道的互相位同步问题。该方案描述了一种创新的方法来开发功率可伸缩的光纤阵列激光器与联合输出光束。该方法具有固有的鲁棒性，能够自动匹配各个信道的频谱和极化特性。这将允许开发输出功率超过多千瓦级的激光系统。第一阶段的工作包括原型系统的设计和分析，以及实验室测量，以证明概念的可行性。此外，还将确定一项商业化战略，以便将该系统推向市场。在第二阶段，将建立、测试和演示一个原型系统。效益：预计本项目开发的技术将有助于建设可行的商用大功率连续波光纤阵列激光器。一个由不同数量的相位匹配通道组成的可扩展的高功率激光系统将立即在高精度激光切割、焊接和清洗、商业标记和包装、医疗和外科应用、遥感和自由空间通信等行业得到应用。可能的军事应用包括目标捕获、不可见高亮度照明、测距和跟踪以及远程导弹拦截。它们还可用于识别和追踪大规模杀伤性化学和生物武器。

Existing solutions to this problem, based on coherent or incoherent combining of multiple fiber channels, have shown limited success. A new paradigm must be considered, encompassing both fundamental properties and practical results, to meet the challenging requirements of perfecting compact and high-power effective laser systems with high-quality output beam. An alternative solution to this problem is to couple the fiber channels inside a combined open cavity. Preliminary experimental data has demonstrated that this automatically solves the problem of mutual phase synchronization of the multiple channels. This proposal describes an innovative approach to developing a power-scalable fiber-array laser with a united output beam. The proposed method is inherently robust and auto-matches the spectral and polarization characteristics of individual channels. This should allow development of a laser system with an output power exceeding the multi-kW level. This Phase I effort includes design and analysis of a prototype system, along with laboratory measurements, to demonstrate concept feasibility. In addition, a commercialization strategy will be identified in order to market the system. During Phase II a prototype system will be built, tested, and demonstrated. BENEFIT: It is anticipated that the technology developed in this project will enable the construction of viable commercial high-power CW fiber array lasers. A scalable, high-power laser system composed of a variable number of phase-matched channels will find immediate application in industries such as high-precision laser cutting, welding and cleaning, commercial marking and packaging, medical and surgical applications, and remote sensing and free-space communications. Possible military applications include target acquisition, non-visible high brightness illuminators, ranging and tracking, and long-range missile interception. They can also be used to identify and track chemical and biological weapons of mass destruction.

Source.Name: United States Department of the Air Force

Project.Title: RIA: Verifying the Temporal Behavior of Concurrent Systems

Title_Other.Title: RIA: Verifying the Temporal Behavior of Concurrent Systems
RIA：验证并发系统的时间行为

Project.Abstract: This research examines the question of how synchronization affects the temporal behavior of concurrent systems. The main problem addressed is that of determining tight bounds on separation times between system events. The concurrent system model used is a directed graph whose vertices represent events (synchronizations) and whose edges are annotated with delay information (bounds on computation times). The approach is to use algebraic techniques for manipulating an infinitely unfolded graph to implicitly examine the entire set of temporal behaviors. The research is extending the types of temporal analyses that can be preformed, as well as extending the classes of concurrent systems whose timing behavior can be efficiently verified. Applications in the area of asynchronous circuits are also being investigated.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: This research examines the question of how synchronization affects the temporal behavior of concurrent systems. The main problem addressed is that of determining tight bounds on separation times between system events. The concurrent system model used is a directed graph whose vertices represent events (synchronizations) and whose edges are annotated with delay information (bounds on computation times). The approach is to use algebraic techniques for manipulating an infinitely unfolded graph to implicitly examine the entire set of temporal behaviors. The research is extending the types of temporal analyses that can be preformed, as well as extending the classes of concurrent systems whose timing behavior can be efficiently verified. Applications in the area of asynchronous circuits are also being investigated.
本研究探讨同步如何影响并发系统的时间行为。所解决的主要问题是确定系统事件之间分离时间的严格界限。所使用的并发系统模型是一个有向图，其顶点表示事件（同步），其边用延迟信息（计算时间的界限）进行注释。方法是使用代数技术来操作无限展开的图，从而隐式地检查整个时间行为集。这项研究正在扩展可执行的时序分析类型，以及扩展其时序行为可有效验证的并发系统类。在异步电路领域的应用也在研究中。

Source.Name: Directorate for Computer & Information Science & Engineering

Project.Title: Coping with Stress: Next Generation Approaches to Borrelia burgdorferi Host Adaptation

Title_Other.Title: Coping with Stress: Next Generation Approaches to Borrelia burgdorferi Host Adaptation
应对压力：下一代伯氏疏螺旋体宿主适应途径

Class.ClassName: 高分子物理、高分子物理化学
理论、技术、方法、研究、评价、策略

Project.Abstract: PROJECT SUMMARY Borrelia burgdorferi, the etiologic agent of Lyme borreliosis, is well adapted to its multiple tick and mammalian hosts and, despite a minimalist genome leaving it devoid of many functions, has evolved highly effective mechanisms for evading different host defenses. As a part of survival within such disparate hosts, one common requirement is the ability to neutralize oxidative and nitrosative stress responses. B. burgdorferi have a striking dearth of reactive oxygen species (ROS) and reactive nitrogen species (RNS) detoxification enzymes seen in most bacterial pathogens suggesting that it uses novel mechanisms to evade these defenses. In our preliminary data, we have identified over 30 new genes that appear to be involved in B. burgdorferi resistance to ROS or RNS. Genes were identified by exposure of a transposon library to either ROS or RNS stress followed by sequencing (Tn-seq) to precisely determine the fitness of individual mutants. Identified genes were confirmed using individual mutants and complemented mutants. Mutants in genes identified as having a role in ROS and/or RNS resistance were tested for their infectivity into their natural tick and mouse hosts. We identified multiple mutants with defects in infectivity into mice or ticks. In this proposal, we seek to understand the unique mechanisms used by B. burgdorferi to evade oxidative and nitrosative killing. We are proposing the following 3 Specific Aims. First, in Aim 1, we will assess the role of ROS/RNS responsive proteins of B. burgdorferi for survival during mammalian infection. Using both mutant bacteria and knockout mice devoid of specific components of the ROS/RNS defenses, we will dissect the role of specific genes at different time points in the infectious cycle. We will use in vivo imaging, RNA-seq and quantitative rt-PCR to pinpoint the role of individual genes. Next, in Aim 2, we will assess the role of ROS/RNS responsive proteins of B. burgdorferi for survival in its tick host using similar strategies to Aim 1. Finally, in Aim 3, we will determine how the candidate proteins mediate resistance to ROS. In this Aim we will test the predicted activity of several targeted proteins for their role in detoxification of ROS/RNS. This study represents the first genetic screen to globally assess how B. burgdorferi combats ROS/RNS. Given the importance of this response in host innate immunity, the characterization of these borrelial genes/proteins will provide important insight into the ability of B. burgdorferi to avoid clearance and persist for prolonged periods within the hosts they occupy in nature. Insights into mechanisms by which the organism is able to escape immune mediated killing are likely to have important implications for understanding human Lyme disease.

项目概述：博格多尔菲螺旋体是莱姆博雷氏症的病原，它很好地适应了多种蜱类和哺乳动物宿主，尽管它的基因组极简，缺乏许多功能，但它已经进化出了逃避不同宿主防御的高效机制。作为在这种不同宿主中存活的一部分，一个共同的要求是中和氧化和硝化应激反应的能力。B. burgdorferi在大多数细菌病原体中表现出明显的缺乏活性氧（ROS）和活性氮物种（RNS）解毒酶，这表明它使用新的机制来逃避这些防御。在我们的初步数据中，我们已经鉴定出30多个新基因，这些基因似乎与B.burgdorferi对ROS或RNS的抗性有关。基因的鉴定是通过将转座子文库暴露于ROS或RNS胁迫下，然后进行测序（Tn-seq），以精确确定单个突变体的适合性。利用个别突变体和补充突变体确认已鉴定的基因。在被鉴定为对ROS和/或RNS具有抗性的基因中，突变株被检测其对自然蜱虫和小鼠宿主的感染性。我们鉴定出多个对小鼠或蜱有传染性缺陷的突变体。在这项建议中，我们试图了解B. burgdorferi用来逃避氧化和杀伤性杀伤的独特机制。我们提出以下三个具体目标。首先，在目的1中，我们将评估勃格多尔菲杆菌ROS/RNS反应蛋白在哺乳动物感染期间对生存的作用。利用突变细菌和缺乏ROS/RNS防御特异性成分的敲除小鼠，我们将在感染周期的不同时间点剖析特异性基因的作用。我们将使用活体成像、RNA序列和定量rt-PCR来确定单个基因的作用。下一步，在目的2中，我们将使用与目的1相似的策略来评估布氏杆菌ROS/RNS反应蛋白在其蜱虫宿主存活中的作用。最后，在目的3中，我们将确定候选蛋白如何介导对ROS的抗性。在这一目标中，我们将测试预测活性的几种靶向蛋白在解毒ROS / RNS中的作用。这项研究代表了第一个全球评估B.burgdorferi如何对抗ROS/RNS的基因筛查。鉴于这种应答在宿主先天免疫中的重要性，这些疏螺旋体基因/蛋白质的特性将为研究布尔格多尔菲菌避免清除并在宿主体内长期存活的能力提供重要的线索。深入了解生物体逃避免疫介导的杀戮的机制，可能对理解人类莱姆病有重要意义。

Source.Name: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases

Project.Title: Aeroservothermoelastic Modeling for a Hypersonic Wave Rider Vehicle

Title_Other.Title: 高超声速乘波飞行器气动伺服热弹性模型
Aeroservothermoelastic Modeling for a Hypersonic Wave Rider Vehicle

Project.Abstract: Development of an innovative analysis and software modeling capability is proposed for aeroservothermoelastic evaluation of air-breathing hypersonic wave rider vehicles. The interface of the airframe dynamic vibration modes with highly nonlinear hypersonic flows is modeled using a particle-based material point method (MPM) in an integrated dynamic fluid-structure environment. MPM is essentially a mesh-free method, which avoids dealing with time-varying mesh distortions and boundary variations due to static and dynamic structural deformations, thus being significantly more robust and computationally efficient than other numerical methods and algorithms, such as the finite element method that is currently favored for fluid-structure interaction simulations. Performance is further enhanced by nonlinear model reduction, massive parallelization, in-situ residual monitoring and computational steering. Inclusion of the flight control system gives a complete integrated aeroservothermoelastic capability covering all flight regimes, and accounting for the aeroelastic effects of dynamic shock/structure interactions and TPS/ablation, as well as real gas effects. The FCS will be represented in full nonlinear detail, and model linearization is also proposed to enable the application of conventional FCS design procedures. Phase I is aimed at establishing basic feasibility and an initial capability. Phase II will extend the research into more detailed developments, leading to a full capability.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 提出了一种用于吸气式高超声速乘波飞行器气动伺服热弹性评估的创新分析和软件建模能力。采用基于质点的材料点法（MPM）对具有高度非线性高超音速流动的机身动力振动模态进行了建模。MPM本质上是一种无网格方法，它避免了由于静态和动态结构变形而引起的时变网格畸变和边界变化，因而比其他数值方法和算法具有更高的鲁棒性和计算效率，如目前流体-结构相互作用模拟的有限元方法。通过非线性模型简化、大规模并行化、原位残差监测和计算指导，性能进一步提高。飞行控制系统的包含提供了覆盖所有飞行状态的完整的气动伺服热弹性能力，并考虑了动态冲击/结构相互作用和TPS/烧蚀的气动弹性效应，以及真实的气体效应。FCS将以完全非线性的细节来表示，并且还提出了模型线性化，以便能够应用常规的FCS设计过程。第一阶段旨在建立基本可行性和初步能力。第二阶段将把研究扩展到更详细的发展，从而实现全面能力。

Development of an innovative analysis and software modeling capability is proposed for aeroservothermoelastic evaluation of air-breathing hypersonic wave rider vehicles. The interface of the airframe dynamic vibration modes with highly nonlinear hypersonic flows is modeled using a particle-based material point method (MPM) in an integrated dynamic fluid-structure environment. MPM is essentially a mesh-free method, which avoids dealing with time-varying mesh distortions and boundary variations due to static and dynamic structural deformations, thus being significantly more robust and computationally efficient than other numerical methods and algorithms, such as the finite element method that is currently favored for fluid-structure interaction simulations. Performance is further enhanced by nonlinear model reduction, massive parallelization, in-situ residual monitoring and computational steering. Inclusion of the flight control system gives a complete integrated aeroservothermoelastic capability covering all flight regimes, and accounting for the aeroelastic effects of dynamic shock/structure interactions and TPS/ablation, as well as real gas effects. The FCS will be represented in full nonlinear detail, and model linearization is also proposed to enable the application of conventional FCS design procedures. Phase I is aimed at establishing basic feasibility and an initial capability. Phase II will extend the research into more detailed developments, leading to a full capability.

Source.Name: United States Department of the Air Force

Project.Title: Decision Making in the Federal Judicial Hierarchy

Title_Other.Title: Decision Making in the Federal Judicial Hierarchy
联邦司法体系中的决策

Project.Abstract: Abstract A signature characteristic of the federal judicial system is its hierarchical structure; that structure shapes the goals of the judges within it, and induces concerns about oversight (for lower courts) and compliance (for higher courts). Such factors, in turn, interact with both case- and judge-level influences on decision making. A complete characterization of judicial decision making in the federal system must therefore allow for the influence of case-specific, judge-specific, and hierarchical effects, with the latter considering both "upward-looking" (oversight) and "downward-looking" (compliance) behavior; ideally, such a model must also measure those factors consistently across the three levels of the hierarchy, and allow for the magnitude of those effects to vary across divergent courts. We develop such a model, and analyze its implications through an analysis of the actions of all participating federal judges in each of the lower court proceedings for all cases decided in the U.S. Supreme Court which originated in a federal district court from 1953-2005. By coding data at the various levels of the judicial hierarchy in each case, our approach allows us to examine judicial voting within a given case context, and thereby holds constant the range of case-specific factors that might otherwise influence judicial decisions. In addition, recent advances in generalized hierarchical and mixed models allow for a flexible specification of the interaction of judge- and court-specific influences, including those related to hierarchy effects due to judges' potential concerns with oversight, compliance, or both. Finally, the end result of our data collection will be a comprehensive accounting of every decision made by every federal judge in every case decided by the U.S. Supreme Court over the past five decades; those data will thus offer scholars an unparalleled resource for the study of judges' decisions in the U.S. federal courts.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 摘要联邦司法系统的一个特征是它的等级结构；这种结构决定了内部法官的目标，并引起对监督（下级法院）和遵守（上级法院）的关注。这些因素反过来又与案件和法官层面对决策的影响相互作用。因此，联邦系统中司法决策的完整特征必须考虑到特定案件、特定法官和等级效应的影响，后者同时考虑“向上看”（监督）和“向下看”（合规）行为；理想情况下，这样一个模型还必须在三个层次上始终如一地衡量这些因素，并允许这些影响的程度在不同的法院之间有所不同。我们开发了这样一个模型，并通过分析所有参与的联邦法官对1953-2005年在联邦地区法院成立的美国最高法院判决的所有案件在下级法院诉讼中的行为来分析其影响。通过对每个案件中各级司法层级的数据进行编码，我们的方法允许我们在给定的案件背景下检查司法投票，从而保持可能影响司法判决的特定案件因素的范围不变。此外，广义等级和混合模型的最新进展允许灵活地说明法官和法院的具体影响之间的相互作用，包括由于法官对监督、遵守或两者都有潜在的关注而产生的等级效应。最后，我们收集数据的最终结果将是对过去50年来美国最高法院判决的每一个案件中每一位联邦法官作出的每一项判决进行全面的说明；因此，这些数据将为学者们研究美国联邦法院法官的判决提供无与伦比的资源。

Abstract A signature characteristic of the federal judicial system is its hierarchical structure; that structure shapes the goals of the judges within it, and induces concerns about oversight (for lower courts) and compliance (for higher courts). Such factors, in turn, interact with both case- and judge-level influences on decision making. A complete characterization of judicial decision making in the federal system must therefore allow for the influence of case-specific, judge-specific, and hierarchical effects, with the latter considering both "upward-looking" (oversight) and "downward-looking" (compliance) behavior; ideally, such a model must also measure those factors consistently across the three levels of the hierarchy, and allow for the magnitude of those effects to vary across divergent courts. We develop such a model, and analyze its implications through an analysis of the actions of all participating federal judges in each of the lower court proceedings for all cases decided in the U.S. Supreme Court which originated in a federal district court from 1953-2005. By coding data at the various levels of the judicial hierarchy in each case, our approach allows us to examine judicial voting within a given case context, and thereby holds constant the range of case-specific factors that might otherwise influence judicial decisions. In addition, recent advances in generalized hierarchical and mixed models allow for a flexible specification of the interaction of judge- and court-specific influences, including those related to hierarchy effects due to judges' potential concerns with oversight, compliance, or both. Finally, the end result of our data collection will be a comprehensive accounting of every decision made by every federal judge in every case decided by the U.S. Supreme Court over the past five decades; those data will thus offer scholars an unparalleled resource for the study of judges' decisions in the U.S. federal courts.

Source.Name: Directorate for Social, Behavioral & Economic Sciences

Project.Title: Ephrin B reverse signaling in endothelian cells

Title_Other.Title: 内皮细胞中的肾上腺素B逆向信号转导
Ephrin B reverse signaling in endothelian cells

Class.ClassName: 科学研究组织、科学研究管理

Project.Abstract: DESCRIPTION (provided by applicant): Angiogenesis is a multi-step process requiring signals to induce endothelial cell proliferation, migration, and assembly. The Eph receptor tyrosine kinases (RTKs) and their ligands, ephrins, are important mediators of endothelial cell migration and attachment. As membrane tethered ligands, ephrins are capable of transmitting signals bi-directionally. Previous studies from our laboratory have shown that ephrin-B1 is activated by a soluble form of the EphB1-Fc receptor which lacks a cytoplasmic domain and thus is incapable of transmitting forward signals. In addition, soluble EphB1-Fc stimulation of endothelial cells induces cell migration, attachment, and in vivo angiogenesis. These cellular changes require the PDZ binding domain of ephrin B1. Based on these data, we hypothesize that (1) ephrin-B1 reverse signaling is mediated by PDZ adapter proteins through which downstream signaling pathways are activated, and (2) internalization of surface ephrin-B1 represents a mechanism by which ephrin-B1-mediated reverse signaling is regulated. To test these hypotheses, we propose to investigate signaling components downstream of ephrin-B1 by identifying ephrin B1 adapter proteins and pathways that transduce signals affecting endothelial cell migration and adhesion. We will also determine the role of ephrin-B1 internalization in regulating ehrin B1 activation and signal transduction.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 描述（由申请人提供）：血管生成是一个多步骤的过程，需要信号来诱导内皮细胞增殖、迁移和组装。Eph受体酪氨酸激酶（RTKs）及其配体肾上腺素是内皮细胞迁移和粘附的重要介质。作为膜系配体，肾上腺素具有双向传递信号的能力。我们实验室以前的研究表明，ephrin-B1被缺乏胞质结构域的可溶性EphB1-Fc受体激活，因此不能传递正向信号。此外，可溶性EphB1-Fc刺激内皮细胞可诱导细胞迁移、附着和体内血管生成。这些细胞变化需要ephrin B1的PDZ结合域。基于这些数据，我们假设：（1）ephrin-B1反向信号传导是由PDZ转接器蛋白介导的，下游信号传导途径通过PDZ转接器蛋白被激活；（2）表面ephrin-B1的内化是ephrin-B1介导的反向信号传导的调控机制。为了验证这些假设，我们建议通过识别ephrin-B1受体蛋白和转导信号影响内皮细胞迁移和粘附的途径，研究ephrin-B1下游的信号成分。我们还将确定ephrin-B1内化在调节ehrin-B1激活和信号转导中的作用。

DESCRIPTION (provided by applicant): Angiogenesis is a multi-step process requiring signals to induce endothelial cell proliferation, migration, and assembly. The Eph receptor tyrosine kinases (RTKs) and their ligands, ephrins, are important mediators of endothelial cell migration and attachment. As membrane tethered ligands, ephrins are capable of transmitting signals bi-directionally. Previous studies from our laboratory have shown that ephrin-B1 is activated by a soluble form of the EphB1-Fc receptor which lacks a cytoplasmic domain and thus is incapable of transmitting forward signals. In addition, soluble EphB1-Fc stimulation of endothelial cells induces cell migration, attachment, and in vivo angiogenesis. These cellular changes require the PDZ binding domain of ephrin B1. Based on these data, we hypothesize that (1) ephrin-B1 reverse signaling is mediated by PDZ adapter proteins through which downstream signaling pathways are activated, and (2) internalization of surface ephrin-B1 represents a mechanism by which ephrin-B1-mediated reverse signaling is regulated. To test these hypotheses, we propose to investigate signaling components downstream of ephrin-B1 by identifying ephrin B1 adapter proteins and pathways that transduce signals affecting endothelial cell migration and adhesion. We will also determine the role of ephrin-B1 internalization in regulating ehrin B1 activation and signal transduction.

Project.Title: Expression and Regulation of the B-pancreatic Islet Cell Glucose Transporter

Title_Other.Title: 胰岛B细胞葡萄糖转运蛋白的表达及调控
Expression and Regulation of the B-pancreatic Islet Cell Glucose Transporter

Project.Title: Development of X-Ray Diffraction Techniques to Study Diffusion in Single Crystal and Polycrystalline Composites

Title_Other.Title: Development of X-Ray Diffraction Techniques to Study Diffusion in Single Crystal and Polycrystalline Composites
单晶和多晶复合材料中扩散的X射线衍射研究进展

Project.Title: THE DAZ GENES AND EARLY GERM CELL DEVELOPMENT

Title_Other.Title: THE DAZ GENES AND EARLY GERM CELL DEVELOPMENT
DAZ基因与早期生殖细胞发育

Project.Abstract: Nearly five percent of men have defects in sperm production but are otherwise healthy. Our previous work led to identification of a common genetic cause of infertility in men, de novo deletions of the DAZ (Deleted in AZoospermia) region of the Y chromosome. Within this region, we identified a cluster of nearly-identical DAZ genes. Several lines of evidence suggest that this gene family is required for germ cell allocation or proliferation and maintenance of early germ cell populations. First, the protein expression pattern suggests an early function for DAZ and an autosomal homolog, DAZL, in all descendants of the germ lineage. Second, although men with deletions of the DAZ gene cluster produce very few sperm, those they do make are morphologically and physiologically normal which suggests DAZ-deleted men have a premeiotic defect in sperm production rather than a defect in spermiogenesis. Third, disruption of the DAZ gene homolog in mice causes infertility in both sexes and depletion of germ cells prenatally, well before meiosis. Finally, the Xenopus homolog of DAZ, X-Dazl, is expressed in the germ plasm, a region of the developing embryo that gives rise to the germ lineage in this organism. This investigation will use biochemical, genetic and molecular biological strategies to elucidate the mechanism by which the DAZ gene family insures that allocation or maintenance and proliferation of early germ cell populations occurs. Specifically, our aims over the next five years are to: 1) Identify and characterize the genes that encode protein(s) that interact with DAZ-protein, 2) identify and characterize the genes that encode RNA substrate(s) that interact with DAZ protein, and 3) identify and characterize other genes, with the same distinctive pattern of expression as exhibited by members of the DAZ gene family, using testicular biopsy tissues from men with different spermatogenic arrest phenotypes.

This investigation will use biochemical, genetic and molecular biological strategies to elucidate the mechanism by which the DAZ gene family insures that allocation or maintenance and proliferation of early germ cell populations occurs. Specifically, our aims over the next five years are to: 1) Identify and characterize the genes that encode protein(s) that interact with DAZ-protein, 2) identify and characterize the genes that encode RNA substrate(s) that interact with DAZ protein, and 3) identify and characterize other genes, with the same distinctive pattern of expression as exhibited by members of the DAZ gene family, using testicular biopsy tissues from men with different spermatogenic arrest phenotypes.

近百分之五的男性有精子产生缺陷，但在其他方面是健康的。我们先前的研究发现了男性不育的一个共同的遗传原因，即Y染色体DAZ（在无精子症中缺失）区域的从头缺失。在这个区域内，我们发现了一组几乎相同的DAZ基因。一些证据表明，这个基因家族是生殖细胞分配、增殖和维持早期生殖细胞种群所必需的。首先，蛋白质表达模式表明，在所有生殖系后代中，DAZ和常染色体同源物DAZL具有早期功能。第二，虽然DAZ基因簇缺失的男性产生的精子很少，但他们产生的精子在形态学和生理学上都是正常的，这表明DAZ缺失的男性在精子产生方面有先天性缺陷，而不是精子形成方面的缺陷。第三，在小鼠中，DAZ基因同源物的破坏会导致两性不育，并在减数分裂前造成生殖细胞的损耗。最后，非洲爪蟾DAZ的同源物X-Dazl在胚质中表达，胚质是发育中胚胎的一个区域，产生了该生物体的生殖系。本研究将利用生物化学、遗传和分子生物学策略来阐明DAZ基因家族确保早期生殖细胞种群分配、维持和增殖的机制。具体来说，我们在未来五年的目标是：1）识别和表征与DAZ蛋白相互作用的编码蛋白质的基因，2）识别和表征与DAZ蛋白相互作用的RNA底物的基因，3）识别和表征其他基因，与DAZ基因家族成员相同的独特表达模式，使用来自不同生精停止表型男性的睾丸活检组织。

Source.Name: National Institute of Child Health and Human Development

Project.Title: Young Carers: Social policy impacts of the caring responsibilities of children and young adults

Title_Other.Title: 青年照料者：儿童和青年人照管责任的社会政策影响
Young Carers: Social policy impacts of the caring responsibilities of children and young adults

Class.ClassName: 控制论（数学）、信息论（数学）

Project.Abstract: This project is a unique collaboration between university researchers, eight government agencies in NSW and South Australia and two Carers Associations, using innovative methods to inform policy development. The project will focus on the costs to young carers (their education, training, employment, social activities, health and wellbeing); benefits of the care relationship to families and to government through savings on formal services; and the social policy frameworks. It will provide a comprehensive audit of policies and services for young carers and care recipients, and identify gaps for future policy development.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 该项目是大学研究人员、新南威尔士州和南澳大利亚州的八个政府机构以及两个护理协会之间的独特合作，利用创新方法为政策制定提供信息。该项目将侧重于年轻护理人员的费用（他们的教育、培训、就业、社会活动、健康和福利）；通过节省正规服务而使护理关系对家庭和政府产生的惠益；以及社会政策框架。它将对年轻的护理人员和受护理者的政策和服务进行全面审计，并查明未来政策发展的差距。

This project is a unique collaboration between university researchers, eight government agencies in NSW and South Australia and two Carers Associations, using innovative methods to inform policy development. The project will focus on the costs to young carers (their education, training, employment, social activities, health and wellbeing); benefits of the care relationship to families and to government through savings on formal services; and the social policy frameworks. It will provide a comprehensive audit of policies and services for young carers and care recipients, and identify gaps for future policy development.

Project.Title: Multi-scale modeling of corrosion fatigue damage using peridynamics theory

Title_Other.Title: 腐蚀疲劳损伤的多尺度模拟
Multi-scale modeling of corrosion fatigue damage using peridynamics theory

Class.ClassName: 金属腐蚀、金属表面处理

Project.Abstract: The overall objective of this effort is to identify, and validate a suitable methodology and the associated multi-scale computational technique for predictive assessment of corrosion fatigue damage in Naval aircraft. Annual costs for corrosion inspection and repair of military aircraft are estimated to exceed $1B. Predictive modeling of corrosion fatigue damage is challenging since it has to capture the interactions between cyclic loading and electrochemistry across disparate time and length scales. Several approaches ranging from atomistic Molecular Dynamics, kinetic Monte Carlo, and Density Functional Theory to continuum mass transport were reported. However, the coupling of these methods to address multi-scale nature of corrosion problem has fundamental problems and requires intensive computational resources and time requirements. CFDRC teamed with Sandia National Laboratories in this STTR project to develop alternative multi-scale computational technology using peridynamics theory for predicting assessment of corrosion fatigue damage from the first principles. Key chemical reactions in proposed technology will be modeled using ab initio-based ReaxFF approach introduced by Prof. van Duin. During Phase I, we will (1) assemble preliminary software and (2) demonstrate the feasibility of our software for selected case studies. The Phase II work will produce the final software implemented in a continuum code and a library of demonstration and validation cases for damage prediction in simulated service conditions.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 这项工作的总体目标是确定和验证一种适用于海军飞机腐蚀疲劳损伤预测评估的方法和相关的多尺度计算技术。军用飞机腐蚀检测和维修的年成本估计超过10亿美元。腐蚀疲劳损伤的预测建模具有挑战性，因为它必须在不同的时间和长度尺度上捕捉循环载荷和电化学之间的相互作用。从原子分子动力学、动力学Monte Carlo和密度泛函理论到连续介质质量输运等方法都有报道。然而，这些方法的耦合处理腐蚀问题的多尺度性质具有根本性的问题，需要大量的计算资源和时间要求。在这个STTR项目中，CFDRC与Sandia国家实验室合作，利用围动力学理论开发替代性多尺度计算技术，从第一原理预测腐蚀疲劳损伤评估。该技术中的关键化学反应将使用van Duin教授介绍的基于从头算的ReaxFF方法进行建模。在第一阶段，我们将（1）组装初步软件，（2）证明我们的软件用于选定案例研究的可行性。第二阶段的工作将产生最终的软件，以连续代码和示范和验证案例库的形式实现，用于模拟使用条件下的损伤预测。

The overall objective of this effort is to identify, and validate a suitable methodology and the associated multi-scale computational technique for predictive assessment of corrosion fatigue damage in Naval aircraft. Annual costs for corrosion inspection and repair of military aircraft are estimated to exceed $1B. Predictive modeling of corrosion fatigue damage is challenging since it has to capture the interactions between cyclic loading and electrochemistry across disparate time and length scales. Several approaches ranging from atomistic Molecular Dynamics, kinetic Monte Carlo, and Density Functional Theory to continuum mass transport were reported. However, the coupling of these methods to address multi-scale nature of corrosion problem has fundamental problems and requires intensive computational resources and time requirements. CFDRC teamed with Sandia National Laboratories in this STTR project to develop alternative multi-scale computational technology using peridynamics theory for predicting assessment of corrosion fatigue damage from the first principles. Key chemical reactions in proposed technology will be modeled using ab initio-based ReaxFF approach introduced by Prof. van Duin. During Phase I, we will (1) assemble preliminary software and (2) demonstrate the feasibility of our software for selected case studies. The Phase II work will produce the final software implemented in a continuum code and a library of demonstration and validation cases for damage prediction in simulated service conditions.

Project.Title: Mode estimation and geoacoustic inversion in shallow water

Title_Other.Title: 浅海模式估计与地声反演
Mode estimation and geoacoustic inversion in shallow water

Project.Abstract: The ONR has organized the Seabed Characterization Experiment (SBCEX) in March 2017. This experiment took place on the New England Mud patch, which is known for complex geology and oceanography. In particular, the first layer of the seabed is mainly composed of fine-grained sediments (i.e. mud). Because acoustic propagation is poorly understood into fine-grained sediments, it is important to understand the physics driving the seabed propagation (direct problem), to estimate the seabed properties and quantify uncertainties (inverse problem), and to assess performances of the proposed methods. The proposed project focuses on low frequencies (0-500 Hz) where propagation is onveniently described by modal theory. In this context, the acoustic field is interpreted as the sum of several modal components, with each mode propagating dispersivelythrough an ocean waveguide. The main objectives of the projects are 1) developing new signal processing methods that would benefit the whole SBCEX group and 2) estimating the seabed properties, quantifying the uncertainty,and assessing performance of the proposed methods. More specifically, the project will develop signal processing methods allowing mode estimation when the source is an impulsive signal, a frequency modulated chirp or a continuous narrowband tone (task 1). Estimated modes will subsequently be used to infer the mud geoacoustic parameters (task 2), and uncertainties will be quantified using Bayesian methodology. Inversion results will be compared in order to make recommendation for future low-frequency inversion experiments (task 3). Last but not least, the opportunities provided by novel autonomous marine platforms (AUVs, gliders) will be studied (task 4).

This experiment took place on the New England Mud patch, which is known for complex geology and oceanography. In particular, the first layer of the seabed is mainly composed of fine-grained sediments (i.e. mud). Because acoustic propagation is poorly understood into fine-grained sediments, it is important to understand the physics driving the seabed propagation (direct problem), to estimate the seabed properties and quantify uncertainties (inverse problem), and to assess performances of the proposed methods. The proposed project focuses on low frequencies (0-500 Hz) where propagation is onveniently described by modal theory. In this context, the acoustic field is interpreted as the sum of several modal components, with each mode propagating dispersivelythrough an ocean waveguide. The main objectives of the projects are 1) developing new signal processing methods that would benefit the whole SBCEX group and 2) estimating the seabed properties, quantifying the uncertainty,and assessing performance of the proposed methods. More specifically, the project will develop signal processing methods allowing mode estimation when the source is an impulsive signal, a frequency modulated chirp or a continuous narrowband tone (task 1). Estimated modes will subsequently be used to infer the mud geoacoustic parameters (task 2), and uncertainties will be quantified using Bayesian methodology. Inversion results will be compared in order to make recommendation for future low-frequency inversion experiments (task 3). Last but not least, the opportunities provided by novel autonomous marine platforms (AUVs, gliders) will be studied (task 4).

ONR于2017年3月组织了海底特征实验（SBCEX）。这项实验是在以复杂地质和海洋学闻名的新英格兰泥地上进行的。特别是，海床的第一层主要由细粒沉积物（即泥浆）组成。由于人们对细颗粒沉积物中的声波传播知之甚少，因此了解驱动海底传播的物理（直接问题）、估计海底特性和量化不确定性（反问题）以及评估所提出方法的性能非常重要。该项目主要关注低频（0-500hz），其中传播被模态理论充分描述。在这种情况下，声场被解释为几个模态分量的总和，每个模态在海洋波导中传播色散。这些项目的主要目标是：1）开发有利于整个SBCEX小组的新的信号处理方法；2）估计海底特性，量化不确定性，并评估所提出方法的性能。更具体地说，该项目将开发信号处理方法，允许在源是脉冲信号、调频啁啾或连续窄带音调时进行模式估计（任务1）。估计模式随后将用于推断泥浆地质声学参数（任务2），不确定性将使用贝叶斯方法量化。将比较反演结果，以便为将来的低频反演实验提供建议（任务3）。最后但并非最不重要的是，将研究新型自主海洋平台（AUV、滑翔机）提供的机会（任务4）。

Project.Title: RI: Small: Collaborative Research: On-Line Learning Algorithms for Path Experts with Non-Additive Losses

Title_Other.Title: RI:Small:协作研究：非加性损失路径专家的在线学习算法
RI: Small: Collaborative Research: On-Line Learning Algorithms for Path Experts with Non-Additive Losses

Class.ClassName: 文字信息处理、文字信息处理系统
控制论（数学）、信息论（数学）

Project.Abstract: On-line learning algorithms are increasingly adopted as the key solution to modern learning applications with very large data sets of several hundred million or billion points. These algorithms process one sample at a time with an update per iteration that is typically computationally cheap and easy to implement. Additionally, these algorithms benefit from a rich theoretical foundation. The objective of this research is to advance on-line learning by broadening its applicability to a variety of applications including machine translation, speech recognition, other natural language processing applications, handwriting recognition, computer vision, bioinformatics, and many other areas which can benefit the society. Expert skills and student talent will be combined to create effective theoretical and algorithmic solutions and open-source software tools tested experimentally that can benefit a wide community. Most learning problems admit some structure. In such problems, experts can be viewed as paths in a directed graph with each edge corresponding to a sub-structure corresponding to a word, phoneme, character, or image patch. Current on-line algorithms with path experts are limited to additive losses and therefore are not applicable in many important applications where the loss is non-additive. We will create the theoretical foundation for designing efficient on-line algorithms for learning with path experts with non-additive losses. Such non-additive losses are the relevant loss functions in most important applications such as machine translation, speech recognition, pronunciation modeling, parsing, image processing and other areas. Carefully designed weighted automata and semiring tools will be used to devise on-line algorithms for path experts with non-additive losses. The theoretical analysis of the algorithms will be complemented by a thorough experimental evaluation in a variety of applications.

These algorithms process one sample at a time with an update per iteration that is typically computationally cheap and easy to implement. Additionally, these algorithms benefit from a rich theoretical foundation. The objective of this research is to advance on-line learning by broadening its applicability to a variety of applications including machine translation, speech recognition, other natural language processing applications, handwriting recognition, computer vision, bioinformatics, and many other areas which can benefit the society. Expert skills and student talent will be combined to create effective theoretical and algorithmic solutions and open-source software tools tested experimentally that can benefit a wide community. Most learning problems admit some structure. In such problems, experts can be viewed as paths in a directed graph with each edge corresponding to a sub-structure corresponding to a word, phoneme, character, or image patch.
