We will create the theoretical foundation for designing efficient on-line algorithms for learning with path experts with non-additive losses. Such non-additive losses are the relevant loss functions in most important applications such as machine translation, speech recognition, pronunciation modeling, parsing, image processing and other areas. Carefully designed weighted automata and semiring tools will be used to devise on-line algorithms for path experts with non-additive losses. The theoretical analysis of the algorithms will be complemented by a thorough experimental evaluation in a variety of applications.

在线学习算法作为现代学习应用的关键解决方案，越来越多地被采用，其数据集非常庞大，可达数亿或十亿个点。这些算法一次处理一个样本，每次迭代更新一次，通常计算成本低，易于实现。此外，这些算法受益于丰富的理论基础。这项研究的目的是通过扩大在线学习的适用范围，将其扩展到各种应用，包括机器翻译、语音识别、其他自然语言处理应用、手写识别、计算机视觉、生物信息学和许多其他有益于社会的领域。专家技能和学生才能将结合起来，创造出有效的理论和算法解决方案，并对开源软件工具进行实验测试，以造福广大社区。大多数学习问题都有一定的结构。在这样的问题中，专家可以被视为有向图中的路径，每个边对应于对应于单词、音素、字符或图像块的子结构。现有的带有路径专家的在线算法仅限于加性损失，因此不适用于许多非加性损失的重要应用。我们将为设计具有非加性损失的路径专家的高效在线学习算法奠定理论基础。在机器翻译、语音识别、语音建模、句法分析、图像处理等领域，这种非加性损失是相关损失函数。精心设计的加权自动机和半环工具将用于为具有非加性损失的路径专家设计在线算法。这些算法的理论分析将辅之以各种应用中的彻底实验评估。

Source.Name: Directorate for Computer & Information Science & Engineering

Project.Title: International Symposium on Aviation Psychology: May 7-10, 2019 in Dayton, Ohio

Title_Other.Title: 国际航空心理学研讨会：2019年5月7-10日，俄亥俄州代顿
International Symposium on Aviation Psychology: May 7-10, 2019 in Dayton, Ohio

Project.Abstract: The 20th International Symposium on Aviation Psychology (ISAP) will be held May 7-10, 2019 in Dayton, Ohio. ISAP is a forum to present the latest research on human performance problems and opportunities within aviation, envision design solutions that best use human capabilities in safe and efficient aviation systems, and bring together scientists and operators to bridge the gap between research and application. The symposium encourages researchers to focus basic research on applied needs. The knowledge generated would not be limited to aviation applications. For example, principles of perceptual representations that could guide cockpit display designs should also apply to displays for spaceships, automobiles, nuclear power plants, and other interactive control displays. The symposium covers basic research issues on cognition, perception, and neuroscience. These topics are studied in the context of cognitive systems, human-system integration, display and visualization, training and simulation, automated and autonomous systems, personnel selection, and sociotechnical system effectiveness, as applied to aviation systems on the ground, in the sky, and in space. One common approach to reduce the often significant time lag between discovery and application is to allow practical needs to inform basic research priorities. In contrast, the philosophy of ISAP is that meaningful dialogues between researchers and practitioners are key to advancing knowledge and putting knowledge to practical use. In two companion ISAP plenary panel sessions, practitioners (e.g., pilots, air traffic controllers, maintenance personnel) present the critical safety issues that they face and researchers present the latest scientific and technological approaches to achieving solutions. These sessions are in addition to three invited plenary speakers purposely selected from different scientific disciplines and pertinent aviation domains. Over the course of the symposium, researchers will have the opportunity to present their latest scientific, engineering, or methodological work in either a spoken or a poster session. ISAP also places a special emphasis on fostering student involvement by conducting a Best Student Paper Competition. This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 第20届国际航空心理学研讨会（ISAP）将于2019年5月7日至10日在俄亥俄州代顿举行。ISAP是一个论坛，旨在介绍有关航空领域人的表现问题和机遇的最新研究，设想在安全高效的航空系统中最佳利用人的能力的设计解决方案，并召集科学家和运营商来弥合研究与应用之间的差距。研讨会鼓励研究人员将基础研究的重点放在应用需求上。所产生的知识将不限于航空应用。例如，可以指导驾驶舱显示器设计的感知表示原理也应适用于宇宙飞船、汽车、核电站和其他交互式控制显示器。研讨会涵盖了认知、知觉和神经科学的基础研究问题。这些主题是在认知系统、人类系统集成、显示和可视化、训练和仿真、自动化和自主系统、人员选择和社会技术系统有效性的背景下研究的，应用于地面、空中和空间的航空系统。一种减少发现和应用之间的时间差的常见方法是允许实际需要告知基础研究优先事项。相反，ISAP的理念是，研究者和实践者之间有意义的对话是推进知识和将知识付诸实践的关键。在国际会计准则专家组的两次全体会议上，从业人员（例如飞行员、空中交通管制员、维修人员）介绍了他们面临的关键安全问题，研究人员介绍了实现解决方案的最新科学和技术方法。除了这些会议之外，还特意从不同的科学学科和相关的航空领域挑选了三位受邀的全体发言者。在研讨会期间，研究人员将有机会通过演讲或海报展示他们最新的科学、工程或方法学工作。ISAP还特别强调通过举办最佳学生论文竞赛来培养学生的参与度。该奖项反映了NSF的法定使命，通过使用基金会的知识价值和更广泛的影响审查标准进行评估，被认为值得支持。

Source.Name: Directorate for Social, Behavioral & Economic Sciences

Project.Title: The role of phosphatase non-receptor type 22 (PTPN22) in atherosclerosis

Title_Other.Title: 磷酸酶非受体22（PTPN22）在动脉粥样硬化中的作用
The role of phosphatase non-receptor type 22 (PTPN22) in atherosclerosis

Project.Abstract: Inflammation and foam cell formation are key elements of atherosclerosis. Macrophages play a major role in both processes, but the mechanisms regulating their involvement are incompletely understood. Toll-like receptors (TLR) are central for macrophage function; they sense pathogens and in response induce two main signaling pathways: (1) activation of the pro-inflammatory transcription factor NF-kappaB, leading to production of inflammatory cytokines, and (2) activation of transcription factors of the Interferon Regulatory Factor (IRF) family, leading to production of type 1 interferon (T1-IFN). Recently, we identified PTPN22 as a selective promoter of IRF-T1-IFN axis in macrophages. TLR signaling in general and T1-IFN specifically are tightly linked to atherosclerosis. Therefore I propose here that PTPN22 may control macrophage involvement in the inflammatory and metabolic events leading to atherosclerosis. To test this hypothesis I will pursue 3 specific aims: 1. To determine PTPN22 contribution to macrophage inflammatory response. We will use macrophages from Ptpn22-null mice, or human macrophages with PTPN22 inactivated in vitro, or macrophages from donors carrying PTPN22 polymorphism, and examine the effect of PTPN22 deficiency on expression and production of immune mediators following TLR stimulation, including NF-kB-dependent inflammatory cytokines and T1-IFN and T1-IFN-dependent genes; 2. To determine PTPN22 role in foam cell formation. We will use Ldlr-null mice transplanted with either wild-type or Ptpn22-null bone marrow and fed Western diet to elicit their peritoneal macrophages and evaluate foam cell formation, lipid content and expression of genes related to cholesterol regulation. 3. To examine the effect of PTPN22 deficiency in mouse models of atherosclerosis. We will use Ptnp22/Apoe double knockout mice and Apoe-null mice to compare their aortic lesion area and macrophage accumulation. Achieving these aims will lead to elucidating the role of PTPN22 in macrophage inflammatory response, foam cell formation and development of atherosclerosis. It will provide significant insight into the mechanisms behind the TLR contribution to atherosclerosis, thus opening new therapeutic avenues to combat this disease.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 炎症和泡沫细胞的形成是动脉粥样硬化的关键因素。巨噬细胞在这两个过程中都起着重要作用，但其参与的调节机制尚不完全清楚。Toll样受体（Toll-like receptors，TLR）是巨噬细胞功能的中枢，它们能感应病原体并诱导两种主要的信号通路：（1）激活促炎性转录因子NF-kappaB，从而产生炎性细胞因子；（2）激活干扰素调节因子（Interferon Regulatory factor，IRF）家族的转录因子，导致产生1型干扰素（T1-IFN）。最近，我们鉴定了PTPN22作为巨噬细胞中IRF -T1-IFN轴的选择性启动子。TLR信号和T1-IFN与动脉粥样硬化密切相关。因此，我认为PTPN22可能控制巨噬细胞参与导致动脉粥样硬化的炎症和代谢事件。为了验证这一假设，我将追求三个具体目标：1。确定PTPN22对巨噬细胞炎症反应的贡献。我们将使用来自Ptpn22缺失小鼠的巨噬细胞，或体外失活的人巨噬细胞，或来自携带Ptpn22多态性的供体的巨噬细胞，并在TLR刺激后检查Ptpn22缺乏对免疫介质表达和产生的影响，包括NF-kB依赖性炎性细胞因子和T1-IFN、T1-IFN依赖性基因。确定PTPN22在泡沫细胞形成中的作用。我们将用野生型或Ptpn22骨髓移植的低密度脂蛋白受体（Ldlr）缺失小鼠，饲喂西餐，诱导其腹腔巨噬细胞，并评估泡沫细胞的形成、脂质含量和胆固醇调节相关基因的表达。三。探讨PTPN22缺乏对动脉粥样硬化小鼠模型的影响。我们将用Ptnp22/Apoe双基因敲除小鼠和Apoe阴性小鼠比较其主动脉病变面积和巨噬细胞聚集情况。达到这些目的将有助于阐明PTPN22在巨噬细胞炎症反应、泡沫细胞形成和动脉粥样硬化形成中的作用。这将为TLR对动脉粥样硬化的作用机制提供重要的见解，从而为防治该病开辟新的治疗途径。

Inflammation and foam cell formation are key elements of atherosclerosis. Macrophages play a major role in both processes, but the mechanisms regulating their involvement are incompletely understood. Toll-like receptors (TLR) are central for macrophage function; they sense pathogens and in response induce two main signaling pathways: (1) activation of the pro-inflammatory transcription factor NF-kappaB, leading to production of inflammatory cytokines, and (2) activation of transcription factors of the Interferon Regulatory Factor (IRF) family, leading to production of type 1 interferon (T1-IFN). Recently, we identified PTPN22 as a selective promoter of IRF-T1-IFN axis in macrophages. TLR signaling in general and T1-IFN specifically are tightly linked to atherosclerosis. Therefore I propose here that PTPN22 may control macrophage involvement in the inflammatory and metabolic events leading to atherosclerosis. To test this hypothesis I will pursue 3 specific aims: 1. To determine PTPN22 contribution to macrophage inflammatory response. We will use macrophages from Ptpn22-null mice, or human macrophages with PTPN22 inactivated in vitro, or macrophages from donors carrying PTPN22 polymorphism, and examine the effect of PTPN22 deficiency on expression and production of immune mediators following TLR stimulation, including NF-kB-dependent inflammatory cytokines and T1-IFN and T1-IFN-dependent genes; 2. To determine PTPN22 role in foam cell formation. We will use Ldlr-null mice transplanted with either wild-type or Ptpn22-null bone marrow and fed Western diet to elicit their peritoneal macrophages and evaluate foam cell formation, lipid content and expression of genes related to cholesterol regulation. 3. To examine the effect of PTPN22 deficiency in mouse models of atherosclerosis. We will use Ptnp22/Apoe double knockout mice and Apoe-null mice to compare their aortic lesion area and macrophage accumulation. Achieving these aims will lead to elucidating the role of PTPN22 in macrophage inflammatory response, foam cell formation and development of atherosclerosis. It will provide significant insight into the mechanisms behind the TLR contribution to atherosclerosis, thus opening new therapeutic avenues to combat this disease.

Project.Title: Typechecking for PCN

Title_Other.Title: Typechecking for PCN
PCN类型检查

Project.Abstract: This award is to support a postdoctoral associate to work in experimental computer science. The associate, Michael Fagen, will work with Dr. Robert Cartwright on problems involving compilers for parallel languages. The research involves using type information to aid the programmer and to allow efficient compilation. The original research was done with functional sequential languages. The proposed research will be to extend these results to imperative parallel programming languages. In particular, the Program Composition Notation (PCN) language will be used as a testbed for the postdoctoral associate's ideas of migrating soft typing from the sequential functional domain to the parallel domain.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 这个奖项是为了支持博士后在实验计算机科学领域的工作。他的助手迈克尔·法根（Michael Fagen）将与罗伯特·卡特赖特（Robert Cartwright）博士一起研究涉及并行语言编译器的问题。这项研究包括使用类型信息来帮助程序员并允许高效的编译。最初的研究是用函数序列语言进行的。拟议的研究将把这些结果扩展到命令式并行编程语言。特别是，程序组合符号（PCN）语言将被用作博士后助理将软类型从顺序功能域迁移到并行域的思想的试验台。

This award is to support a postdoctoral associate to work in experimental computer science. The associate, Michael Fagen, will work with Dr. Robert Cartwright on problems involving compilers for parallel languages. The research involves using type information to aid the programmer and to allow efficient compilation. The original research was done with functional sequential languages. The proposed research will be to extend these results to imperative parallel programming languages. In particular, the Program Composition Notation (PCN) language will be used as a testbed for the postdoctoral associate's ideas of migrating soft typing from the sequential functional domain to the parallel domain.

Project.Title: Omega-3 tablets

Title_Other.Title: Omega-3 tablets
欧米茄-3片

Class.ClassName: 高分子物理、高分子物理化学

Project.Abstract: Doktogradsarbeidet concerns formulation, preparation and characterization of an omega-3 based powder for use in food supplements tablets, as well as optimization of the resulting tablets. Omega-3 are sold in the form of pure oil, softgel capsules elle r powder. Omega-3 tablets is not currently on the market, either as supplements or pharmaceutical composition. Existing omega-3 powders are primarily targeting the functional food, and beta essentially of microencapsulated fish oil. Mikroin nkapslingen making of powder, tablets feasible since it will leak oil during tabletting. Omegatri AS has since 2008 worked on developing an omega-3 powder where omega-3 fatty acids are absorbed into a carbohydrate based carrier at the molecular level, and how concurrently fatty acids are protected from oxidation. Tabletting of powder requires first and foremost that the powder compressable and that it flows well. Efforts to develop a directly compressible powder was begun in the candidate's thesis: Preparation and coating of stacking Omega-3 containing tablets. In his doctoral dissertation, this technology will be further developed, which includes increasing the omega-3 concentration, test different omega-3 concentrates and to ensure that the product stays fresh throughout the pros essen when it is prepared, mixed, screened and run in the tableting machine. It is further planned studies regarding the bioavailability of omega-3 from powder or tablets adjacent to PhD. Candidate role in this will be preparation of custom T powder, design and preparation of tablets, as well as machining and interpretation of data. The final step in the creation of a commercialized omega-3 supplements in tablet form, the upscaling of production processes from the laboratory scale to the production scale. There in nnbefatter also establishing standards for intermediate and final products, and the establishment and further development of methods for quality control of these standards.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: doktogradsarbidet涉及用于食品补充剂片剂的omega-3基粉末的配方、制备和表征，以及所得片剂的优化。 欧米茄-3以纯油、软胶囊、elle r粉末的形式出售。欧米茄-3片目前还没有上市，无论是作为补充剂还是药物成分。现有的omega-3粉末主要针对功能性食品，β主要是微囊化鱼油。米可林是制作粉剂、片剂的可行方法，因为它在压片过程中会漏油。自2008年以来，欧米茄公司一直致力于开发一种欧米茄-3粉末，其中欧米茄-3脂肪酸在分子水平上被吸收到基于碳水化合物的载体中，以及如何同时保护脂肪酸免受氧化。 粉末压片首先要求粉末可压缩且流动良好。在候选人的论文中，开发一种直接可压缩粉末的工作已经开始：制备和包衣堆叠的含Omega-3的片剂。在他的博士论文中，这项技术将得到进一步发展，包括提高欧米茄-3的浓度，测试不同的欧米茄-3浓缩物，并确保产品在制备、混合、筛选和在压片机中运行时在整个普瑞斯埃森过程中保持新鲜。 这是进一步计划的研究，关于奥米加-3的生物利用度从粉末或片剂接近博士学位。候选角色包括定制T粉的制备、片剂的设计和制备以及数据的加工和解释。 在以片剂形式生产商业化的omega-3补充剂的最后一步，是将生产过程从实验室规模扩大到生产规模。此外，还建立了中间产品和最终产品的标准，并建立和进一步发展了这些标准的质量控制方法。

Doktogradsarbeidet dreier seg om formulering, preparering og karakterisering av et omega-3 basert pulver for bruk i kosttilskuddstabletter, samt optimalisering av de resulterende tablettene. Omega-3 omsettes i dag i form av ren olje, softgel kapsler elle r som pulver. Omega-3 tabletter er per i dag ikke på markedet, hverken som kosttilskudd eller farmasøytisk preparat. Eksisterende omega-3 pulvere er primært rettet mot markedet for funksjonell mat, og betår stort sett av mikroinnkapslet fiskeolje. Mikroin nkapslingen gjør at pulveret ikke er tabletterbart, da det vil lekke olje under tabletteringen. Omegatri AS har siden 2008 arbeidet med å utvikle et omega-3 pulver hvor omega-3-fettsyrene absorberes i en karbohydratbasert bærer på molekylnivå, og hvor sam tidig fettsyrene er beskyttet mot oksidasjon. Tablettering av pulver krever først og fremst at pulveret lar seg komprimere, og at det flyter godt. Arbeid med å utvikle et direkte komprimerbart pulver ble påbegynt i kandidatens masteroppgave: Preparation and coating of stable Omega-3 containing tablets. I doktorgradsarbeidet vil denne teknologien videreutvikles, hvilket inkluderer å øke omega-3 konsentrasjonen, teste ut ulike omega-3 konsentrater og å sikre at produktet holder seg friskt gjennom hele pros essen når det prepareres, blandes, siktes og kjøres i tablettmaskin. Det er videre planlagt studier for å vise biotilgjengeligheten av omega-3 fra pulver og tabletter i tilknytning til doktorgraden. Kandidatens rolle i dette vil være fremstilling av egne t pulver, design og preparering av tabletter, samt bearbeidning og tolkning av data. Siste trinn i etableringen av et kommersialiserbart omega-3 kosttilskudd i tablettform, er oppskalering av produksjonsprosessene fra labskala til produksjonsskala. Det i nnbefatter også etablering av standarder for intermediate og endelige produkter, samt etablering og videreutvikling av metoder for kvalitetskontroll av disse standardene.

Project.Title: Use of Humanities Materials and Programs in FPA's World Affairs Educational Activities

Title_Other.Title: 人文教材与课程在FPA世界事务教育活动中的运用

Project.Abstract: To promote wider public understanding of the humanities by expanding and bringing to FPS's adult audiences ideas from the humanities that bear on America's past, present, and future role in the world.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: To promote wider public understanding of the humanities by expanding and bringing to FPS's adult audiences ideas from the humanities that bear on America's past, present, and future role in the world.
通过扩大并向FPS的成人观众带来与美国过去、现在和未来在世界上的作用有关的人文学科的思想，促进更广泛的公众对人文学科的理解。

Project.Title: Scholarship for outstanding young scientist

Title_Other.Title: 杰出青年科学家奖学金
Stypendium naukowe dla wybitnego młodego naukowca

Project.Abstract: The subject of my research was the relationship between investment performance and characteristics of investment funds, which determine above-average rates of return. The main objectives of the dissertation were: - Identification, classification and evaluation of the characteristics of investment funds (attributes) that affect their rate of return based on the experience of mature markets, - Verification that the features can contribute to achieving superior returns by investment funds in Poland. The result of the research is habilitation thesis, Fri. The effectiveness of Polish investment funds habilitation colloquium on 11.10.2013 r.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: Przedmiotem moich badań był związek między wynikami inwestycyjnymi a cechami charakterystycznymi funduszy inwestycyjnych, które decydują o ponadprzeciętnych stopach zwrotu. Podstawowymi celami rozprawy habilitacyjnej były: - identyfikacja, klasyfikacja oraz ocena cech funduszy inwestycyjnych (attributes) wpływających na ich stopy zwrotu na podstawie doświadczeń rynków dojrzałych, - weryfikacja, które z cech mogą przyczyniać się do osiągania ponadprzeciętnych stóp zwrotu przez fundusze inwestycyjne w Polsce. Efektem badań jest praca habilitacyjna, pt. Efektywność polskich funduszy inwestycyjnych, kolokwium habilitacyjne w dniu 11.10.2013 r.
我的研究主题是投资绩效与投资基金特征之间的关系，这决定了高于平均水平的回报率。本文的主要目的是： -根据成熟市场的经验，识别、分类和评估影响投资基金回报率的投资基金（属性）特征， -验证这些功能有助于波兰投资基金获得更高的回报。 研究的结果是，fri的能力训练论文。波兰投资基金培训座谈会于2013年10月11日举行。

Project.Title: A Novel Biomimetic Scaffold Design that Accelerates Long Bone Segment Defect Regeneration

Title_Other.Title: 一种促进长段骨缺损再生的仿生支架设计
A Novel Biomimetic Scaffold Design that Accelerates Long Bone Segment Defect Regeneration

Project.Abstract:
PUBLIC ABSTRACT
Background: Critical size long bone defects, which will not heal without surgical intervention, can result from combat wounds in military personnel. According to the Army Physical Evaluation Board, severe musculoskeletal trauma is the most common disabling condition experienced by Service personnel, with 54% of those injuries involving extremities. In the civilian population, these defects also result from severe traumatic injuries or large bone resections secondary to cancer treatment. Although surgical options exist to address this problem, all current methods have drawbacks that include long periods of non-weight bearing and poor long-term success rates. Failure of surgical treatments can lead to amputation resulting in significant morbidity, inability to return to previous activities, and significant physical and psychological impairment. This is a critical problem resulting in an enormous financial burden to the military. A need exists for a treatment that can bridge critical size long bone defects that is rapid, reliable, and eliminates the extensive period of non-weight bearing required with all the current surgical treatments.
Objective: The overall goal of this research program is to utilize novel implantable sensate scaffolds that allow immediate limb loading, facilitate rapid regeneration of bone across a critical size defect, and allow accurate real-time monitoring of tissue and scaffold loads that can be used to guide patient-specific rehabilitation protocols. This project will test a promising biomimetic scaffold that can be produced in a patient-specific fashion using x-ray computed tomography (CT) scans coupled to a freeform fabrication three-dimensional printing technique. These scaffolds have previously facilitated rapid bone formation and ingrowth, particularly when seeded with adult adipose-derived mesenchymal stem cells (MSCs). In addition, the scaffolds incorporate sensors that can be used to define loading of the scaffold and surrounding tissues. Measurements obtained from these sensors are critical to translating the technology from an animal model to patients by allowing the development and testing of rehabilitation protocols designed to accelerate bone healing and remodeling. Ultimately, the use of a sensate implant will allow real-time measurements that can be used to determine the effect of pharmaceutical treatments, guide patient-specific rehabilitation, and facilitate clinical decision-making by allowing evaluation of functional bone formation and provide a technique to detect and address any pending catastrophic event prior to implant failure. A hypothesis of this overall goal is that the appropriate scaffold, stem cells, and loading environment are necessary to rapidly generate bone in order to bridge a very large defect in a load-bearing long bone.
Specific Aims: This proposal includes three specific aims intended to develop the technology to a point where a clinical trial will be possible. The first aim uses implantable biomimetic “sensate” scaffolds to test whether increased loading across a critical size defect during the healing process accelerates bone formation. The second aim tests the quality of the bone that is formed by removing supporting internal hardware to demonstrate that the bone formed can withstand long-term normal physiologic loading. The third aim develops and tests bioceramic patient-specific scaffolds that will ultimately be used in clinical trials and simultaneously compares the current scaffold material to the next-generation materials that can provide increased strength and durability for patients with highly demanding activity levels.
Relevance: Development of rapidly deployable, adult stem cell infiltrated biomimetic sensate scaffolds will provide a method of regenerating damaged or missing load-bearing long bone segments in Service personnel. These segments will be sturdy enough to allow immediate limb loading and rehabilitation with the goal of preventing prosthetic replacement or amputations, returning Service personnel to full active duty. The scaffolds used for this purpose will also benefit civilians that sustain severe traumatic injuries or undergo surgical treatment for bone cancer. The testing in this proposal will prepare this technology for clinical trial, potentially directly benefiting Service personnel immediately following completion of this study. The ability to regenerate long load-bearing bone segments and return Service personnel to full active duty will reduce the severe physical and psychological impairment Service members with this injury currently experience. It will also provide substantial cost savings to the military in health services and in training required for new recruits.

The ability to regenerate long load-bearing bone segments and return Service personnel to full active duty will reduce the severe physical and psychological impairment Service members with this injury currently experience. It will also provide substantial cost savings to the military in health services and in training required for new recruits.

公共摘要 背景：军事人员战斗创伤可导致严重的长骨缺损，未经手术治疗无法愈合。根据陆军物理评估委员会的数据，严重的肌肉骨骼创伤是军人最常见的致残情况，其中54%的伤势涉及四肢。在平民中，这些缺陷也是由于严重的创伤或癌症治疗后的大骨切除造成的。尽管存在着解决这一问题的手术方案，但目前所有的方法都有缺点，包括长期不负重和长期成功率低。手术治疗失败可导致截肢，导致严重的发病率，无法恢复以前的活动，以及严重的生理和心理损害。这是一个严重的问题，给军队造成了巨大的财政负担。需要一种治疗方法，该方法能够弥合临界尺寸的长骨缺损，其快速、可靠，并且消除了所有当前外科治疗所需的非承重期。 目的：本研究计划的总体目标是利用新型可植入的sensate支架，该支架允许立即加载肢体，促进通过关键尺寸缺陷的骨快速再生，并允许对组织和支架负载进行准确的实时监测，可用于指导患者特定的康复方案。该项目将测试一种有前途的仿生支架，这种支架可以通过x射线计算机断层扫描（CT）结合自由制造三维打印技术以特定于患者的方式生产。这些支架先前促进了骨的快速形成和生长，特别是当与成人脂肪间充质干细胞（MSCs）一起种植时。此外，支架包含传感器，可用于定义支架和周围组织的负载。从这些传感器获得的测量结果对于将该技术从动物模型转化为患者至关重要，因为它允许开发和测试旨在加速骨愈合和重建的康复方案。最终，使用sensate植入物将允许实时测量，可用于确定药物治疗的效果，指导患者特定康复，通过评估功能性骨形成来促进临床决策，并提供一种技术来检测和解决植入失败之前的任何未决灾难性事件。这一总体目标的一个假设是，为了快速生成骨，需要合适的支架、干细胞和加载环境，以桥接承载长骨中非常大的缺陷。 具体目标：本提案包括三个具体目标，旨在将该技术发展到可能进行临床试验的程度。第一个目标是使用可植入的仿生“sensate”支架来测试在愈合过程中，穿过临界尺寸缺陷的负荷增加是否会加速骨形成。第二个目标是测试通过移除支撑内部硬件形成的骨骼的质量，以证明形成的骨骼能够承受长期正常的生理负荷。第三个目标是开发和测试最终将用于临床试验的生物陶瓷患者专用支架，同时将当前的支架材料与下一代材料进行比较，后者可以为活动水平要求很高的患者提供更高的强度和耐久性。 相关性：研制可快速展开的成人干细胞浸润仿生传感支架将为服务人员提供一种修复受损或缺失的承重长骨段的方法。这些节段将足够坚固，以便立即进行肢体负荷和康复，以防止假肢替换或截肢，使服务人员返回到充分的现役状态。用于此目的的支架也将使遭受严重创伤或接受骨癌手术治疗的平民受益。本提案中的测试将为临床试验准备这项技术，可能在本研究完成后立即直接惠及服务人员。再生长负荷轴承的能力

Project.Title: Experiments on Granular Fluctuation and Dissipation

Title_Other.Title: 颗粒脉动与耗散实验
Experiments on Granular Fluctuation and Dissipation

Project.Abstract: NON-TECHNICAL ABSTRACT: The goal of this project at the University of Pennsylvania is to provide fundamental guidance for how granular materials flow and deform in response to applied forces. The experimental approach will leverage modern optical technologies developed in-house. Modern society relies on transporting, storing, mixing, crushing, and processing such diverse granular materials as foods, seeds, minerals, ores, building materials, and pharmaceutical pills & powders. However, actual applications are inefficient and subject to such catastrophic failures as clogging, mispacking, and demixing. This project will lay the basis for improved engineering practices by establishing the fundamental link between microscopic grain-scale motion and the macroscopic flows that result from applied forces. Besides applications, this topic is of basic interest both because granular materials are nonlinear far-from equilibrium systems at the boundary of the world of known physics, and because of their rich connections to geophysical problems such as earthquakes, mudslides, erosion, and desertification. The project will bring modern physics and measurement techniques into the educational experience of graduate and undergraduate students by involving them directly in cutting-edge scientific research. TECHNICAL ABSTRACT: The goal of this project at the University of Pennsylvania is to measure grain-scale dynamics and to connect with the unusual macroscopic mechanical properties of granular media. For strong forcing, both the microscopic dynamics and the macroscopic flows are homogeneous, and are reasonably well described by hydrodynamic approaches. However, for low forcing, the response can be intermittent in time and localized in space. Such heterogeneities are exacerbated on approach to jamming, and create havoc both for modeling as well as for applications. This project will elucidate grain-scale behavior using high-speed video microscopy, as well as a multispeckle dynamic light scattering method developed in-house and known as Speckle-Visibility Spectroscopy. These probes will be applied to heap and hopper flows, to flows involving impact cratering, and to gas-fluidized grains and rods. The results will be correlated with bulk flow behavior and to rheological properties. Altogether this will establish the fundamental microscopic fluctuation mechanisms responsible for the dissipation of energy injected at the macroscopic scale, and their consequences for deformation and flow. The project will bring modern physics and measurement techniques into the educational experience of graduate and undergraduate students by involving them directly in cutting-edge scientific research.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 非技术摘要：宾夕法尼亚大学这个项目的目标是为颗粒材料如何在外力作用下流动和变形提供基本指导。实验方法将利用内部开发的现代光学技术。现代社会依赖于运输、储存、混合、粉碎和加工各种粒状材料，如食品、种子、矿物、矿石、建筑材料和药物药丸和粉末。然而，实际应用是低效的，并且遭受诸如阻塞、错包装和脱模这样的灾难性故障。该项目将为改进工程实践奠定基础，通过建立微观晶粒尺度运动和由外力引起的宏观流动之间的基本联系。除了应用之外，这一课题还具有基本的意义，因为颗粒材料是非线性的，远离已知物理世界边界的平衡系统，而且它们与地震、泥石流、侵蚀和荒漠化等地球物理问题有着丰富的联系。该项目将通过让研究生和本科生直接参与尖端科学研究，将现代物理和测量技术带入他们的教育体验中。技术摘要：宾夕法尼亚大学这个项目的目标是测量颗粒尺度动力学，并与颗粒介质的异常宏观力学性质相联系。对于强强迫，微观动力学和宏观流动都是均匀的，并且可以用流体力学方法很好地描述。然而，对于低强迫，响应在时间上是间歇性的，在空间上是局部化的。这种不均匀性在干扰方法上更加恶化，并对建模和应用造成严重破坏。该项目将使用高速视频显微镜，以及一种内部开发的多光谱动态光散射方法，即散斑可见度光谱，来阐明晶粒尺度行为。这些探针将应用于堆料和料斗流、涉及撞击坑的流以及气体流态化颗粒和棒。结果将与体积流动特性和流变特性相关。总之，这将建立基本的微观波动机制，负责在宏观尺度上注入能量的耗散，及其对变形和流动的影响。该项目将通过让研究生和本科生直接参与尖端科学研究，将现代物理和测量技术带入他们的教育体验中。

Project.Title: Sens Solutions Smart Disinfection Platform for Legionella Prevention in Hospital and Hotel water heating & cooling systems.

Title_Other.Title: Sens Solutions Smart Disinfection Platform for Legionella Prevention in Hospital and Hotel water heating & cooling systems.
SENS解决方案智能消毒平台，用于医院和酒店水加热和冷却系统的军团菌预防。

Project.Abstract: Legionella is responsible for around 2000 deaths in Europe every year, resulting in a direct cost of 1B€/year for EU healthcare systems including working days lost and those numbers increase by 9% every year. In 2015, 7034 Legionella outbreaks have been occurring in the whole Europe with a fatality rate reaching up 50% in the hospital-acquired infections and 50% of the outbreak cases associated with holidays associated facilities. Up to now, the Legionella detection is performed through in situ sampling and analysis in Microbiology Laboratories, delaying the results and any possible actuation by 13 days. Hydro-S3DP is a global secured IoT solution, combining virtual & physical sensors with Big Data Machine learning process and state-of-the-art disinfection systems that allows in-situ detection of Legionella proliferation and direct disinfection for bacterial treatment in water cooling & heating systems in less than 2h. Moreover, Hydro-S3DP acts directly on the lime deposition reduction within the cooling & heating system, allowing an energy bill saving up to 70 000€/year in hard water environment per building facility and an increase of the system life span from 5-8 to 25 years. All together, the EU market for hospital and hotel is estimated to be ~3.4B€/year. Upon commercialization of Hydro-S3DP in Spain and progressively in the rest of Europe sales are projected to reach 5.5M€ and to employ 12 people by 2022 (1.5 year after the end of the Phase II). More than an economical solution for cooling & heating systems, Hydro-S3DP responds to a challenge of the European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control by preventing any Legionella outbreaks as well as offering a solution for hospital and hotel to improve their energy efficiency in accordance with the COM(2016)860 Directive from the Energy Union, and ensure their water security.

Up to now, the Legionella detection is performed through in situ sampling and analysis in Microbiology Laboratories, delaying the results and any possible actuation by 13 days. Hydro-S3DP is a global secured IoT solution, combining virtual & physical sensors with Big Data Machine learning process and state-of-the-art disinfection systems that allows in-situ detection of Legionella proliferation and direct disinfection for bacterial treatment in water cooling & heating systems in less than 2h. Moreover, Hydro-S3DP acts directly on the lime deposition reduction within the cooling & heating system, allowing an energy bill saving up to 70 000€/year in hard water environment per building facility and an increase of the system life span from 5-8 to 25 years. All together, the EU market for hospital and hotel is estimated to be ~3.4B€/year. More than an economical solution for cooling & heating systems, Hydro-S3DP responds to a challenge of the European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control by preventing any Legionella outbreaks as well as offering a solution for hospital and hotel to improve their energy efficiency in accordance with the COM(2016)860 Directive from the Energy Union, and ensure their water security.

军团菌每年在欧洲造成约2000人死亡，导致欧盟医疗系统每年10亿欧元的直接成本，包括损失的工作日，这些数字每年增加9%。2015年，整个欧洲共发生7034起军团菌疫情，医院获得性感染病死率高达50%，与节假日相关设施的疫情病死率高达50%。到目前为止，军团菌的检测是通过在微生物学实验室进行现场取样和分析，将结果和任何可能的驱动延迟13天。Hydro-S3DP是一个全球安全的物联网解决方案，将虚拟和物理传感器与大数据机器学习过程和最先进的消毒系统相结合，允许在不到2小时的时间内对军团菌增殖进行原位检测，并直接消毒用于水冷和加热系统中的细菌处理。Hydro-S3DP直接作用于冷却和加热系统内石灰沉积的减少，允许每个建筑设施在硬水环境中节省高达70000欧元/年的能源费用，并将系统寿命从5-8年延长至25年。总的来说，欧盟医院和酒店市场估计约为34亿欧元/年。在西班牙和欧洲其他地区，随着Hydro-S3DP的商业化，预计到2022年（第二阶段结束后1.5年），销售额将达到550万欧元，雇佣12人。不仅仅是冷却和加热系统的经济解决方案，Hydro-S3DP应对欧洲疾病预防和控制中心的挑战，防止军团菌爆发，并根据能源联盟COM（2016）860指令，为医院和酒店提供提高能源效率的解决方案，确保其水安全。

Project.Title: Macrophage development and specification in mice.

Title_Other.Title: 小鼠巨噬细胞的发育和特性。
Macrophage development and specification in mice.

Project.Abstract: Project Summary Macrophages are a diverse family of professional phagocytes and `accessory cells' present within most tissues, and equipped with long and motile filopodia that continuously explore surrounding matrix and cells. Macrophages recognize and scavenge pathogens as well as unfit cells and cell debris, glycoproteins and lipids, and produce a large range of bioactive molecules and growth factors. A literature that covers 150 years of research has demonstrated their important and complex roles (i) as innate immune sentinels for the uptake of pathogens, but also as (ii) regulators of epithelia and blood and lymphatic vessels morphogenesis during fetal development, postnatal homeostasis and tissue remodeling, and inflammatory and degenerative processes. An overarching hypothesis that drives the present proposal and the work of our laboratory is that the understanding the genetic and molecular events that control development, growth, and maintenance of macrophages within tissues is essential to elucidate their roles in disease and the consequence(s) of genetic polymorphisms. Early studies suggested that tissue macrophages originate and renew from hematopoietic stem cells (HSC) via circulating progenitors such as blood monocytes. However, as recently shown by us and others, monocytes and macrophages play different roles in disease pathogenesis, and in fact, they represent distinct cell types, as most tissue-resident macrophages develop from embryonic progenitors distinct from HSCs and are maintained in postnatal tissues independently of bone marrow progenitors and monocytes. Furthermore, macrophages that reside in distinct tissues present with different molecular identities and functions. The tissue-specific identities of macrophages are in part maintained by their local microenvironment, but are also likely to result from developmental processes. The present project builds on these exciting and `paradigm-changing' developments. 1) We will characterize the genetic and molecular determinants that control macrophage development from embryonic progenitors in the mouse, using sate-of-the-art fate mapping methods, and explore the mechanisms that underlie the colonization of embryos by the macrophages precursors. 2) We will also take advantage of single-cell genomic and systems biology approaches to characterize the mechanisms and spatio-temporal sequence of events responsible for tissue macrophage specification in vivo. We will further test the role of novel key transcriptional regulators that control macrophage differentiation, maintenance, and functions in postnatal tissues, with a focus on Kupffer cells. Along this process we will generate novel genetic tools needed to distinguish and selectively target tissue-resident macrophages, independently of HSC and their progeny. Altogether, this work represents a ground-breaking advance toward our aim to characterize the function of tissue-resident macrophage in health and disease.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: Project Summary Macrophages are a diverse family of professional phagocytes and `accessory cells' present within most tissues, and equipped with long and motile filopodia that continuously explore surrounding matrix and cells. Macrophages recognize and scavenge pathogens as well as unfit cells and cell debris, glycoproteins and lipids, and produce a large range of bioactive molecules and growth factors. A literature that covers 150 years of research has demonstrated their important and complex roles (i) as innate immune sentinels for the uptake of pathogens, but also as (ii) regulators of epithelia and blood and lymphatic vessels morphogenesis during fetal development, postnatal homeostasis and tissue remodeling, and inflammatory and degenerative processes. An overarching hypothesis that drives the present proposal and the work of our laboratory is that the understanding the genetic and molecular events that control development, growth, and maintenance of macrophages within tissues is essential to elucidate their roles in disease and the consequence(s) of genetic polymorphisms. Early studies suggested that tissue macrophages originate and renew from hematopoietic stem cells (HSC) via circulating progenitors such as blood monocytes. However, as recently shown by us and others, monocytes and macrophages play different roles in disease pathogenesis, and in fact, they represent distinct cell types, as most tissue-resident macrophages develop from embryonic progenitors distinct from HSCs and are maintained in postnatal tissues independently of bone marrow progenitors and monocytes. Furthermore, macrophages that reside in distinct tissues present with different molecular identities and functions. The tissue-specific identities of macrophages are in part maintained by their local microenvironment, but are also likely to result from developmental processes. The present project builds on these exciting and `paradigm-changing' developments. 1) We will characterize the genetic and molecular determinants that control macrophage development from embryonic progenitors in the mouse, using sate-of-the-art fate mapping methods, and explore the mechanisms that underlie the colonization of embryos by the macrophages precursors. 2) We will also take advantage of single-cell genomic and systems biology approaches to characterize the mechanisms and spatio-temporal sequence of events responsible for tissue macrophage specification in vivo. We will further test the role of novel key transcriptional regulators that control macrophage differentiation, maintenance, and functions in postnatal tissues, with a focus on Kupffer cells. Along this process we will generate novel genetic tools needed to distinguish and selectively target tissue-resident macrophages, independently of HSC and their progeny. Altogether, this work represents a ground-breaking advance toward our aim to characterize the function of tissue-resident macrophage in health and disease.

项目总结：巨噬细胞是一个在大多数组织中存在的不同的专业吞噬细胞和“辅助细胞”家族，并配备有长而活动的丝状体，不断探索周围的基质和细胞。巨噬细胞识别和清除病原体、不适细胞和细胞碎片、糖蛋白和脂质，并产生大量生物活性分子和生长因子。一篇涵盖150年研究的文献已经证明了它们的重要而复杂的作用（i）作为先天性免疫哨兵对病原体的吸收，但也作为（ii）在胎儿发育、出生后内环境稳定和组织重塑、炎症和退行性变过程中上皮和血管及淋巴管形态发生的调节器过程。推动本提案和我们实验室工作的一个总体假设是，了解控制组织内巨噬细胞发育、生长和维持的遗传和分子事件对于阐明它们在疾病中的作用和遗传多态性的后果至关重要。早期研究表明，组织巨噬细胞通过血液单核细胞等循环祖细胞从造血干细胞（HSC）中起源和更新。然而，正如我们和其他人最近所展示的，单核细胞和巨噬细胞在疾病发病中扮演着不同的角色，事实上，它们代表着不同的细胞类型，由于大多数组织内的巨噬细胞是从不同于hsc的胚胎祖细胞中发育而来的，并且在出生后的组织中保持独立于骨髓祖细胞和单核细胞。此外，存在于不同组织中的巨噬细胞具有不同的分子特性和功能巨噬细胞的组织特异性部分是由其局部微环境维持的，但也可能是由发育过程引起的。本项目建立在这些令人兴奋和“改变范式”的发展之上。1）我们将利用最新的命运定位方法，描述控制小鼠胚胎祖细胞巨噬细胞发育的遗传和分子决定因素，并探索巨噬细胞前体定植胚胎的机制。2）我们还将利用单细胞基因组学和系统生物学方法来描述体内组织-巨噬细胞规范化的机制和事件的时空顺序。我们将进一步测试控制巨噬细胞分化、维持和功能的新型关键转录调节因子在产后组织中的作用，重点是Kupffer细胞。在这一过程中，我们将产生新的基因工具来区分和选择性靶向组织内的巨噬细胞，而不依赖于HSC及其后代。总之，这项工作代表了一个突破性的进展，朝着我们的目标，以表征组织驻留巨噬细胞在健康和疾病中的功能。

Source.Name: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases

Project.Title: More energy-efficient buildings, national goals in a local context

Title_Other.Title: More energy-efficient buildings, national goals in a local context
更节能的建筑，地方的国家目标

Class.ClassName: 居住建筑、居住建筑设计

Project.Abstract: The Department of Sustainable Community Planning, Borlänge Municipality is part of the program Uthållig kommun. An energy and climate strategy has been composed while the municipality has been engaged in the program. The aim of this research project is to investigate obstacles and opportunities to fulfill goals of improving energy efficiency e g those presented in the energy and climate strategy. This will be done by clarifying the connection between goals and realized measures, and effects in the form of possible reduced energy consumption. Dalarna and Örebro University are carrying out, in collaboration with the housing company Tunabyggen and the Department of Sustainable Community Planning, a research study of the initial period of the housing company´s 10 year project of renovating and improving energy efficiency in the multi-family housing area Jakobsgårdarna. A gender perspective will be used when focusing the improvements of Jakobsgårdarna. The improvements are from a research perspective interesting because they include questions concerning both technical and behavioral issues e g energy efficiency and the inhabitants´ social situation.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: Borl_nge市可持续社区规划部是Uth_llig Kommun项目的一部分。在市政当局参与该方案的同时，制定了能源和气候战略。本研究计画的目的是探讨实现能源及气候策略中所提出的提高能源效率目标的障碍及机会。这将通过澄清目标与已实现措施之间的联系，以及以可能减少能源消耗的形式产生的影响来实现。达拉纳和厄勒布鲁大学正与图纳比根住房公司和可持续社区规划部合作，对雅各布斯加尔达纳多户住房区住房公司10年期翻修和提高能源效率项目的初期进行研究。在关注jakobsg_rdarna的改进时，将采用性别观点。这些改进是从一个有趣的研究角度出发的，因为它们包括技术和行为问题，例如能源效率和居民的社会状况。

The Department of Sustainable Community Planning, Borlänge Municipality is part of the program Uthållig kommun. An energy and climate strategy has been composed while the municipality has been engaged in the program. The aim of this research project is to investigate obstacles and opportunities to fulfill goals of improving energy efficiency e g those presented in the energy and climate strategy. This will be done by clarifying the connection between goals and realized measures, and effects in the form of possible reduced energy consumption. Dalarna and Örebro University are carrying out, in collaboration with the housing company Tunabyggen and the Department of Sustainable Community Planning, a research study of the initial period of the housing company´s 10 year project of renovating and improving energy efficiency in the multi-family housing area Jakobsgårdarna. A gender perspective will be used when focusing the improvements of Jakobsgårdarna. The improvements are from a research perspective interesting because they include questions concerning both technical and behavioral issues e g energy efficiency and the inhabitants´ social situation.

Project.Title: Spin Resonance of Solids

Title_Other.Title: Spin Resonance of Solids
固体的自旋共振

Project.Title: The Influence of Stromal Transforming Growth Factor- (Beta) Receptor Signaling on Mouse Mammary Neoplasia

Title_Other.Title: The Influence of Stromal Transforming Growth Factor- (Beta) Receptor Signaling on Mouse Mammary Neoplasia
基质转化生长因子（β）受体信号转导对小鼠乳腺癌的影响

Project.Abstract:
PUBLIC ABSTRACT
The mammary gland consists of two major components; the milk protein producing cells and the supporting cells. Human breast cancer usually derives from the milk producing cells in either the terminal ductal lobular units or in the ducts (collectively referred to as epithelial cells) which connect them to each other and to the nipple. Over stimulation of growth promoting genes (Her2/neu) or loss of growth suppressing genes (transforming growth factor-beta; TGF-?) within the epithelial cells generally produces cancer. However, multiple (estimated to be as few as four but as many as eight) other genetic events must take place before a normal, healthy epithelial cell turns bad. Communication between the epithelial cells and supporting cells is critical for normal homeostasis within the breast. ¿Supporting cells¿ is a misnomer as these cells do much more than physically support the epithelial cells. The support tissue is composed of several different cell types such as endothelial cells (blood vessels), adipocytes (fat cells--a major constituent of the breast), and fibroblasts (connective tissue cells). During development of the breast the epithelial cells communicate with the supporting cells (collectively referred to as the mammary stroma) and the stroma communicate back to the epithelial cells directing growth and differentiation of the epithelial cells. Without the mammary stroma (supporting cells) the epithelial cells (milk producing cells) would fail to develop. The role the stroma plays in the development of breast cancer; however, is not well understood. To better understand how the mammary stroma may affect tumor development we have taken advantage of the mouse as a model system. The mouse is very attractive for these types of studies for the following reasons: (1) the mouse mammary gland is similar to the human in that it has all the same components; (2) genes are easily manipulated in the mouse; and (3) tumors may be experimentally induced and the effects of a particular tissue on cancer development (in this case the mammary stroma) may be studied. Our laboratory has created a transgenic mouse (a mouse with a foreign gene inserted into its genome) that has lost responsiveness to the growth suppressor, TGF-?, in the mammary stroma. The mice who harbor the transgene have an abnormal epithelial ductal tree, in that it contains more branches than its normal littermate. The mammary gland from a normal virgin mouse has the appearance of a tree in winter. The transgenic mice is the same tree in winter with approximately double the number of branches. Therefore, in these mice, loss of a signal specific for the stroma has created an alteration in the epithelium. To understand the role of stromal TGF-? in tumor formation, tumors will be induced in mice with the transgene and in those without, and the difference in tumor formation and latency will be measured. In addition, the genetic alterations that accompany loss of responsiveness to stromal TGF-? will also be assayed. Better understanding of how the mammary stroma affects tumor formation and the genes involved may lead to better predictors for development and progression of breast cancer and may open up new, previously unexploited avenues for cancer treatment.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 公共摘要 乳腺由两个主要成分组成：乳蛋白产生细胞和支持细胞。人类乳腺癌通常起源于导管末梢小叶单位或导管（统称为上皮细胞）中的产乳细胞，这些细胞将乳腺癌细胞彼此连接并与乳头相连。过度刺激促生长基因（Her2/neu）或失去生长抑制基因（转化生长因子β；TGF-？）在上皮细胞内通常会产生癌症。然而，在正常健康的上皮细胞恶化之前，必须发生多种（估计只有4种，但多达8种）遗传事件。上皮细胞和支持细胞之间的通讯对乳腺内的正常稳态至关重要。？支持细胞？是一个不恰当的说法，因为这些细胞所做的远不止物理上支持上皮细胞。支持组织由几种不同的细胞类型组成，如内皮细胞（血管）、脂肪细胞（脂肪细胞——乳腺的主要成分）和成纤维细胞（结缔组织细胞）。在乳腺发育过程中，上皮细胞与支持细胞（统称为乳腺基质）沟通，基质与上皮细胞沟通，指导上皮细胞的生长和分化。如果没有乳腺基质（支持细胞），上皮细胞（产乳细胞）将无法发育。基质在乳腺癌发生发展中的作用尚不清楚。为了更好地了解乳腺间质如何影响肿瘤的发展，我们利用小鼠作为模型系统。小鼠对这些类型的研究很有吸引力，原因如下：（1）小鼠乳腺与人类相似，因为它具有所有相同的成分；（2）基因在小鼠体内很容易被操纵；（3）肿瘤可以通过实验诱发，并且可以研究特定组织对癌症发展的影响（在这种情况下是乳腺基质）。我们的实验室已经创造出一种转基因小鼠（一种在其基因组中插入外源基因的小鼠），这种小鼠对生长抑制物TGF-？，在乳腺基质中。携带转基因的小鼠有一个异常的上皮导管树，因为它比正常的幼鼠含有更多的分支。正常初生小鼠的乳腺在冬季呈树状。转基因小鼠在冬季是同一棵树，分枝数是其数量的两倍。因此，在这些小鼠中，基质特异性信号的丢失造成了上皮细胞的改变。了解基质转化生长因子-？在肿瘤形成过程中，转基因小鼠和未转基因小鼠都会诱发肿瘤，并测量肿瘤形成和潜伏期的差异。此外，伴随着对基质转化生长因子-也会被化验。更好地了解乳腺基质是如何影响肿瘤形成和相关基因的，可能有助于更好地预测乳腺癌的发展和进展，并可能为癌症治疗开辟新的、以前未开发的途径。

PUBLIC ABSTRACT

Project.Title: Collaborative project: Sensor network node for the evaluation of structural elements in vehicles by means of acoustic monitoring techniques - AkuSens - Subproject: Simulation and application of the sensor network for the monitoring of rail vehicles

Title_Other.Title: Verbundprojekt: Sensornetzwerkknoten zur Bewertung von Konstruktionselementen in Fahrzeugen mittels akustischer Überwachungstechniken - AkuSens -, Teilvorhaben: Simulation und Anwendung des Sensornetzwerkes für die Überwachung von Schienenfahrzeugen

Source.Name: Federal Ministry of Education and Research

Project.Title: Metacommunity Dynamics at Hydrothermal Vents

Title_Other.Title: 热液喷口的亚群落动力学
Metacommunity Dynamics at Hydrothermal Vents

Class.ClassName: 金属元素、金属元素化合物

Project.Abstract: In this project, the researchers will develop new mathematical models to study the population dynamics of organisms that live at deep-sea hydrothermal vents, areas of the seafloor where volcanic activity causes hot, chemical-rich fluids to exit. The discovery of these vents in 1977 revealed unexpectedly novel and diverse organisms, challenging the prevailing view of the deep sea as a sparsely populated desert. Recent international efforts to mine hydrothermal vent deposits rich in copper, gold, silver and zinc are intensely debated, as deep-sea mineral mining can destroy diverse vent communities and alter the surrounding seafloor habitat. The investigators will extend their models to analyze the potential effects of mining activities. Results from new models will be synthesized to meet the needs of potential stakeholders, including organizations that advise, manage, and conduct activities related to seafloor mining and Marine Protected Areas. Research products will be disseminated as reports and in stakeholder meetings such as those organized by the International Seabed Authority and the Deep Ocean Stewardship Initiative. The research team will work with graphic artists, video producers, and educators to develop new educational presentations for the NOAA Science on a Sphere® (SOS) system. This new content will be distributed via open access to the entire SOS Users Network and incorporated into SOS programs at over 100 science centers across the U.S. and in 20 other countries. Undergraduate students will participate in the project through the Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution's Summer Student Fellowship Program and the Woods Hole Partnership Education Program. These two programs provide students with authentic research experiences; the PEP program attracts underrepresented minority students, and offers them a short course in marine science and a research internship along with a 6-wk research project. Metacommunity theory offers important advantages over alternative approaches in modeling vent ecosystems, and the proposed work will advance both our understanding of these communities and strategies for developing models of metacommunities more generally. The proposed work substantially expands earlier metacommunity models for vent systems developed by the researchers in innovative ways. The analyses will remove many initial constraints and add important considerations including site-dependent transition probabilities and clustering of nearby sites with shared characteristics. The options for modeling dispersal properties with two alternative dispersal kernels will also advance understanding. The researchers will examine recognized successional patterns not considered in the previous work using patch occupancy models, and they will carry out sensitivity analyses to evaluate the role of parameters for which uncertainty is high, such as larval duration and dispersal distance, patch disturbance rates and recovery times. This element of the work plan will serve to prioritize future field research, emphasizing the role that models can play in guiding research programs.

在这个项目中，研究人员将开发新的数学模型，研究生活在深海热液喷口（海底火山活动导致富含化学物质的热液流出的区域）的生物种群动态。1977年，这些喷口的发现出乎意料地揭示了新奇多样的生物，挑战了人们普遍认为深海是人烟稀少的沙漠的看法。最近国际上对开采富含铜、金、银和锌的热液喷口矿床的努力引起了激烈的争论，因为深海矿物开采会破坏不同的喷口群落并改变周围的海底生境。研究人员将扩展他们的模型来分析采矿活动的潜在影响。将综合新模式的成果，以满足潜在利益攸关方的需要，包括提供建议、管理和开展与海底采矿和海洋保护区有关的活动的组织。研究成果将作为报告和利益攸关方会议（如国际海底管理局和深海管理倡议组织的会议）分发。该研究团队将与图形艺术家、视频制作人和教育工作者合作，在Sphere（SOS）系统上为美国国家海洋和大气管理局科学部开发新的教育演示。这些新内容将通过开放访问整个SOS用户网络进行分发，并纳入美国和其他20个国家100多个科学中心的SOS项目中。本科生将通过伍兹霍尔海洋研究所的暑期学生奖学金计划和伍兹霍尔伙伴关系教育计划参与该项目。这两个项目为学生提供了真实的研究经验；政治公众人物项目吸引了代表性不足的少数民族学生，为他们提供了一门短期海洋科学课程和一个为期6周的研究项目和一个研究实习。元群落理论在模拟喷口生态系统方面比其他方法提供了重要的优势，本文的工作将促进我们对这些群落的理解和更广泛地开发元群落模型的策略。这项工作实质上扩展了研究人员以创新方式开发的通风系统的早期元社区模型。分析将消除许多初始约束，并添加重要的考虑因素，包括与站点相关的转移概率和具有共享特征的邻近站点的聚类。使用两个可选的分散核来建模分散特性的选项也将促进理解。研究人员将使用斑块占有率模型检查先前工作中未考虑的已识别的演替模式，并进行敏感性分析，以评估不确定性较高的参数的作用，如幼虫持续时间和传播距离、斑块干扰率和恢复时间。工作计划的这一要素将有助于确定未来实地研究的优先次序，强调模型在指导研究计划方面可以发挥的作用。

Project.Title: Investigation into the alternative splicing of steroid hormone regulated genes in breast cancer.

Title_Other.Title: 乳腺癌类固醇激素调控基因选择性剪接的研究。
Investigation into the alternative splicing of steroid hormone regulated genes in breast cancer.

Project.Abstract: Steroid hormones have imortant roles in breast tissue growth and differentiation. We have identified several proteins called PRMT6 and CAPER's , that are involved in steroid hormone signaling and control the alternative splicing of RNA, the process in which several different proteins can be produced from a single gene. Our aim is to study these proteins in an effort to understand how they influence alternative splicing and to identify genes they control in relation to breast cancer.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 类固醇激素在乳腺组织生长和分化中有重要作用。我们已经鉴定了一些蛋白质，称为PRMT6和CAPER，它们参与类固醇激素信号传导和控制RNA的选择性剪接，在这个过程中，几个不同的蛋白质可以从一个基因中产生。我们的目的是研究这些蛋白质，以了解它们如何影响选择性剪接，并确定它们控制的与乳腺癌相关的基因。

Steroid hormones have imortant roles in breast tissue growth and differentiation. We have identified several proteins called PRMT6 and CAPER's , that are involved in steroid hormone signaling and control the alternative splicing of RNA, the process in which several different proteins can be produced from a single gene. Our aim is to study these proteins in an effort to understand how they influence alternative splicing and to identify genes they control in relation to breast cancer.

Source.Name: National Health and Medical Research Council

Project.Title: Clinical Research for Rare Diseases: Opportunities, Challenges, and Solutions

Title_Other.Title: Clinical Research for Rare Diseases: Opportunities, Challenges, and Solutions
罕见病临床研究：机遇、挑战与对策

Class.ClassName: 计算机安全、计算机保密

Project.Abstract: DESCRIPTION (provided by applicant): There are more than 6,000 diseases classified as "rare" (defined as having a prevalence in the United States of <200,000 persons). While individually these entities are uncommon, as a group they are an important cause of chronic illness, disability and premature death in both children and adults. Despite their rarity, many fundamental advances in medicine have come from the study of rare diseases and these have benefited common diseases. Both because of currently inadequate therapy and the potential to assist common as well as rare disorders, the conduct of clinical research in rare diseases is essential. In order to assure the future of this research, the training of the next generation of investigators in this field is important. The NIH Rare Diseases Clinical Research Network (RDCRN, www.RareDiseasesNetwork.org) is the ideal group to sponsor a conference addressing rare disease research methodology that would supplement general training in clinical research and hopefully attract trainees and junior faculty into this important field. This R13 grant proposes to hold a conference entitled "Clinical Research for Rare Diseases: Opportunities, Challenges, and Solutions" that will provide information and resources to trainees and junior faculty that they can directly apply to their work and career development. This proposal has three specific aims: 1) Hold a conference on rare disease research methodology for investigators early in their career; 2) Develop a renewable on-line curriculum for rare disease methodology; 3)Provide support to expand the number of trainees able to attend the research methods conference. The proposed conference format is of a full day program made up of short didactic lectures, each followed by ample time for questions, and panel discussions on focused areas relevant to the attendee's current stage of career and research development. The issues that will be addressed include: 1) recruitment strategies, 2) study design and biostatistics in dealing with small number of subjects, 3) maintaining participant anonymity with rare diseases, 4) use of demographic and registry data, 5) pathways for developing orphan products, and 6) working with patient advocacy groups and with industry. There will also be the opportunity for poster presentations, so that trainees can share with each other and with senior investigators of the RDCRN their current research and receive feedback. The final session will be a dinner with a keynote address given by Dr. Francis Collins, Director of the National Human Genome Research Institute, and a champion of rare disease research. All members of the RDCRN Steering Committee (Consortia PIs, NIH program officials from multiple institutes, and patient advocacy group representatives) will participate in the conference. There will be an evaluation component where participants will fill out a form indicating the level of success in achieving our goals. Finally, the proceedings will be posted on the web and a summary article will be published. If this conference proves successful, we plan on having similar sessions attached to future RDCRC meetings.

Finally, the proceedings will be posted on the web and a summary article will be published. If this conference proves successful, we plan on having similar sessions attached to future RDCRC meetings.

描述（由申请人提供）：有6000多种疾病被归类为“罕见”（定义为在美国的患病率低于200000人）。虽然这些个体并不常见，但作为一个群体，它们是儿童和成人慢性疾病、残疾和过早死亡的重要原因。尽管罕见，但医学上的许多根本性进展都来自于对罕见疾病的研究，这些都有益于常见疾病。由于目前治疗不充分，而且有可能帮助常见和罕见的疾病，对罕见疾病进行临床研究是必不可少的。为了保证这项研究的未来，培训下一代的研究人员在这一领域是很重要的。美国国立卫生研究院罕见病临床研究网络（RDCRN，www.rarediseasnetwork.org）是举办罕见病研究方法会议的理想组织，该会议将补充临床研究的一般培训，并有望吸引学员和初级教员进入这一重要领域。这项R13资助计划举办一个题为“罕见疾病临床研究：机遇、挑战和解决方案”的会议，为受训者和初级教师提供信息和资源，他们可以直接应用于工作和职业发展。这项建议有三个具体目标：1）在研究人员的早期职业生涯中召开一次罕见疾病研究方法的会议；2）为罕见疾病研究方法开发一个可更新的在线课程；3）提供支持，以扩大能够参加研究方法会议的受训人数。拟议的会议形式是一个全天的方案，由简短的说教讲座组成，每个讲座之后都有足够的时间提问，并就与与会者目前职业和研究发展阶段相关的重点领域进行小组讨论。将要解决的问题包括：1）招募策略，2）研究设计和生物统计学处理少量受试者，3）保持受试者对罕见疾病的匿名性，4）使用人口和登记数据，5）开发孤儿产品的途径，6）与患者权益团体和行业合作。此外，还将提供海报展示的机会，以便受训者能够相互分享并与RDCRN的高级研究人员分享他们当前的研究成果，并获得反馈。最后一次会议将是一次晚宴，由国家人类基因组研究所所长、罕见疾病研究冠军弗朗西斯·柯林斯博士作主旨演讲。RDCRN指导委员会的所有成员（财团PIs、多个研究所的NIH项目官员和患者权益团体代表）将参加会议。将有一个评估部分，参与者将填写一份表格，表明在实现我们的目标方面的成功程度。最后，会议记录将在网上公布，并将发表一篇摘要文章。如果这次会议成功，我们计划在今后的RDCRC会议上举行类似的会议。

Source.Name: National Center for Advancing Translational Sciences

Project.Title: Between Home and Nature: Gardening in the Post-Socialist City and its Urban Impacts by Looking at Urban Political Ecology

Title_Other.Title: Mezi domovem a přírodou: zahrádkaření v post-socialistickém městě a jeho urbánní dopady pohledem městské politické ekologie
在家与自然之间：后社会主义城市的园林及其城市政治生态影响

Class.ClassName: 公共建筑、公共建筑设计

Project.Abstract: The project examines the Prague Garden Settlements as an empirical example of changes in the approach to spatial planning and urban nature after the fall of socialism. Settlements represent areas of relationship and care, but also intense political bargaining. The aim of the project is to analyze, through settlement research, changes in the development (policies) of the city and urban nature and the experience of home and the city connected with them. By combining micro and macro perspectives using multi-methodical research (extended case study by Burawoy (1998)), the project (1) provides a detailed understanding of the practices / experiences of urban gardening and their changes in post-socialist transformation; (2) Exploring how changes in the ideas and experiences of home, nature, and city are reflected; And (3) analyzes the negotiation of urban space and settlement nature. The aim of the project is to find out how the transformation after the fall of socialism was reflected in the complex policies of urban nature and what impact it has on the everyday experience of home and nature in the post-socialist city.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: Projekt zkoumá pražské zahrádkové osady jako empirický příklad změn v přístupu k územnímu plánování a městské přírodě po pádu socialismu. Osady představují prostory vztahu a péče, ale také intenzivního politického vyjednávání. Cílem projektu je prostřednictvím výzkumu osad analyzovat změny v rozvoji (politik) města a městské přírody a zkušenosti domova a města s nimi spojených. Kombinací mikro a makro perspektivy za použití multi-metodického výzkumu (rozšířená případová studie dle Burawoy (1998)) projekt (1) poskytne detailní porozumění praktikám/zkušenostem městského zahrádkaření a jejich změnám v rámci post-socialistické transformace; (2) prozkoumá, jak se projevují změny v představách a zkušenosti domova, přírody a města; a (3) zanalyzuje vyjednávání městského prostoru a přírody osad. Záměrem projektu je zjistit, jak se transformace po pádu socialismu projevila v komplexních politikách městské přírody a jaký dopad měla a má na každodenní zkušenost domova a přírody v post-socialistickém městě.

该项目将布拉格花园住区作为社会主义垮台后空间规划方法和城市性质变化的一个实证例子。定居点是关系和关心的领域，也是激烈的政治谈判。该项目的目的是通过定居研究，分析城市和城市性质发展（政策）的变化，以及家庭和与之相关的城市的经验。通过采用多方法研究（Burawoy（1998）的扩展案例研究）将微观和宏观视角结合起来，该项目（1）详细了解了城市园艺的实践/经验及其在后社会主义改造中的变化；（2）探索了家庭、自然的观念和经验的变化，分析了城市空间与聚落性质的交融。该项目的目的是了解社会主义垮台后的转型是如何体现在复杂的城市性质政策中的，对后社会主义城市的家庭和自然的日常体验有什么影响。

Project.Title: ELOKA Phase II: Toward Operational Data Management Support for Community-Based Observations Contributing to the Arctic Observing Network

Title_Other.Title: ELOKA第二阶段：为北极观测网提供社区观测的业务数据管理支持
ELOKA Phase II: Toward Operational Data Management Support for Community-Based Observations Contributing to the Arctic Observing Network

Class.ClassName: 理论、技术、方法、研究、评价、策略

Project.Abstract: This award is funded under the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 (Public Law 111-5). This award supports the continued development of the Exchange for Local Observations and Knowledge of the Arctic (ELOKA). It provides data management and user support to facilitate the collection, preservation, exchange, and use of local observations and knowledge. The first phase of ELOKA was developmental. This award will help move ELOKA into a fully operational mode that will help projects to acquire, manage and preserve their data, and to provide user-friendly tools for user-based searches, browsing and data access, through either project portals or the ELOKA portal as a means of access to all partner projects. There are three main "Intellectual Merits" of ELOKA. First, it will further develop innovative data management approaches to handle 'non-traditional' forms of information. Second, it will make more observational data and information available to the wider research community and beyond through discoverability of data. Third, ELOKA fills a critical gap in Arctic research by providing data management services to social science projects, community-based research projects, and other projects with 'non-traditional data', many of which are mandated to make their metadata and data available, but currently have few options for support. ELOKA has several "Broader Impacts". It will expand indigenous participation in scientific activities by supporting community-based projects in the Arctic. It will make indigenous observations and perspectives accessible to a larger audience, increasing general understanding of Arctic peoples and their relationship with a changing environment. And it will improve communication and collaboration between the scientific and indigenous communities by promoting the exchange of information and ideas. With a network in place to support them, Arctic residents and indigenous communities will also strengthen their ties to each other and have a mechanism to voice local and collective ideas and findings.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 该奖根据2009美国复苏和再投资法案（公法111-5）提供资金。该奖项支持继续开展北极地区观测和知识交流。它提供数据管理和用户支持，以便于收集、保存、交换和使用当地的观察和知识。伊洛卡的第一阶段是发育阶段。该奖项将有助于埃洛卡进入一个全面运作的模式，帮助项目获取、管理和保存其数据，并通过项目门户或埃洛卡门户提供用户友好的工具，供用户通过这些门户进行搜索、浏览和数据访问，作为访问所有合作伙伴项目的手段。伊洛卡有三个主要的“智力优点”。首先，它将进一步发展创新的数据管理方法，以处理“非传统”形式的信息。第二，通过数据的可发现性，它将使更多的观测数据和信息可供更广泛的研究界和更广泛的研究界使用。第三，ELOKA通过向社会科学项目、社区研究项目和其他具有“非传统数据”的项目提供数据管理服务，填补了北极研究领域的一个关键空白，其中许多项目的任务是提供其元数据和数据，但目前几乎没有支持的选择。埃洛卡有几个“更广泛的影响”。它将通过支持北极地区以社区为基础的项目，扩大土著人对科学活动的参与。它将使更多的观众了解土著人的意见和观点，增进对北极人民及其与不断变化的环境的关系的普遍了解。它还将通过促进信息和思想的交流，改善科学界和土著社区之间的交流与合作。有了支持他们的网络，北极居民和土著社区也将加强彼此之间的联系，并有一个机制来表达当地和集体的想法和结论。

There are three main "Intellectual Merits" of ELOKA. First, it will further develop innovative data management approaches to handle 'non-traditional' forms of information. Third, ELOKA fills a critical gap in Arctic research by providing data management services to social science projects, community-based research projects, and other projects with 'non-traditional data', many of which are mandated to make their metadata and data available, but currently have few options for support. ELOKA has several "Broader Impacts". It will expand indigenous participation in scientific activities by supporting community-based projects in the Arctic. Project.Title: Elucidating the mechanism of UL138 mediated suppression of lytic phase genes during human cytomegalovirus latency.

Title_Other.Title: 阐明UL138介导人巨细胞病毒潜伏期裂解期基因抑制的机制。
Elucidating the mechanism of UL138 mediated suppression of lytic phase genes during human cytomegalovirus latency.

Class.ClassName: 理论、技术、方法、研究、评价、策略

Project.Abstract: Project summary Human cytomegalovirus (HCMV) is a major human pathogen infecting 60-90% of the population. Its ability to establish latency and persist for the life of the host contributes to its widespread success as a pathogen. While infection in healthy adults is relatively asymptomatic HCMV can cause severe disease in immunocompromised patients such as transplant and HIV/AIDS patients and those with undeveloped immune systems. Importantly disease can be caused by virus reactivating after decades of latency when immune defenses are compromised. The viral protein UL138 is required to establish and maintain latency and is retained in all clinical isolates but lost upon serial passage in fibroblasts (25, 26, 28). UL138?s critical role during latency makes it an ideal target to combat latent infection. When expressed from a latency defective HCMV strain AD169, UL138 prevents histone deacetylase (HDAC) inhibitor valproic acid (VPA) induced expression of the viral protein IE1 from the major immediate early promoter (MIEP); blocking the first step of a lytic infection (27). This critical checkpoint determines whether HCMV will undergo a lytic or latent infection. Initial studies have found UL138 prevents lysine demethylases (KDMs) from removing repressive histone modifications on the MIEP (27). Intriguingly, UL138 localizes to the Golgi apparatus and has not been found in the nucleus where its effect on the MIEP takes place. The primary goal of this study is to identify how UL138 prevents demethylases from being recruited to the MIEP allowing for the establishment of latency. A clearer understanding of how UL138 helps HCMV establish and maintain latency is needed to develop treatments to combat latent HCMV and to clear the latent reservoir. Through our studies possible cellular targets to modulate HCMV latency will be discovered. This research is driven by the hypothesis that UL138 alters cellular trafficking of an unidentified protein(s) preventing them from recruiting KDMs to the MIEP. Supporting this hypothesis UL138 contains four Golgi sorting motifs and alters the subcellular localization of several proteins (33, 34, 35, 37). The requirement for these sorting motifs and cellular sorting machinery for UL138 mediated suppression of the MIEP will be tested and the proteins UL138 must interact with to silence the MIEP will be identified.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 人类巨细胞病毒（HCMV）是一种主要的人类病原体，感染率为60-90%。它能够建立潜伏期并在宿主的生命中持续存在，这有助于它作为病原体获得广泛的成功。而健康成人的HCMV感染相对无症状，可导致移植、HIV/AIDS等免疫功能低下患者和免疫系统不发达患者的严重疾病。重要的是，当免疫防御系统受到损害时，病毒经过数十年的潜伏期后重新激活，可导致疾病。病毒蛋白UL138需要建立和维持潜伏期，并保留在所有临床分离株中，但在成纤维细胞（25，26，28）中连续传代时丢失。尺138？潜伏期的关键作用使其成为对抗潜伏感染的理想靶点。当从潜伏期缺陷的HCMV株AD169表达时，UL138阻止组蛋白脱乙酰酶（HDAC）抑制剂丙戊酸（VPA）诱导主要即刻早期启动子（MIEP）的病毒蛋白IE1表达；阻断裂解感染的第一步（27）这个关键的检查点决定HCMV是否会发生溶解性或潜伏性感染。初步研究发现UL138阻止赖氨酸去甲基化酶（KDMs）去除MIEP上的抑制性组蛋白修饰（27）。有趣的是，UL138定位于高尔基体，在其对MIEP的影响发生的细胞核中没有发现。本研究的主要目的是确定UL138如何阻止去甲基化酶被招募到MIEP中，从而建立潜伏期。需要更清楚地了解UL138是如何帮助HCMV建立和维持潜伏期的，以便开发治疗方法来对抗潜在HCMV和清除潜在的蓄水池。通过我们的研究，我们将发现可能的细胞靶点来调节HCMV的潜伏期。这项研究是由UL138改变未知蛋白质的细胞运输阻止他们招募KDM加入MIEP的假设驱动的。支持这一假设的UL138包含四个高尔基分类基序，并改变了一些蛋白质（33，34，35，37）的亚细胞定位。将测试这些分选基序和细胞分选机制对UL138介导的MIEP抑制的需求，并鉴定UL138必须与之相互作用以使MIEP沉默的蛋白质。

Project summary Human cytomegalovirus (HCMV) is a major human pathogen infecting 60-90% of the population. Its ability to establish latency and persist for the life of the host contributes to its widespread success as a pathogen. While infection in healthy adults is relatively asymptomatic HCMV can cause severe disease in immunocompromised patients such as transplant and HIV/AIDS patients and those with undeveloped immune systems. Importantly disease can be caused by virus reactivating after decades of latency when immune defenses are compromised. The viral protein UL138 is required to establish and maintain latency and is retained in all clinical isolates but lost upon serial passage in fibroblasts (25, 26, 28). UL138?s critical role during latency makes it an ideal target to combat latent infection. When expressed from a latency defective HCMV strain AD169, UL138 prevents histone deacetylase (HDAC) inhibitor valproic acid (VPA) induced expression of the viral protein IE1 from the major immediate early promoter (MIEP); blocking the first step of a lytic infection (27). This critical checkpoint determines whether HCMV will undergo a lytic or latent infection. Initial studies have found UL138 prevents lysine demethylases (KDMs) from removing repressive histone modifications on the MIEP (27). Intriguingly, UL138 localizes to the Golgi apparatus and has not been found in the nucleus where its effect on the MIEP takes place. The primary goal of this study is to identify how UL138 prevents demethylases from being recruited to the MIEP allowing for the establishment of latency. A clearer understanding of how UL138 helps HCMV establish and maintain latency is needed to develop treatments to combat latent HCMV and to clear the latent reservoir. Through our studies possible cellular targets to modulate HCMV latency will be discovered. This research is driven by the hypothesis that UL138 alters cellular trafficking of an unidentified protein(s) preventing them from recruiting KDMs to the MIEP. Supporting this hypothesis UL138 contains four Golgi sorting motifs and alters the subcellular localization of several proteins (33, 34, 35, 37). The requirement for these sorting motifs and cellular sorting machinery for UL138 mediated suppression of the MIEP will be tested and the proteins UL138 must interact with to silence the MIEP will be identified.

Source.Name: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases

Project.Title: Existential Phenomenology and Philsophy

Title_Other.Title: 存在主义现象学与哲学
Existential Phenomenology and Philsophy

Project.Abstract: To complete a book on the constructive uses of existential/phenomenology for the philosophy of natural science, i.e. the uses of observed phenomena in forming theories about functioning and purpose of the world in which we live.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: To complete a book on the constructive uses of existential/phenomenology for the philosophy of natural science, i.e. the uses of observed phenomena in forming theories about functioning and purpose of the world in which we live.
完成一本关于存在主义/现象学在自然科学哲学中的建设性用途的书，即观察到的现象在形成关于我们所生活的世界的功能和目的的理论中的用途。

Project.Title: The Pathogenesis of Kawasaki Disease

Title_Other.Title: The Pathogenesis of Kawasaki Disease
川崎病的发病机理

Project.Abstract: DESCRIPTION (provided by applicant): A major pediatric research priority and the long-term goal of my laboratory is the identification of the etiology and pathogenesis of Kawasaki Disease (KD), the leading cause of acquired heart disease in children in developed nations. KD can result in coronary artery aneurysm (CAA) formation with resultant myocardial infarction and/or sudden death. Clinical and epidemiologic data are consistent with an infectious cause of KD, but conventional methods have not yielded the etiologic agent. We discovered that oligoclonal IgA plasma cells, CD8 T lymphocytes, and macrophages infiltrate CAA and other tissues in acute KD, indicating an antigen-driven response to an intracellular pathogen, such as a virus, with a mucosal portal of entry. We found that macrophages in CAA secrete matrix metalloproteinases and other secreted products that may result in tissue damage. In the prior funding period, we made oligoclonal KD antibodies in vitro and used them as tools to identify their target antigens. Immunohistochemistry revealed that KD synthetic antibodies detected antigen in acute KD but not control bronchial epithelium and in a subset of macrophages in acute inflamed KD tissues. In acute KD ciliated bronchial epithelium, antigen localized to distinctive perinuclear intracytoplasmic spheroids. Light microscopy using H&E, trichrome and nucleic acid stains revealed that the spheroids in ciliated bronchial epithelium were cytoplasmic inclusion bodies (CIB), and transmission electron microscopy (TEM) of these cells in 4/4 acute KD patients showed homogeneous electron-dense CIB. The CIB were most consistent with aggregates of protein and associated nucleic acid and likely derive from the KD etiologic agent. Thus, synthetic antibodies derived from IgA sequences prevalent in plasma cells infiltrating acute KD arterial wall bind to CIB in acute KD ciliated bronchial epithelium, attesting to the likely importance of the CIB in KD pathogenesis. These data support the hypothesis that the KD agent enters via the respiratory tract, infects bronchial epithelium, and travels in macrophages to targeted tissues including coronary arteries, with antigen- specific IgA plasma cells and other inflammatory cells entering the tissues to combat the pathogen and resulting in tissue damage. The presence of CIB consistent with aggregates of microbial, likely viral, proteins and nucleic acids in acute KD lung provides a structural and molecular footprint that could lead to identification of the KD etiologic agent. The specific aims of this proposal are to 1) Identify the cell and tissue types in which CIB form in acute KD, and search these cells/tissues for microbial elements by TEM;2) identify the nucleic acid/protein contents of KD CIB;and 3), building upon our prior studies of macrophage-secreted factors that play a role in CAA formation in acute KD, determine whether dysregulation of members of the tumor necrosis factor (TNF)- and TNF-receptor superfamily contribute to KD vasculopathy. The goals of these studies are to determine whether CIB derive from the KD etiologic agent and to identify new targets for therapy of acute KD.KD is the leading cause of acquired heart disease in children in developed nations and can result in heart attacks and sudden death. Clinical and epidemiologic features point to a common infectious agent, but the cause remains unknown. PUBLIC HEALTH RELEVANCE: The goal of these studies is to determine whether cytoplasmic inclusion bodies in KD patient tissues derive from the KD etiologic agent, and to identify new targets for therapy of KD.
