Clinical and epidemiologic features point to a common infectious agent, but the cause remains unknown. PUBLIC HEALTH RELEVANCE: The goal of these studies is to determine whether cytoplasmic inclusion bodies in KD patient tissues derive from the KD etiologic agent, and to identify new targets for therapy of KD.

描述（由申请人提供）：我实验室的长期目标是确定川崎病（KD）的病因和发病机制，川崎病是发达国家儿童获得性心脏病的主要病因。KD可导致冠状动脉瘤（CAA）形成，导致心肌梗死和/或猝死。临床和流行病学数据与KD的感染原因一致，但传统方法尚未产生病因。我们发现，在急性KD中，寡克隆IgA浆细胞、CD8 T淋巴细胞和巨噬细胞浸润CAA和其他组织，表明抗原驱动的对细胞内病原体（如病毒）的反应具有粘膜入口。我们发现CAA中的巨噬细胞分泌基质金属蛋白酶和其他可能导致组织损伤的分泌产物。在前期的研究中，我们在体外制备了寡克隆KD抗体，并将其作为鉴定靶抗原的工具。免疫组化结果显示，KD合成抗体可在急性KD组织中检测到抗原，但不能控制支气管上皮细胞和巨噬细胞亚群。在急性KD纤毛支气管上皮中，抗原定位于独特的核周胞浆内球体。光镜下H&E、三色和核酸染色显示纤毛支气管上皮中的球状体为胞质包涵体（CIB），透射电镜（TEM）显示4/4例急性KD患者均为电子致密的CIB。CIB与蛋白质和相关核酸的聚集体最为一致，可能来源于KD病原。因此，从弥漫于急性KD动脉壁的血浆细胞中的IgA序列中获得的合成抗体与急性KD纤毛支气管上皮中的CIB结合，证明了CIB在KD发病中的可能重要性。这些数据支持这样的假设，即KD制剂通过呼吸道进入，感染支气管上皮，并通过巨噬细胞进入包括冠状动脉在内的靶组织，抗原特异性IgA浆细胞和其他炎性细胞进入组织以对抗病原体并导致组织损伤。CIB的存在与急性KD肺中的微生物、可能的病毒、蛋白质和核酸的聚集相一致，提供了一个结构和分子足迹，可以导致KD病原的鉴定。本提案的具体目的是：1）确定急性KD中CIB形成的细胞和组织类型，并通过透射电镜（TEM）对这些细胞/组织中的微生物元素进行搜索；2）确定KD-CIB的核酸/蛋白质含量；3）在我们先前对在急性KD中CAA形成中起作用的巨噬细胞分泌因子的研究基础上，确定肿瘤坏死因子（TNF）和TNF受体超家族成员的失调是否与KD血管病变有关。这些研究的目的是确定CIB是否来源于KD的病因，并确定治疗急性KD的新靶点。KD是发达国家儿童获得性心脏病的主要病因，可导致心脏病发作和猝死。临床和流行病学特征表明是一种常见的传染源，但病因尚不清楚。公共卫生相关性：这些研究的目的是确定KD患者组织中的细胞质包涵体是否来源于KD病原，并确定KD治疗的新靶点。

Source.Name: National Heart Lung and Blood Institute

Project.Title: AF: Small: Collaborative Research: Effective Numerical Algorithms and Software for Nonlinear Eigenvalue Problems

Title_Other.Title: AF:Small:协作研究：非线性特征值问题的有效数值算法和软件
AF: Small: Collaborative Research: Effective Numerical Algorithms and Software for Nonlinear Eigenvalue Problems

Project.Abstract: The eigenvalue problem is a central topic in science and engineering arising from a wide range of applications and posing major numerical challenges. For decades, it has been the focus of numerous theoretical research activities for developing various efficient numerical algorithms. These efforts have led to the development of new software that is essential to assist the everyday work of many engineers and scientists. In spite of progress made on solving the eigenvalue problem, methods available for handling these problems remain limited in their scope and they have not resulted in effective general-purpose software so far. The primary goal of this project is to fill this gap by advancing the state of the art in solution methods for nonlinear eigenvalue problems which are both mathematically and practically far more challenging than the traditional linear eigenvalue problems. The combined expertise of the investigating team is well suited for exploring new algorithms in this arena, analyzing them, and developing new effective software that can universally impact a wide range of disciplines (engineering, physics, chemistry, and biology). The outcome of the project are expected to open new and efficient ways to solve nonlinear eigenvalue problems. A new suite of state of the art numerical routines will be developed, fully tested, and publicly released. The goal of this project is to advance the state-of-the-art in solution methods for nonlinear eigenvalue problems. The new approaches that are envisioned are expected to be particularly effective for solving large-scale problems using parallelism. The main thrust of the project is the development of novel eigenvalue algorithms based on generalizations of Cauchy integral type methods for the nonlinear case, combined with projection methods such as Krylov and subspace iteration. A starting point in this investigation is the FEAST approach which will be adapted to the nonlinear context. Because the problems under consideration are expected to be large and sparse, the team will investigate methods that rely on domain decomposition where the original physical domain is partitioned into a number of subdomains in order to exploit parallelism. Among other goals, the team will carefully study the extension of the tools that are exploited in the linear case, such as spectrum slicing (computing eigenvalues by parts), block methods, and iterative linear solves, to the nonlinear case. This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 特征值问题是科学和工程中的一个中心问题，它的应用范围广泛，对数值计算提出了重大挑战。几十年来，发展各种高效的数值算法一直是众多理论研究活动的焦点。这些努力已导致开发新的软件，这是必不可少的，以协助许多工程师和科学家的日常工作。尽管在求解特征值问题方面取得了一些进展，但可用于处理这些问题的方法仍然局限于它们的范围，而且迄今为止还没有产生有效的通用软件。本计画的主要目标是藉由提升非线性本征值问题的最新解方法来填补这一空白，这些非线性本征值问题在数学上和实务上都远比传统的线性本征值问题更具挑战性。调查小组的综合专业知识非常适合在这个领域探索新的算法，分析它们，并开发新的有效软件，这些软件可以普遍影响广泛的学科（工程、物理、化学和生物学）。该项目的成果有望为非线性特征值问题的求解开辟新的有效途径。一套新的最先进的数字程序将被开发、充分测试和公开发布。本计画的目标是提升非线性本征值问题解的最新方法。所设想的新方法对于使用并行性解决大规模问题特别有效。该项目的主要目的是发展新的特征值算法，基于非线性情况下的柯西积分型方法的推广，结合投影法，如Krylov和子空间迭代。本研究的一个出发点是适合非线性背景的盛宴方法。由于所考虑的问题预计将是大而稀疏的，因此团队将研究依赖于域分解的方法，其中原始物理域被划分为多个子域以利用并行性。除其他目标外，该团队将仔细研究在线性情况下开发的工具的扩展，如谱切片（按部分计算特征值）、块方法和迭代线性求解，以扩展到非线性情况。该奖项反映了NSF的法定使命，通过使用基金会的知识价值和更广泛的影响审查标准进行评估，被认为值得支持。

Project.Title: Corrosion Prevention Coatings

Title_Other.Title: Corrosion Prevention Coatings
防腐涂料

Class.ClassName: 金属腐蚀、金属表面处理

Project.Abstract: Military aircraft are largely constructed from special aluminum alloys, which typically have secondary precipitate phases that substantially improve mechanical strength. However, these regions also promote corrosion in such common environmental conditionsas acid rain, saltwater, and thermal cycling. The problem is significant enough that the U.S. Air Force expends approximately $1 billion per year on corrosion-related maintenance for its aluminum-skinned aircraft. The team of CMS Technetronics and tworesearch groups from Oklahoma State University proposes to develop next-generation, nanoengineered surface treatments that will meet the goals of superior protection against corrosion, environmental compliance, and controllable removal. The team'sadvanced, integrated, composite-nanophasic materials systems can provide the USAF with corrosion-inhibiting properties superior to present coatings systems.The development of advanced corrosion suppression methods utilizing nanoengineered structures offersnew opportunities for aircraft corrosion prevention and maintenance. Use of

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 军用飞机主要由特殊的铝合金制成，这些合金通常具有二次沉淀相，可显著提高机械强度。然而，在酸雨、盐水和热循环等常见环境条件下，这些区域也会促进腐蚀。这个问题非常严重，美国空军每年在铝皮飞机的腐蚀相关维修上花费大约10亿美元。CMS Technetronics团队和俄克拉荷马州立大学的两个研究小组提议开发下一代纳米工程表面处理技术，以达到更好的防腐、环保和可控去除的目标。该团队先进的、集成的复合纳米材料系统可以为美国空军提供优于现有涂层系统的缓蚀性能，利用纳米工程结构开发先进的缓蚀方法为飞机防腐和维修提供了新的机会。使用

Source.Name: United States Department of the Air Force

Project.Title: Targeting Neovascular Age-Related Macular Degeneration with Two-Photon Photodynamic Therapy

Title_Other.Title: Targeting Neovascular Age-Related Macular Degeneration with Two-Photon Photodynamic Therapy
双光子光动力疗法靶向治疗新生血管性老年性黄斑变性

Class.ClassName: 气体压缩、气体压缩机械

Project.Abstract: Age-Related Macular Degeneration (AMD) is a major cause of severe vision loss in the elderly. It occurs due to growth of new blood vessels in the central vision region. These blood vessels leak blood and damage light sensitive cells, leading to blindness. "Standard" 1-photon photodynamic therapy (PDT) using the drug Visudyne is an approved method of AMD treatment. PDT is based on combined action of light and the drug. Unfortunately, 1-photon PDT also damages healthy regions around these diseased vessels due to drug accumulation. Also, the treatment needs to be repeated every 3-4 months for 2 years as new vessels reappear. Two-photon PDT is a possible solution to this problem. The hypothesis is that simultaneous 2-photon PDT is really focused and avoids damage to surrounding healthy eye tissues. This should improve the outcome and decrease the number of repeat treatments required. The aim of my research is to test the possibility of 2-photon PDT. In order to do that, I am optimizing certain biological methods to estimate the effectiveness of novel 2-photon drugs. I have recently tested the efficacy of a new 2-photon drug, synthesized by our collaborator in UK, in my adapted in vivo mouse blood vessel model. The results showed for the first time that a blood vessel can be closed by focused 2-photon PDT treatment. Future studies will focus on optimizing different parameters such as drug dose and light dose. This study will contribute towards determining the pre-clinical efficacy of this novel drug. Once these studies are completed, this drug will be tested in eye vessels of rat/rabbit before moving to clinical investigations.

These blood vessels leak blood and damage light sensitive cells, leading to blindness. "Standard" 1-photon photodynamic therapy (PDT) using the drug Visudyne is an approved method of AMD treatment. PDT is based on combined action of light and the drug. Unfortunately, 1-photon PDT also damages healthy regions around these diseased vessels due to drug accumulation. Also, the treatment needs to be repeated every 3-4 months for 2 years as new vessels reappear. Two-photon PDT is a possible solution to this problem. 老年性黄斑变性（AMD）是老年人严重视力丧失的主要原因。它的发生是由于中央视觉区域新血管的生长。这些血管会泄漏血液，损害感光细胞，导致失明。”标准的“使用Visudyne药物的单光子光动力疗法（PDT）是一种公认的AMD治疗方法。PDT是基于光和药物的联合作用。不幸的是，由于药物积聚，单光子PDT也会损害病变血管周围的健康区域。另外，随着新血管的出现，治疗需要每3-4个月重复一次，持续2年。双光子PDT是解决这一问题的可能途径。假设同时进行的双光子PDT是真正聚焦的，避免了对周围健康眼组织的损害。这将改善治疗结果，减少重复治疗的次数。我的研究目的是测试双光子PDT的可能性。为了做到这一点，我正在优化某些生物学方法，以评估新型双光子药物的疗效。我最近在我的活体小鼠血管模型中测试了一种新的双光子药物的疗效，这种药物是由我们在英国的合作者合成的。结果表明，聚焦双光子PDT治疗首次实现了血管闭合。未来的研究将集中在优化不同的参数，如药物剂量和光剂量。这项研究将有助于确定这种新药的临床前疗效。一旦这些研究完成，这种药物将在进入临床研究之前在大鼠/兔的血管中进行试验。

Project.Title: High Dynamic Range Broadband Fiber Optic Links

Title_Other.Title: High Dynamic Range Broadband Fiber Optic Links
高动态范围宽带光纤链路

Class.ClassName: 有线通信、通信线路工程

Project.Abstract: The development of large dynamic range, linear response optical transmitters would allow significantly lower cost lasers to be used in many microwave analog data links for video, sensor, and optoelectronic signal/image processing in phased array applications. Our approach will decrease the distortions caused by second and third order harmonics of a signal and by cross modulation with other signals in the laser transmitter. Multi-function phased array antennas require low loss, high dynamic range RF/microwave transport from the array elements to image processing receiver electronics located many motors from the antenna. This type of application finds an excellent fit with fiber optic links when the laser transmitter and optical processing receiver provide low noise, wide- bandwidth high dynamic operation and the connecting fiber provides low thermal coefficient of delay. TACAN proposes a novel broadband high power, low chirp laser link with high dynamic range to support command, control, communications, and intelligence (C31) systems for transporting up to 5 GHz signal spectra with high SNR and extremely low distortion.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 大动态范围、线性响应光发射机的发展将使成本显著降低的激光器可以用于许多微波模拟数据链路，用于相控阵应用中的视频、传感器和光电信号/图像处理。我们的方法将减少由信号的二阶和三阶谐波以及与激光发射机中其他信号的交叉调制所引起的失真。多功能相控阵天线需要低损耗、高动态范围的射频/微波传输，从阵列元件传输到图像处理接收器电子设备，接收器电子设备位于天线的许多电机上。当激光发射机和光处理接收机提供低噪声、宽带宽、高动态工作和连接光纤提供低热延迟系数时，这种应用与光纤链路非常匹配。塔康提出了一种新型宽带高功率、低啁啾、高动态范围的激光链路，以支持指挥、控制、通信和智能（C31）系统，用于传输高信噪比、低失真、高达5ghz的信号频谱。

The development of large dynamic range, linear response optical transmitters would allow significantly lower cost lasers to be used in many microwave analog data links for video, sensor, and optoelectronic signal/image processing in phased array applications. Our approach will decrease the distortions caused by second and third order harmonics of a signal and by cross modulation with other signals in the laser transmitter. Multi-function phased array antennas require low loss, high dynamic range RF/microwave transport from the array elements to image processing receiver electronics located many motors from the antenna. This type of application finds an excellent fit with fiber optic links when the laser transmitter and optical processing receiver provide low noise, wide- bandwidth high dynamic operation and the connecting fiber provides low thermal coefficient of delay. TACAN proposes a novel broadband high power, low chirp laser link with high dynamic range to support command, control, communications, and intelligence (C31) systems for transporting up to 5 GHz signal spectra with high SNR and extremely low distortion.

Source.Name: United States Department of the Navy

Project.Title: N6-methyladenosine and the biology of HIV

Title_Other.Title: N6-甲基腺苷与HIV生物学
N6-methyladenosine and the biology of HIV

Project.Abstract: DESCRIPTION (provided by applicant): Recent technological advances showed that m6A methylation is abundant in human mRNA and long non- coding RNA and can guide a wide range of cellular processes. The HIV genome comprises numerous putative m6A modification sites and our preliminary experimental data show that m6A modifications are present in the HIV genome. The overall goal of the proposed research is to pinpoint the precise sites of m6Amodifications within the HIV genomic RNA and to determine the functional impact of these modifications on HIV biology. In Aim 1 we will apply Site-specific Cleavage And Radioactive-labeling followed by Ligation-assisted Extraction and Thin-layer chromatography (SCARLET), to quantify and precisely locate m6A modifications at a single nucleotide resolution. In Aim 2 we will study the effects of m6A RNA modifications on HIV infectivity and viral production. In addition, we will test the effect of varying m6A in HIV on the immunogenicity of HIV by infecting monocyte derived dendritic cells. The proposed experiments will characterize a novel mode of RNA modification of HIV RNA. The characterization of HIV m6A modifications and its elucidation of its role in the HIV life cycle would not only expand our knowledge of HIV, but also for other viruses that are m6A modified.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: ? The HIV genome comprises numerous putative m6A modification sites and our preliminary experimental data show that m6A modifications are present in the HIV genome. The overall goal of the proposed research is to pinpoint the precise sites of m6Amodifications within the HIV genomic RNA and to determine the functional impact of these modifications on HIV biology. In Aim 1 we will apply Site-specific Cleavage And Radioactive-labeling followed by Ligation-assisted Extraction and Thin-layer chromatography (SCARLET), to quantify and precisely locate m6A modifications at a single nucleotide resolution. In Aim 2 we will study the effects of m6A RNA modifications on HIV infectivity and viral production. ? 说明（申请人提供）：最近的技术进展表明，m6A甲基化在人的mRNA和长的非编码RNA中非常丰富，可以指导多种细胞过程。HIV基因组包含许多假定的m6A修饰位点，我们的初步实验数据表明，m6A修饰存在于HIV基因组中。该研究的总体目标是确定m6a修饰在HIV基因组RNA中的精确位置，并确定这些修饰对HIV生物学的功能影响。在目的1中，我们将应用位点特异性切割和放射性标记，然后连接辅助提取和薄层色谱（猩红），以在单核苷酸分辨率下量化和精确定位m6A修饰。在目的2中，我们将研究m6A RNA修饰对HIV感染性和病毒产生的影响。此外，我们还将通过感染单核细胞衍生的树突状细胞来测试HIV中m6A的变化对HIV免疫原性的影响。该实验将描述一种新的HIV RNA的RNA修饰模式。对HIV-m6A修饰的表征及其在HIV生命周期中的作用的阐明，不仅可以扩展我们对HIV的认识，而且可以用于其它m6A修饰的病毒。

Project.Title: The Drosophila Dot Chromosome: Gene Expression in the Context of Repetitious DNA

Title_Other.Title: The Drosophila Dot Chromosome: Gene Expression in the Context of Repetitious DNA
Drosophila dot染色体：基因在重复DNA上下文中的表达

Class.ClassName: 航天器发射、航天器发射控制、航天器返回
理论、技术、方法、研究、评价、策略

Project.Abstract: The chromosomes of eukaryotes contain tightly packed regions known as heterochromatin. Genes in these regions are typically silenced; however, some genes in heterochromatic regions are actively expressed. The aim of this project is to address this long-standing and important question in the field of gene regulation: what is the mechanism that allows certain genes located in heterochromatic regions to be expressed? This work is a collaborative effort with the students and faculty of the Genomics Education Partnership. Undergraduate students from over 60 colleges and universities will analyze heterochromatic DNA sequences in the fourth chromosome of several fruit fly species. The goal of this work is to identify potential regulatory motifs for gene expression in heterochromatic DNA. This process will allow the students to develop basic bioinformatics skills, participate in genomics research, and be contributors (and co-authors) on the resulting publications. The fourth chromosome of Drosophila melanogaster, with a 30% repeat density, is largely heterochromatic; as illustrated by the variegating phenotype of an hsp70-white reporter gene at most insertion sites on the fourth chromosome. This silencing appears to be due to packaging in a heterochromatic form. While high levels of HP1a and H3K9me2/3 are found across the body of fourth chromosome genes, their transcription start sites (TSSs) consistently show depletion of these silencing marks. This project hase identified a "landing pad" site (a MiMIC line) on the fourth chromosome where an inserted hsp70-white transgene gives a variegated phenotype, while a fourth chromosome gene (Rad23) tagged with a fluorescent marker shows full expression. Gene fragments between these constructs will be swapped to determine what features of the fourth chromosome gene drive full expression in this heterochromatic environment, with an initial focus on the region around the TSS. The goal of this project is to determine the sequence elements necessary and sufficient to drive full expression of hsp70-white at this chromatin site, and conversely those changes that would result in variegation of Rad23 (Elements involved in transcription elongation may prove to be as important as the TSS, and will not be neglected). Key motifs identified by the bioinformatics approach will be tested in this system, and vice-versa. The chromatin structure of the various lines will be checked by both genetic and biochemical approaches (analysis of the impact of Su(var) mutations; ChIP-PCR experiments). These studies will lead to a better understanding of heterochromatic gene regulation, and identification of motifs (some of which may be novel) that influence gene expression in repeat-rich domains that are also common in the genomes of higher eukaryotes.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 真核生物的染色体包含紧密排列的异染色质区域。这些区域的基因通常是沉默的；然而，一些异色区域的基因是积极表达的。这个项目的目的是解决基因调控领域中的这个长期而重要的问题：是什么机制使得位于异色区的某些基因得以表达？这项工作是一项与基因组学教育伙伴关系的学生和教师的合作努力。来自60多所高校的大学生将分析几种果蝇第四染色体的异色DNA序列。这项工作的目的是确定在异色DNA中基因表达的潜在调控基序。这一过程将允许学生发展基本的生物信息学技能，参与基因组学研究，并成为最终出版物的撰稿人（和合著者）。黑腹果蝇的第四条染色体具有30%的重复密度，主要是异染色质；如hsp70白色报告基因在第四条染色体上大多数插入位点的杂色表型所示。这种沉默似乎是由于包装在异色形式。虽然在第四染色体基因体中发现高水平的HP1a和H3K9me2/3，但它们的转录起始位点（TSSs）始终显示这些沉默标记的缺失。这个项目阶段在第四条染色体上发现了一个“着陆板”位点（一个模拟线），其中一个插入的hsp70白色转基因产生了一个杂色表型，而第四条染色体基因（Rad23）标记了一个荧光标记，显示出完全表达。这些结构物之间的基因片段将被交换，以确定第四染色体基因的哪些特征在这种异色环境中推动了完全表达，最初的重点是TSS周围的区域。这个项目的目标是确定在这个染色质位点上驱动hsp70白蛋白充分表达所必需的和足够的序列元素，相反，这些改变会导致Rad23的杂色（参与转录延长的元素可能和TSS一样重要，并且不会被忽略）。生物信息学方法识别的关键基序将在该系统中进行测试，反之亦然。将通过遗传和生化方法（Su（var）突变的影响分析；芯片PCR实验）检查不同系的染色质结构。这些研究将有助于更好地理解异染色质基因的调控，以及鉴定影响基因在重复丰富区域表达的基序（其中一些基序可能是新的），这些重复丰富的区域在高等真核生物的基因组中也很常见。

The chromosomes of eukaryotes contain tightly packed regions known as heterochromatin. Genes in these regions are typically silenced; however, some genes in heterochromatic regions are actively expressed. The aim of this project is to address this long-standing and important question in the field of gene regulation: what is the mechanism that allows certain genes located in heterochromatic regions to be expressed? This work is a collaborative effort with the students and faculty of the Genomics Education Partnership. Undergraduate students from over 60 colleges and universities will analyze heterochromatic DNA sequences in the fourth chromosome of several fruit fly species. The goal of this work is to identify potential regulatory motifs for gene expression in heterochromatic DNA. This process will allow the students to develop basic bioinformatics skills, participate in genomics research, and be contributors (and co-authors) on the resulting publications. The fourth chromosome of Drosophila melanogaster, with a 30% repeat density, is largely heterochromatic; as illustrated by the variegating phenotype of an hsp70-white reporter gene at most insertion sites on the fourth chromosome. This silencing appears to be due to packaging in a heterochromatic form. While high levels of HP1a and H3K9me2/3 are found across the body of fourth chromosome genes, their transcription start sites (TSSs) consistently show depletion of these silencing marks. This project hase identified a "landing pad" site (a MiMIC line) on the fourth chromosome where an inserted hsp70-white transgene gives a variegated phenotype, while a fourth chromosome gene (Rad23) tagged with a fluorescent marker shows full expression. Gene fragments between these constructs will be swapped to determine what features of the fourth chromosome gene drive full expression in this heterochromatic environment, with an initial focus on the region around the TSS. The goal of this project is to determine the sequence elements necessary and sufficient to drive full expression of hsp70-white at this chromatin site, and conversely those changes that would result in variegation of Rad23 (Elements involved in transcription elongation may prove to be as important as the TSS, and will not be neglected). Key motifs identified by the bioinformatics approach will be tested in this system, and vice-versa. The chromatin structure of the various lines will be checked by both genetic and biochemical approaches (analysis of the impact of Su(var) mutations; ChIP-PCR experiments). These studies will lead to a better understanding of heterochromatic gene regulation, and identification of motifs (some of which may be novel) that influence gene expression in repeat-rich domains that are also common in the genomes of higher eukaryotes.

Project.Title: Enhancing the dog as a model for human cancers: from genome sequence towards clinical trials.

Title_Other.Title: 增强狗作为人类癌症模型：从基因组序列到临床试验。
Enhancing the dog as a model for human cancers: from genome sequence towards clinical trials.

Project.Abstract: SUMMARY The domestic dog has become increasingly useful as a comparative spontaneous cancer model to study genetic and environmental risk factors as well as for easing the transition between rodent and human clinical trials for novel cancer therapies. The many similarities between various cancer types affecting humans and dogs and the spontaneous development of these cancers in immune competent canine individuals living in a shared environment with us suggest a common aetiology. The shorter lifespan of dogs and the shorter time to relapse after cancer treatment allows data regarding efficacy, short and long term toxicity and side effects of novel cancer drugs to be generated in years rather than decades as in human clinical trials. However, certain limitations need to be overcome to make full use of the dog model. Slightly different classification systems for common cancers limit translation of data and clinical outcome from dog to human. The canine genome and annotation, especially that of complex immune gene families, could be improved to allow a more careful and correct comparison with the human genome and immune response, a key factor in cancer development and treatment. Using novel long-read sequencing techniques, we will generate a platinum CanFam4.0 genome and improved information of both gene and variant annotation for an old healthy female German shepherd. In addition, we will specifically focus on canine mammary tumors, lymphoma and osteosarcoma where improved models would benefit human studies, and the canine forms are diverse and only partly characterized. Since the molecular sub-classifications used in human cancers are not yet used for these canine cancers, we plan to characterize these tumor types in the dog population using several approaches to meet human standards. We will further set up a Scandinavian-wide veterinary oncology network for research collaboration, increased use of the dog as a model. We will perform repeated blood sampling from dogs with malignant mammary tumors to allow the study of tumor evolution and progression. All of this work will lay the groundwork to enable more useful and efficient future clinical trials.

In addition, we will specifically focus on canine mammary tumors, lymphoma and osteosarcoma where improved models would benefit human studies, and the canine forms are diverse and only partly characterized. 摘要家养犬作为一种比较自发的癌症模型，在研究遗传和环境危险因素以及缓解啮齿动物与人类之间的过渡方面，对于新的癌症治疗方法的临床试验，已经变得越来越有用。影响人类和狗的各种癌症类型之间的许多相似性，以及在与我们生活在同一环境中的具有免疫能力的犬类个体中这些癌症的自发发展，表明了一种共同的病因。狗的寿命较短，癌症治疗后复发的时间较短，这使得新的癌症药物的疗效、短期和长期毒性和副作用的数据可以在数年内产生，而不是像人类临床试验那样在数十年内产生。然而，要充分利用dog模型还需要克服一定的局限性。常见癌症的分类系统略有不同，限制了从狗到人的数据转换和临床结果。犬的基因组和注释，特别是复杂免疫基因家族的基因组和注释，可以得到改进，以便与人类基因组和免疫应答（癌症发展和治疗的关键因素）进行更仔细和正确的比较。利用新的长读测序技术，我们将产生一个白金canfam4.0基因组，并为一只年老健康的德国雌性牧羊犬改进基因和变异注释信息。此外，我们将特别关注犬乳腺肿瘤、淋巴瘤和骨肉瘤，改进的模型将有助于人类研究，犬型多样，只有部分特征。由于用于人类癌症的分子亚分类尚未用于这些犬类癌症，因此我们计划使用几种方法在犬类人群中描述这些肿瘤类型，以满足人类标准。我们将进一步建立一个斯堪的纳维亚范围内的兽医肿瘤学网络进行研究合作，增加以狗为模型的使用。我们将从患有恶性乳腺肿瘤的狗身上重复采集血液，以研究肿瘤的演变和进展。所有这些工作将奠定基础，使未来的临床试验更加有用和有效。

Project.Title: EUTECTIC COMBINATIONS OF HYDROEYLAMMONIUM PERCHLORATE (HAP) AND OXIDIZERS

Title_Other.Title: EUTECTIC COMBINATIONS OF HYDROEYLAMMONIUM PERCHLORATE (HAP) AND OXIDIZERS
高氯酸氢铵（HAP）与氧化剂的共晶结合

Project.Abstract: THE OBJECTIVES OF THIS PHASE I EFFORT ARE: I. STUDY EUTECTIC COMBINATIONS OF HYDROXYLAMMONIUM PERCHLORATE AND OTHER OXIDIZERS. A. DEVELOP THE PHASE DIAGRAM OF HAP AND AMMONIUM PERCHLORATE. B. DEVELOP THE PHASE DIAGRAM OF HAP AND POTASSIUM PERCHLORATE. II. STUDY THE EFFECTS OF MONOETHANOLAMINE PERCHLORATE AS A MELTING POINT DEPRESSANT WITH THE ABOVE TWO COMBINATIONS.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 第一阶段工作的目标是：研究高氯酸羟胺和其他氧化剂的共晶组合。A.绘制羟基磷灰石和高氯酸铵的相图。B.绘制羟基磷灰石和高氯酸钾的相图。二。研究了高氯酸单乙醇胺与上述两种组合作为熔点抑制剂的效果。

THE OBJECTIVES OF THIS PHASE I EFFORT ARE: I. STUDY EUTECTIC COMBINATIONS OF HYDROXYLAMMONIUM PERCHLORATE AND OTHER OXIDIZERS. A. DEVELOP THE PHASE DIAGRAM OF HAP AND AMMONIUM PERCHLORATE. B. DEVELOP THE PHASE DIAGRAM OF HAP AND POTASSIUM PERCHLORATE. II. STUDY THE EFFECTS OF MONOETHANOLAMINE PERCHLORATE AS A MELTING POINT DEPRESSANT WITH THE ABOVE TWO COMBINATIONS.

Project.Title: Skeletal muscle: development, regeneration and disease

Title_Other.Title: Skeletal muscle: development, regeneration and disease
骨骼肌的发育、再生与疾病

Project.Abstract: Sacco, Alessandra Summary The goal of the Skeletal muscle: development, regeneration and disease conference is to bring together international leaders in skeletal muscle research to provide a forum for cutting edge genetic, cellular and molecular biology underlying muscle development, regeneration and disease. This Frontiers in Myogenesis series organized by the Society for Muscle Biology has been held every three years for the last twenty years and has successfully defined the state of the art in the field. The 2019 meeting will not only discuss recent discoveries in skeletal muscle development and repair, but will also encompass advances in our understanding of human diseases, including muscular dystrophies and cancer. Our keynote speaker will be Dr. Pura Muñoz-Cánoves, who has performed exceptional work in muscle stem cell aging and rejuvenating strategies. Ten plenary sessions are planned, presenting 59 speakers (31 invited speakers and 28 selected from submitted abstracts) at the senior, mid-career and junior levels. Topics addressed will include: skeletal muscle development, myoblast fusion and nuclear positioning, regulation of muscle stem cell (MuSC) quiescence, activation, epigenetic control of MuSC, novel approaches for the derivation of MuSC from induced pluripotent stem cells, bioengineering platforms for skeletal muscle modeling, role of the tissue microenvironment in skeletal muscle repair and disease, muscular dystrophies, and cancer. Invited speakers have been selected for their scientific excellence, with particular attention to appropriate representation (39% women/minorities) and geographical diversity (45% are from non-US countries). Speakers are explicitly required to present unpublished work, to ensure scientific discussions focused at the forefront of the field. Importantly, and for the first time, we have liaised with the organizers of the Gordon Research Conference on Myogenesis (Italy, June 2019), to avoid all overlap in invited speakers at the two meetings. This mutual-exclusion policy has dramatically increased the range of young scientists (26% at Assistant Professor level) invited to speak, giving them the invaluable opportunity to present at an international conference. We have also designed the program to accommodate 28 short talks selected from abstracts, to again offer more opportunities for junior faculty and postdoc/students to present. Finally, we will have three poster sessions each accompanied by a ?posters blitz? where selected poster presenters will give a one-minute talk to highlight their work, to provide invaluable experience in presenting and facilitate networking. To further foster interaction, we will organize lunch sessions where speakers are distributed and attendees can sign up to join their tables. This meeting will provide a forum for discussing recent discoveries in skeletal muscle research, and foster cross-fertilization from diverse areas of research, to further advance our understanding of muscle biology and help in development of therapeutics.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: Sacco，Alessandra总结：骨骼肌：发展、再生和疾病会议的目标是汇集骨骼肌研究领域的国际领先者，为骨骼肌发展、再生和疾病背后的尖端遗传、细胞和分子生物学提供一个论坛。在过去的二十年中，由肌肉生物学学会组织的肌生成系列的这一前沿已经每三年举行一次，并且成功地定义了这一领域的最新技术。2019年的会议不仅将讨论骨骼肌发育和修复方面的最新发现，还将包括我们对人类疾病（包括肌营养不良和癌症）认识的进展。我们的主讲人将是Pura Muñoz-Cánoves博士，他在肌肉干细胞老化和年轻化策略方面做了卓越的工作。计划举行10次全体会议，在高级、中级和初级级别上发言的有59名发言者（31名特邀发言者和28名从提交的摘要中选出）。主题包括：骨骼肌发育、成肌细胞融合和核定位、肌肉干细胞（mucs）静止的调节、激活、mucs的表观遗传控制、从诱导多能干细胞衍生mucs的新方法、骨骼肌建模的生物工程平台，组织微环境在骨骼肌修复和疾病、肌营养不良和癌症中的作用。受邀的演讲者因其卓越的科学成就而被选中，特别注重适当的代表性（39%的妇女/少数民族）和地理多样性（45%来自非美国国家）。明确要求发言者提交未发表的工作，以确保科学讨论集中在该领域的最前沿。重要的是，我们第一次与Gordon肌生成研究会议（意大利，2019年6月）的组织者保持联系，以避免在两次会议上邀请的发言者出现重叠。这种相互排斥政策大大增加了受邀发言的年轻科学家的范围（助理教授级为26%），使他们有机会出席一次国际会议。我们还设计了这个项目，以容纳从摘要中选出的28个简短演讲，再次为初级教师和博士后/学生提供更多的演讲机会。最后，我们将有三个海报环节，每个环节都有一个？海报闪电战？其中，选定的海报演示者将进行一分钟的演讲，突出他们的工作，提供宝贵的经验，介绍和促进网络。为了进一步促进互动，我们将组织午餐会，在那里，发言者被分发，与会者可以报名加入他们的桌子。本次会议将提供一个论坛，讨论骨骼肌研究的最新发现，并促进来自不同研究领域的交叉受精，以进一步提高我们对肌肉生物学的理解，并有助于治疗学的发展。

Project.Title: PROTEASE INHIBITOR-INDUCED HYPERLIPIDEMIA IN AIDS

Title_Other.Title: 蛋白酶抑制剂诱导的艾滋病高脂血症
PROTEASE INHIBITOR-INDUCED HYPERLIPIDEMIA IN AIDS

Project.Abstract: DESCRIPTION (Adapted from the applicant's abstract) HIV-protease inhibitors (PI) prevent the maturation of nascent virions and are thus very effective in blocking further infection in HIV-positive patients. Significant reductions in mortality from AIDS have been achieved with the use of PI. Cross-sectional studies, however, have suggested accelerated atherosclerosis in HIV-positive patients receiving PI therapy and this may be associated with high prevalence of several risk factors for atherosclerosis: hyperlipidemia, hyperglycemia, insulin resistance and fat redistribution. The exact mechanisms underlying these metabolic changes are not known. Based on homology studies, HIV-protease inhibitors may interfere with the function of the low density lipoprotein receptor-related protein (LRP) and the cytoplasmic retinol binding protein (CRBP). LRP is responsible for the hepatic uptake of intestinal lipoproteins transporting dietary fats and fat- soluble vitamins such as vitamin A. Inside the cell, the transport of retinoic acid by CRBP may interact with peroxisome proliferator activator receptor (PPAR) and thus affect the production of apoC-III and the differ- entiation of adipocytes. Using non-radioactive tracers, we propose to examine the changes in lipoprotein metabolism associated with HIV infection and the therapeutic use of PI. The metabolism of oral retinol will be examined with respect to the effect of PI on LRP. The production of apoC-III, a PPAR- regulated apolipoprotein linked to hypertriglyceridemia and diabetes, will be examined with respect to its association in PI-induced hypertriglyceridemia. While hyperlipidemia may be associated with atherosclerosis, it cannot explain the accelerated progression of the disease. Changes in physiological and biochemical responses with oxidative stress associated with postprandial lipemia will be examined as a possible mechanism for accelerated disease progression. A comprehensive longitudinal study with new markers for CAD will also be conducted to characterize the progression of the risk factors with PI. In a subset of patients with hyperlipidemia, the efficacy of combined therapy with vitamin A, fibrates, and thiazoladinediones will be evaluated. These are specific agents that are effective in reducing triglyceride as well as improving insulin resistance.

In a subset of patients with hyperlipidemia, the efficacy of combined therapy with vitamin A, fibrates, and thiazoladinediones will be evaluated. These are specific agents that are effective in reducing triglyceride as well as improving insulin resistance.

描述（改编自申请人的摘要）HIV蛋白酶抑制剂（PI）防止新生病毒的成熟，因此在阻止HIV阳性患者进一步感染方面非常有效。使用PI可显著降低艾滋病死亡率。然而，横断面研究表明，接受PI治疗的HIV阳性患者动脉粥样硬化加速，这可能与动脉粥样硬化的几种危险因素的高患病率有关：高脂血症、高血糖、胰岛素抵抗和脂肪再分配。这些代谢变化的确切机制尚不清楚。根据同源性研究，HIV蛋白酶抑制剂可能干扰低密度脂蛋白受体相关蛋白（LRP）和胞浆视黄醇结合蛋白（CRBP）的功能。LRP是肝内脂蛋白的转运，脂肪酸和脂溶性维生素如维生素A在细胞内运输，维甲酸通过CRBP转运可能与过氧化物酶体增殖物激活受体（PPAR）相互作用，从而影响APCO-3的产生和脂肪细胞的不同程度。利用非放射性示踪剂，我们建议检查与HIV感染相关的脂蛋白代谢的变化以及PI的治疗应用。将根据PI对LRP的影响来检查口服视黄醇的代谢。ApoCⅢ是一种与高甘油三酯血症和糖尿病有关的PPAR调节载脂蛋白的产生，将与PI诱导的高甘油三酯血症有关。虽然高脂血症可能与动脉粥样硬化有关，但它不能解释疾病加速发展的原因。与餐后血脂相关的氧化应激的生理和生化反应的变化将被视为加速疾病进展的可能机制。此外，还将进行一项综合性的纵向研究，采用新的冠心病标志物，用PI来表征危险因素的进展。在一部分高脂血症患者中，将评估维生素a、贝特类和噻唑烷二酮类药物联合治疗的疗效。这些是在降低甘油三酯和改善胰岛素抵抗有效的特异性药物。

Project.Title: Tech Farm: hacking co-housing

Title_Other.Title: Tech Farm: hacking co-housing
科技农场：黑客联合住宅

Class.ClassName: 房屋细部构造、房屋细部构造设计
居住建筑、居住建筑设计
理论、技术、方法、研究、评价、策略

Project.Abstract:
Purpose and goal: The project aims to define and develop a new type of housing, a´co-living-property´ to meet the new values that come with the sharing economy. Where more people can fit i a smaller space through micro apartments. The long term goal is 100 properties in 10 countries. In step 1, we have developed a first draft of a design of the property and als looking at regulatory barriers and technical barriers. There are significant challenges to overcome, but the solution seems realistic.
Expected results and effects: We have found a solution for housing that reduces the square meters of space per person by 60%. Today one Stockholmer in a single household lives on average 51 square meters and the figures are similar in other large cities (Source: Statistics Sweden, the average space per person in 2014). We have found a new solution where the residents have an average of 20 square meters, while the quality of life increases. Half of the property is shared spaces such as living room, kitchen, work and gym. The private area is a cubic smart sleep module sized 4 to 10 square meters per person.
Approach and implementation: We have had the opportunity to involve more municipalities than expected which has given us a broad understanding. We have found existing studies around the needs of the target group, which has become a great addition to our own study of 20 in-depth interviews. We have found partners and competence needed for step 2. We have early drafts of concrete sketches and calculations. We have a collection of over 200 links to articles and studies in the field.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 目的和目标： 该项目旨在定义和开发一种新型住房，一种“共住物业”，以满足共享经济带来的新价值。在那里，更多的人可以通过微型公寓为我提供一个更小的空间。长期目标是在10个国家拥有100家酒店。在第1步中，我们已经制定了一份房地产和als设计初稿，旨在研究监管障碍和技术障碍。有重大挑战需要克服，但解决办法似乎是现实的。 预期结果和效果： 我们找到了一种解决住房问题的办法，使人均住房面积减少60%。如今，一户人家中有一个斯托克福尔摩斯的平均居住面积为51平方米，其他大城市的数据也差不多（来源：瑞典统计局，2014年人均居住面积）。我们找到了一个新的解决方案，居民平均拥有20平方米，同时生活质量提高。一半的财产是共享空间，如客厅，厨房，工作和健身房。私人区域是一个立方智能睡眠模块，每人4至10平方米。 方法和实施： 我们有机会让更多的市镇参与进来，这使我们有了广泛的了解。我们发现现有的研究都是围绕着目标群体的需求展开的，这已经成为我们自己20次深入访谈研究的一大补充。我们找到了第二步所需的合作伙伴和能力。我们有混凝土草图和计算的早期草稿。我们有超过200个链接到该领域的文章和研究。

Project.Title: An MD-MSM Study of Allosterism on the DNA Repair Protein MutS

Title_Other.Title: 变构作用对DNA修复蛋白MutS的MD-MSM研究
An MD-MSM Study of Allosterism on the DNA Repair Protein MutS

Project.Abstract: Allosterism is involved in almost all regulatory, signaling and control processes in cells. While there are many observations of the net effect of allosterism, a number of questions remain about the nature of this process at the molecular level. These include the role of induced fit vs. conformational selection in ligand binding and clarification of the actual mechanism of allosteric signal transmission, whether this involves a distinct pathway, a cooperative network of residues, correlated motional fluctuations or simply a perturbation of the energy landscape. Obtaining a deeper understanding of the dynamics of allostery has been especially challenging, since the signal transmission per se is not directly accessible to experiment. The idea behind our proposed project is that much can be learned about allosterism from the detailed study of a well-chosen prototype system by all-atom molecular dynamics (MD) simulations with analysis using Markov State Models (MSM), kinetic grouping analysis (KGA) and cFEP free energy profiles. The system chosen for study is the large, multi-domain protein MutS and its pathological mutants. MutS and eukaryotic homologs recognize errors in DNA replication and initiate mismatch repair. In Muts, DNA binding and ATP/ADP activities are allosterically coupled over a distance of ~ 70 Angstroms, but the mechanism of signal transmission over such a large distance has not been unequivocally determined. MutS and homologs are the focus of a biochemical research program in the laboratory of our collaborator here, Professor Manju Hingorani in the Department of Molecular Biology and Biochemistry. New in this proposal is the analysis of MD on MutS via a Markov State Model, which elucidates substate structure of a protein or DNA and enables the study of dynamical allosterism in terms of a proper Boltzmann ensemble. Specifically, we propose a) to carry out extended MD simulations on MutS and selected pathological mutants in aqueous solution at biological ionic strengths, considering all relevant combinations of DNA and ATP bound and unbound constructs; b) to cluster the MD trajectories on MutS and apply kinetic grouping analyses to obtain MSM to obtain substates of MutS, their structural properties, populations (thermodynamics), the rates of interconversions (kinetics) for the various MutS processes; and c) to analyze the MSM to elucidate the dynamics of allosteric signal transmission based on the calculated states and rates; apply this to search for new allosteric druggable sites.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 变构作用几乎涉及细胞内所有的调控、信号和控制过程。尽管有许多关于变构作用的净效应的观察，但在分子水平上，这一过程的性质仍然存在一些问题。这包括诱导拟合与构象选择在配体结合中的作用，以及澄清变构信号传递的实际机制，无论这是否涉及一个独特的途径、一个残基的合作网络、相关的运动波动或仅仅是能量景观的扰动。由于信号传输本身不易被实验直接获得，因此深入了解同位体的动力学特性尤其具有挑战性。我们提出这个计划的想法是，通过全原子分子动力学（MD）模拟和马尔可夫状态模型（MSM）、动力学分组分析（KGA）和cFEP自由能谱分析，对一个精心选择的原型系统进行详细研究，可以学到很多关于变构的知识。所选择的研究体系是大的、多域的蛋白质MutS及其病理突变株。MutS和真核同系物识别DNA复制中的错误并启动错配修复。在Muts中，DNA结合和ATP/ADP活性在约70angstroms的距离上是变构耦合的，但在如此大的距离上信号传递的机制尚未明确确定。MutS和同系物是我们的合作者、分子生物学和生物化学系的Manju Hingorani教授在实验室的一个生化研究项目的重点。新的建议是通过马尔可夫状态模型对MutS上的MD进行分析，该模型阐明了蛋白质或DNA的亚态结构，并使根据适当的Boltzmann系综研究动态变构成为可能。具体地说，我们建议a）考虑到DNA和ATP结合和非结合结构的所有相关组合，在生物离子强度的水溶液中对MutS和选定的病理突变体进行扩展的MD模拟；b） 将分子动力学轨迹聚类，应用动力学分组分析得到分子动力学模型，得到分子动力学模型的子态、结构性质、总体（热力学）、相互转化率（动力学）；（c）根据计算的状态和速率分析MSM，阐明变构信号传递的动力学；应用此方法寻找新的变构药物位点。

Allosterism is involved in almost all regulatory, signaling and control processes in cells. While there are many observations of the net effect of allosterism, a number of questions remain about the nature of this process at the molecular level. These include the role of induced fit vs. conformational selection in ligand binding and clarification of the actual mechanism of allosteric signal transmission, whether this involves a distinct pathway, a cooperative network of residues, correlated motional fluctuations or simply a perturbation of the energy landscape. Obtaining a deeper understanding of the dynamics of allostery has been especially challenging, since the signal transmission per se is not directly accessible to experiment. The idea behind our proposed project is that much can be learned about allosterism from the detailed study of a well-chosen prototype system by all-atom molecular dynamics (MD) simulations with analysis using Markov State Models (MSM), kinetic grouping analysis (KGA) and cFEP free energy profiles. The system chosen for study is the large, multi-domain protein MutS and its pathological mutants. MutS and eukaryotic homologs recognize errors in DNA replication and initiate mismatch repair. In Muts, DNA binding and ATP/ADP activities are allosterically coupled over a distance of ~ 70 Angstroms, but the mechanism of signal transmission over such a large distance has not been unequivocally determined. MutS and homologs are the focus of a biochemical research program in the laboratory of our collaborator here, Professor Manju Hingorani in the Department of Molecular Biology and Biochemistry. New in this proposal is the analysis of MD on MutS via a Markov State Model, which elucidates substate structure of a protein or DNA and enables the study of dynamical allosterism in terms of a proper Boltzmann ensemble. Specifically, we propose a) to carry out extended MD simulations on MutS and selected pathological mutants in aqueous solution at biological ionic strengths, considering all relevant combinations of DNA and ATP bound and unbound constructs; b) to cluster the MD trajectories on MutS and apply kinetic grouping analyses to obtain MSM to obtain substates of MutS, their structural properties, populations (thermodynamics), the rates of interconversions (kinetics) for the various MutS processes; and c) to analyze the MSM to elucidate the dynamics of allosteric signal transmission based on the calculated states and rates; apply this to search for new allosteric druggable sites.

Source.Name: National Institute of General Medical Sciences

Project.Title: Protease Activated Receptor 2 Antagonist In Inflammatory Disease

Title_Other.Title: 蛋白酶激活受体2拮抗剂在炎症性疾病中的作用
Protease Activated Receptor 2 Antagonist In Inflammatory Disease

Project.Abstract: The immune response to infection involves a network of proteins that produce an inflammatory response. Sometimes this response is prolonged or uncontrolled and can lead to a large number of inflammatory and other diseases. We have discovered a class of drugs that can bind to a particular protein on the surface of human cells and control this inflammatory response. This property has the potential to treat a wide range of inflammatory and other diseases in humans.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: The immune response to infection involves a network of proteins that produce an inflammatory response. Sometimes this response is prolonged or uncontrolled and can lead to a large number of inflammatory and other diseases. We have discovered a class of drugs that can bind to a particular protein on the surface of human cells and control this inflammatory response. This property has the potential to treat a wide range of inflammatory and other diseases in humans.
对感染的免疫反应涉及一个蛋白质网络，产生炎症反应。有时这种反应会延长或失控，并可能导致大量炎症和其他疾病。我们发现了一类药物，可以与人类细胞表面的特定蛋白质结合并控制这种炎症反应。这种特性有可能治疗人类的一系列炎症和其他疾病。

Source.Name: National Health and Medical Research Council

Title_Other.Title: La composition chimique des atmosphères des étoiles des types F, G et K
F、G、K型恒星大气的化学成分

Title_Other.Title: Diffusion of Gases in Liquid Metals
气体在液态金属中的扩散

Project.Title: Documentation of discourse and cultural activities to advance scientific knowledge of an endangered tonal language

Title_Other.Title: Documentation of discourse and cultural activities to advance scientific knowledge of an endangered tonal language
记录话语和文化活动以提高对濒危音调语言的科学认识

Project.Abstract: The world's estimated 7,000 languages are disappearing at an increasingly rapid rate. Parallel to language loss is the disappearance of cultural and economic activities. The present project, part of a long-term multidisciplinary effort, will emphasize video documentation to enhance a language documentation project that focuses on highly endangered cultural activities particularly prone to loss. This has the potential to increase scientific understanding of the spatial and motion components of grammar and to generate a valuable corpus of the distribution of complex tonal properties in narrative and other grammatical contexts. With up to 21 tonal contrasts on a single disyllabic sequence, Yoloxochitl Mixtec (YM), the language documented in this project, has one of the most extensive tonal inventories in any reported language. This inventory that carries great functional weight both lexically (distinguishing words) and morphologically (marking both derivational and inflectional processes), providing opportunities to deepen scientific advances both in terms of YM tone and cross-linguistic studies of complex tone systems. Broader impacts include the training of a US undergraduate in video documentation of endangered indigenous cultures. Additionally, annotated videos will be disseminated through Internet venues (e.g., Vimeo and YouTube). The entire subtitled corpus will serve as an educational resource for US high school and college students, especially those from diasporic Mexican Indigenous communities here in the US. In addition, video documentation will enhance intercultural understanding and has significant educational value for the community and the general public. The language and cultural and economic activities that will be documented are from Yoloxochitl, state of Guerrero, Mexico. The project continues the documentation of YM, a highly complex tonal language in which little comparative work has been done on this prosodic feature. The present project on YM will create the first extensive audio corpus of Mixtec lemmas (headwords). Video documentation will enable a focus on activities that are best documented and understood through audiovisual recordings. Visual imagery most effectively captures varied processes (e.g., preparation of plant material) and movements (e.g., the relationship between language and gesture; the documentation of manual skills) that would remain opaque in textual or simple audio descriptions. Moreover, the lexicon of a given language is connected to activities that must be conceptualized if the words themselves are to be understood. The expert team will record with two cameras (one stationary and one mobile) to allow the complete recording of each process while yielding footage for the creative editing of short vignettes on each activity. All footage as well as the final videos will be transcribed in YM, translated into English and Spanish, disseminated, and archived. It will serve as a primary source in an under-documented group of language for future comparative work on over three dozen recognized Mixtec languages while allowing acoustic analysis of the high number of tonal contrasts. Additionally, the focus on semantic domains involving ritual performance and material culture production will provide highly nuanced data of often archaic material in the linguistic and anthropological realm. The results of this project will be of value to linguists in a range of specialties (typologists, Oto-Mangueanists, historical linguists, tonologists, and semanticists) as well as to anthropologists studying Mesoamerican language and culture. This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 世界上估计有7000种语言正在以越来越快的速度消失。与语言丧失平行的是文化和经济活动的消失。本项目是一项长期的多学科工作的一部分，将强调视频文件，以加强一个语言文件项目，该项目的重点是高度濒危的文化活动，特别是易受损失的文化活动。这有可能增加对语法的空间和运动成分的科学理解，并生成一个有价值的语料库，说明在叙事和其他语法语境中复杂的声调属性的分布。在一个双音节序列上有多达21个音调对比，本项目中记录的语言yolozochitl Mixtec（YM）在任何报告的语言中都有最广泛的音调清单。这个清单在词汇（区分词）和形态（标记派生和屈折过程）上都具有很大的功能权重，提供了在YM音调和复杂音调系统的跨语言研究方面深化科学进步的机会。更广泛的影响包括对一名美国大学生进行濒危土著文化视频文档的培训。此外，带注释的视频将通过互联网传播（如Vimeo和YouTube）。整个字幕语料库将作为美国高中生和大学生的教育资源，特别是那些来自美国散居墨西哥土著社区的学生。此外，录影带文件将增进不同文化间的了解，对社区和公众具有重要的教育价值。将记录的语言、文化和经济活动来自墨西哥格雷罗州的约洛希特尔。该项目继续记录YM，一种高度复杂的调性语言，其中很少有比较工作做了这个韵律特征。目前关于YM的项目将创建Mixtec引理（headwords）的第一个广泛的音频语料库。视频文档将使人们能够关注通过视听记录能够最好地记录和理解的活动。视觉图像最有效地捕捉各种过程（例如，植物材料的制备）和动作（例如，语言和手势之间的关系；手工技能的记录），这些过程在文本或简单的音频描述中保持不透明。此外，一种特定语言的词汇与那些必须概念化才能被理解的活动相联系。专家小组将使用两台摄像机（一台固定摄像机和一台移动摄像机）进行记录，以便能够完整记录每个过程，同时为每项活动的短篇小品的创造性编辑提供录像。所有的录像和最后的录像都将用YM语言转录，翻译成英语和西班牙语，传播和存档。它将作为一组未被充分记录的语言的主要来源，用于未来对30多种已被认可的Mixtec语言的比较工作，同时允许对大量音调对比进行声学分析。此外，对涉及仪式表演和物质文化生产的语义领域的关注，将提供语言和人类学领域中经常是古老材料的高度细致的数据。该项目的研究成果将对一系列专业的语言学家（类型学家、奥托-曼古埃语言学家、历史语言学家、语调学家和语义学家）以及研究中美洲语言和文化的人类学家有价值。该奖项反映了NSF的法定使命，通过使用基金会的知识价值和更广泛的影响审查标准进行评估，被认为值得支持。

Source.Name: Directorate for Social, Behavioral & Economic Sciences

Project.Title: Activation and suppression of oncogenic translocation by uracil-DNA glycosylases

Title_Other.Title: 尿嘧啶DNA糖基化酶激活和抑制癌基因易位
Activation and suppression of oncogenic translocation by uracil-DNA glycosylases

Project.Abstract: The AID enzyme is implicated in cancer in B lymphocytes and prostate cells. AID causes DNA damage normally recognised by repair enzymes UNG and MutS?, among others. The repair processes these factors initiate involve a DNA break that, if incorrectly re-joined, destabilises the genome, causing cancer. Understanding the function of AID, UNG and MutS? in B cell lymphomas and prostate cancer will provide fundamental insights into cancer and may identify targets for new therapeutics.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 这种辅助酶与B淋巴细胞和前列腺细胞中的癌症有关。帮助导致DNA损伤通常由修复酶UNG和MutS识别？，等等。这些因素引发的修复过程涉及DNA断裂，如果重新连接不当，会破坏基因组的稳定性，导致癌症。了解AID，UNG和MutS的功能？在B细胞淋巴瘤和前列腺癌将提供对癌症的基本见解，并可能确定新的治疗目标。

Understanding the function of AID, UNG and MutS? in B cell lymphomas and prostate cancer will provide fundamental insights into cancer and may identify targets for new therapeutics.

Project.Title: Multi-channel ICs for simultaneous measurement of time interacting and deposited cargo for radiation detectors provide high-capacity linear processing.

Title_Other.Title: 多通道集成电路用于同时测量时间相互作用和存放的货物，用于辐射探测器，提供高容量线性处理。

Wielokanałowe scalone układy do równoczesnego pomiaru czasu interakcji i zdeponowanego ładunku dla potrzeb detektorów promieniowania o dużej pojemności zapewniające liniową charakterystykę przetwarzania.

Class.ClassName: 自动化技术、自动化技术设备

Project.Abstract: The aim of the project is to develop methods and solutions to systemic allowing the simultaneous determination of time to generate the load and measuring its quantity sensors for high-capacity and in special conditions.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: Celem projektu jest rozwój metod i rozwiązań układowych pozwalających na jednoczesne wyznaczenie czasu wygenerowania ładunku oraz pomiar jego ilości w sensorach o dużej pojemności i w szczególnych warunkach pracy.
该项目的目的是开发方法和解决方案，使系统能够同时确定产生负载的时间，并测量其高容量和特殊条件下的数量传感器。

AGH University of Science and Technology

Project.Title: Mathematical Sciences: Research in Stochastic Processes

Title_Other.Title: 数学科学：随机过程研究
Mathematical Sciences: Research in Stochastic Processes

Class.ClassName: 概率论（几率论、或然率论）

Project.Abstract: The three general areas of research are Brownian motion on manifolds, measure valued processes, and the range of a random walk. The unifying theme among them is the study of intersection local times. The research is generalization to manifolds of the results previously obtained by the investigator. Various forms of intersection local times are used. Study of the local times for Levy processes is prompted due to the relatively recent discovery of the necessary and sufficient condition for sample continuity of a stationary Gaussian process. The isolation of the regular part of the intersection local times of higher orders lead in a normal way to the study of anticipative integrands. Various new methods developed for these integrands will contribute towards the study of the higher order intersection local times.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: The three general areas of research are Brownian motion on manifolds, measure valued processes, and the range of a random walk. The unifying theme among them is the study of intersection local times. The research is generalization to manifolds of the results previously obtained by the investigator. Various forms of intersection local times are used. Study of the local times for Levy processes is prompted due to the relatively recent discovery of the necessary and sufficient condition for sample continuity of a stationary Gaussian process. The isolation of the regular part of the intersection local times of higher orders lead in a normal way to the study of anticipative integrands. Various new methods developed for these integrands will contribute towards the study of the higher order intersection local times.
研究的三个一般领域是流形上的布朗运动、测度值过程和随机游动的范围。其中一个统一的主题是对交集时代的研究。这项研究是对研究者先前获得的结果的流形的推广。使用各种形式的交叉点当地时间。由于最近发现了平稳高斯过程样本连续性的充分必要条件，因此对Levy过程的局部时间进行了研究。高阶交集局部时间正则部分的分离是研究预期被积函数的正常途径。为这些被积函数开发的各种新方法将有助于研究高阶交集的局部时间。

Project.Title: Elucidating the complex genetic and molecular basis of Plasmodium falciparum artemisinin resistance.

Title_Other.Title: Elucidating the complex genetic and molecular basis of Plasmodium falciparum artemisinin resistance.
阐明恶性疟原虫抗青蒿素的复杂遗传和分子基础。

Project.Abstract: DESCRIPTION (provided by applicant): Malaria is a disease caused by infection with Plasmodium parasites, of which P. falciparum is the deadliest. Half of the world's population is at risk of infection. Increased access to artemisinin-based combination therapies (ACTs) and mosquito vector control initiatives have saved an estimated 3.3 million lives since the year 2000. Despite this substantial progress, malaria remains a major burden to human health with approximately 627,000 deaths in 2012. There is no effective vaccine. Alarmingly, artemisinin resistance has emerged in Southeast Asia. It is imperative that we understand the mechanism and extent of resistance to help prevent a regional crisis from becoming a global disaster. Genomic and transcriptomic analyses of artemisinin-resistant parasites have recently implicated mutations in the K13 gene, with secondary contributions from genes involved in iron transport and ubiquitin-mediated protein degradation. We used zinc-finger nucleases (ZFNs), a transformative genetic editing tool, to show that removing K13 mutations from artemisinin-resistant Cambodian parasites ablates resistance. Inserting K13 mutations into artemisinin-sensitive parasite lines conferred variable degrees of resistance, indicating the influence of a permissive genetic background. We believe that our combination of ongoing evaluation of parasites from Southeast Asia and the ability to swiftly add or remove candidate mutations from isogenic, well-characterized parasites will allow a comprehensive dissection of the resistance mechanism. We will use ZFNs to study the function of K13 and the influence of genetic background on the emergence and spread of artemisinin resistance. Emergence is tied to the mechanism of resistance, whereas spread is tied to transmission. We will use ZFNs to add or remove potential resistance mutations into isogenic parasite lines alone or in combination. To study emergence, we will use both the ring-stage survival assay (RSA0-3h) and a modified [3H]-hypoxanthine incorporation assay to determine artemisinin sensitivity, and explore K13 function through identifying changes in the parasite redox metabolome, ubiquitin-mediated proteasomal degradation, the definition of interacting partners, and K13 subcellular localization. Given current data, we hypothesize that K13 functions as a negative regulator of oxidative stress responses that respond to iron-mediated redox damage. We posit that resistance-associated mutations in K13 reduce function, leading to increased antioxidant capability. To study transmission, we will perform pairwise fitness comparisons of parasites in both asexual blood stages and sexual mosquito stages. An improved understanding of artemisinin resistance will help guide the targeted geographical use of non-artemisinin-based second-line or novel therapies to reduce the burden of malaria.

Half of the world's population is at risk of infection. ? 描述（由申请人提供）：疟疾是由疟原虫感染引起的疾病，其中恶性疟原虫最致命。世界上一半的人口有感染的危险。自2000年以来，越来越多地获得青蒿素类联合疗法和蚊虫病媒控制倡议，估计挽救了330万人的生命。尽管取得了实质性进展，疟疾仍然是人类健康的主要负担，2012的人约有627000人死亡。没有有效的疫苗。令人震惊的是，东南亚出现了对青蒿素的耐药性。我们必须了解抵抗的机制和程度，以帮助防止区域危机成为全球性灾难。对青蒿素抗性寄生虫的基因组和转录组分析表明，K13基因突变与铁转运和泛素介导的蛋白质降解有关。我们使用锌指核酸酶（ZFNs），一种转化性的基因编辑工具，证明从抗青蒿素的柬埔寨寄生虫身上去除K13突变可以消除抗药性。在青蒿素敏感寄生虫株系中插入K13突变可产生不同程度的抗性，表明遗传背景的影响是允许的。我们相信，我们正在对东南亚寄生虫进行的评估，以及迅速从等基因、特征良好的寄生虫中添加或删除候选突变的能力，将有助于全面分析抗药性机制。我们将利用ZFNs研究K13的功能以及遗传背景对青蒿素抗性产生和传播的影响。出现与抵抗机制有关，而传播则与传播有关。我们将使用ZFNs单独或联合向等基因寄生虫系中添加或移除潜在的抗性突变。为了研究青蒿素的产生，我们将使用环期存活试验（RSA0-3h）和改良的[3h]次黄嘌呤掺入试验来测定青蒿素的敏感性，并通过鉴定寄生虫氧化还原代谢组的变化、泛素介导的蛋白酶体降解、相互作用伙伴的定义来探索K13的功能，以及K13亚细胞定位。根据目前的数据，我们假设K13作为氧化应激反应的负调控因子，响应于铁介导的氧化还原损伤。我们认为，K13中的抗性相关突变降低了功能，导致抗氧化能力增强。为了研究传播，我们将在无性血液阶段和性蚊子阶段对寄生虫进行配对适合度比较。提高对青蒿素耐药性的认识将有助于指导有针对性地使用非青蒿素二线疗法或新疗法，以减轻疟疾的负担。

Project.Title: New Connection of Laredo Community College to Internet

Title_Other.Title: New Connection of Laredo Community College to Internet
拉雷多社区学院与互联网的新连接

Class.ClassName: 有线通信、通信线路工程

Project.Abstract: PI: Alma Hernandez Laredo Community College requests support from NSF to acquire communications lines required to connect to the Internet. THENET, a midlevel network in the in the state of Texas, will provide operations management and information services and it will give the campus access to the Internet, a collection of interoperable networks that connect most research and education organizations in the United States. Laredo Community College needs the Internet connection to be able to access information resources throughout the state, the nation and the world. The connection will benefit the faculty, staff students of this institution as well as the community in general.

PI:Alma Hernandez Laredo社区学院请求NSF提供支持，以获取连接到Internet所需的通信线路。THENET是德克萨斯州的一个中层网络，它将提供运营管理和信息服务，并为校园提供互联网接入，互联网是连接美国大多数研究和教育机构的一组互操作网络。拉雷多社区学院需要互联网连接，以便能够访问整个州、国家和世界的信息资源。这种联系将有利于本机构的教职员工和学生以及整个社区。
