一个多学科的研究计划旨在了解蛋白质酪氨酸磷酸酶（PTPase）底物特异性的结构基础，并开发特异的、高亲和力的低分子量非肽PTPase抑制剂。ptpase是一大类酶，可分为两类：受体样ptpase和细胞内ptpase。以PTPα为例的受体样PTPase通常具有胞外结构域、单个跨膜结构域和一个或两个胞质PTPase结构域。以PTP1B为例，细胞内ptpase包含一个催化结构域和多种氨基或羧基末端延伸，包括可能具有靶向性或调节性特异性磷酸酶的SH2结构域。VHR是一种典型的双特异性磷酸酶，可以利用含有磷酸酪氨酸和磷酸丝氨酸/磷酸苏氨酸的底物。尽管配体结合域和定位/靶向域被认为参与了PTPase活性的调节，但PTPase催化位点在确定底物特异性中的作用尚未得到充分的研究。本提案将集中于PTP1B、PTPα和VHR。这些酶的底物序列特异性将通过组合磷酸肽库进行评估，并结合对具有系统改变的化学性质的单个纯肽的详细动力学分析。通过筛选低分子量芳香族膦酸盐的合成文库，可以确定活性部位定向抑制剂。所选抑制剂的体内疗效将在过度表达人胰岛素受体的中国仓鼠细胞系中进行评估。由于阐明分子识别事件的基本原理需要了解分子相互作用的原子细节，因此将确定与高亲和力底物/抑制剂复合的ptpase的三维结构。在这方面，PTP1B、PTPα和VHR是理想的，因为它们的晶体结构已经被解决。因此，这些ptpase与紧密结合的底物/抑制剂复合后的晶体结构可以通过分子置换技术来解决。

Source.Name: National Institute of General Medical Sciences

Project.Title: SAMBA - Smart Automotive Managed Battery Algorithms

Title_Other.Title: SAMBA-智能汽车电池管理算法
SAMBA - Smart Automotive Managed Battery Algorithms

Project.Abstract:
"SAMBA (Smart Automotive Managed Battery Algorithms) is a project seeking to develop an innovative health module that integrates with electric vehicle chargers and uses smart algorithm technology to help prolong battery life. Recent research shows that optimally charging and discharging the battery could improve its life by about 10% over a year.
Electric vehicles (EVs) are often seen as a key driver towards a greener future and reduced air pollution. There are now almost 110,000 EVs on UK roads, and sales are set to rise sharply. ""By 2030, we could see as many as nine million electric vehicles on the road,"" (Marcus Stewart, National Grid Energy Insights Manager).
EV batteries are the crucial component in determining both the price and environmental impact of EVs, as they contain rare earth materials that are cost-intense to extract and difficult to recycle. Increasing the lifespan of EV batteries is therefore not only key to making EVs more economically viable, but also environmentally imperative. Additionally, with rising EV numbers comes a rising demand on the charging infrastructure in terms of available charge points and electricity generation.
SAMBA combines cutting-edge smart algorithms, machine learning and innovative technology to optimise EV charging for battery health. Currently, EV owners would want their EV charged to full as fast as possible. This ""ICE analogy"" behaviour, however, often contradicts the process that would help prolong battery life. It also often results in charge being drawn from national grid at the least opportune times, both in terms of network demand and cost. The SAMBA health module optimises the charging process by smart switching of multiple electricity flows. SAMBA gets added to an existing EV charge point together with a local renewable energy generator (e.g. solar, wind) with its own local battery pack and a two-way connection to the the national grid. The algorithms then intelligently manage battery needs, e.g. discharge completely before recharging, in order to prolong battery life. The charge post's vehicle-to-grid capability ensures that the charge drawn from the car battery can also be fed into the grid to help meet peak demands and reduce energy costs. Similarly, surplus from the local energy source is fed into the grid. Crucially, the innovative software includes machine learning algorithms that predict charging patterns and manage battery life to always make the optimal choice between charging and discharging from the post's own generator, the grid and the vehicle."

Abstract_Other.Abstract: “SAMBA（智能汽车管理电池算法）是一个项目，旨在开发一个创新的健康模块，该模块与电动汽车充电器集成，并使用智能算法技术帮助延长电池寿命。最近的研究表明，对电池进行最佳的充放电可以使其寿命在一年内提高10%左右。 电动汽车（EV）通常被视为实现绿色未来和减少空气污染的关键驱动力。目前，英国道路上有近11万辆电动汽车，销量将大幅上升到2030年，我们可以看到多达900万辆电动汽车上路，”（国家电网能源洞察经理马库斯·斯图尔特）。 电动汽车电池是决定电动汽车价格和环境影响的关键组成部分，因为它们含有稀土材料，提取成本高，难以回收。因此，提高电动汽车电池的使用寿命不仅是提高电动汽车经济可行性的关键，而且也是环境保护的当务之急。此外，随着电动汽车数量的增加，充电基础设施在可用充电点和发电方面的需求也在增加。 SAMBA结合了尖端的智能算法、机器学习和创新技术，优化了电动汽车的充电以保证电池的健康。目前，电动汽车车主希望他们的电动汽车尽快充满电。然而，这种“冰类比”的行为往往与有助于延长电池寿命的过程相矛盾。从网络需求和成本来看，这也常常导致至少在适当的时候从国家电网中提取费用。SAMBA health模块通过智能切换多个电流来优化充电过程。桑巴被添加到一个现有的EV充电点连同当地可再生能源发电机（如太阳能，风能）与它自己的本地电池组和双向连接到国家电网。然后，这些算法智能地管理电池需求，例如在充电前完全放电，以延长电池寿命。充电桩的车辆到电网的能力确保了从汽车电池中提取的电荷也可以输入电网，以帮助满足峰值需求并降低能源成本。同样，当地能源的剩余部分也会被送入电网。至关重要的是，该创新软件包括机器学习算法，可以预测充电模式和管理电池寿命，以便始终在充电和从邮政自身的发电机、电网和车辆放电之间做出最佳选择。”

Crucially, the innovative software includes machine learning algorithms that predict charging patterns and manage battery life to always make the optimal choice between charging and discharging from the post's own generator, the grid and the vehicle."

Project.Title: Dispersive Estimates for the Schrodinger Equation

Title_Other.Title: 薛定谔方程的色散估计
Dispersive Estimates for the Schrodinger Equation

Project.Abstract: This project is to study dispersive estimates for Schroedinger's equation. These estimates are basic to recent developments in the mathematical analysis of Schroedinger's equation and its nonlinear variants. The aim of this project is to obtain minimal regularity and spatial decay conditions on potentials that imply dispersive estimates in each dimension n and to use these results to study related issues including results for nonlinear Schroedinger-type equations. Schroedinger equations govern the evolution of wave functions in quantum mechanics. Nonlinear analogues are of importance in chemistry and the transmission of information in fiber optic cables. This research will provide mathematical information about the processes involved in quantum mechanics and the applications of quantum physics.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 本计画是研究薛定谔方程的分散估计。这些估计是薛定谔方程及其非线性变量数学分析的最新进展的基础。本计画的目的是获得在每个维n中包含色散估计的势的最小正则性和空间衰减条件，并利用这些结果来研究相关问题，包括非线性薛定谔型方程的结果。薛定谔方程控制着量子力学中波函数的演化。非线性类似物在化学和光纤信息传输中具有重要意义。这项研究将提供有关量子力学过程和量子物理学应用的数学信息。

This project is to study dispersive estimates for Schroedinger's equation. These estimates are basic to recent developments in the mathematical analysis of Schroedinger's equation and its nonlinear variants. The aim of this project is to obtain minimal regularity and spatial decay conditions on potentials that imply dispersive estimates in each dimension n and to use these results to study related issues including results for nonlinear Schroedinger-type equations. Schroedinger equations govern the evolution of wave functions in quantum mechanics. Nonlinear analogues are of importance in chemistry and the transmission of information in fiber optic cables. This research will provide mathematical information about the processes involved in quantum mechanics and the applications of quantum physics.

Project.Title: Portable, User-Friendly, Uniform Temperature Heat Blanket System for Composite Repair

Title_Other.Title: Portable, User-Friendly, Uniform Temperature Heat Blanket System for Composite Repair
便携式、用户友好、温度均匀的复合材料修补热毯系统

Project.Abstract: Existing heat blankets for composite bonded repair are unsatisfactory because they are incapable of preventing large temperature variations over the surface. Creare proposes to develop a heat blanket that will maintain a constant uniform temperature over the entire surface. More specifically, we will first determine and fully document specifications for the blanket. Then,based on these-specifi- cations and the.innovative approaches described later in this proposal, we will select the best approach for further development. A detailed design will be developed using this approach. To support the design work, a thermal model will be developed to predict the blanket's temperature distribution. The model will incorporate different environmental conditions and variations in the structure being repaired. The final design will be the starting point for our Phase II effort, in which a blanket will be fabricated and thoroughly tested.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 现有的用于复合粘结修复的热毯是不能令人满意的，因为它们不能防止表面上的大的温度变化。克雷尔建议开发一种热毯，使整个表面的温度保持恒定均匀。更具体地说，我们将首先确定和完全文件规格的毯子。然后，根据这些规范和本提案后面描述的创新方法，我们将选择进一步发展的最佳方法。将采用这种方法进行详细设计。为了支持设计工作，将开发一个热模型来预测毯子的温度分布。模型将包含不同的环境条件和正在修复的结构的变化。最终设计将是我们第二阶段工作的起点，在这一阶段中，将制造一个毯子并进行彻底的测试。

Existing heat blankets for composite bonded repair are unsatisfactory because they are incapable of preventing large temperature variations over the surface. Creare proposes to develop a heat blanket that will maintain a constant uniform temperature over the entire surface. More specifically, we will first determine and fully document specifications for the blanket. Then,based on these-specifi- cations and the.innovative approaches described later in this proposal, we will select the best approach for further development. A detailed design will be developed using this approach. To support the design work, a thermal model will be developed to predict the blanket's temperature distribution. The model will incorporate different environmental conditions and variations in the structure being repaired. The final design will be the starting point for our Phase II effort, in which a blanket will be fabricated and thoroughly tested.

Source.Name: United States Department of the Navy

Project.Title: EAGER: Place Attachment and Collective Action: The Changing Landscape of Urban Neighborhoods

Title_Other.Title: 渴望：地方依恋与集体行动：城市社区景观的变迁
EAGER: Place Attachment and Collective Action: The Changing Landscape of Urban Neighborhoods

Project.Abstract: SES-1402515 Todd Shaw Barbara Combs Kirk Foster Michael Hodge Desiree Pedescleaux University of South Carolina at Columbia This proposal requests support for an Early Concept Grant for Exploratory Research (EAGER) for a one year pilot study that tests a new model for understanding how group or neighborhood identify impacts civic engagement and collective action by residents. The researchers propose a model that argues that geographic dispersion (an ongoing feature of minority neighborhoods) impacts the length of residence and how rooted residents are in their particular neighborhood. These factors are positively related to the level of the concept of linked fate (we are all in this together whether or not we are residents of the same neighborhood), attachment to the neighborhood and whether residents assume their neighborhoods' identify. These dynamics then contribute to trust and the level of cooperation among residents that in turn determines participation in collective action on behalf of the neighborhood. To test these basic assumptions, the research team will conduct a pilot study of two primarily African American historic neighborhoods in Atlanta, Georgia--the Old Fourth Ward and the West End -- that have undergone gentrification, with significantly diverse outcomes. The Old Fourth Ward over the last three decades has been transformed from a historically middle class black community to a neighborhood that is now 30 percent white, with a significant rise in median income. On the other hand, the West End, a black working class/lower income community, witnessed a 39 percent decrease in white residents, now has a population that is only 2 percent white, and experienced a modest decline in median income. These two communities offer the opportunity to study African American's perceptions of the changes that have occurred in two of their communities (that reflect trends in other such communities in the South) and responses (civic collective action) to these changes. Broader Impacts The project has significant broader impacts. Specifically, it (1) is an interdisciplinary collaboration between two Research-I, majority-white universities and two historically black liberals arts colleges; (2) mentors and substantively involves the participation of graduate and undergraduate students from underrepresented groups; (3) provides student and faculty researchers and the broader public with a robust dataset that has potential multi-disciplinary interest; (4) creates an opportunity to disseminate research findings directly relevant to the life of two vibrant urban neighborhoods; and (5) makes a unique theoretical and methodological contributions to the literature on the changing social and civic spaces of urban communities. While policymakers have long argued that devoting public and private resources to building local capacity can tackle urban poverty and spur economic redevelopment, e.g., Community Action Programs, Enterprise Zones, and Empowerment Zones. The study?s results can help us better understand the role that heterogeneous relationships among neighborhood residents play in successful communities? problem-solving.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: SES-1402515 Todd Shaw Barbara Combs Kirk Foster Michael Hodge Desiree Pedescleaux大学哥伦比亚分校本提案要求支持探索性研究（EAGER）的早期概念资助，该研究为期一年，旨在测试一种新模式，以了解群体或邻里识别如何影响公民参与和居民集体行动。研究人员提出了一个模型，该模型认为地理分布（少数民族社区的一个持续特征）会影响居住的时间和居民在其特定社区中的扎根程度。这些因素与关联命运概念的水平（无论我们是否是同一个社区的居民，我们都在一起）、对社区的依恋以及居民是否假定他们的社区认同有正相关关系。然后，这些动态有助于居民之间的信任和合作水平，进而决定了代表社区参与集体行动的程度。为了验证这些基本假设，研究小组将对佐治亚州亚特兰大的两个主要是非裔美国人的历史街区——老四区和西区——进行一项试点研究，这两个街区经历了贵族化，结果显著不同。过去三十年来，老四区已经从一个历史上中产阶级的黑人社区转变为现在白人占30%的社区，收入中值显著上升。另一方面，西区是一个黑人工人阶级/低收入社区，白人居民减少了39%，现在只有2%的白人人口，中间收入略有下降。这两个社区为研究非裔美国人对其两个社区发生的变化（反映南部其他此类社区的趋势）的看法和对这些变化的反应（公民集体行动）提供了机会。更广泛的影响项目具有更广泛的重大影响。具体而言，它（1）是两所研究性大学（大多数是白人大学）和两所历史上黑人自由艺术学院（2）之间的跨学科合作；（2）导师，实质上涉及来自代表性不足群体的研究生和本科生的参与；（3）提供学生和教员研究人员以及更广泛的公众有一个强大的数据集，具有潜在的多学科兴趣；（4）创造一个机会，传播与两个充满活力的城市社区生活直接相关的研究成果；（5）对城市社区社会与市民空间变迁的文献研究做出了独特的理论和方法论贡献。尽管政策制定者长期以来一直认为，将公共和私人资源用于建设地方能力，可以解决城市贫困问题，促进经济重建，例如社区行动计划、企业区和授权区。研究？研究结果可以帮助我们更好地理解社区居民之间的异质关系在成功社区中所扮演的角色？解决问题。

Source.Name: Directorate for Social, Behavioral & Economic Sciences

Project.Title: China-Sweden Safety Centre Stage 1

Title_Other.Title: 中瑞安全中心一期
China-Sweden Safety Centre Stage 1

Class.ClassName: 有线通信、通信线路工程

Project.Abstract:
Purpose and goal: To create the centre, develop the Swedish node and perform pilot projects.
The objective of the pilot projects were to - investigate the prerequisites for FOT studies in the Chinese traffic situation. - get a status report on the traffic situation in China. - get basic knowledge of the situation in China - get information on how to proceed in the next phase of the centre - create prerequisites for a fruitful collaboration regarding research and innovation. - establish the structures and agreements for the Center and establish forms of cooperation. - be a learning process for those involved.
Expected results and effects: An agreement (the Framework Agreement) was drawn up and signed by the Swedish and Chinese parties. An operational plan has been developed. A Director of the centre is appointed. The office is situated at RIOH in Beijing. The Board, the Steering Committee and Scientific Committee are staffed and are operational. The managers of the pilot projects have reported their results and publications are being prepared. The lessons learned give important input for the next phase. New project proposals are under way with the aim to have 3-6 new projects implemented over the coming two-year period.
Approach and implementation: The work has been done in four pilot projects, all of which had both Chinese and Swedish participants. The collaboration was executed through phone meetings, Skype, mail and physical meetings. Clear goals and deadlines were set for the deliverables, e.g. the Framework agreement should be signed by all parties before the end of 2012. The conclusion is that the pilot projects have been very valuable for the mutual understanding of the Chinese and Swedish way to run projects. The success builds upon the ability to create good relations and the physical meetings have been of great importance.

目的和目标： 创建该中心，开发瑞典节点并执行试点项目。 试点项目的目的是 -调查中国交通状况下FOT研究的先决条件。 -获取中国交通状况的状态报告。 -了解中国的基本情况 -获取有关如何在中心下一阶段进行的信息 -为研究和创新方面卓有成效的合作创造先决条件。 -建立中心的架构和协议，建立合作形式。 -对相关人员来说是一个学习过程。 预期结果和效果： 瑞典和中国双方起草并签署了一项协议（框架协议）。已经制定了行动计划。中心任命了一名主任。办公室位于北京里欧。董事会、指导委员会和科学委员会的人员配备和运作情况。试点项目的管理人员已报告了其成果，正在编写出版物。吸取的经验教训为下一阶段提供了重要的投入。新的项目提案正在进行中，目标是在未来两年内实施3-6个新项目。 方法和实施： 这项工作已经在四个试点项目中完成，所有项目都有中国和瑞典的参与。合作通过电话会议、Skype、邮件和物理会议进行。 为可交付成果设定了明确的目标和期限，如框架协议应在2012年底前由各方签署。 得出的结论是，这些试点项目对于中瑞两国项目管理方式的相互理解非常有价值。成功建立在建立良好关系的能力之上，而物理会议也非常重要。

Project.Title: PYI: Flow Control and Routing in High Speed Networks

Title_Other.Title: PYI：高速网络中的流量控制与路由
PYI: Flow Control and Routing in High Speed Networks

Class.ClassName: 分析作业方法、分析作业技术

Project.Abstract: The research area that this principal investigator (PI) will focus on during his Presidential Young Investigator award is the control and management of information flow in communication networks. The focus will be on overcoming the bottlenecks of switching and network processing that result from using optical transmission and electronic devices. Processing bottlenecks may arise in network protocols. The PI plans to develop analysis techniques for evaluating performance of higher level protocols using, for example, a non-statistical approach to predict worst case performance. To address the switching bottleneck, the PI plans to synthesize and investigate the performance of switching architectures which utilize massively parallel processing and the benefits of spatial statistical multiplexing and deflection routing.

The focus will be on overcoming the bottlenecks of switching and network processing that result from using optical transmission and electronic devices. To address the switching bottleneck, the PI plans to synthesize and investigate the performance of switching architectures which utilize massively parallel processing and the benefits of spatial statistical multiplexing and deflection routing.
这位首席调查员（PI）在获得总统青年调查员奖期间将重点关注的研究领域是通信网络中信息流的控制和管理。重点将是克服由于使用光传输和电子设备而造成的交换和网络处理瓶颈。网络协议中可能会出现处理瓶颈。PI计划开发用于评估更高级别协议性能的分析技术，例如，使用非统计方法来预测最坏情况下的性能。为了解决交换瓶颈，PI计划综合和研究利用大规模并行处理的交换体系结构的性能以及空间统计复用和偏移路由的优点。

Source.Name: Directorate for Computer & Information Science & Engineering

Project.Title: Machine Learning for Hearing Aids: Intelligent Processing and Fitting

Title_Other.Title: Machine Learning for Hearing Aids: Intelligent Processing and Fitting
助听器的机器学习：智能加工与装配

Class.ClassName: 电声技术、语音信号处理

Project.Abstract:
Current hearing aids suffer from two major limitations:
1) hearing aid audio processing strategies are inflexible and do not adapt sufficiently to the listening environment, 2) hearing tests and hearing aid fitting procedures do not allow reliable diagnosis of the underlying nature of the hearing loss and frequently lead to poor fitting of devices.
This research programme will use new machine learning methods to revolutionise both of these aspects of hearing aid technology, leading to intelligent hearing devices and testing procedures which actively learn about a patient's hearing loss enabling more personalised fitting.
Intelligent audio processing
The optimal audio processing strategy for a hearing aid depends on the acoustic environment. A conversation held in a quiet office, for example, should be processed in a different way from one held in a busy reverberant restaurant. Current high-end hearing aids do switch between a small number of different processing strategies based upon a simple acoustic environment classification system that monitors simple aspects of the incoming audio. However, the classification accuracy is limited, which is one of the reasons why hearing devices perform very poorly in noisy multi-source environments. Future intelligent devices should be able to recognise a far larger and more diverse set of audio environments, possibly using wireless communication with a smart phone. Moreover, the hearing aid should use this information to inform the way the sound is processed in the hearing aid. The purpose of the first arm of the project is to develop algorithms that will facilitate the development of such devices.
One of the focuses will be on a class of sounds called audio textures, which are richly structured, but temporally homogeneous signals. Examples include: diners babbling at a restaurant; a train rattling along a track; wind howling through the trees; water running from a tap. Audio textures are often indicative of the environment and they therefore carry valuable information about the scene that could be harnessed by a hearing aid. Moreover, textures often corrupt target signals and their suppression can help the hearing impaired. We will develop efficient texture recognition systems that can identify the noises present in an environment. Then we will design and test bespoke real-time noise reduction strategies that utilise information about the audio textures present in the environment.
Intelligent hearing devices
Sensorineural hearing loss can be associated with many underlying causes. Within the cochlea there may be dysfunction of the inner hair cells (IHCs) or outer hair cells (OHCs), metabolic disturbance, and structural abnormalities. Ideally, audiologists should fit a patient's hearing aid based on detailed knowledge of the underlying cause of the hearing loss, since this determines the optimal device settings or whether to proceed with the intervention at. Unfortunately, the hearing test employed in current fitting procedures, called the audiogram, is not able to reliably distinguish between many different forms of hearing loss.
More sophisticated hearing tests are needed, but it has proven hard to design them. In the second arm of the project we propose a different approach that refines a model of the patient's hearing loss after each stage of the test and uses this to automatically design and select stimuli for the next stage that are particularly informative. These tests will be be fast, accurate and capable of determining the form of the patient's specific underlying dysfunction. The model of a patient's hearing loss will then be used to setup hearing devices in an optimal way, using a mixture of computer simulation and listening test.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 目前的助听器有两大局限性： 1） 助听器音频处理策略不灵活，不能充分适应听力环境， 2） 听力测试和助听器安装程序不允许对听力损失的潜在性质进行可靠诊断，并且经常导致设备安装不良。 这项研究计划将使用新的机器学习方法来彻底改变助听器技术的这两个方面，从而产生智能听力设备和测试程序，从而积极了解患者的听力损失，从而实现更个性化的安装。 智能音频处理 助听器的最佳音频处理策略取决于声环境。例如，在安静的办公室里进行的谈话，其处理方式应与在繁忙的混响餐厅进行的谈话不同。目前的高端助听器确实在基于简单的声环境分类系统的少量不同处理策略之间切换，该系统可监测传入音频的简单方面。然而，分类精度有限，这也是听觉设备在噪声多源环境中表现不佳的原因之一。未来的智能设备应该能够识别更大、更多样化的音频环境，可能使用与智能手机的无线通信。此外，助听器应使用此信息告知助听器中声音的处理方式。该项目的第一个分支的目的是开发算法，以促进此类设备的开发。 其中一个焦点将是一类被称为音频纹理的声音，它们结构丰富，但时间上是均匀的信号。例如：用餐者在餐馆里叽叽喳喳；火车在铁轨上嘎嘎作响；风呼啸着穿过树林；水从水龙头流出。音频纹理通常表示环境，因此它们携带关于场景的宝贵信息，可以通过助听器加以利用。此外，纹理往往会破坏目标信号，对它们的抑制有助于听力受损。我们将开发有效的纹理识别系统，可以识别环境中存在的噪音。然后，我们将设计和测试定制的实时降噪策略，利用环境中存在的音频纹理信息。 智能听力设备 感音神经性耳聋可能与许多潜在原因有关。耳蜗内可能有内毛细胞（IHCs）或外毛细胞（OHCs）功能障碍、代谢紊乱和结构异常。理想情况下，听力专家应根据对听力损失潜在原因的详细了解来安装患者的助听器，因为这决定了最佳的设备设置或是否在进行干预。不幸的是，目前被称为听力图的听力测试不能可靠地区分多种不同形式的听力损失。 需要更复杂的听力测试，但事实证明很难设计。在该项目的第二部分中，我们提出了一种不同的方法，在测试的每一个阶段之后，改进患者听力损失的模型，并使用该方法自动设计和选择下一个阶段的刺激物，这些刺激物的信息量特别大。这些测试将是快速，准确和能够确定的形式，病人的具体潜在功能障碍。患者听力损失模型将被用于以最佳方式设置听力设备，使用计算机模拟和听力测试的混合。

Current hearing aids suffer from two major limitations:
1) hearing aid audio processing strategies are inflexible and do not adapt sufficiently to the listening environment, 2) hearing tests and hearing aid fitting procedures do not allow reliable diagnosis of the underlying nature of the hearing loss and frequently lead to poor fitting of devices.
This research programme will use new machine learning methods to revolutionise both of these aspects of hearing aid technology, leading to intelligent hearing devices and testing procedures which actively learn about a patient's hearing loss enabling more personalised fitting.
Intelligent audio processing
The optimal audio processing strategy for a hearing aid depends on the acoustic environment. A conversation held in a quiet office, for example, should be processed in a different way from one held in a busy reverberant restaurant. Current high-end hearing aids do switch between a small number of different processing strategies based upon a simple acoustic environment classification system that monitors simple aspects of the incoming audio. However, the classification accuracy is limited, which is one of the reasons why hearing devices perform very poorly in noisy multi-source environments. Future intelligent devices should be able to recognise a far larger and more diverse set of audio environments, possibly using wireless communication with a smart phone. Moreover, the hearing aid should use this information to inform the way the sound is processed in the hearing aid. The purpose of the first arm of the project is to develop algorithms that will facilitate the development of such devices.
One of the focuses will be on a class of sounds called audio textures, which are richly structured, but temporally homogeneous signals. Examples include: diners babbling at a restaurant; a train rattling along a track; wind howling through the trees; water running from a tap. Audio textures are often indicative of the environment and they therefore carry valuable information about the scene that could be harnessed by a hearing aid. Moreover, textures often corrupt target signals and their suppression can help the hearing impaired. We will develop efficient texture recognition systems that can identify the noises present in an environment. Then we will design and test bespoke real-time noise reduction strategies that utilise information about the audio textures present in the environment.
Intelligent hearing devices
Sensorineural hearing loss can be associated with many underlying causes. Within the cochlea there may be dysfunction of the inner hair cells (IHCs) or outer hair cells (OHCs), metabolic disturbance, and structural abnormalities. Ideally, audiologists should fit a patient's hearing aid based on detailed knowledge of the underlying cause of the hearing loss, since this determines the optimal device settings or whether to proceed with the intervention at. Unfortunately, the hearing test employed in current fitting procedures, called the audiogram, is not able to reliably distinguish between many different forms of hearing loss.
More sophisticated hearing tests are needed, but it has proven hard to design them. In the second arm of the project we propose a different approach that refines a model of the patient's hearing loss after each stage of the test and uses this to automatically design and select stimuli for the next stage that are particularly informative. These tests will be be fast, accurate and capable of determining the form of the patient's specific underlying dysfunction. The model of a patient's hearing loss will then be used to setup hearing devices in an optimal way, using a mixture of computer simulation and listening test.

Project.Title: The magnetic fabrics of surge type glaciers in Svalbard

Title_Other.Title: The magnetic fabrics of surge type glaciers in Svalbard
斯瓦尔巴德浪涌型冰川的磁组构

Project.Abstract: This project involves the novel application of anisotropy of magnetic susceptibility (AMS) to examine deformation within glacier ice. Preliminary results have demonstrated that AMS can provide reliable and useful fabric data from glacier basal ice, reveal ing new information about glacial strain. In this project, the technique will be used to investigate three surge type or suspected surge type glaciers in Svalbard in order to develop the application of this technique, examine the origin and evolution of s tructures within the ice and test the processes occurring during glacial surges in Svalbard and thus advance our understanding of surging glaciers.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 本计画包括利用磁化率各向异性（AMS）来检视冰川冰内部的变形。初步结果表明，AMS能提供可靠、有用的冰川基冰组构数据，揭示冰川应变的新信息。在本项目中，该技术将用于调查斯瓦尔巴特岛的三个浪涌型或疑似浪涌型冰川，以开发该技术的应用，研究冰中s结构的起源和演化，测试斯瓦尔巴特岛冰川涌动期间发生的过程，从而提高我们对涌动冰川的理解。

This project involves the novel application of anisotropy of magnetic susceptibility (AMS) to examine deformation within glacier ice. Preliminary results have demonstrated that AMS can provide reliable and useful fabric data from glacier basal ice, reveal ing new information about glacial strain. In this project, the technique will be used to investigate three surge type or suspected surge type glaciers in Svalbard in order to develop the application of this technique, examine the origin and evolution of s tructures within the ice and test the processes occurring during glacial surges in Svalbard and thus advance our understanding of surging glaciers.

Project.Title: Secure Legacy Application Integration with NCES (SLAIN)

Title_Other.Title: Secure Legacy Application Integration with NCES (SLAIN)
与NCE的安全遗留应用程序集成（SLAIN）

Project.Abstract: Over the last two years, Progeny has worked with the Office of Naval Research (ONR), Program Executive Office Integrated Warfare Systems (PEOIWS) 1, 5 and 6 as well as Program Executive Office Command, Control, Communications, Computers, and Intelligence (PEOC4I) on a project focused on acquisition and technology gaps that hinder achieving OPNAV N2/6 near-term goals for information dominance and efficient data sharing. We will be taking our work and preparing it for integration with various SPAWAR-determined ship and shore sites.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 在过去的两年里，后裔与海军研究办公室（ONR）、项目执行办公室综合作战系统（PEOIWS）1、5和6以及项目执行办公室指挥、控制、通信、计算机，以及情报部门（PEOC4I）在一个项目上的工作，该项目的重点是阻碍实现OPNAV N2/6近期目标的获取和技术差距，以实现信息优势和有效的数据共享。我们将采取我们的工作，并准备它与各种SPAWAR确定的船舶和海岸网站的整合。

Over the last two years, Progeny has worked with the Office of Naval Research (ONR), Program Executive Office Integrated Warfare Systems (PEOIWS) 1, 5 and 6 as well as Program Executive Office Command, Control, Communications, Computers, and Intelligence (PEOC4I) on a project focused on acquisition and technology gaps that hinder achieving OPNAV N2/6 near-term goals for information dominance and efficient data sharing. We will be taking our work and preparing it for integration with various SPAWAR-determined ship and shore sites.

Class.ClassName: 海洋生物资源、海洋生物资源开发

Project.Abstract: 9530332 Baumgartner This workshop will develop a science implementation plan for research in Pacific Ocean margins along the western Americas, including their distinctive upwelling and eastern boundary current ecosystems. The focus of the proposal is on the coastal and oceanic regions of the Pacific margins in order to focus on the biophysical interactions within a set of ecosystems that are significantly different from their Atlantic and estuarine counterparts. The research approach will use comparative studies of ecosystems, using the present and past spatial and temporal variability to identify and quantify the most important biophysical interactions and human impacts on those interactions. The goal is to increase the ability to predict the response of the ecosystems to natural and anthropogenic changes in environmental conditions using improved ecosystems models. The unifying theme of this workshop and the research program for Phase II will be the use of comparative and integrative studies of the physical, chemical, and biological processes, as well as the human-induced effects which drive the principal elements of the marine ecosystems. These ecosystems extend from the intertidal zone onshore to the pelagic region about 200 km offshore. The underlying scientific question to be addressed by this program is how to predict the response of these ecosystems and key populations to the forces of global change resulting from direct and indirect human intervention and from the stresses on natural systems which have been accumulating over the past century. The workshop participants will design a coherent and well-coordinated program to conduct comparative studies leading to substantially improved understanding of the control and regulation of population/ community structures and productivity of the ecosystems of interest. The workshop will address priority areas identified in the Inter-American Institute for Global Change Research (IAI) Science Agenda. The questions which will be addressed in the formation of a Phase II proposal consider the natural, intrinsic states and modes of variability in the large-scale biophysical systems which regulate local physical and biological characteristics of the ecosystems. The biophysical coupling which regulates abundance and distribution of planktonic components and closure of complex life cycles in both pelagic and benthic ecosystems is highlighted for particular attention. In addition, questions which also relate the concern for effects of direct and indirect intervention in the natural systems by human activities will be addressed. Lastly, there will be the application of our understanding of the interaction of natural processes and human activities to develop predictive models addressing the pre-eminent question of predicting and ecosystem responses under various global change scenarios. %%% This workshop will develop a science implementation plan for research in Pacific Ocean margins along the western Americas, including their distinctive upwelling and eastern boundary current ecosystems. The focus of the proposal is on the coastal and oceanic regions of the Pacific margins in order to focus the planning process on the biophysical interactions within a set of important ecosystems that are significantly different from their Atlantic and estuarine counterparts. The research approach will use comparative studies of ecosystems, using the present and past spatial and temporal variability to identify and quantify the most important biophysical interactions and the human impacts on those interactions. The goal is to increase the ability to predict the response of the ecosystems to natural and anthropogenic changes in environmental conditions, using improved ecosystems models. The upwelling regions off western North and South America are among the most biologically productive in the world's oceans. There is a correspondingly great potential for the commercial harvest of pelagic species like anchovies, sardines and mackerel, as well as harvest of the wild and cultivated benthic invertebrates like crustaceans, mollusks, and urchins. The economic importance of this ocean productivity to Peru and Chile is difficult to overestimate. Of the approximately 82 million metric tons (mmt) of marine fish landed in 1991 worldwide, Peru and Chile accounted for approximately 13 mmt (the U.S. west coast accounted for approximately 1 mmt). The landings in Peru and Chile are an order of magnitude greater than any other South American country and a factor of 5-6 times as great as the landings in other Pacific Eastern Boundary Current areas, making them the fourth and fifth most productive nations in the world in terms of fisheries landings. The economic impacts extend far beyond the direct income from exports and in-country sales. For instance, although the amount of fish landed off the west coast of the US was lower than Peru or Chile by a factor of 5-10, the US Department of Commerce lists the direct, indirect or induced impact of fisheries on the economies of California, Oregon and Washington in 1992 as US$4 billion. Canada, Chile, Mexico, Peru, and the United States will coordinate their research through the IAI Network of ecosystems of the eastern boundary regions of North and South America. These countries are members of the IAI, a United States initiative to stimulate global change research among the scientific institutions of the Americas. The National Science Foundation is the designated U.S. Government agency to carry out the U.S. responsibilities within the IAI. ***

9530332 Baumgartner本次研讨会将为西美洲太平洋边缘的研究制定科学实施计划，包括其独特的上升流和东部边界流生态系统。该提案的重点是太平洋边缘的沿海和海洋区域，以便侧重于一组生态系统内的生物物理相互作用，这些生态系统与大西洋和河口的对应生态系统有着显著的不同。研究方法将利用生态系统的比较研究，利用目前和过去的时空变异性，确定和量化最重要的生物物理相互作用和人类对这些相互作用的影响。目标是提高利用改进的生态系统模型预测生态系统对环境条件的自然和人为变化的反应的能力。本讲习班和第二阶段研究方案的统一主题将是对物理、化学和生物过程以及驱动海洋生态系统主要要素的人为影响进行比较和综合研究。这些生态系统从陆上潮间带延伸到离岸约200公里的远洋区。该计划要解决的根本科学问题是，如何预测这些生态系统和关键人口对全球变化力量的反应，这种力量是由人类直接和间接干预造成的，也是由于过去一个世纪以来对自然系统不断积累的压力造成的。讲习班参加者将设计一个协调一致的方案，进行比较研究，从而大大提高对有关生态系统的人口/社区结构和生产力的控制和管制的认识。研讨会将讨论美洲全球变化研究所（IAI）科学议程中确定的优先领域。在形成第二阶段提案时将讨论的问题考虑到调节生态系统局部物理和生物特性的大规模生物物理系统的自然、内在状态和变异模式。在远洋和底栖生态系统中，调节浮游生物成分的丰度和分布以及复杂生命周期的闭合的生物物理学耦合特别值得注意。此外，还将讨论与人类活动对自然系统的直接和间接干预的影响有关的问题。最后，我们将利用对自然过程和人类活动相互作用的理解，开发预测模型，解决各种全球变化情景下预测和生态系统反应这一突出问题。%%%该讲习班将制定一项科学实施计划，以研究西美洲太平洋边缘，包括其独特的上升流和东边界洋流生态系统。该提案的重点是太平洋边缘的沿海和海洋区域，以便将规划过程的重点放在一系列重要生态系统内的生物物理相互作用上，这些生态系统与大西洋和河口的对应生态系统有着显著的不同。研究方法将利用生态系统的比较研究，利用目前和过去的时空变异性，确定和量化最重要的生物物理相互作用以及人类对这些相互作用的影响。目标是利用改进的生态系统模型，提高预测生态系统对环境条件的自然和人为变化的反应的能力。北美洲和南美洲西部的上升流地区是世界海洋中生物生产力最高的地区之一。相应地，对鱼类、沙丁鱼和鲭鱼等远洋物种的商业捕捞，以及对甲壳类动物、软体动物和海胆等野生和栽培的底栖无脊椎动物的捕捞，都具有巨大的潜力。这种海洋生产力对秘鲁和智利的经济重要性难以高估。在全球约1991吨的海洋鱼类中，约8200万公吨（MMT），秘鲁和智利约占13 MMT（美国西海岸约占1 MMT）。秘鲁和智利的渔获量比南美其他任何国家都大一个数量级，是太平洋东部边界其他海流区渔获量的5-6倍，是世界上渔获量第四和第五大的国家。经济影响远远超出了出口和国内销售的直接收入。例如，虽然从美国西海岸捕捞的鱼类数量比秘鲁或智利低5-10倍，但美国商务部在1992年将渔业对加利福尼亚、俄勒冈州和华盛顿经济的直接、间接或诱发影响列为40亿美元。加拿大、智利、墨西哥、秘鲁和美国将通过美国北部和南部东部边界区域的生态系统IAI网络来协调他们的研究。这些国家是IAI的成员，IAI是美国在美洲科学机构中促进全球变化研究的一项倡议。美国国家科学基金会是美国政府指定的机构，在国际原子能机构内履行美国的职责。***

Class.ClassName: 混凝土结构、钢筋混凝土结构
理论、技术、方法、研究、评价、策略

Project.Abstract:
PUBLIC ABSTRACT
Soldiers often return from conflict with debilitating and disfiguring injuries, which can include the loss of hands, limbs, or feet after contact with explosive devices. Recovering from such injuries can be both physically and emotionally challenging, since the process is painful and extremely slow. Although prosthetics exist that can restore some key features of missing limbs, they do not restore many important neurological functions, such as fine motor skills and sensory modalities, including pain and touch. Prosthetics are also sometimes jarring to observers, such as young children. Limb transplantations, also known as vascularized composite allotransplantations (VCAs) are a remarkable medical development that promises to revolutionize our ability to replace the tissue loss caused by penetrating blast explosives. The success of VCAs depends on many factors, including (a) suppressing the patient's immune system to prevent rejection of the transplanted limb and (b) the vigorous growth of peripheral nerves into the transplanted limb, permitting the transplanted limb to both move and react to the environment. We seek to address both of these concerns in this proposal.
Peripheral nerves, unlike nerves in the brain and spinal cord, can completely regenerate. However the process is slow, estimated at ~1 mm/day. Thus, while minor nerve injuries heal in matter of weeks, patients recovering from serious nerve damage can take years to recover. Recovery is typically painful as the nerves grow back to their targets, and it is often inadequate; muscles can wither during this period, making it challenging for the patient to achieve a full recovery. Ongoing studies to reverse peripheral nerve injuries have focused on stitching severed nerves back together and implanting channels into patients for the nerves to grow along. Here, we propose a different therapy: improving the rate at which nerves grow into, i.e., reinnervate, limbs after VCA. We seek to better understand how immunosuppressant drugs affect nerve regeneration in Aim 1 (focus area: controlling and modulating a patient's immune response to maximize outcomes), and propose to develop critical, but as yet unrealized, therapeutics in Aim 2: drugs that speed up the rate at which peripheral nerves grow, thereby reducing the amount of time that it takes a patient to recover from nerve damage (focus area: reconstructive transplant rehabilitation, improving transplant function).
Our previous studies have identified a logical mechanistic premise to use as a basis for screening for drugs that accelerate the rate at which nerves grow. We have characterized a critical molecular mechanism that controls the rate at which peripheral nerves normally regenerate. Our studies have shown that immediately after a nerve injury, cofilin, a key regulator of cell movement, is inactivated by LIM domain kinase 1 (Limk1) to slow the rate of nerve growth. We have found that altering the activity of cofilin and Limk1 can accelerate the rate at which nerves extend by 15%-40%. Remarkably, even a 15% increase in the rate at which peripheral nerves regenerate has a profound effect on the ability of a mouse to recover function after nerve damage. Mice show an approximately two-fold increase in the rate at which they recover coordinated movement, sensory modalities, such as the ability to sense temperature or pain, recover approximately 30% faster and notably more robustly than controls.
Aim 1: Determine the effect of immune suppression on peripheral nerve regeneration. We will examine the effect of three commonly used immunosuppressant drugs on transplant patients, tacrolimus, cyclosporine A, and sirolimus on (a) the normal rate of peripheral nerve regeneration and (b) the activity of cofilin/Limk1, factors that control the rate at which nerves regenerate.
Aim 2: Identify drugs that target the cofilin/Limk1 pathway to increase the rate of axon regeneration. We will screen for compounds that increase the length of nerves extending from neurons compared to control treatments. Candidate drugs will be further screened to assess whether they act as cofilin activators or Limk1 inhibitors. In future experiments, we will examine whether the implantation/injection of candidate drugs results in the improvement in the recovery of neural function after either a peripheral nerve is severed or the transplantation of a limb in adult mice. Does an injured mouse treated with a candidate therapeutic recover the ability to walk or react to the environment faster than a sham-treated mouse?
We will anticipate seeking approval for human trials with candidate drugs that robustly increase the rate of growth of nerves and improve the rate of motor and sensory recovery by at least 30%. This series of experiments may result in drugs that approximately halve patient's recovery times after nerve injuries.

Abstract_Other.Abstract:
PUBLIC ABSTRACT
Soldiers often return from conflict with debilitating and disfiguring injuries, which can include the loss of hands, limbs, or feet after contact with explosive devices. Recovering from such injuries can be both physically and emotionally challenging, since the process is painful and extremely slow. Although prosthetics exist that can restore some key features of missing limbs, they do not restore many important neurological functions, such as fine motor skills and sensory modalities, including pain and touch. Prosthetics are also sometimes jarring to observers, such as young children. Limb transplantations, also known as vascularized composite allotransplantations (VCAs) are a remarkable medical development that promises to revolutionize our ability to replace the tissue loss caused by penetrating blast explosives. The success of VCAs depends on many factors, including (a) suppressing the patient's immune system to prevent rejection of the transplanted limb and (b) the vigorous growth of peripheral nerves into the transplanted limb, permitting the transplanted limb to both move and react to the environment. We seek to address both of these concerns in this proposal.
Peripheral nerves, unlike nerves in the brain and spinal cord, can completely regenerate. However the process is slow, estimated at ~1 mm/day. Thus, while minor nerve injuries heal in matter of weeks, patients recovering from serious nerve damage can take years to recover. Recovery is typically painful as the nerves grow back to their targets, and it is often inadequate; muscles can wither during this period, making it challenging for the patient to achieve a full recovery. Ongoing studies to reverse peripheral nerve injuries have focused on stitching severed nerves back together and implanting channels into patients for the nerves to grow along. Here, we propose a different therapy: improving the rate at which nerves grow into, i.e., reinnervate, limbs after VCA. We seek to better understand how immunosuppressant drugs affect nerve regeneration in Aim 1 (focus area: controlling and modulating a patient's immune response to maximize outcomes), and propose to develop critical, but as yet unrealized, therapeutics in Aim 2: drugs that speed up the rate at which peripheral nerves grow, thereby reducing the amount of time that it takes a patient to recover from nerve damage (focus area: reconstructive transplant rehabilitation, improving transplant function).
Our previous studies have identified a logical mechanistic premise to use as a basis for screening for drugs that accelerate the rate at which nerves grow. We have characterized a critical molecular mechanism that controls the rate at which peripheral nerves normally regenerate. Our studies have shown that immediately after a nerve injury, cofilin, a key regulator of cell movement, is inactivated by LIM domain kinase 1 (Limk1) to slow the rate of nerve growth. We have found that altering the activity of cofilin and Limk1 can accelerate the rate at which nerves extend by 15%-40%. Remarkably, even a 15% increase in the rate at which peripheral nerves regenerate has a profound effect on the ability of a mouse to recover function after nerve damage. Mice show an approximately two-fold increase in the rate at which they recover coordinated movement, sensory modalities, such as the ability to sense temperature or pain, recover approximately 30% faster and notably more robustly than controls.
Aim 1: Determine the effect of immune suppression on peripheral nerve regeneration. We will examine the effect of three commonly used immunosuppressant drugs on transplant patients, tacrolimus, cyclosporine A, and sirolimus on (a) the normal rate of peripheral nerve regeneration and (b) the activity of cofilin/Limk1, factors that control the rate at which nerves regenerate.
Aim 2: Identify drugs that target the cofilin/Limk1 pathway to increase the rate of axon regeneration. We will screen for compounds that increase the length of nerves extending from neurons compared to control treatments. Candidate drugs will be further screened to assess whether they act as cofilin activators or Limk1 inhibitors. In future experiments, we will examine whether the implantation/injection of candidate drugs results in the improvement in the recovery of neural function after either a peripheral nerve is severed or the transplantation of a limb in adult mice. Does an injured mouse treated with a candidate therapeutic recover the ability to walk or react to the environment faster than a sham-treated mouse?
We will anticipate seeking approval for human trials with candidate drugs that robustly increase the rate of growth of nerves and improve the rate of motor and sensory recovery by at least 30%. This series of experiments may result in drugs that approximately halve patient's recovery times after nerve injuries.

公共摘要 士兵们经常在冲突中因身体虚弱和毁容受伤而返回，这可能包括在接触爆炸装置后失去手、四肢或脚。从这样的伤病中恢复可能在身体和情感上都是具有挑战性的，因为这个过程是痛苦和极其缓慢的。虽然假肢存在可以恢复缺失肢体的一些关键特征，但它们不能恢复许多重要的神经功能，例如精细的运动技能和感觉方式，包括疼痛和触觉。假肢有时也会让观察者感到不安，比如小孩子。肢体移植，也被称为血管化复合同种异体移植（VCAs），是一项了不起的医学发展，有望彻底改变我们的能力，以取代穿透性爆炸造成的组织损失。VCAs的成功取决于许多因素，包括（a）抑制患者的免疫系统以防止移植肢体的排斥反应；（b）周围神经向移植肢体的旺盛生长，允许移植肢体同时运动和对环境作出反应。我们力求在这项建议中解决这两个问题。 与大脑和脊髓的神经不同，周围神经可以完全再生。但是这个过程是缓慢的，估计约为1毫米/天。因此，虽然轻微的神经损伤在几周内就会痊愈，但从严重神经损伤中恢复的患者可能需要数年才能康复。当神经生长回到目标时，恢复通常是痛苦的，而且常常是不充分的；在此期间，肌肉可能会萎缩，使患者难以实现完全恢复。目前正在进行的外周神经损伤修复研究主要集中在将切断的神经缝合在一起，并在患者体内植入神经生长通道。在这里，我们提出了一种不同的治疗方法：提高VCA后神经生长的速度，即神经再生。我们试图更好地了解免疫抑制药物如何影响AIM 1中的神经再生（重点领域：控制和调节患者的免疫应答以获得最大的结果），并建议在AIM 2中开发关键但尚未实现的治疗药物：加速周围神经生长的药物，从而减少患者从神经损伤中恢复所需的时间（重点领域：重建移植康复，改善移植功能）。 我们先前的研究已经确定了一个逻辑机制前提，作为筛选加速神经生长速度的药物的基础。我们已经描述了一种控制周围神经正常再生速率的关键分子机制。我们的研究表明，在神经损伤后，细胞运动的关键调节因子cofilin立即被LIM结构域激酶1（Limk1）灭活以减缓神经生长速度。我们发现改变cofilin和Limk1的活性可以加速神经的伸展速度15%-40%。值得注意的是，即使周围神经再生率增加15%，也会对神经损伤后小鼠恢复功能的能力产生深远影响。小鼠表现出大约两倍的速度，在他们恢复协调运动的速度，感觉模式，如感知温度或疼痛的能力，恢复约30%的速度，特别是更强劲地比对照组。 目的1：探讨免疫抑制对周围神经再生的影响。我们将检查三种常用的免疫抑制剂对移植患者的影响，他克莫司、环孢素A和西罗莫司对（A）周围神经再生正常率和（b）cofilin/Limk1活性的影响，这是控制神经再生率的因素。 目的2：寻找靶向cofilin/Limk1途径的药物，以提高轴突再生率。与对照组相比，我们将筛选能增加神经从神经元延伸长度的化合物。候选药物将进一步筛选，以评估它们是否作为辅酶激活剂或Limk1抑制剂。在未来的实验中，我们将研究在成年小鼠中植入/注射候选药物是否能改善周围神经切断或肢体移植后的神经功能恢复。一只受伤的老鼠

Project.Title: Consequences of Palmitic Acid Methyl Ester in Cerebral Ischemia

Title_Other.Title: Consequences of Palmitic Acid Methyl Ester in Cerebral Ischemia
棕榈酸甲酯在脑缺血中的作用

Project.Abstract: Cardiopulmonary arrest remains one of the leading causes of death and disability in the USA. Despite current advancements, prognosis remains poor following cardiac arrest. In this field, the prevalent quandary is the multi-factorial nature of cardiac arrest [i.e. whole-body (global) ischemia]. Whole body ischemia compromises cerebral, renal, and cardiac function, thus, consequently disrupting cerebral blood flow that results in severe and selective brain damage. Cardiac arrest-induced hypoperfusion (decrease in cerebral blood flow) contributes to neuronal cell death leading to cognitive impairment. Therefore, our goal is to identify novel neuroprotective therapies that will modulate cerebral blood flow and increase neuroprotection after ischemia. Our preliminary data suggests that methylation of palmitic acid (also known as palmitic acid methyl ester) but not palmitic acid (no methylation) is necessary to enhance cerebral blood flow, neuroprotection and cognitive function after cardiac arrest. We previously discovered that palmitic acid methyl ester functions as a novel vasodilator/neuroprotective agent; it is derived from the superior cervical ganglion innervating major cerebral arteries, and is enhanced in the presence of arginine derivatives. This discovery led to further investigations to determine the importance of fatty acid methylation as biological activators/targets. Methylation, via arginine derivatives, can be regulated by protein arginine methyltransferases (PRMTs), which are involved in histone methylation and other post-translational modifications. Interestingly, PRMT8 is expressed predominately in the brain with no known function to date. Therefore, our central hypothesis is that PRMT8 can methylate palmitic acid to form palmitic acid methyl ester, causing subsequent enhanced cerebral blood flow, neuroprotection, and functional outcomes after cardiac arrest.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 在美国，心肺骤停仍然是导致死亡和残疾的主要原因之一。尽管目前进展迅速，但心脏骤停后的预后仍然很差。在这一领域，普遍存在的窘境是心脏骤停的多因素性质[即全身（整体）缺血]。全身缺血损害脑、肾和心脏功能，从而扰乱脑血流，导致严重的选择性脑损伤。心搏骤停引起的低灌注（脑血流减少）导致神经元死亡，导致认知功能障碍。因此，我们的目标是确定新的神经保护疗法，将调节脑血流和增加缺血后的神经保护。我们的初步数据表明，棕榈酸甲基化（也称为棕榈酸甲酯）而不是棕榈酸甲基化（无甲基化）对于增强心脏骤停后的脑血流、神经保护和认知功能是必要的。我们以前发现棕榈酸甲酯是一种新型的血管扩张剂/神经保护剂；它来自支配大脑主要动脉的颈上神经节，在精氨酸衍生物存在下增强。这一发现导致了进一步的研究，以确定脂肪酸甲基化作为生物激活剂/靶点的重要性。通过精氨酸衍生物，甲基化可以由蛋白质精氨酸甲基转移酶（PRMTs）调节，PRMTs参与组蛋白甲基化和其他翻译后修饰。有趣的是，PRMT8主要在大脑中表达，至今还没有已知的功能。因此，我们的中心假设是，PRMT8可以甲基化棕榈酸形成棕榈酸甲酯，导致随后的脑血流增强，神经保护，以及心脏骤停后的功能转归。

Cardiopulmonary arrest remains one of the leading causes of death and disability in the USA. Despite current advancements, prognosis remains poor following cardiac arrest. In this field, the prevalent quandary is the multi-factorial nature of cardiac arrest [i.e. whole-body (global) ischemia]. Whole body ischemia compromises cerebral, renal, and cardiac function, thus, consequently disrupting cerebral blood flow that results in severe and selective brain damage. Cardiac arrest-induced hypoperfusion (decrease in cerebral blood flow) contributes to neuronal cell death leading to cognitive impairment. Therefore, our goal is to identify novel neuroprotective therapies that will modulate cerebral blood flow and increase neuroprotection after ischemia. Our preliminary data suggests that methylation of palmitic acid (also known as palmitic acid methyl ester) but not palmitic acid (no methylation) is necessary to enhance cerebral blood flow, neuroprotection and cognitive function after cardiac arrest. We previously discovered that palmitic acid methyl ester functions as a novel vasodilator/neuroprotective agent; it is derived from the superior cervical ganglion innervating major cerebral arteries, and is enhanced in the presence of arginine derivatives. This discovery led to further investigations to determine the importance of fatty acid methylation as biological activators/targets. Methylation, via arginine derivatives, can be regulated by protein arginine methyltransferases (PRMTs), which are involved in histone methylation and other post-translational modifications. Interestingly, PRMT8 is expressed predominately in the brain with no known function to date. Therefore, our central hypothesis is that PRMT8 can methylate palmitic acid to form palmitic acid methyl ester, causing subsequent enhanced cerebral blood flow, neuroprotection, and functional outcomes after cardiac arrest.

Project.Title: Structure and function of novel prokaryotic DNA transposases

Title_Other.Title: Structure and function of novel prokaryotic DNA transposases
新型原核dna转座酶的结构与功能

Project.Abstract: Towards our goal of understanding DNA transposition by the IS608 transposase, TnpA, we have recently reconstituted the entire recombination reaction in vitro using single-stranded DNA, and have solved the structures of six different complexes of TnpA with various oligonucleotides representing sequences located at the transposon ends. These structures have provided detailed views of sequential steps along the recombination pathway including (i) the pairing of transposon ends caused by TnpA binding to DNA hairpin structures located close to each end; (ii) the large-scale conformational change induced by hairpin binding that causes the transition from an inactive enzyme to one with a correctly assembled active site; (iii) the orientation of the transposon ends in the active site; and (iv) the mode of target site recognition. This last observation is particularly important as it immediately suggests ways to modify the system so that alternate targets might be used for transposition. In particular, we hope to devise methods to allow targets longer than a tetranucleotide to be used. If we can do this, this might allow the precise introduction of exogenous genes into benign locations in chromosomes or places where gene expression can be appropriately controlled in a cell- and development-specific manner. We are also investigating another member of the IS200 superfamily, ISDra2, to determine if features of IS608 transposition might be generalizable to the entire superfamily. ISDra2 is particularly interesting as its transposition is specifically induced in Deinococcus radiodurans upon UV or gamma irradiation (Mennecier et al., 2006). We have solved a series of Dra2-DNA complexes, and shown that although many of the principles of targeting found for IS608 are also applicable, there are subtle yet mechanistically important differences. One noteworthy difference is that ISDra2 recognizes five nucleotides at its target site, rather than the four of IS608. The manner in which ISDra2 accomplishes this extends our understanding of the mechanism of transposition. We have also been able to structurally capture the pre-cleavage state along the pathway, a snapshot that eluded us with the IS608 system. Curcio, M.J. and Derbyshire, K.M. (2003) Nat. Rev. Mol. Cell. Biol. 4, 865-877. Debets-Ossenkopp, Y.J., et al. (1999) Antimicrob. Agents Chemother. 43, 2657-2662. Kersulyte, D., et al. (2002) J. Bacteriol. 184, 992-1002. Mennecier, S., Servant, P., Coste, G., Bailone, A., and Sommer, S. (2006) Mol. Microbiol. 59, 317-325. Sebaihia, M. et al. (2006) Nature Genet. 38, 779-786.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 为了了解is608转座酶tnpa对dna的转座作用，我们最近利用单链dna在体外重建了整个重组反应，并解决了六种不同的tnpa与代表转座末端序列的寡核苷酸复合物的结构。这些结构提供了沿着重组途径的顺序步骤的详细视图，包括（i）由tnpa结合到位于每一端附近的dna发夹结构引起的转座子末端配对；（ii）由发夹结合引起的大规模构象变化，导致从非活性酶到具有正确组装的活性位点的酶的转变；（iii）转座子的方向在活性位点结束；和（iv）目标位点识别模式。这最后一次观察尤其重要，因为它立即提出了修改系统的方法，以便可以使用替代目标进行换位。特别是，我们希望能够设计出一种方法来允许比四核苷酸更长的靶点被使用。如果我们能做到这一点，这可能会允许将外源基因精确地导入染色体上的良性部位或基因表达可以以细胞和发育特定的方式适当控制的部位。我们也在调查IS200超家族的另一个成员ISDRA2，以确定IS608转位的特征是否可以推广到整个超家族。ISDRA2特别有趣，因为它的转位是在紫外线或γ辐射下在耐辐射球菌中特别诱导的（Mennecier等人，2006）。我们已经解决了一系列的DRA2 DNA复合物，并表明，虽然IS608的许多靶向原理也适用，但仍存在细微但机械上重要的差异。一个值得注意的区别是ISDRA2在其靶位识别五个核苷酸，而不是IS608的四个。ISDRA2实现这一点的方式扩展了我们对换位机制的理解。我们还能够在结构上捕捉到沿着路径的预解理状态，这是IS608系统无法捕捉到的快照。Curcio，M.J.和Derbyshire，K.M.（2003），国家。修订版分子细胞。比尔。4865-877。Debets Ossenkopp，Y.J.等人（1999）抗菌。化学疗法。432657-2662年。Kersulyte，D.等人（2002）细菌学杂志。184992-1002年。Mennecier，S.，Servant，P.，Coste，G.，Bailone，A.，和Sommer，S.（2006）分子微生物学。59317-325。Sebaihia，M.等人（2006）自然基因。38779-786。

Towards our goal of understanding DNA transposition by the IS608 transposase, TnpA, we have recently reconstituted the entire recombination reaction in vitro using single-stranded DNA, and have solved the structures of six different complexes of TnpA with various oligonucleotides representing sequences located at the transposon ends. These structures have provided detailed views of sequential steps along the recombination pathway including (i) the pairing of transposon ends caused by TnpA binding to DNA hairpin structures located close to each end; (ii) the large-scale conformational change induced by hairpin binding that causes the transition from an inactive enzyme to one with a correctly assembled active site; (iii) the orientation of the transposon ends in the active site; and (iv) the mode of target site recognition. This last observation is particularly important as it immediately suggests ways to modify the system so that alternate targets might be used for transposition. In particular, we hope to devise methods to allow targets longer than a tetranucleotide to be used. If we can do this, this might allow the precise introduction of exogenous genes into benign locations in chromosomes or places where gene expression can be appropriately controlled in a cell- and development-specific manner. We are also investigating another member of the IS200 superfamily, ISDra2, to determine if features of IS608 transposition might be generalizable to the entire superfamily. ISDra2 is particularly interesting as its transposition is specifically induced in Deinococcus radiodurans upon UV or gamma irradiation (Mennecier et al., 2006). We have solved a series of Dra2-DNA complexes, and shown that although many of the principles of targeting found for IS608 are also applicable, there are subtle yet mechanistically important differences. One noteworthy difference is that ISDra2 recognizes five nucleotides at its target site, rather than the four of IS608. The manner in which ISDra2 accomplishes this extends our understanding of the mechanism of transposition. We have also been able to structurally capture the pre-cleavage state along the pathway, a snapshot that eluded us with the IS608 system. Curcio, M.J. and Derbyshire, K.M. (2003) Nat. Rev. Mol. Cell. Biol. 4, 865-877. Debets-Ossenkopp, Y.J., et al. (1999) Antimicrob. Agents Chemother. 43, 2657-2662. Kersulyte, D., et al. (2002) J. Bacteriol. 184, 992-1002. Mennecier, S., Servant, P., Coste, G., Bailone, A., and Sommer, S. (2006) Mol. Microbiol. 59, 317-325. Sebaihia, M. et al. (2006) Nature Genet. 38, 779-786.

Project.Title: Predictive Analysis of Complex Interfacial Flows (PACIF)

Title_Other.Title: Predictive Analysis of Complex Interfacial Flows (PACIF)
复杂界面流动的预测分析（PACIF）

Project.Abstract: Interfacial flows are encountered in a wide variety of natural phenomena and technological applications: from underwater, river and lava flows to biological settings such as tear films in the eye to conventional engineering applications such as condensers, heat exchangers and distillation units and more recent developments in the area of microreactors/MEMS and nanotechnology. The length scales involved range from the nanometer level as for dewetting of thin films, to the centimetre scale for heat and mass transfer applications, to the meter scale for geological flows. These processes and devices often depend critically on the behaviour of liquid films, especially in the presence of moving contact lines. The proposed research is a synergistic approach combining state-of-the-art theory, modelling, simulations and experimentation and involves a highly multi-disciplinary effort with a team that includes chemical/mechanical engineers, chemists, physicists and applied mathematicians. The proposed research calling upon the complementary expertise of this team aims to examine a number of open problems and research directions in the area of complex interfacial flows. For instance, a crucial problem in current predictive models for flows with moving contact lines is that artificial measures are required to alleviate the contact-line singularity. As a consequence, the necessary local mesh refinement to fully resolve the flow near contact lines render current models either unrealistic or excessively inefficient. The proposed research is therefore of paramount scientific and practical significance. It is a high-risk effort to provide the foundations and methodologies necessary for a detailed understanding of complex interfacial flows with moving contact lines and the development of tools for the accurate and efficient prediction of their dynamics that can be used in future research. The ultimate aim is the use of these tools for optimisation of processes and devices that exploit such flows.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 界面流在许多自然现象和技术应用中都会遇到：从水下、河流和熔岩流到生物环境（如眼中的泪膜）再到传统的工程应用（如冷凝器），热交换器和蒸馏装置以及微反应器/MEMS和纳米技术领域的最新发展。所涉及的长度尺度从薄膜的脱湿纳米尺度到用于传热传质的厘米尺度，再到用于地质流动的米尺度。这些过程和装置通常在很大程度上取决于液膜的性能，特别是在存在移动接触线的情况下。拟议的研究是一种结合最新理论、建模、模拟和实验的协同方法，涉及一个高度多学科的团队，包括化学/机械工程师、化学家、物理学家和应用数学家。拟议的研究需要该小组的补充专门知识，目的是审查复杂界面流领域的一些开放问题和研究方向。例如，在现有的接触线运动预测模型中，一个关键的问题是需要人工措施来缓解接触线的奇异性。因此，为了完全解决接触线附近的流动问题，必须进行局部网格细化，这使得当前的模型要么不现实，要么效率太低。因此，本研究具有重要的科学意义和现实意义。这是一个高风险的努力，提供必要的基础和方法，以详细理解复杂的界面流动与移动接触线和工具的发展，以准确和有效地预测其动态，可用于未来的研究。最终目的是使用这些工具优化利用这些流的过程和设备。

Interfacial flows are encountered in a wide variety of natural phenomena and technological applications: from underwater, river and lava flows to biological settings such as tear films in the eye to conventional engineering applications such as condensers, heat exchangers and distillation units and more recent developments in the area of microreactors/MEMS and nanotechnology. The length scales involved range from the nanometer level as for dewetting of thin films, to the centimetre scale for heat and mass transfer applications, to the meter scale for geological flows. These processes and devices often depend critically on the behaviour of liquid films, especially in the presence of moving contact lines. The proposed research is a synergistic approach combining state-of-the-art theory, modelling, simulations and experimentation and involves a highly multi-disciplinary effort with a team that includes chemical/mechanical engineers, chemists, physicists and applied mathematicians. The proposed research calling upon the complementary expertise of this team aims to examine a number of open problems and research directions in the area of complex interfacial flows. For instance, a crucial problem in current predictive models for flows with moving contact lines is that artificial measures are required to alleviate the contact-line singularity. As a consequence, the necessary local mesh refinement to fully resolve the flow near contact lines render current models either unrealistic or excessively inefficient. The proposed research is therefore of paramount scientific and practical significance. It is a high-risk effort to provide the foundations and methodologies necessary for a detailed understanding of complex interfacial flows with moving contact lines and the development of tools for the accurate and efficient prediction of their dynamics that can be used in future research. The ultimate aim is the use of these tools for optimisation of processes and devices that exploit such flows.

Source.Name: Engineering and Physical Sciences Research Council

Project.Title: EAGER: COLLABORATIVE RESEARCH: Developmental mechanisms of perception and language in the infant brain

Title_Other.Title: EAGER: COLLABORATIVE RESEARCH: Developmental mechanisms of perception and language in the infant brain
合作研究：婴儿大脑感知和语言的发展机制

Class.ClassName: 分析作业方法、分析作业技术

Project.Abstract: Understanding what infants understand about objects and words that they encounter in the world has been an important goal in developmental science, but the field understands relatively little about how infants perform either of these two tasks. Several neuroimaging methods have been used to determine how adult brains recognize familiar objects and words, but most of these methods are not suitable for use with infants. The goal of this research project is to deploy two neuroimaging methods that are amenable for use with infants, as a novel way to gain insights into the fundamental brain mechanisms that enable object recognition and word understanding in 3- to 12-month-old infants. One technique, electroencephalography (EEG) involves measuring electrical activity generated by the brain from sensors on the scalp. The other, functional near-infrared spectroscopy (fNIRS), shines near-infrared light through the skull and measures how it is absorbed by the brain at each location as an index of how active that part of the brain is. Recording both these measures while infants watch and listen to stimuli will provide important insights into how the infant brain processes this information. EEG has been in use with infants for many years, whereas functional near-infrared spectroscopy (fNIRS) is a relatively newer non-invasive neuroimaging technique ideally suited for use with infants. fNIRS, like fMRI, provides a signature of metabolic activity in localized regions of the brain but is more suitable for infants because it delivers light to the scalp via a tight-fitting cap. In this project, EEG and fNIRS will be used to measure electrical and metabolic activity in the brain as infants watch objects of various categories such as vehicles or furniture, or listen to words that they know or do not know (or nonsense words). The key analysis tool is a suite of machine-learning algorithms from the field of computer science that take the EEG or fNIRS signals to determine which components of these signals best predict, on a trial by trial basis, what the infant was seeing or hearing. The outcome of the proposed research will localize in the brain where encoding of visual objects and spoken words takes place and over what time period after stimulus onset that processing occurs. These are fundamental aspects of object and language processing have eluded study in the human infant because of methodological challenges. Establishing protocols for analyzing data generated by these two methods will contribute to analytic techniques available for future infant brain research. Identifying normative properties of these processing mechanisms in the infant brain will set the stage for future research investigating how the developing brain is affected by variations in early experience, by compensation after injury, and by a variety of genetic anomalies.

Several neuroimaging methods have been used to determine how adult brains recognize familiar objects and words, but most of these methods are not suitable for use with infants. The goal of this research project is to deploy two neuroimaging methods that are amenable for use with infants, as a novel way to gain insights into the fundamental brain mechanisms that enable object recognition and word understanding in 3- to 12-month-old infants. 理解婴儿对他们在世界上遇到的物体和单词的理解是发展科学的一个重要目标，但是这个领域对婴儿如何完成这两个任务的理解相对较少。有几种神经影像学方法被用来确定成人大脑如何识别熟悉的物体和单词，但这些方法大多不适合婴儿使用。该研究项目的目标是部署两种适合婴儿使用的神经成像方法，作为一种新的方法，深入了解使3-12个月大婴儿能够进行物体识别和单词理解的基本大脑机制。一种技术，脑电图（EEG）涉及测量大脑从头皮上的传感器产生的电活动。另一种是功能性近红外光谱仪（fNIRS），它通过头骨发出近红外光，并测量大脑如何在每个位置吸收它，以此作为大脑该部分活动程度的指标。当婴儿观看和聆听刺激物时，记录这两种测量将提供婴儿大脑如何处理这些信息的重要见解。脑电图已经在婴儿身上使用多年，而功能性近红外光谱（fNIRS）是一种相对较新的非侵入性神经成像技术，非常适合婴儿使用。fNIRS和fMRI一样，在大脑的局部区域提供了代谢活动的特征，但更适合婴儿，因为它通过一个紧密的盖子将光传送到头皮。在这个项目中，脑电图（EEG）和fNIRS将被用来测量婴儿的大脑中的电活动和代谢活动，因为婴儿观看各种类型的物体，如车辆或家具，或听他们知道或不知道的单词（或无意义的单词）。关键的分析工具是一套计算机科学领域的机器学习算法，这些算法利用脑电或fNIRS信号来确定这些信号的哪些成分在逐个试验的基础上最能预测婴儿的视觉或听觉。这项研究的结果将定位在大脑中视觉对象和口语的编码发生的地方，以及刺激开始后的一段时间内发生的处理过程。这些都是对象和语言处理的基本方面，由于方法学上的挑战，在人类婴儿身上的研究一直未能实现。建立分析由这两种方法产生的数据的协议将有助于为未来婴儿大脑研究提供分析技术。确定婴儿大脑中这些加工机制的规范性特征，将为今后研究奠定基础，研究早期经验的变化、损伤后的补偿以及各种遗传异常对发育中大脑的影响。
