苍蝇对罗浮顿产的家畜造成相当大的损害。昆虫每年侵扰产量的5-10%。这导致质量下降，价格下降。家畜产量大，产品作为出口商品十分重要。每年，乐丰的生产商都会因苍蝇而损失700-2000万挪威克朗。尽管损失巨大，但很少有人试图研究和解决这个问题。 河豚在初春时节还在鱼身上产卵。幼虫在鱼体内发育，然后留下食物来源在地上化蛹。我们将开发和试验方法，以吸引和诱捕成虫和幼虫。我们还将调查主要毁灭性蝇类的生命周期和种群增长潜力。捕集方案将在生产区实施，并随着项目的进行不断完善和完善。在整个项目期间，将监测蝇密度和家畜的损害。畜牧鱼类生产为不自然的大白种种群创造了一个基础，我们预计最大的减灾发生在项目的最后一年，当当地的蝇种群通过连续诱捕努力减少。 这项工程对养鱼者来说是很重要的。它可以确保他们的产品质量更高，增加利润，刺激行业增长。通过稳定收入和提高客户的声誉，既有直接的经济效益，也有长期的效果。我们将在生产现场开展大部分工作，以确保生产商的积极参与。有关成果和控制方案的信息将通过国际科学出版物和已经建立的信息渠道，包括通讯、讲习班、研讨会、杂志、因特网和当地新闻界的联系，向所有有关各方提供。

Project.Title: FETAL ORIGIN OF ADULT DISEASE? A POPULATION-BASED STUDY OF THE OFFSPRING OF WOMEN WITH SEVERE MENTAL DISORDERS

Title_Other.Title: FETAL ORIGIN OF ADULT DISEASE? A POPULATION-BASED STUDY OF THE OFFSPRING OF WOMEN WITH SEVERE MENTAL DISORDERS
成人疾病的胎儿起源？严重精神障碍妇女后代的人群研究

Project.Abstract: Fetal origin of adult disease is a currently influential paradigm in epidemiological research into common diseases (ischaemic heart disease, hypertension, diabetes) and behaviour problems (suicide, criminal offending). It postulates an early pathophysiological programming of outcomes that become manifest in adult life. In the proposed research we aim to examine key aspects of this model by conducting a population-based study on the developmental outcomes, antecedent and concomitant risk factors, and a spectrum of neuropsychiatric morbidity in all children (N-5150) born in Western Australia in 1980-2001 to women diagnosed with schizophrenia, bipolar affective disorder or unipolar depression, as compared to children (N-504,553) born to women without a diagnosed psychiatric illness. The study will be based on record linkage, utilising the unique resource of multiple, comprehensive population databases in Western Australia. Specifically, this research will identify the range of developmental outcomes and morbidity in four consecutive birth cohorts (1980-84; 1985-89; 1990-94; and 1995-2001) of children at high genetic and environmental risk and examine their relationship to specific risk factors, including familial genetic load, obstetric complications, severity of maternal illness, and psychosocial adversity. The study will be the first of its kind and its findings will inform aetiological research into the major mental disorders, as well as clinical and public health practice. It will provide novel data on fundamental issues, such as the interaction between genetic risk and environmental factors in the causation of schizophrenia, as well as on the extent to which the risk of developing severe mental illness is immutably embedded in its fetal origin, or is modifiable by subsequent mitigating factors and appropriate intervention.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 成人疾病的胎儿起源在常见疾病（缺血性心脏病、高血压、糖尿病）和行为问题（自杀、犯罪）的流行病学研究中是一个具有影响力的研究范式。它假设一个早期的病理生理程序的结果，成为显着的成人生活。在提议的研究中，我们的目的是通过对1980-2001年在西澳大利亚出生的所有患有精神分裂症的妇女（N-5150）的发育结果、前因和伴随危险因素以及神经精神病发病率谱进行基于人群的研究，来检验该模型的关键方面，双相情感障碍或单极性抑郁症，与未经诊断患有精神疾病的妇女所生的儿童（N-504553）相比。这项研究将以记录联系为基础，利用西澳大利亚多个综合人口数据库的独特资源。具体来说，这项研究将确定四个连续出生队列（1980-84；1985-89；1990-94；和1995-2001）的高遗传和环境风险儿童的发育结果和发病率范围，并检查它们与特定风险因素的关系，包括家庭遗传负荷、产科并发症，母亲疾病的严重性和心理社会逆境。这项研究将是第一次，它的发现将为主要精神疾病的病原学研究以及临床和公共卫生实践提供信息。它将提供关于基本问题的新数据，例如遗传风险和导致精神分裂症的环境因素之间的相互作用，以及发展严重精神疾病的风险在多大程度上不受胎儿来源的影响，或者可以通过随后的缓解因素和适当的干预来改变。

Fetal origin of adult disease is a currently influential paradigm in epidemiological research into common diseases (ischaemic heart disease, hypertension, diabetes) and behaviour problems (suicide, criminal offending). It postulates an early pathophysiological programming of outcomes that become manifest in adult life. In the proposed research we aim to examine key aspects of this model by conducting a population-based study on the developmental outcomes, antecedent and concomitant risk factors, and a spectrum of neuropsychiatric morbidity in all children (N-5150) born in Western Australia in 1980-2001 to women diagnosed with schizophrenia, bipolar affective disorder or unipolar depression, as compared to children (N-504,553) born to women without a diagnosed psychiatric illness. The study will be based on record linkage, utilising the unique resource of multiple, comprehensive population databases in Western Australia. Specifically, this research will identify the range of developmental outcomes and morbidity in four consecutive birth cohorts (1980-84; 1985-89; 1990-94; and 1995-2001) of children at high genetic and environmental risk and examine their relationship to specific risk factors, including familial genetic load, obstetric complications, severity of maternal illness, and psychosocial adversity. The study will be the first of its kind and its findings will inform aetiological research into the major mental disorders, as well as clinical and public health practice. It will provide novel data on fundamental issues, such as the interaction between genetic risk and environmental factors in the causation of schizophrenia, as well as on the extent to which the risk of developing severe mental illness is immutably embedded in its fetal origin, or is modifiable by subsequent mitigating factors and appropriate intervention.

Source.Name: National Health and Medical Research Council

Project.Title: Doctoral Dissertation Research: Measuring the Benefits of Reproductive Health Services

Title_Other.Title: Doctoral Dissertation Research: Measuring the Benefits of Reproductive Health Services
博士论文研究：衡量生殖健康服务的效益

Project.Abstract: Reproductive health services such as family planning, pregnancy care, and HIV prevention services are readily accessible in the developed world. Yet in poor countries, even basic reproductive health services are often unavailable. Though governments and non-governmental organizations struggle to increase coverage of these services, the benefits accruing from increased access are relatively unknown. The purpose of this study is to assess the impacts of reproductive health services (RHS) in the context of poor countries in Africa. Primary benefits resulting from increased access to RHS may include improvements in maternal health, especially post-partum, increased satisfaction with family size, and lower incidence of HIV infections. However, the secondary benefits have longer-term impacts on the wellbeing of individuals and the development of the country economically. Such secondary impacts include improvements to the health of the children of recipients, increases in education, and the resulting benefits to future labor markets. By correctly estimating the benefits of RHS in terms of maternal and child health, child education, and HIV infection, this study will inform decisions regarding efforts to increase or sustain access to such services. The broad impact of this study will be to provide donors and service providers with the information necessary to accurately compare the benefits of RHS with the cost of providing the services. Current knowledge of such benefits is often contradictory and is plagued with methodological shortcomings. Studies that have attempted to quantify the benefits of RHS have been generally confounded by important unobserved factors, such as family choice in receiving such services. Without methodologically dealing with these unobservables, it is impossible to identify the true causal effect of RHS on outcomes. In addition to the broader impacts of this study discussed above, this project will also exhibit intellectual merit in the methods used to address these substantial challenges. The researcher will make use of an exogenous change in U.S. policy to circumvent endogeneity issues that typically hamper research of this ature. The 2001 implementation of the Mexico City Policy affected U.S. development assistance and reduced funding to major RHS service providers in around 10 African countries. The policy effectively reduced availability of RHS to vrying degrees in communities throughout these countries. First, the impact of the policy on service provision in affected communities will be assessed. The analysis will combine existing household survey data with institutional survey data to be collected by the researcher. This preliminary analysis will involve differencing methods based on the exogeneity of policy timing and location of organizational cut-backs. After assessing the impact of the policy on service provision, the policy change will be used as an instrument to identify the impact of RHS on outcomes of interest. By examining the impact of exogenous availability on outcomes, the project will abstract from the family choice to receive services that would otherwise bias the results. Outcomes of interest will be: indicators of maternal post-partum health, indicators of health-at-birth such as prevalence of pre-term births and prevalence of low birth weight;indicators of child health such as weight-for-height and height-for-age of children under age six; and indicators of human capital development such as percent enrolled in primary school.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 发达国家很容易获得计划生育、孕期保健和艾滋病毒预防等生殖健康服务。然而，在贫穷国家，即使是基本的生殖健康服务也常常得不到。尽管各国政府和非政府组织努力提高这些服务的覆盖面，但增加获得这些服务的机会所带来的好处却相对未知。本研究旨在评估生殖健康服务对非洲贫穷国家的影响。增加获得生殖健康服务的机会带来的主要好处可能包括改善产妇健康，特别是产后健康，提高对家庭规模的满意度，降低艾滋病毒感染率。但是，次级福利对个人的福利和国家经济的发展有着长期的影响。这些次要影响包括改善受教育者子女的健康状况，增加教育，以及由此给未来劳动力市场带来的好处。通过正确估计RHS在妇幼保健、儿童教育和艾滋病毒感染方面的益处，本研究将为增加或保持获得此类服务的机会提供决策依据。这项研究的广泛影响将是向捐助者和服务提供者提供必要的信息，以便准确比较RHS的效益和提供服务的成本。目前对这些好处的认识往往是矛盾的，并且充满了方法上的缺陷。试图量化RHS益处的研究通常被一些不可观察的重要因素所混淆，例如接受此类服务的家庭选择。如果不对这些不可观察因素进行方法学处理，就不可能确定RHS对结果的真正因果影响。除了上述研究的广泛影响外，该项目还将在解决这些实质性挑战的方法方面显示出智力价值。研究人员将利用美国政策中的外生变化来规避通常阻碍这一自然规律研究的内生性问题。2001年墨西哥城政策的实施影响了美国的发展援助，并减少了对大约10个非洲国家主要RHS服务提供商的资助。该政策有效地将这些国家社区的RHS可用性降低到Vring程度。首先，将评估该政策对受影响社区提供服务的影响。分析将结合现有的住户调查数据和研究人员收集的机构调查数据。这一初步分析将涉及基于政策时机和组织削减地点的外部性的不同方法。在评估政策对服务提供的影响后，政策变更将被用作确定RHS对相关结果的影响的工具。通过研究外生可得性对结果的影响，该项目将从家庭选择中抽象出接受服务的方式，否则会影响结果。感兴趣的结果将是：产妇产后健康指标，出生时健康指标，如产前出生率和低出生体重率；儿童健康指标，如身高体重和6岁以下儿童身高；以及小学入学率等人力资本发展指标。

Source.Name: Directorate for Social, Behavioral & Economic Sciences

Project.Title: Flexible Restoration for Remanufacture of Rolling Stock Components

Title_Other.Title: Flexible Restoration for Remanufacture of Rolling Stock Components
机车车辆零部件再制造的柔性修复

Project.Abstract: Increasingly stringent environmental regulations such as WEEE and End-of-Life (EoL) Vehicle Directive require the reuse of waste. Remanufacturing adds value to waste streams by returning EoL items to working order rather than reducing them to their raw material value only, preserves more than 80% of the material and energy used to manufacture a new product [PEARL, 2010], thus is considered as an important element of the circular economy. Restoration, which returns defective parts back to service life is a critical operation of remanufacturing and could account for up to 50% of total remanufacturing cost. Currently restoration is still ad-hoc. Focusing on one-off production resulting from the differential quality of returned defective products, this feasibility study aims to assess and validate a new flexible restoration for the remanufacture of rolling stock components. This would address one of the major barriers hindering the uptake of remanufacturing which is the inability to remanufacture at a cost similar to that of mass production. The results of the study could lead to significant improvement in efficiency, thus promoting the expansion of the remanufacturing industry.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: Increasingly stringent environmental regulations such as WEEE and End-of-Life (EoL) Vehicle Directive require the reuse of waste. Remanufacturing adds value to waste streams by returning EoL items to working order rather than reducing them to their raw material value only, preserves more than 80% of the material and energy used to manufacture a new product [PEARL, 2010], thus is considered as an important element of the circular economy. Restoration, which returns defective parts back to service life is a critical operation of remanufacturing and could account for up to 50% of total remanufacturing cost. Currently restoration is still ad-hoc. Focusing on one-off production resulting from the differential quality of returned defective products, this feasibility study aims to assess and validate a new flexible restoration for the remanufacture of rolling stock components. This would address one of the major barriers hindering the uptake of remanufacturing which is the inability to remanufacture at a cost similar to that of mass production. The results of the study could lead to significant improvement in efficiency, thus promoting the expansion of the remanufacturing industry.

越来越严格的环境法规，如WEEE和报废（EoL）车辆指令，要求废物的再利用。再制造通过使下线项目恢复正常工作状态而不是仅将其降低到原材料价值，从而增加了废物流的价值，保留了用于制造新产品的80%以上的材料和能源【PEARL，2010年】，因此被视为循环经济的一个重要元素。修复是再制造的一个关键环节，它可以使有缺陷的零件恢复到使用寿命，并且可以占到再制造总成本的50%。目前恢复仍然是临时的。本次研究的目的是针对退货缺陷产品的质量差异导致的一次性生产，目的是评估和验证一种新的用于机车车辆零部件再制造的柔性修复。这将解决阻碍再制造的主要障碍之一，即无法以类似于大规模生产的成本进行再制造。研究结果可以显著提高再制造业的效率，从而促进再制造业的发展。

Project.Title: Kahnawake center for research and training in diabetes prevention

Title_Other.Title: Kahnawake center for research and training in diabetes prevention
卡纳维克糖尿病预防研究训练中心

Project.Title: Psychophysiology of Emotion

Title_Other.Title: Psychophysiology of Emotion
情绪心理生理学

Project.Title: Collaborative Research: Women in Science and Technology Policy

Title_Other.Title: 合作研究：妇女参与科技政策
Collaborative Research: Women in Science and Technology Policy

Project.Abstract: The work of science and technology (S&T) policymaking agencies in the United States is important to building knowledge and economic growth. These agencies make decisions about how to structure policies and programs for funding science and technology development, how to promote technology transfer and innovation, and how to use scientific and technical methods in federal regulation and oversight. This project investigates the role that gender plays in the creation of science and technology policy through a study of women's careers in US federal policymaking. Research across the social sciences has investigated the advantages of including diverse perspectives in decision-making, including the perspectives of men and women leaders. While there is much research on women in science and women in management or government, there is little previous research on the role of women leaders in science and technology policy. This project explores new ground by providing both qualitative and quantitative measures of women's participation and influence on science and technology policy at the federal level. Data collection focuses on leadership in S&T policymaking agencies from 1992-2008. Products include a multiyear, multiagency dataset of women's careers in S&T policy at the federal level. The research informs understanding of organizational processes from theories at the intersection of multiple social science disciplines and areas, including: science and technology studies; sociology; political science; public policy; management science; and economics. For example, whether variation in the organizational structures of S&T agencies shapes women's participation in science and technology policy is a question of wide intellectual interest. To science policy studies, this work contributes important insights on how leaders at agencies that fund science view their respective roles in the knowledge production processes. Broader Impacts: Research funding is the lifeblood of science and engineering. This project contributes to our understanding of that vital role of S&T policymaking agencies by investigating the organization and leadership of federal level S&T policymaking agencies in the United States. Understanding how women leaders have contributed to the S&T policy agenda, how variation in the participation of women in different agencies has produced different outcomes, and what the anatomy of a healthy S&T policy sector looks like are important outcomes expected in this project. This project generates knowledge with practical implications for improving policy organization structures and practices, and a dataset that other researchers can use to investigate the relationship between gender and science policymaking.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 美国科学技术决策机构的工作对建立知识和经济增长具有重要意义。这些机构决定如何制定资助科学技术发展的政策和方案，如何促进技术转让和创新，以及如何在联邦法规和监督中使用科学技术方法。该项目通过对美国联邦政策制定中女性职业的研究，调查了性别在科技政策制定中的作用。社会科学领域的研究调查了在决策中纳入不同观点的好处，包括男女领导人的观点。虽然有许多关于妇女在科学界和妇女在管理或政府中的研究，但很少有关于妇女领导人在科学和技术政策中的作用的研究。该项目通过提供联邦一级妇女参与和对科学技术政策影响的定性和定量指标，探索了新的领域。数据收集的重点是1992-2008年科技决策机构的领导能力。产品包括一个多年、多机构的联邦级科技政策妇女职业数据集。这项研究从多个社会科学学科和领域交叉的理论中了解组织过程，包括：科学和技术研究；社会学；政治学；公共政策；管理学；经济学。例如，科学技术机构组织结构的变化是否影响妇女参与科学技术政策，是一个具有广泛智力兴趣的问题。对于科学政策研究，这项工作有助于深入了解资助科学的机构的领导人如何看待他们在知识生产过程中各自的角色。更广泛的影响：研究经费是科学和工程的生命线。本项目通过调查美国联邦级科技决策机构的组织和领导，有助于我们理解科技决策机构的重要作用。了解女性领导如何为科技政策议程做出贡献，不同机构中女性参与的差异如何产生不同的结果，以及健康科技政策部门的结构是什么样，这些都是本项目预期的重要结果。该项目产生了对改善政策组织结构和实践具有实际意义的知识，以及其他研究人员可以用来调查性别与科学决策之间关系的数据集。

The work of science and technology (S&T) policymaking agencies in the United States is important to building knowledge and economic growth. These agencies make decisions about how to structure policies and programs for funding science and technology development, how to promote technology transfer and innovation, and how to use scientific and technical methods in federal regulation and oversight. This project investigates the role that gender plays in the creation of science and technology policy through a study of women's careers in US federal policymaking. Research across the social sciences has investigated the advantages of including diverse perspectives in decision-making, including the perspectives of men and women leaders. While there is much research on women in science and women in management or government, there is little previous research on the role of women leaders in science and technology policy. This project explores new ground by providing both qualitative and quantitative measures of women's participation and influence on science and technology policy at the federal level. Data collection focuses on leadership in S&T policymaking agencies from 1992-2008. Products include a multiyear, multiagency dataset of women's careers in S&T policy at the federal level. The research informs understanding of organizational processes from theories at the intersection of multiple social science disciplines and areas, including: science and technology studies; sociology; political science; public policy; management science; and economics. For example, whether variation in the organizational structures of S&T agencies shapes women's participation in science and technology policy is a question of wide intellectual interest. To science policy studies, this work contributes important insights on how leaders at agencies that fund science view their respective roles in the knowledge production processes. Broader Impacts: Research funding is the lifeblood of science and engineering. This project contributes to our understanding of that vital role of S&T policymaking agencies by investigating the organization and leadership of federal level S&T policymaking agencies in the United States. Understanding how women leaders have contributed to the S&T policy agenda, how variation in the participation of women in different agencies has produced different outcomes, and what the anatomy of a healthy S&T policy sector looks like are important outcomes expected in this project. This project generates knowledge with practical implications for improving policy organization structures and practices, and a dataset that other researchers can use to investigate the relationship between gender and science policymaking.

Source.Name: Directorate for Social, Behavioral & Economic Sciences

Project.Title: Deceased non-free labor force in uranium ore production areas 1946-1986

Title_Other.Title: 1946-1986年铀矿生产区非自由劳动力死亡
Zemřelé nesvobodné pracovní síly v oblastech produkce uranové rudy 1946-1986

Class.ClassName: 各类型出版物编辑出版
安全事故、安全事故分析

Project.Abstract: The aim of the project is to publish a publication mapping the types of non-free labor forces involved in the production of uranium ore in Czechoslovakia with the main emphasis on human losses (occupational accidents, illnesses, suicides, shooting on the run) in the period 1946-1986.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: Cílem projektu je vydání publikace, která by mapovala typy nesvobodných pracovních sil podílejících se na produkci uranové rudy v Československu s hlavním důrazem na lidské ztráty (pracovní úrazy, nemoci, sebevraždy, zastřelení na útěku) v období 1946-1986.
该项目的目的是出版一份出版物，介绍捷克斯洛伐克铀矿生产所涉及的非自由劳动力的类型，重点是1946-1986年期间的人员损失（职业事故、疾病、自杀、枪击）。

Project.Title: CCTN - CONTRACEPTIVE CLINICAL TRIALS NETWORK - CORE - FEMALE

Title_Other.Title: CCTN - CONTRACEPTIVE CLINICAL TRIALS NETWORK - CORE - FEMALE
CCTN-避孕临床试验网络-核心-女性

Project.Abstract: The National Institutes of Health (NIH), Eunice Kennedy Shriver National Institute of Child Health and Human Development (NICHD), is the lead Federal agency for the conduct of basic, clinical research to develop new contraceptives and to evaluate existing methods of contraception and reproductive health. The Center for Population Research (CPR), within NICHD, was established in1968 by the Secretary of Health Education and Welfare, with the important goal of developing new contraceptives through the use of contracts and grants. Within CPR, the Contraception and Reproductive Health Branch (CRHB) has long supported several preclinical contraceptive testing facilities as well as facilities for synthetic chemical and synthetic peptide formulation. To further expand their contraceptive development capabilities, in 1996 CRHB established the NICHD Contraceptive Clinical Trials Network (CCTN). The current CCTN has conducted Phase I, II, and III clinical trials of both female and male contraceptive methods. With the recompetition of the CCTN, clinical sites will perform Phase I, II, III, and Phase IV clinical trials of a wide variety of new or existing female contraceptive methods.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: 美国国立卫生研究院（NIH）、尤尼斯·肯尼迪·施赖弗国家儿童健康和人类发展研究院（NICHD）是进行基础和临床研究的主要联邦机构，旨在开发新的避孕药具，并评估现有的避孕方法和生殖健康。人口研究中心（CPR）位于NICHD内，由卫生教育及福利部长于1968年成立，其重要目标是通过使用合同和补助金开发新的避孕药具。在CPR中，避孕和生殖健康处（CRHB）长期以来一直支持一些临床前避孕测试设施以及合成化学和合成肽制剂的设施。为了进一步扩大其避孕药具的开发能力，1996年CRHB建立了NICHD避孕药具临床试验网络（CCTN）。目前，CCTN已经对女性和男性避孕方法进行了一期、二期和三期临床试验。随着CCTN的重新申请，临床中心将对各种新的或现有的女性避孕方法进行一期、二期、三期和四期临床试验。

The National Institutes of Health (NIH), Eunice Kennedy Shriver National Institute of Child Health and Human Development (NICHD), is the lead Federal agency for the conduct of basic, clinical research to develop new contraceptives and to evaluate existing methods of contraception and reproductive health. The Center for Population Research (CPR), within NICHD, was established in1968 by the Secretary of Health Education and Welfare, with the important goal of developing new contraceptives through the use of contracts and grants. Within CPR, the Contraception and Reproductive Health Branch (CRHB) has long supported several preclinical contraceptive testing facilities as well as facilities for synthetic chemical and synthetic peptide formulation. To further expand their contraceptive development capabilities, in 1996 CRHB established the NICHD Contraceptive Clinical Trials Network (CCTN). The current CCTN has conducted Phase I, II, and III clinical trials of both female and male contraceptive methods. With the recompetition of the CCTN, clinical sites will perform Phase I, II, III, and Phase IV clinical trials of a wide variety of new or existing female contraceptive methods.

Women & Infants Hospital of Rhode Island

Source.Name: National Institute of Child Health and Human Development

Project.Title: American Women as Writers: Wharton and Cather

Title_Other.Title: American Women as Writers: Wharton and Cather
美国女作家：沃顿和凯瑟

Project.Title: Submodular optimization, lattice theory and maximum constraint satisfaction problems

Title_Other.Title: 子模优化、格理论与最大约束满足问题
Submodular optimization, lattice theory and maximum constraint satisfaction problems

Project.Abstract: Sub- and supermodular functions are special functions defined on the powerset of a set. Such functions are a key concept in combinatorial optimization, and they have numerous applications elsewhere. The problem, SFM, of minimizing a given submodular function is one of the most important tractable optimization problems. Our first goal is to investigate algorithmic aspects of the SFM generalized to arbitrary finite lattices rather than just families of subsets (thus representing order different from that of inclusion). In our setting, the classical SFM would correspond to the simplest non-trivial case of the two-element lattice. We intend to find a new wide natural class of tractable optimization problems.Recently, a strong connection was discovered between the properties of sub- and supermodularity on lattices and tractability of the so-called maximum constraint satisfaction problems (Max CSP), which are very actively studied problems in computer science and artificial intelligence. In a Max CSP, one is given a collection of (possibly weighted) constraints on overlapping sets of variables, and the goal is to find an assignment of values from a fixed domain to the variables with a maximum number (or total weight) of satisfied constraints. We intend to investigate the full extent of this connection. We will also consider an extension of the Max CSP framework to valued, or soft, constraints that deal with desirability rather than just feasibility, and hence define a more general optimization problem. Thus, our second goal is to understand the reasons for tractability within a wide class of (generally hard) combinatorial optimization problems.

Abstract_Other.Abstract: Sub- and supermodular functions are special functions defined on the powerset of a set. Such functions are a key concept in combinatorial optimization, and they have numerous applications elsewhere. The problem, SFM, of minimizing a given submodular function is one of the most important tractable optimization problems. Our first goal is to investigate algorithmic aspects of the SFM generalized to arbitrary finite lattices rather than just families of subsets (thus representing order different from that of inclusion). In our setting, the classical SFM would correspond to the simplest non-trivial case of the two-element lattice. We intend to find a new wide natural class of tractable optimization problems.Recently, a strong connection was discovered between the properties of sub- and supermodularity on lattices and tractability of the so-called maximum constraint satisfaction problems (Max CSP), which are very actively studied problems in computer science and artificial intelligence. In a Max CSP, one is given a collection of (possibly weighted) constraints on overlapping sets of variables, and the goal is to find an assignment of values from a fixed domain to the variables with a maximum number (or total weight) of satisfied constraints. We intend to investigate the full extent of this connection. We will also consider an extension of the Max CSP framework to valued, or soft, constraints that deal with desirability rather than just feasibility, and hence define a more general optimization problem. Thus, our second goal is to understand the reasons for tractability within a wide class of (generally hard) combinatorial optimization problems.

子模函数和超模函数是在集合的幂集上定义的特殊函数。这类函数是组合优化中的一个关键概念，在其它领域有着广泛的应用。最小化给定子模函数的SFM问题是最重要的可处理优化问题之一。我们的第一个目标是研究广义到任意有限格的SFM的算法方面，而不仅仅是子集的族（因此表示不同于包含的顺序）。在我们的设置中，经典的SFM对应于二元格的最简单的非平凡情形。我们试图找到一类新的可处理优化问题，最近发现了格上的次模性和超模性与所谓的最大约束满足问题（Max-CSP）的可处理性之间的紧密联系，它们是计算机科学和人工智能领域非常活跃的研究课题。在Max-CSP中，我们给出了重叠变量集上的一组（可能是加权的）约束，其目标是找到从固定域到满足最大数量（或总权重）约束的变量的值的赋值。我们打算全面调查这一联系。我们还将考虑将Max-CSP框架扩展到处理期望而不仅仅是可行性的有值或软约束，从而定义一个更一般的优化问题。因此，我们的第二个目标是了解在一类（通常是困难的）组合优化问题中可处理性的原因。

Source.Name: Engineering and Physical Sciences Research Council
